ynBX6NDxzbXaQptMOvvghQ.text: Came here with three of my girlfriends and shared one entree, one side, and one appetizer. We weren't that hungry and didn't want to be too stuffed before going out. The amount we ordered ended up being perfect (bc we also had the bread they brought for the table). Can't miss out on the "best butter in the world." Honestly the butter was good! But it was pretty average compared to butter at any other nice restaurant. Really delicious rib eye and black truffle fries!! the sauces on the side perfectly complimented the meat. It is pretty heavy though. The fries were more airy than expected but very crispy and hot. The Brussels sprouts were not the best I've ever had but still tasty? They were a little too flavored with vinegar. The charcuterie board was good! The little pickles were to die for!!! The prosciutto and salami were tasty. overall this restaurant is very cute and has a nice ambience. It isn't it of this works but would definitely come back!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie board
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye 14 ounces w black truffle fries

el42o0zVS6Fguumb07cl4Q.text: Dined at BARDOT yesterday.  For 2 glasses of wine, 1 appetizer and 2 courses was over $200 with tip. Clearly the value was no near that cost.  Your first clue that this restaurant is mediocre is they charge for butter.  Haven't been to any other restaurants on the strip that charges for butter. Thought the dishes that we ordered were generally bland.  I ordered the prime rib special.  It was just a huge slab of meat that was not cooked properly.  Not sure the weight of the serving (it was not on the menu and the waiter didn't say) but the size was offensive.  Maybe BARDOT thinks serving huge portions will distract you from the fact that the food is mediocre at best.  My wife got a scallop dish that she didn't like and made her feel queasy later in the evening.  Clearly there are much better restaurants than this one.

ScVKIgLd1dJqCeTzBFYNrg.text: YUM! Going to Bardot for brunch was such a great experience! Brunch is my favorite meal of the day so I am SUPER particular, but there are so many little things here that elevated our experience... first of all the caneles were SO good. They are a French delicate pastry, and rather than order the entire basket with a bunch of various pastries, we each got one... and they were literally the best thing I ate in Vegas all weekend!! I highly recommend everyone gets one... the drinks and complimentary bread were also right on point! The food itself was good, creative takes on brunch (my eggs were in a hollowed out croissant which was good), and the ambiance was really fun! In looking back, although it would have been weird with brunch, the French onion soup that others were eating looked SO good, wish I would have ordered that instead of the hash browns, which had cheese on top that had a texture that was a little too close to melted American cheese for me (which is not something I am a big fan of...). Overall it was a really great brunch, and I would absolutely return in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caneles and house bread, so so good!!!!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict and hash browns!

gWIEa-oBNquTvK7xE2J5GQ.text: I love French brunch and this place rose to my expectations, which is saying a lot! Great dining experience from start to finish. We had the crab benedict (outstanding and probably better to get one for yourself because you won't want to share!), the mussels (exactly what you would expect), and the smoked salmon benedict (love that it's in a croissant pastry but salmon was a little too salty for my taste, will try another next time instead). The house bread was also the yummy, chewy kind with room-temp. butter. Oh, and don't skip the cocktails-- the melon cocktail we had was out of this world.  The only negative for us was the fact that everything. took. forever. I was getting so impatient by the end. I think we waited 5 minutes just to get the check. Our server was lovely but I don't know if she had a lot of tables or she was just slow, but my goodness!   Will definitely come back!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab crepe

7z2GoLaW30ZaeV1nmX_rBw.text: I had no idea what I was in for when I made my plans to hit up BARDOT Brasserie for a solo dinner.  I only knew that they were pretty new and that they have a happy hour menu with some terrific sounding selections.  I had absolutely no idea of their pedigree!  That being their association with James Beard Award-winning chef Michael Mina.  Finding this place was step one.  Fortunately I had read that it was in the neighborhood of the Zarkana theater, which turned out to be up a flight of escalators from the casino floor.  But instead of heading towards the theater, I found it to my right when heading towards the buffet, as direct neighbor to the Jean Georges Steakhouse.  I liked the little tables set for two bordering the exterior wall of the restaurant, but I headed in to the bar area to enjoy a meal made up of selections from their Happy Hour menu, available daily from 5-7pm at the bar and lounge area.  These are smaller offerings of some of their regularly priced and portioned appetizers, which is great for a single diner who wants to try a bunch of things.  Tip - eat the Escargots $6 toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse butter, puff pastry shells while they're hot.  They are less a wonderment once cooled.  The Duck Wings A L'Orange $4 Wood grilled duck wings, seasoned citrus, sauce maltaise were meaty and tender and arrived 3 pieces to an order, as did the escargot.  The Bone Marrow $5 Roasted bone marrow, red wine onion jam, grilled country bread was perfectly portioned for one.  So if snails don't weird you out, definitely get the escargot, but I'd order any of these again.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Bone Marrow $5 at BARDOT Brasserie 2/2015
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bar area at BARDOT Brasserie 2/2015

rAdUzlIZ17YpNRkFHA2pGw.text: The happy hour is the cities best kept secret! Run don't walk!  I had the cod frites and a burger! It was honestly the best burger I've had in the city and the value overall was amazing!

McT2VAbYk-yZNOvpNKhuog.text: We have been here several times over the past couple of years and used to always look forward to it. This time was the last since there are so many other great places to go and the last couple times the experience has been lacking. Today no coffee refills. No water refills. Took an exceptionally long time for a basic breakfast. No more NY steak and eggs - filet only. Great if you love filet, but I don't so didn't get it and that was a let down. The thick cut bacon just isn't very good. The American in Paris breakfast is "okay," but that's really all it is. I've had the French toast before and that is admittedly epic, but it's way too much for one person. Hunter's Waffle is again, just okay. Over all service is lacking the last couple of times and today the food was also sort of sub par. Bouchon at the Venetian is compatible and far superior so next time we will remember that.

bXsLNXTGDAYwxBYAK7_EVw.text: Huge disappointment. Service was slow, which was understandable since it was busy when we got there, but soon we realized half the tables were empty and our server was MIA. We ordered off of the summer prix fixe menu which sounded great. I went straight down the middle, starting with a classic French onion soup. The cheese and bread were the stars here. The soup itself was on the sweet side, under seasoned, and unmemorable. Next up was steak au poivre, and this was the biggest let down. The meat itself was sub par and untrimmed. In the accompanying picture, you can literally see the silver skin and gristle left on the steak. It was tough, over cooked, AND came out lukewarm. What a joke. The mille-feuille was ok, but was made by brutes with heavy hands. This delicate dish translates to thousand leaves was 4 layers of thick puff pasty too hard to cut without a knife layered with thick layers of filling. Flavor was ok, but execution was terrible.   The winners at Bardot? The French fries and complimentary bread and butter. Everything else was embarrassingly unfortunate, especially considering Michael Mina's name on the door. If it were a more pedestrian establishment, I would have given it 3 stars, but for the $$$$, it doesn't deserve to be in the same category as other fine dining restaurants in Las Vegas.   My advice, put your $200 on the roulette table. The odd are better than Brasserie Bardot.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross! Zoom in to see the untrimmed silver skin and gristle left on this steak which had the flavor and consistency of shoe leather.

wP1526xx0fG_c4xr8KGycw.text: First time to bardot for bunch and it did not disappoint.  Amazing butter,  fantastic bisque, crepes and traditional steak and eggs. Oscar was amazing.  This is one of our favorites which should say something about the food and service since we are locals. Ask for Oscar... he takes pride in his work! #vegasborn

AWF7Gpl7rdRQWoJ9PVB2og.text: Located in Aria and it took over American Fish. I loved the entryway and the tile circular flooring. Inside the bar is very grand and beautiful flowers greet you. Very much like a brasserie in Paris. We ordered the frisee salad which was good but the egg was not poached but pretty much boiled which defeats the purpose of the egg in the salad. I ordered the heritage chicken that came with mushroom bread pudding and green beans. It tasted great except only the meat close to the bone was a little pink so I avoided eating that part.  Also got the steak frites which was good. The best dish was the macaroni gratinee. Never had it served this way but it was the best. At the end they gave me some pretty flowers :) Must go back to try the amazing looking desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best mac and cheese

Wl7zRBC75Ya5M4c-ZFvbMg.text: Did u like French kitchen?  Doesn't matter, because this plates, what cooked in Bardot Brasserie - awesome! All my friends was together with me for 1 year which I live in Las Vegas. Best oysters what I'm try in my life - kushii from British Columbia. Expensive restaurant. But if like gastronomic experience - not big deal

x_wtrdM1sFHgd5gj1gMJNQ.text: We absolutely Love  this place!!!!!  We where here for Brunch. The food was great coffee was delicious.  Oscar was our server and he was so on point!  He was funny, attentive and eager to taking care of us. The manager was a delight!  He welcomed us right away and made us feel so comfortable!  I enjoyed the experience and the the food!  This is a must for anyone who cares to be pampered.

zCWJeEUhby13vY5N2-109Q.text: If you are on the fence about visiting here you shouldn't be:) ..it's the Best! One of my favorite restaurants in town! We were greeted with a warm and joyful reception, and taken care of by an amazing server, Kim, who was knowledgeable, fun and very attentive! It was very nice when Mattaij stopped by the table to make sure we were enjoying our selves. The macaroni & mimolette gratinee aka Mac & chz is a must! Beyond the delicious menu, the super talented chef serves amazing specials leaving guests with an immaculate and memorable dining experience.

SgW_QIA-dnrNG8FrZKo-2g.text: One of my go to spots in Vegas.   Inventive French cuisine. I've loved almost everything I've tried there. It's on the pricier side of things so I've had some buyers remorse on a dish or two, but nothing horrible.   The burger is one of the best fine dining burgers I've had.

JyXC3vJf2gUsd-gV-w1BcQ.text: The omelette was delicious.. and the steak frites was even better.. the Albanian host was super nice (sorry I forgot his name) and our server Tish was very helpful and super nice as well..

9c7kAQfBPc5dWyEGn0nwRg.text: First, note that we came here for brunch, not dinner, and oh my, what a brunch! We were served by Nereida, who had a friendly demeanor, plentiful knowledge, and made great recommendations throughout.  Cocktails were standard morning fair- a peach bellini for my girl, mimosa for me. While wonderful, 15 bucks a pop is a little much. All the other food was well worth the price.  Charcuterie board to start and it was divine. The prosciutto was just a touch fatty and hard to cut, but the flavor was excellent. The pate went beautifully with the bread served, and the pork spread even better.  For entrees, steak and eggs for the girlfriend. She growled when I tried for a bite of the steak so I'm assuming it was spot on.  As for me, I would live on my entree if I could. The Hunters Waffle was duck confit on a waffle with over easy egg on top. I really can't describe it, but can say if you're here for brunch, this should be a serious first look. It was beyond amazing. Melted in my mouth, the egg yolk and duck went together so well, and the waffle soaked up the excess. All in all, an experience not to be missed. Aria continues its stellar reputation for fine dining, even for something as simple as brunch. A new staple to add to my vegas favorites. Look for many return visits from me!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie board-filling and delicious
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunters Waffle- divinity on a plate

EQoEFDydMWnxFJRBUqjsXQ.text: Came here one night for dinner. The restaurant looks beautiful, nice bar and definitely great for a date night. We got seated in a strange spot, a round table with 4 seats when we are a couple and it was at the walk way so I asked to move for a smaller table and more quiet spot. It took quite a while before the staff came to us to give the menu and took our order but over all she was good.   We ordered Foie Gras, Bone Marrow, onion soup, salad and mussels. They were so delicious. I could not stop eating. I love this place and the food was so good better than we could ever expected. I would definitely recommend this place. The best French food I had in a long time.

6odvDv9cHkOaJNgcN_LR6A.text: Well... I probably had very high expectations, having recently been to both Paris and Jaleo. The food technique was good, but not impressive.   We had the charcuterie ensemble; prosciutto was fresh and delicious but a bit think for the type (I think it was Parma or some sweet Italian).   Onto roasted octopus salad: the texture was just off; tough and chewy. I know it's vegas and we don't have octopuses swimming around freely on the strip... but don't put it as a special.  It turned me off to order anything else. Especially because the rubber octopus didn't come cheap.  But I was a masochist and ordered dessert.  Salted caramel something with hazelnut creme. It was ok - it was basically a stale donut with some creme in between.   Drinks were ok - weak and overtly sweet. I felt like I was drinking syrup out of a glass.   You might think - why the 4 stars then? If you have complained all the way?  Well, Kim, our server, was really nice and friendly. She made sure we were taken care of.  The vibe was good. The bread was fresh. The ingredients were fresh. But it just didn't come together in execution.  I will check it out again in two weeks. We will see!

iFaS8xwSk1qxqwOz44e5PQ.text: Never again, way over priced for dry eggs terrible bacon.  We also ordered the pastry basket it never arrived.   When I asked why I was told they ran out.

LOOnTIESSv4k6R5oBcMN1w.text: Wow. This is our new favorite restaurant in Vegas. We went to Happy hour 3 nights in a row for the great food and wonderful staff. When God created woman is now my wife's favorite cocktail one of their signature drinks. The bar staff was great say hi to Eric Brooke Alex Michelle Dino thanks guys. All three of the appetizer tartine's were fantastic the chef puts out super clean and flavorful food. And then we went the fourth day for brunch, I had the lobster scramble it was awesome and my wife had a croissant Benedict whatever you choose you can't go wrong. We are looking forward to our next trip to the Aria and Bardot are new HomeBase. Cheers

IV_UuZ1jhD6ZbBprHDoJEw.text: I came here last weekend for a small birthday dinner, and was blown away by the experience. Tucked away inside Aria, this place is a True gem. The ambiance is intimate, service warm and friendly, and the food is delicious. Every dish is beautifully presented and reasonably priced.   + PRIME STEAK TARTARE: We ordered the small order to share (among 5 people), and it was more than enough, especially if you're looking to order multiple appetizers to share. The beef is delectably tender and is ground to order.   + SEARED FOIE GRAS LYONNAISE: The more extravagant of their two foie dishes, this is the one to get if you want the full on texture of foie gras. The foie melts in your mouth, but the star of the dish was the beluga lentils, I could eat a whole plateful of the lentils.  + KING CRAB CREPE: I loved the simplicity and elegance of this dish. The trumpet mushrooms paired very well with the crab, and the buckwheat crepe was very delicate. Tasty dish and also very Instagrammable  + BONE MARROW AU POIVRE: Rustic and hearty are the two best words to describe this dish. Aesthetically beautiful, the bone marrow is a golden brown and is served with country bread. Usually I'm tentative about onion jam, but I enjoyed their rendition.  + ONION SOUP GRATINEE: We got the basic onion soup (definitely will get all the fixin's next time). All I can say is, if you love cheese, get this soup. I'm salivating just thinking about it. The soup was also very flavorful. The dish is a bit heavy, but that's expected of French onion soup.  + OAK SMOKED DUROC PORK CHOP: I can't resist a good pork chop, especially one that's topped with even more pork (bacon lardons). Loved loved LOVED this entree. The Pork was extremely moist and well -cooked. Topped with the crispiness of the lardons and the crunchiness of the carrots, you have a great balance of flavors as well.

LuNi8-Fc0mqFENaBNU2M6A.text: Went to Vegas for a vacation last month, and went for brunch on a Sunday morning. Britton(sp?) was our server, and he was the greatest. He was very attentive, professional, and friendly. The food was DELICIOUS. We were big fans of the pastry basket (which you MUST get) and the coffee bar selection. Our entrees were the Bardot Breakfast Sandwich and the American in Paris. Both were amazing, but you definitely can't go wrong ordering any of the other selections. Everything is worth the price. If we do go to Vegas again (which I hope is soon), we will definitely be coming back.

AWojDuOFNguGtmUYRvPh4Q.text: A friend told me to make a stop in for the steak burger, so I said goodbye to Holsteins and hello to Bardot. And I was not disappointed. This thing was delicious. Its a great quality meat, and when topped with all the goodies it is a top 5 burger anywhere. Pair it with a nice wine and you are in business at a very reasonable, by Vegas standard, price.

uzV9apjl7Bs3jFjxxsDIRA.text: We went for brunch today. The ambiance of this restaurant is just beautiful and as Parisian as it can get. The menu is vast and allows for lovely choices, all of which are prepared under the influence of French cuisine. I ordered the salmon with brioche which was a souped up French version of the American bagel with lox and cream cheese. In this case, the cream cheese was a lovely herb cream cheese with a brioche bread on the side and fresh smoked salmon. There was a little avocado, small cornichons, tomatoes, and cucumbers. There were also a few slices of red onion. It was delicious. It was also properly proportioned. Prior to that, they did bring a mini French baguette with fresh butter. For my drink, I ordered a spritz with orange pavana... Just lovely. The prices are very reasonable and over all, it is a fabulous experience. I greatly enjoyed this brunch and would not hesitate to come back again.

wkvsD2gtj5u6_6O_-bdYRg.text: 2 strikes you're out!!!!  Nope not willing to give a third try when it comes to Michael Mina...  As previously reviewed had a bad time at MM in SF.  As for this establishment it pretty much sucked too.  How in the world do these reviewers give 4 or 5 stars????  Maybe they all had colds and their taste buds were malfunctioning...   First let me start that 5 stars to the waiter who dealt with our table.  He is the only great experience I had with this establishment.  Otherwise let me begin (or end) my experience with this restaurant.  After ordering our meal, it took 1 hour and a half to receive our meal.  Suffice to say there was absolutely no excuses.  The restaurant was 1/2 full!!!!  That in itself is really bad.    Now let's not forget the "forgetful" appetizers.  The one that most comes to mind is the scallops that is on the tasting menu.  Who in the world serves scallops "sliced"? Who serves scallops not seared (besides a sushi restaurant which this is not). Also they were quite chewy....  But worst of all was my main course.... A rib eye steak.  There are many ways to ruin a good cut of meat.  Over or under cook or lack of seasoning.  In my case it was lack of seasoning.  But wait.... the other shoe is about to drop.  Who in the world serves a prime piece of meat by cutting it in half and shoving it together and put's garnish to try to cover it up?!?!?!?  This was an all time low for me.  Shame on MM for opening restaurants to just put his name on it and collect a paycheck.  Doesn't he realize this affects his reputation in the long run?    Never ever again.......

DpUo1fWcEllwMd064lBxkw.text: The food was good but the service was bad. We had an 11:15 reservation and were told we could have a table that was actually someone's "regular" (standing) table if we thought we'd be done by noon... if not we'd have to wait 20 minute. Since one of us had a plane to catch we took the table and said we'd be done in time, and please let the server know so my friend could make her plane. We sat at 11:15 and didn't even get a menu till 11:30, nor did anyone offer any coffee or other beverage. Finally were served at 11:45 and had to rush to eat as well as flag down wait staff to bring coffee- they also never once came by to ask if we needed anything. For the price, the service was poor and this is a recurring theme at Aria. Eternal waits for breakfast, for drinks at the pool. I assume they're understaffed, but for what is supposed to be one of the better hotels they have a long way to go.

5GDnvmmfhHl4rhMXMi3lLg.text: This place is one of the many restaurants located inside the Aria hotel on the Vegas strip and it is one of the nicer/fancier places to eat dinner on the strip.  Getting a reservation at this place wasn't too hard, looked it up at 7:30 and we were able to get a reservation for 8:45 and we got there right at our reservation time and were seated promptly.  My friend ordered the pork chops and I had the 1/2 chicken which came with a side of mushroom bread pudding and my friend's pork chops came with a side of mashed potatoes.  I also ordered a side of black truffle fries.  The service was amazing and I could not possibly have any complaints about that.   The portion sizes were also just right in that we weren't left still hungry after finishing our meal nor did we have so much food on our plates that we couldn't finish it.  The food however was only alright.  Based on what we ordered, it seemed to be hit or miss.  The chicken was okay but seemed to be slightly on the saltier side, enough so that I would occasionally have to switch from drinking wine to drinking water just to wash out the salt from my mouth.  The mushroom bread pudding on the other hand was really good and I did not regret having it come as a side with my main dish.  For my friend however, his mashed potatoes weren't too great for him.  He complained that they had a strong taste and that it was so much so that he couldn't even get around to finishing the potatoes.  He had no complaints about the pork chops though.  The black truffle fries were something I highly recommend on this menu though.  They were perfectly cooked, had just the right amount of flavor and unlike my friend's mashed potatoes they were in no way overbearing to eat or taste.  All in all, this place has great service and good portion sizes, a fair sized wine menu, and a decent regular menu.  I would just recommend you ask them to go easy on the salt for the 1/2 chicken and stay away from anything that comes with mashed potatoes as a side.

dtCdl2k9kFmknx4r-6fwbA.text: I needed a drink... And a little something to munch on. Thank goodness Bardot is open late!   I had never really considered myself a whiskey person, but the Charlemagne was quite tasty. It also has Chambord, tempus fugit kina, pineapple, & lemon. Watch out, as it can be quite addictive!  And wow, that Parisian Gnocchi! The gnocchi were perfectly crisp on the outside and pillowy soft inside. Add in sauteed black trumpet mushrooms, creamy chevre, celery root (which I'm normally not crazy about, but was done quite well here), and tasty roasted garlic cream, and I was in "gnocchi nirvana".  I had a wonderful bar side experience at Bardot last week. Perhaps next time, I'll grab a booth and taste what else this latest Michael Mina hotspot has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parisian Gnocchi! Ooh la la!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charlemagne

22K7JZAhvDWYyal2sdQB1Q.text: Maybe the best breakfast I've ever had.  French toast with a side of bacon.  My wife had the beef short rib Benedict.  Ummmmmm.   Atmosphere: great.  Food:  A triple plusssssss! We are Las Vegad locals, have tried most of the places in town.  This place is at the top!

5OfqWxzl90ZWSLVWGFxdWg.text: Really darn good. I'd go back just for the macaroni and cheese.   A group of friends had dinner here before an event - each of us oohing and awwing over our bites.   The frisee salad with egg and bacon got rave reviews and the Bardot salad with Dijon vinaigrette and radishes was light and refreshing.   Order a side of Mac and cheese! Noodles were oddly stacked on end (I feel bad for whoever has that job in kitchen prep) but the gruyere cheese was creamy on one side and and the noodles had a salty, crispy crust on the other. I ate most of it before my dining companions could try it.   The burger was really good. Mine was cooked well without being dry. Seared crispy on the outside with cheese and tart onions, watercress and garlic aioli. The fries were perfectly cooked and salted.  The herb gnocchi were great with a cream sauce. The skate got rave reviews too.   I'd certainly recommend this restaurant. We had some service issues with the bill getting rung up incorrectly but I'd give them another chance for sure.

A1aMcQOF7l6fc0pTMEiVzg.text: My favorite French restaurant in LAS Vegas! We sat at the bar because they were really busy and the service was impeccable. Our bartender Dino made fantastic cocktails and made us feel so special. The food though..... Outstanding!!!! I almost want to shed a tear. I will definitely be back many, many times.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi to share... So filling but you can stop once you start.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The escargot in puff pastry.... You will literally die.

EuPuJ-4VYXGg6vdoAq4bGQ.text: We only sat at the bar twice but oh my, the shrimp cocktail!!! This is no ordinary shrimp-would love to know where they source it.  Succulent.  Gorgeous.  Delicious.  Sealed, slow cooked in a water bath - did I say huge & succulent??? Best we've ever had in our lives, served in ice with a beautiful remoulade sauce and a fab cocktail sauce.  Drinks were great, service perfect, atmosphere beautiful, and beer salad awesome.  The goat cheese, wowza.

hY3z917Jy9YFWmTLnuv6Eg.text: My wife and I decided to try this place given that it is located in the hotel we were staying in. We thought an early happy hour would be a good choice because that would give us the ability to experience some food and drink without it being too busy during peaks hours.   We sat at the bar and shortly after were approached by a wonderful and polite bartender (I didn't get her name). We ordered a glass of white wine and a French 75, along with the salmon tartare. The drinks tasted fabulous, and when the salmon arrived, we were both impressed. The presentation and the taste were extraordinary. We later ordered the steak tartare and were also impressed! It was a really fun experience, and having been to France several times, a very authentic one.   If/when I am ever back in Vegas I will definitely head to this place again. I would love to try more on their menu as I am sure it will taste as great or better.

EDt-3GzpGIGZjiuh3TCHgw.text: Just a wonderful experience. Standard brasserie menu, but everything was executed perfectly. Even let us create our own dessert - grilled ! Had to thank the chef personally.

rS7x1mOzrXY8PSyacRlh5w.text: This place is okay. Definitely not one of the better meals I had during my trip to Vegas. It's a little ho hum. Hubby and I ordered appetizers and smaller plates to share. Most of it is pretty unmemorable to me except the King Crab Crepe. That was the one item that was really savory and flavorful. I would highly recommend getting that if you eat here. It's not a bad place to eat by any means, and the ambiance is nice. It truly does have the brasserie feel. I just think there are lots of better places to eat.

KrLQD8TbQILDi3Hupo9Siw.text: Vraiment tres bien!!  Some friends and I stopped in here around 6:30PM before a show on a Saturday night without reservations.  I was very busy inside, but there were some bar stools available near the open windows.  We pulled some together and our waitress very kindly had someone make us a table in the bar area so we could sit and eat in comfort.    It was very beautiful inside and the service was fantastic.  Since we where crunched for time we only grabbed one glass of bubbly & the Charcuterie board. Everything on it was delicious.  The hazelnuts were my favorite thing of interest though.  And oh la la, that bread that was served was divine.  You could live on bread and wine alone in this place! (but what fun would that be)  My only regret was how quickly we had to devour our food and rush off.  I would certainly come back and plan to stay for a full dining experience next time.

gNqRuRk7K5rdvtHxK9WgAQ.text: After we experienced our brunch here, we completely understand why it was rated 4.5 stars. All the dishes we ordered was fantastic.  1)We love the escargot here, it's the best so far, although it's only 4 small ones, each bit was awesome, you can completely enjoy the escargot in your mouth.  2) French onion soup was very flavorful. We love how rich the cheese on top but not heavy. The soup contained onions and toasts. Good combination  3) chicken French dip was amazing. The dipping was rich but not heavy. We had beef French dip before, but this one was very creative  4) smoked salmon croissant Benedict. The poached egg was good.   Service was not as good. Not as attentive.   Overall, good experience for brunch.

d_Ozd4u2NJdxbJ6ZfmrcsA.text: Caught their happy hour, great food and really good prices.  The prime rib burger was very flavorful and perfectly prepared.  The real highlight was the dessert, a frozen Paris Brest.  Hazelnut ice cream, chocolate cremeux and salted Carmel sauce, and a bigger portion than I could finish.  The drink special was an old fashion with Elijah Craig 12 year.  Overall, a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kEkqblamEF6pkUnBubZpgg.text: Like most American restaurants claiming to be French this or that, you basically just hope the bread is good.  The bread was good, as was everything else.  Started with the cheese plate, all three selections recommend by the waitress were unique, complex and delicious.  We ordered cocktails, which were fresh and strong.  The black truffle fries could use a little more black truffle than the light dusting they get, but it's a good amount for a side order.  For entrees we shared the pork chop and the gnocchi.  While the pork chop, vegetables and mashed potatoes were cooked perfectly, the mustard topping sauce was a bit boring but good.  The gnocchi was the best I've had; the black trumpet mushrooms give the dish a smokey, meaty flavor.  For dessert we had the strawberry pavlova, which was a perfect light finish.  The lavender gelato and strawberries provide plenty of flavor without being too overwhelming.  (Note that the meringue in a pavlova is crispy.)

q9YuagzkD3ImoEV5RMwXcA.text: As someone with zero skill or luck when it comes to gambling, It's great knowing you don't have to roll the dice to find exquisite dining in Las Vegas. For no particular reason I hadn't been back to Vegas in nearly two years. While maybe not the newest, my wife and I had been hearing consistently great things about BARDOT Brasserie so we made a point of getting reservations for her B-day dinner.  Located within Aria, we went with a small group of friends and met up at the restaurant right around our reservation time. It took a few minutes before we got seated, but once inside the first thing one notices is how the place is dimly lit and full or tile, dark wood and brass. Deservingly a brasserie.  While on the pricier side, there are certainly pricier still in Vegas. As one would expect the menu is decidedly French. No need to try and reinvent the wheel here as the majority of menu options are relatively timeless.  While wine would definitely be on the table for dinner, we started things off with cocktails. Preferring alcohol-forward, I ordered the Smoke & Mirrors while my wife got the Snake In The Grass.  Both were excellent. Looking to try a little of everything we also ordered the charcuterie board, which came packed with pate, rillettes and other cured meats.  Main course had to be steak - 8oz Angus Filet Mignon, medium rare. A friend of ours ordered the same thing, medium. As with most fine dining experiences we had some time before the meals came out. Everything looked great and we dug right in. While the meat was what one would expect from a proper filet mignon, for a roughly $50 item, it didn't seem medium rare as we would have liked.   About halfway through the meal we look over at our friend who'd ordered hers medium and noticed it was far pinker than our own. At that point we realized they had given us the wrong plates. I brought this up with the waiter next time they came by. While our friend who had ordered the medium learned then and there that she preferred medium rare, our server asked as flat out if we'd like another one. I actually felt bad, but yes, the medium wasn't doing the trick and we obliged.   The new steak came out soon enough, and was indeed, perfectly medium rare. It cut like butter and melted in my mouth. I also then understood why this place gets such high marks to begin with. The food was great. And while they may have slipped up an expensive order, they also fixed it with poise and speed. That's how it's done.

pWId1-npcJbjvvGGdFpcKg.text: The bar at this restaurant stands out and the place provides the French Bistro experience.  The waiter was professional, and the special drink with the mezcal is small but really good,.  The FOOD is another story.  The snails were incased in a doughy pastry.  The solution was to take the snails out of the dough and eat them without it.  The steak tartare was not a traditional and tasted more like a chopped meat with salad dressing.  We could not eat it, and send it back.   The King Crab and Endive came with plenty of Endive but very little king crab with a preponderance of  parmesan cheese.  I found it inedible and did not eat it. We ended up eating the small baguette with a very tasty butter, and ordering a second round of drinks.

oUWmtqUvSXon5M0mqJ1nJg.text: BARDOT delivered exactly what we were looking for in a quality boozy brunch after a night out in Vegas. The ambiance has a nice high-end feel. Our party of four opted for the $25 bottomless Rose which got us right back in the Vegas spirit.   For food, we started by sharing a Nutella sticky bun which hit our sweet spot. For the entree two of us had the French toast and two had Eggs Benedict. Both were great, but one 'loaf' of French toast is more than enough for a party of four.  Ask for Tish! She's a pro and very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ovpz6OZVbsQALbLcyfe6yw.text: When staying at ARIA, Michael Mina's French bistro BARDOT is a must. Especially for Happy Hour. I'm not sure if I'd go here during regular hours as prices are $$$$ but then again, Happy Hour...  HH prices for cocktails were around $10, and small plates between $10 and $19. Highlight were the Tartines - shrimp, avocado, and fried egg were all delicious ($8 each).    The bartender kept the drinks coming, and one is happily eating away. Good times.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QPfrmFuT3ZxOgZnmWL-HzQ.text: I am a HUGE fan of Bardot (and most things Michael Mina). Bardot is Aria's take on a french brasserie - it's not intimidating or really over priced. The decor is beautiful and it's a very intimate restaurant.  The service is always fantastic - I prefer to go sit at the bar during happy hour because they have great specials, but sitting in the dining room is just as great. Plus, 2 words: CHAMPAGNE CART!! Don't miss out this! During brunch they offer $20 bottomless rose, which is just crazy!   The Le Steakburger is really good, but I think my favorite dish has been the roasted chicken french dip....it's really good! I definitely suggest checking out Bardot, they have a lot to offer!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Steakburger
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Macaron
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croque Madame

82EQz6eQrCXGguOjwof4Kg.text: We've been to many of Chef Michael Mina's restaurants over the years. All of them have some degree of quality and Bardot is no exception. We've been visiting here ever since they opened when they replaced the previous restaurant American Fish. Brunch, lunch or dinner I've tried it all. For brunch the Hunter's Waffle and french toast is absolutely delightful. The French toast though is quite large but pleasantly so. I recommend sharing. The regular lunch menu is very reduced. Dinner has some interesting dishes and their famous lobster pot pie. There's absolutely nothing I can complain about besides the infrequent consistency in the preparation of certain dishes which is mainly a problem with dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunter&#39;s Waffle (Duck)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zNMHBU5DyPlLZukv053xHw.text: My husband and I were relaxing at the spa @ Aria and took a break (yea, from relaxing) to come eat. The restaurant is on open table and it's really easy to make a reservation. We were seated quickly during lunch as there are only three or four of the parties in the restaurant. The restaurant itself is nice--it features fresh flowers and classic French decor. Service was a bit slow considering the restaurant was not very full, but servers were very friendly. Food was beautifully plated, but heavily salted. If you're in aria for lunch or dinner, I'd recommend Herringbone instead.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQmT-uDByeZbWiEqrq2Pgw.text: Good burger here for lunch on a Friday morning. The cut was really supreme and flavorful. Highly recommend. I didn't eat much of the complimentary bread (they serve it Parisian style, in the paper still), but it was tasty. I had a Bloody Mary which was also spicy and not too watery (no bueno when there's too much ice in it, which this one didn't have). The place was pretty empty, maybe because there's no actual brunch menu (only applies on weekends apparently). It does have a Paris feel to it, with the decor and architecture of the restaurant, so I liked it. Good to know you also can take the Aria shuttle to get to Bellagio from here afterwards (free).

bqMtxF6_QTsouzbhtRKahw.text: The bread and butter here was so amazing, I almost wanted to lick the butter out of the bowl but restrained myself. I really enjoyed the mussels in white wine sauce I had, it was a generous portion and the sauce was great for dunking more bread into. I can say the only thing I tried there that my palate didn't like was the french onion soup. I think the truffle oil didn't mix well or the bacon, but it was something that no one at my table would finish.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella sticky bun

AvI1Cji1Oe1y4s1fUhbThw.text: As a pick for dinner from my Brother, we gathered our hungry appetites and walked through the doors of Bardot for culinary satisfaction.  Dishes tried: - Duck wings - Foie Gras - Frese Salad - Kobe bone marrow - Onion Soup - Escargo - Mac and Cheese - Beef Wellington - Sirloin Steak  I have a healthy appetite, but this was a meal that was shared amongst six hungry adults.  The meal starts with some amazing fresh baked bread, I am a simple guy and bread and butter does not get as simple or delish as this.  The baguette is crisp yet fluffy on the inside.  Standout Apps: - Escargo - Frese Salad - Onion Soup  The least favorite of the apps turned out to be the duck wings, they had too much zest for our taste and not enough flavor.  I felt the jam on top of the foie gras was too sweet and did not contrast well with the foie gras itself.  I had to sprinkle in some salt to offset the sweetness.    My favorite dish was the Beef Wellington because it was cooked and seasoned to absolute precision by the team at Bardot.  The puff pastry was perfectly crisp and the beef to an even higher echelon of medium rare. Be prepared to pay for this work of culinary art as it took a big chunk of the final receipt.  I can't forget to mention the mac and cheese because of the preparation. If i could have I would have paid to go back to see the chef whose duty it is to align each individual piece of macaroni to stand up for this dish.    I hate to call this out, but the cheesy restaurant photography and option to buy your photo weighed on me while I dined.  I get this is a good added revenue stream for Bardot, but it does cheapen the fine dining experience in my opinion.  Everything else from the hostess, staff, and kitchen prep was outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tf4oXLcymVsIDqg0Dw9frw.text: Great food, small plates. Staff was attentive and entertaining ( one server was quoting Pulp Fiction! )  Would absolutely go back when in Vegas again. Foie gras parfait was amazing, olive tapenade with fresh breads the same. Escargot was a let down, but only because I thought I was getting escargot with puff pastry and a garlic butter sauce for dipping. Instead, the escargot was wrapped in puff and had a garlic pesto sauce on top. Still really good, just not what I wanted.

jd76k7ElWwALtMPXvh74pA.text: This place never disappoints, this time I had the parisien gnocchi and OMG!! Delicious... the beet salad was delicious as well. My fiance had the duck and he loved it! Amazing food. Awesome service. Ask for Kim, she's awesome

uUhY5gqo3ZG3GT2O1Ijo5Q.text: Not sure who wrote the other 895 reviews of this restaurant, either friends of the owner or employees but this was the worst service in a "upscale" vegas restaurant I've ever experienced. The appetizers were ok but both the steak and sea bass were over cooked and not once after the entree was served did the waiter return to ask how the food was.......We both looked at each other in disbelief as several times the waiter and the person we thought was the GM walked by us and said nothing, cleared nothing never asked about dessert?   Not sure who Michael Mina is but his name is proudly mentioned by everyone that recommended the restaurant, if I were him I'd make some changes or hide my name.  Real bad folks, there are so many better places ( and cheaper) in vegas to get an outstanding meal...... and service.

HJ-1_bNu2axqY13SltiNnw.text: I have only had phenomenal experiences here at BARDOT, both as an individual and when booking for a whole group.  The Sidecar is 100% my favorite cocktail and their sidecar is on point! I stayed at the Aria for a conference and am so grateful that Bardot was here!  If you come during happy hour the price of the drinks plus the complementary baguette and butter (which is delicious) make it all worth it.  For dinner I had the pork chop and it was well worth it! Glistening white, perfectly cooked and plenty flavorful, I was very impressed by my meal. 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside is very cool looking and you get prompt service
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sidecar was boozy and smooth, just the way I like it
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chop was tender and moist; went great with the mustard sauce

Kmj1ARDCCPN1Juo8SNdrxw.text: We booked a 12:15 birthday brunch for our friend Ronn, and brought a bottle of Champagne and special dessert wine, a '98 Sauternes. Our server Oscar brought the champagne perfectly chilled just as we realized we wanted it. We asked him to speak to the sommelier about food pairings, and guess what? Oscar *was* the sommelier. He recommended incredible pairings (including off-menu customizations) worthy of the wine we had brought-- our meal was perfectly paced, the food was flawless, and our flaming Baked Alaska dessert pairing put on quite a show for all our dining companions! I can't wait to return.

u7QL8KFDP6Z65E5BLkjkSQ.text: Service was excellent until the crowd starting streaming in after 8pm when the servers became really busy. Our server was friendly and gave great recommendations.   Food wise, my scallops were too salty for my taste and my friend's rack of lamb was a tad too pink for medium. The starters of fresh oysters and grilled octopus were excellent though.   We finished with baked Alaska for dessert which the server flambed at the table.

wLUC5lPTZl7ZF0DbnDwS8A.text: This place was overpriced for what it is. I had the Double Decker Croque Madame was good. It was HUGE and pretty tasty (maybe a bit too salty?) but just a little overpriced for bread, eggs, sauce and a little bit of meat. I didn't have the bloody mary but two of the girls did and said it was AMAZING (better than any they've had before).

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant Benedict&#39;s and hand cut truffle fries
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double decker croque madame

rTm3LSD8X-l1HxnXbL8NSQ.text: Bardot is beautiful. The food is fantastic. Go there wearing your fat pants. The end.  Okay, so obviously reviews need a bit more detail but that's the gist of it. Bardot stands out in a city overwhelmed with French restaurants both on- and off-Strip. It's great for a business meal, a date night, a special event, or even just sitting at the bar for dessert to treat yourself. So far my visits have been limited to a networking event with passed appetizers and seafood and a group brunch, but I'll definitely be back for dinner soon.  Standouts include their cheese (duh), charcuterie, fresh oysters, escargot, and any incarnation of terrine or foie gras. I'm sure their entrees are great, but I'd go wild with multiple appetizers instead. My next visit will include the beef tartare and onion soup for sure.  You can't go wrong with their brunch options. Mussels have a great, complex broth and a massive mountain of a portion. The giant French toast is amazingly light with a great vanilla mascarpone and the world's fanciest granola bar garnish. The Hunter's Waffle with duck confit was a nice balance of sweet and savory. It took all of my self control not to run off with Cint B's Short Rib Croissant Benedict.    Just go, tout de suite.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast in back
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib croissant Benedict

e9LHnOxCwMkpC6qAA0eboQ.text: Great place to dine while staying at Aria!! I had a chance to go a couple times while I was here.  I had tried the lobster: fresh and cooked to perfection! And I had also tried the risotto, steak tartare and grilled octopus.  If you stay in Vegas, you must stop by and try!

NEPHxqyeXwN1oYx4cB7cpA.text: Loved this place! We made an impromptu stop for dinner at Bardot and were pleasantly surprised.   Every staff member was so attentive and made great recommendations for us (as first timers). The space was elegant and had plenty of room for our party and offered lighting that was just right! I definitely recommend and will be back!

1fAsnBFDdn7oZZF3QmRphg.text: This place was amazing. Had the seared foie gras appetizer, it was mind blowing!! Rack of lamb was perfectly prepared as well. Service was great as well. Would definitely got back next time  I'm in Vegas.

swgRjhWvyTwZtDfbWrIk6A.text: We stayed in Aria so stopped by for a bougie brunch with the GF. we shared the Nutella sticky buns to start, I had the dry aged prime burger. That thing was fricken awesome, it felt like I was eating a steak. The gf had the Hunters Waffles and she liked her dish as well too. Washed it all down with some mimosas. Service was a bit slow, our waitress disappeared quite a bit, but they were busy. Pricy meal, but it's On the Vegas Strip so you gotta splurge

UL_Cp9rhxMA2beUMDp-rdA.text: The Best French Toast Ever!!!  If you like french toast, you must make a weekend brunch stop at Bardot Brasserie at Aria.  It is huge and comes with a large portion of vanilla mascarpone and almond brittle.  I'm keeping this review short and simple to highlight the french toast.  Go, now, stop reading and experience what French Toast was meant to be...

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best French Toast ever!

K2n6wPzNsg7gyKWmc6uWyA.text: Stopped into Bardot for a late drink and was blown away. We ended up staying for awhile and enjoyed some delicious food as well. Definitely would recommend!

ORVa5IEv8UhP0kroRwpe_Q.text: This place got class, sass, and plenty of ass walking around. I absolutely loved this place. If I could live in the back booth I would. Upon entering you feel transported to France. Everything is beautiful. I found myself staring too much and people thought I was a creeper but I didn't care. Everything is amazing here. Tenor steak tartare is a must. I repeat must!!!!! So buttery, flavorful, and orgasmic! Their escargot is also bomb.com. Not rubber at all or chewy. Their iced frappe is stellar beyond stellar. Their beet salad was heaven. Absolute heaven. I could have eaten 12 plates. And their steak is sublime. I wanted to lick the plate. My highlight was my beautiful chocolate macaroon. My giant macaron. Which was all for me and I didn't want to share. I like my macaroons the way I like my men. Dark, rich, velvety, and black. Lord have mercy. You must come here and enjoy your life and make sure you do the bottomless rose too. Xoxo.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Being creepers
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My drinkies
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I wanted to steal this

r2xKELb8xc8yO9bt9B1LzA.text: Fantastic Kirk French bistro in the Aria hotel. Great wine list with affordable white and red burgundies and champagne. The menu is also wonderful and the service well above average. Great spot

MbMOTyKCcBtR1x9GTcH64g.text: We had a large bachelorette party and Oscar our server was amazing! Brunch was soooo tasty and the service was great!

GdfXnqLuV9Djo6GZVsPS9Q.text: If this is how Royalty dines sign me up! It was the perfect self indulgence birthday dinner anyone could ever ask for. What else can I say that hasn't been said already???  Just fatten me up like a turkey and feed me bottomless duck wings a l'orange and foie gras parfait please!   No but really, if you haven't tried their food definitely check this place out. Everything we tasted from their dinner menu was amazing!  Will definitely be back to try their brunch menu.

5uk_zfupJIcRkjhp4ABvrg.text: This place ROCKS!  Before I give a review, ask to be served by the waiter named Steve from the Ivory Coast.  He is the greatest living waiter on Earth.  When God created the greatest waiter on Earth, he made him of French Lebanese descent and he sprung out from the Cote d'ivoire.  This place replaced the missed American Fish, another Michael Mina spot.  This haunt is Mina's take on French food (greatest in the world).  The bar itself is worth in the millions.  No penny was spared creating this place and Michael's wife can be seen here every so often.  All salads and soups are solid orders.  Many of the apps are near top notch.  But what anyone cares about are the main courses.  The flank steak is ELITE.  The ribeye and all other steaks I have eaten all rate a 8 or more out of 10.  The sides are a bit too small for sharing for more than two people.  The mushrooms side is more of a pastry than a mushroom dish  Asparagus and brussel sprouts sides are really good, totally French style.  Fish dishes all rate a 8 out of 10. I had the cod, salmon and sea bass and to me reverse the order I just stated for taste and quality.  All deserts are high end.  I recommend the banana desert.  All cocktails are of high quality and all have a special flare to them.  Heck, all the dudes behind the bar are friendly, ready to serve, want to talk to you and have no heirs.

xfq1fBJYfOhfBFngYnd3mw.text: Our party of 9 had dinner here for my cousin's bachelorette party. Overall the atmosphere was welcoming but it was really dark in the dining so that it was difficult to see our dishes.  Our table shared a variety of appetizers:  - Foie Gras Parfait - Charcuterie Board (housemade pate, pork rillette, ham) - Bardot Escargot -hazelnuts, chartreuse butter   I expected a lot from the escargots because our server touted them to high heaven. But they were just ok. Charcuterie Board was solid--loved the rillette. But I was ALL ABOUT THE FOIE GRAS PARFAIT! So wonderfully smooth and somehow rich and light at the same time. The port gelee added the perfect acidity to it.  For entrees, seester and I split:  -Oak Smoked Duroc Pork Chop with Crispy Lardons -Alaskan Cod with a Saffron Beurre Blanc  The pork was very juicy and the lardons were decadent. The horseradish was fantastic with it. The cod was light, flaky and I loved the corn.   But beware....if you love wine--bring your $$$$$$  The cheapest bottle was around $150 and I kid you not, we saw a bottle that was listed for $38K---no joke!  Overall, I really enjoyed the dinner but it was VERY pricey especially if you order booze.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Parfait topped with a Ruby Port Gelee served with Ffresh Grilled Country Bread.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oak Fired Duroc Pork Chop with  Bacon Lardons, Baby Carrots, Potato Purée and Grain Mustard
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Herb Crusted Alaskan Cod crushed English Peas, Sweet Corn, with a Saffron Buerre Blanc.

qahwZAYnpGg4cdik1NDgIw.text: We stumbled upon Bardot Brasserie while strolling through the Aria Resort Casino.  We tried their HH and it did not disappoint.  Quite a few food selections but on the other hand their service is better than the food.  Nothing creative or out of the ordinary.  Mind you, it is good quality food and a nice place for lunch or dinner inside Aria.    We will repeat on our next visit and hope to see some new and different HH menu items.  You will enjoy this place.

D9p8sNC97MfEi2GtIojKBQ.text: This was one of my top 2 meals in the past year. I had the chicken which was perfectly cooked and had crispy skin. It came with a side of bread pudding that was an umami bomb. My wife had the gnocchi which were fantastic, I am not usually a fan of truffle but the black truffle was perfect on the dish. We also had the cheese board which was outstanding. Also as everyone has mentioned the bread and butter we good enough for a meal. We ordered to much so you may be able to lighten the tab a little. It was pricey, but for what you are getting on the strip actually pretty reasonable.

1gtdajaew-XN2lNUs3rIMQ.text: Amazing place and great atmosphere!  Came here on father's day for brunch so it was very busy. It did take a while to get our food, but it was worth the wait. The server was attentive and very friendly.  The Maine Lobster Scramble was my personal favorite! Dad had the Steak and Eggs and really enjoyed that too.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bardot

jCrGQS3WcwIjcx4whZOtRg.text: Keep coming back here, the food is amazing. Authentic French. High quality. Amazing drink menu, unbelievable. French onion soup to die for.

msJtQzGrwb_RObQbFmaFZw.text: Only review of the bar.  Very good appetizers including charcuterie board and tasty craft cocktails.

8oMHxGFs3Twn7sImzGwvkA.text: We were able to make same day reservation for party of 14. Great ambience, good service & the food was surprisingly good. We were actually celebrating a birthday & a bit disappointed that they don't give a free desserts for celebrants. Nice place to eat if celebrating a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R0sISkO-ovYPv0qZXxxK9g.text: Ooh La La, it is wonderful to have Michael Mina's French brasserie at Aria's! I enjoyed having a nice time there!    Ambience 5: welcoming lounge filled with lively guests laughing and chatting while sipping at their drinks ... wowed when I was led to their oh so inviting dining room ... finishing were the more casually dressed and gatherings of families with young children from early seatings ... very popular place for big parties ... and, when the night moved on, stylishly dressed guests swaggered in!  Service 3.5: warm, funny, and personable was our waiter ... was rushed in finishing the first shared appetizer before having the second appetizer appeared, the table top just can't fit both plates; otherwise, the pacing was perfect the rest of the evening ... sommelier came to table at the start but never came back after I had decided what my entree to be as requested!  Food 3.75: their bone marrow with red wine onion jam AND their generous portion of seared foie gras were delicious ... I loved their warm beets & goat cheese tossed in a fantastic vinaigrette ... unfortunately, their lamb crown roast was a total disappointment - turned off I was with how much fat was left on the lamb!  Instead of dinner reservations next time, I'll be back at Bardot's lounge for their signature cocktails and bubblies with an hors d'oerves or two!  Cheers!

qwhI4dpNSfKkFewnTQibeQ.text: Came here for Happy Hour and found two amazing things: -The chicken sandwich dip -Eric, the bartender  Besides serving up a nice strong sidecar, Eric really made me want to return to this place, thanks to his friendly nature and great conversation.  Guys like him are the reason people like to spend time in bars (besides the alcohol).  Not only did he make us feel right at home, by treating us as if we were lifelong pals, he also asked us about our dinner plans and pointed us in the direction of Carbone, which was right across the way and did not disappoint.  Thanks Eric and thanks Bardot!

qmPAgE5oHogB1lUfvNXKsA.text: Fantastic french brasserie ambiance! Our party of 8 just had dinner here for the first time and were generally pleased. Highlights were the cheese plate, beet salad, and seared foie gras. We ordered "the world's best butter" for fun ( it came pre-packaged with a side of sea salt)and while it was impressively rich and creamy, my bro advised farm fresh butter in rural Portugal is still the best he's had. Moule frites were solid, but I was too stuffed from the starters to thoroughly enjoy them. Everyone who ordered the lamb said it was phenomenal so I'll have to come back for it.

ec_mJRKGsBMwj_oZJisVdg.text: Superb service.  The seafood tower, moules-frites, and prime rib were delicious!  The decor is classic bistro with a splash of romance: roses, dark wood, marble, and mercury glass everywhere.

cvMagFhGMieRVtwz2lUwvw.text: The Bardot Brasserie at The Aria is a French cuisine restaurant in a tribute to the classic Parisian brasserie at its finest! The dishes here are amazing!  For starters, I had the King Crab Crepe, together with Black trumpet mushrooms, sunny-side egg, normandic cider beurre blanc. Where have you ever had a crepe prepared like this? Anywhere? Except maybe in France? All of the ingredients were blended beautifully to perfection!   My main entree was the King Salmon Aux Lentilles, an organic Scottish salmon, beluga lentils, smoked tomato vinaigrette. Another perfect dish, indeed! The salmon was seared on the outside so the salmon skin was crunchy! After searing the outside, chef baked the salmon just enough, but leaving enough of the inside undercooked, making for another beautifully inspired dish!  For dessert, I had the Frozen Paris Brest, hazelnut ice cream, chocolate cremieux, and salted caramel. Lily, while preparing the utensils for my dessert, provided me not only with a spoon, but also a fork and knife! I jokingly asked, wow, do I really need a knife for my dessert? She laughed! When I got my dessert, yes, I'll need my knife! LOL. The dessert was actually 6 separate ice cream sandwiches craftfully connected together! It was like eating 6 ice cream sandwiches!  Props to my server Lily, who was warm and inviting through my journey through this whole experience! I will never forget her, and be sure to make a return visit here with other friends, if not on this trip, for sure in the future!  The restaurant was very elegant, high end and high class! The dishes are pricey, but hey, you get what you pay for! Right? There are flat screen TVs at the bar to make for more "casual" feel! It's a good thing we had an early dinner, 6:30, because by 7:00pm the place started to fill quickly! The whole experience here makes for my 5-star review to go with the 5-star dishes and 5-star experience! Special props to Chef Joshua Smith, under the tuitiledge of James Beard award winning chef Michael Mina! An unforgettable experience indeed! French cuisine at its finest!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trendy French restaurant

_NEkFUM-qhQVyq2IZhSgbQ.text: I had already read a lot of good reviews and we always try new places in Vegas. Bardot was fabulous, we loved it a lot. The service was the best. I  recommend Sean who was the Sommelier. I love cognac and wanted to try something different than my regular Remy. He suggested the Guillon Painturaud Hors d'Age Cognac, which was amazing great price for such an amazing taste. They have a large list of cognac and I loved it.  We started with the duck l'orange and king crab crepe. Wow. the duck was wonderful. I loved the crepe but not so much my wife. The onion soup was good but the best was the pork chop. The mac and cheese another tasty one. OMG yummy.   We recommend this place if you love great food. Oh and on a side note we saw Antonio Esfandiari , Poker, come in and sit about three tables away. Nice.

dpzC4XaGenBLdUtMV1PGHA.text: another great michael mina spot.  really amazing french menu, everything was spectacular!   favorite dish: the mac and cheese!!!   desserts are so so. photographer came around and took photos of us, which was nice touch
