qRYxRN4jSS9z-_IKr2D0xA.text: Had a party of 5 and made reservations for 8pm. However, we were running a bit late and needed to move our reservation back by 15 mins. The hostess was very accommodating and happily moved it back with no issue.   By the time we arrived, we were seated very quickly and already placed our orders within 15 mins of our arrival. They also provided 2 warm, baked baguettes that were very tasty with a side of salted butter. My friends thought the bread was so good, they almpst ate all of it before our main courses.   We ordered quite few dishes, 2 chicken plates, 1 lamb plate, 1 scallop playe, and 1 salmon plate, and 1 order of black truffle fries. We all shared a few bits and piece in order to enjoy everything we ordered. The scallops were very delicious, crispy sear on the outside and soft on the inside. The salmon plate was cooked at medium and I absolutely loved it. The chicken was very juicy and had a lot of flavor. The lamb was also delicious, it had a very light flavor in the center of the meat, but the seared portion had a wonderful taste.  Overall, the service and food was delicious. We will definitely return on our next visit to Vegas!

4tjxLEgUfXUpjmrSNvNTog.text: I'm writing this because I have been left waiting for a check for 25 minutes and I'm bored. The food was excellent but the service was terrible. Waiter was incredibly slow and inattentive.

C3QLImTzuAz_sKFNfjIeBQ.text: We ordered the Bone Marrow, Bread and Butter, Onion Soup, a 3 Cheese plate and Lamb Chop entree and Creme Brulee for dessert.   Our only disappointment was the Creme Brulee. I feel a great brulee MUST crack when whacked wit a spoon. We think they didn't torch that sugar enough. I could feel the unburnt sugar granules at the edge of the dish.   Other than that I freakin LOVED the food. The lamb, especially, was wonderfully delicious. I will be coming back for the lamb and soup. And next time we will try the apple gratin for dessert.   If you dig bone marrow or if you haven't tried it I simply insist you have it here! So worth it!

06AVjp9mVqSIaUc_NSYPtg.text: We went to Bardot Brasserie thinking that we would find a replica of a Paris brasserie. Well, the decor is very well designed, the service by Shannon very friendly and that's where the similarity ends. My wife's omelette seemed to come out of a pan of pre-made rolls, my lobster tasted somewhat blend, no home made sauce to accompany the dishes. So we were disappointed by the lack of culinary research and the wine glasses at $18 seem to be somewhat overpriced. Oh but we were in Las Vegas where everything is "oversized"!. chef Mina, you have a little way to go to reach the quality we were expecting for that price range.

QJ0D1YBcU2YWiyKDcPOFhQ.text: I LOVE Bardot Brasserie :)  I have literally been 5 times in the past 6 months, and really enjoy it even more, every time I go. The service is on point, the food quality is FANTASTIC, and I have not ever had anything but great times when dining there. In my experience, it's one of the more understated Michael Mina restaurants, but it is most definitely one of my favorites. I have frequented many others in Las Vegas and San Francisco and this is easily top 5 on my list.   Additionally, Bardot has a really elegant bar overflowing with tempting libations. All of your classic favorites are available, and a few that may be new for you to check out -  My recent favorite has been the MAN ABOUT TOWN: it's Rittenhouse rye, rooibos infused campari, and carpano antica sweet vermouth.. it's so elegant and satisfying. If that's not your thing, they have a mean wine list, ready to pair with your dining experience.   On the dinner menu - Like so many others have said, I cannot get away from the FOIE GRAS PARFAIT. It's so good, so decadent, so 'just right'. It is literally one of my favorite things on any menu in Las Vegas. So simple and delicious. It makes me happy every time I get a chance to enjoy it. I have also sampled their selection of very fresh OYSTERS, the crispy and elegant ESCARGOTS BARDOT, their KING CRAB CREPE, and their excellent WARM BEETS & CARAMELIZED GOAT CHEESE salad. Most recently, the classic style PATE de CAMPAGNE made it's way to our table, and was absolutely perfect. I am a fan for sure.   On one particular visit, my whole meal consisted of just starters and dessert and it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had in Las Vegas!  For the main course, the LAMB RACK "FRITES" is probably my favorite dish. It's designed to be shared for two and is a really beautiful and classic presentation of rack of lamb. As well, I have loved the OAK-SMOKED DUROC PORK CHOP, but one of my all-time favorites is a well prepared LOUP DE MER. Also known as a Mediterranean sea bass, Bardot prepares theirs grilled, with caramelized lemon, fennel, and steamed potatoes. Too right!  In every case.. every meal..  perfect.   Needless to say, if you ever have the opportunity to give Bardot Brasserie a chance.. please do. I haven't even touched on their amazing desserts and after dinner embellishments. This is a place to be savored and enjoyed. Check it out.  Happy Eating!

NctoOm739jyRfVxokx5e6A.text: Made a reservation for two, were quickly seated and sat for 10 minutes with no service, menus and drinks. My wife and I watched two waiters attend to our neighbors, while we managed to pour our own water. We left and asked the hostess for directions to another restaurant. Highly disappointed based on reviews and expectations of the brand.

pdq88J0c5LcE4Xojb3oU0A.text: Over my maany visits to Las Vegas, this restaura t is where I had tge most fun.  My fiance and I went for Brunch on Mothers Day.  The service was to die foe, if you go definetly ask for Rositsa!! She was amazing and made sure our every want and need was taken care of.  I had the French toast and my Fiance had the Hunters Waffle, and it was the best Eggs Bennedict and French Toast we ever had. Make sure you head over here ob your Vegas trip!!!

fY69sUlEFNRgj8_CAKthDA.text: Came in for a birthday. Little disappointed they don't do anything special for birthdays :( also kinda got ignored after a large table came in next to us. Food was okay, had the chicken and lamb. Probably won't try again.

8tOZr_6zBwUJ49xgG7Cctg.text: Great French food. Solid cocktails. Stay away from the smokey old fashioned it's ok and I LOVE old fashioneds of all kinds. Their happy hour is one of the best in vegas. Salmon tartare mmmmmm.  And their bartender know their drinks! Worth a visit and a great atmosphere!!!! Hard to find in the aria but worth the hunt!

GXRcKLreIb2WBdGZmRE1CQ.text: Absolutely amazing. I think this meal was one of the best meals I have ever had in my life. I had the French toast of course and it was out of this world. I told my boyfriend I didn't think I had ever been so happy in my life. They have a great selection of French and American breakfast lunch and dinner options. All kinds of coffee and champagne or cocktails. The ambiance is perfect, I thought about moving in. It's such a cute place and everyone is super nice and friendly. My boyfriend had the quiche which was rich but excellent. Will definitely come back whenever in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum. French toast, fruit plate with Greek yogurt and buckwheat beignets, fresh baguette and butter, and the quiche Lorraine.

kPDpgiriATVmdDFJZC8C-g.text: Came for a Elite Yelp event and stayed for the delicious drinks.  The peach infused bourbon was absolutely amazing!  Eric was our bartender and he suggested fabulous drinks and was quick on the refills.  We ordered the Fries with Chickpea sauce...oh the fries...so light and crispy.  We also ordered the beet, goat cheese, arugula salad...plate licking good!  I will definitely be back in the near future to sit down and enjoy a dinner here.  The service was great and the atmosphere was fun but classy.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach infused bourbon...oh yeah!!

KFBlc4JiA53AbMbZuuO0jA.text: Big let down.  My French Onion soup tasted burnt and the escargot was drowned out by the bread that wrapped it.  Wife's lobster bisque had no chunks of lobster like at the Brio, which we use as a comparison since it is very good. Her pork chop was flovarless.  My steak arrived cold but tasted good, excpet the red wine bordelaise was bland but horse radish one was good.  Daughter said her fish tasted good otherwise might have been a lower rating since our waitress was slow. We were falling asleep waiting for the desert menu which didnt really jump at you for choices. What is with them not having coffee on that menu. You would tjink they'd at least have French stlye coffee. Next time we will stick with the Effiel Tower French restaurant or maybe try another French one as we are looking for second French one if Effiel is packed.

mTOYm_3cVT9x3N7D-k8EBg.text: Brunch...  Hunter's Waffle. Croissant Benedict w/ Maine Lobster. French Toast.  Hecka good! Especially that French Toast! #smackin

S09TP3FQa4uZrPidh-kMQg.text: Went here for dinner before seeing Zarkana. We wanted to eat light, so we didn't get a chance to really enjoy the full menu.   My boyfriend ordered the gnocchi and I ordered the endive, walnut, and blue cheese salad and the French onion soup.   The salad was delicious. It had the right amount of watercress and vinaigrette to complement the main ingredients.  My soup wasn't too salty, as I've noticed some French onion soups to be. I tasted my boyfriend's dish and it was light with not too much sauce.   I also had the De Peche Mode cocktail. I forget exactly what was in it but I think it had chamomile, honey, whiskey?, peach something or other, and a sprig of thyme. It was pretty strong, I was impressed.   Overall great experience. Loved the decor and ambiance. Staff was attentive and professional. The noise level was pretty bad though. People talking loudly over the music which you could barely hear.

0A8spbKOeguy4KKBK9YmrQ.text: Great food & ambiance. Everything we ordered was delicious. Starting from black caviar, oysters to steak.

jbexPQow_hQjCVMuiXGVdQ.text: One of the best restaurants on the strip!  The service was spot on and the foie gras was delicious.  Cannot wait to go back just for that alone.  So good in fact, the server said he came to work for Bardot after having it?!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9-qIpkmvGxZEtAcLijMCGA.text: If I could give SIX stars I would do so.  We stopped by earlier to confirm that we wanted to spend our anniversary evening at Bardot and upon inquiring about a particular dish that we love there from past experiences, we discovered that it was served only for brunches, not dinners.   We thought that was that.  But the front hostess actually called out a server to discuss the item with us to confirm that we were speaking about the same item.  We made the reservation.  Upon arrival in the evening, we were promptly seated.   We were properly greeted and taken care of.  I ordered a rib eye steak but it came out overcooked a bit.  But at the luxary price that I paid for it, I returned it to the kitchen and asked for the lamb chops.   The manager, Mr. Anthony Carideo - general manager - came to my table and in one of the most excellent exhibitions of proper customer care, was nice, communicative, not overly drippingly fake, and admitted fault - immediately - "it was overcooked - I looked at it and it was cooked medium well" (I ordered medium).   We chatted a bit about life, and he appropriately moved on.  The chops arrived and as the rest of the food, including my wife's and our other dishes, and drinks, they were excellent - fantastic.  But wait.  The best was last.  At the conclusion of the meal, they brought to us THE SPECIAL DISH that we wanted so much that is not normally made for dinners.  It is a like a fruit/yogurty type of a tray.  We were happily surprised.  We also had our photos professionally taken there and bought the photo.  Thanks Bardot - you were the BEST part of our Vegas trip.

IRptiEJFq89QpKBvDnyRmQ.text: Wife and I had an early dinner at Bardot before seeing Zarkana (The Circus de Soleil show at Aria.). The Zarkana theater is right next door to this restaurant. The food was very good and prices reasonable (OK...I did pay $60 for my petite filet. But it was one of the best steaks I've ever had!) Let's start with the bread-freshly made baguettes. Bardot makes its own baguettes every morning and they're great. We shared a crab crepe for an appetizer. It was very creative with a sunnyside-up fried egg, chunks of crab, spinach and garnished with green apples on a whole wheat tortilla. I had steak frites (a petite filet) and my wife had a cod fish entree. The cod was somewhat bland, but the cut of fish was very good. Here's my basic breakdown of Bardot:  1. Food: B+ (I don't believe in grade inflation; so the food really was quite good eventhough my wife's entree could have been better.  2. Waite Staff: B+  Our waiter was a little cold, but very efficient and professional. We told our waiter that we only had 1 1/2 hours for dinner because of our theater tickets. No problem. We were easily served within that time and got to our theater seats 5 minutes before show time. Perfect.  3. Ambiance: A-  This restaurant has a beautiful bar. It's generally a quiet restaurant with the tables spaced far enough apart so you don't have to be an unwilling listener to the next table's gossip.  4. Presentation of Food: B  Nothing too over-the-top  5. Table Setting: C  This is my biggest complaint of Bardot's. The tables were marble with very little on them. The tableware, china, etc. did not seem on a par with a restaurant of this caliber. The table setting was quite cold. But this is a very minor point and shouldn't stop you from eating at this wonderful restaurant.  Highly recommend this restaurant. We'll be back.

c9FqKyUTqunLar08_z3oiA.text: Another awesome experience at Bardot! Mussels, foie parfait, escargot, and some of their soupsthis go around. Delicious! Topping it off with the coffee crepe bruleeand their totally unusual strawberry baked Alaska (by far the best baked Alaska I've ever had). I recommend coming here for happy hour as well - from the lower priced drinks, cognac, and chartreuse, to the delicious tartines and Tartare it's an awesome casual experience.

O7_Q_vHnDxm3TY8cmCuyKg.text: Renewed experience - updated review.  It goes without saying, Executive Chef Joshua Smith and General Manager Gerti Gjika are running a gem of a restaurant nestled within one of Las Vegas premier luxury Hotels and Resorts.  Joshua and his staff bring the elegance and sophistication of French cuisine to a beautifully crafted space were guest can embark in a culinary journey rivaling against even the best rated Michelin star restaurants within the Las Vegas Boulevard.  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2_9KV1WQpYJQifaRJmaulQ.text: Came here for brunch, my favorite thing was their bacon, thick and juicy. We also ordered escargot, roasted beet salad, and an egg omelette.  Everything was good but nothing really wowed me.   The service was not bad.   I would definitely come back here again to try their dinner, perhaps have drinks at their beautiful looking bar.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot

uJ3leE6VGttxyC3oNHjf6Q.text: In my mothers words, "that was one of the best brunches Ive ever had". Whenever I have a poor experience at a restaurant that consistently gets 4 and 5 star reviews I always want to go back and give them a second chance. My second visit to Bardot was extraordinary.   We decided to try Sunday brunch this time and it was packed full. Service however was excellent from the time we sat down until we left completely stuffed. We started with peach bellini's and that wonderful pastry basket filled with light delicious pastries that will make you think you are in Paris.   Our table shared the king crab crepe which was presented beautifully. It was served open faced with the perfectly cooked egg in the center of the dark buckwheat crepe. When you mix the egg, crepe, king crab and mushrooms together it is a rich and elegant way to start your brunch.   We also enjoyed the Le steak burger, hunters waffle and the french toast. The steak burger was excellent, cooked perfectly medium rare and the hunters waffle was an interesting mix of duck confit and poached eggs served on a waffle. Now...for that french toast.   You have never seen anything like it. It is HUGE. A super thick slice of brioche with a giant scoop of vanilla marscapone and two large pieces of almond brittle. Stunning when placed on the table but even better in your mouth! The almond syrup is a perfect match. The outside of the toast is crispy and the inside soft and warm. This is a must order item.   The food and service was worthy of all their 4 and 5 star reviews. I am really glad we came back to Bardot and it definitely won't be our last time.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast. The biggest piece I&#39;ve ever seen!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunters waffle. Eggs were perfectly poached
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab crepe. Rich and delicious

HxlnYkLw8c82pVPboUABUw.text: King crab crepe! Omg. Flavor combination out of this world. Buckwheat crepe, don't let that scare you, trumpet mushrooms and sunny side up egg. Decadence!!! Hunters waffle also out of this world. Belgium waffle, duck, poached egg.  You should also try the short rib Benedict. All great choices and $20 all you can drink...rose...sparkling or dry. Heavenly brunch!

vNkE6-0jxDdqSjTxUYa9Sg.text: Bardot was awesome. Did a tapas style brunch so we could try a bit of everything( as recommended by our top notch waiter Oscar). Tartar, Foie gras parfait and French toast(best I've had) were my favorites. Service was great and staff very friendly.     Manager Matej customer service was outstanding. Had met him the day before, we came by for brunch and were told that they only do brunch on Saturdays and Sundays. So we rescheduled for the next day and sat at the tables in front of restaurant deciding what to do for lunch.  A moment later Matej came up and handed us waters and said going to be hot out there today,  got to keep hydrated. Next day he remembered us and thanked us for coming back and checked on us personally. Then later sent us some complementary birthday/Father's Day desserts.    Definitely coming back.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7jm9-LkR7jaBtQ1F0IcO6Q.text: Staying at Aria for a getaway weekend and we had such a great dinner on Friday night at BARDOT Brasserie, combined with a ton of 5-star reviews, we decided to give it a try before we had to make our way to the airport to go back to reality!  We had 10am reservations for 3 and we were warmly welcomed at the hostess stand and taken immediately to our table. The waiter stop by quickly and took our drink order...did I mention they have bottomless sparkling Rose' at brunch?  Thank you...we'll take 2! We ordered the French Omelette served with fresh herbs, hash browns and a light salad and it was the best omelette we've ever had!  We also ordered the French Toast, which is a lie because it is a BLOCK of brioche bread with slightly sweetened mascarpone cheese, almond bark and almond syrup. Unbelievably decedent and perfectly prepared...just look at that picture!  I had the French Dip with fries. Again, another masterpiece!  This place rocks and you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BARDOT&#39;s signature French Toast with mascarpone cheese, almond bark and almond syrup!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The French Omelette, with hash browns and a small salad....absolutely perfect in every way!!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip with fries....yes, it was that good!

7G8s2X41MPkhEMvbludJDQ.text: Didn't think I was a fan of French food, but this was an incredible experience. The most delicious food ever, attention to every detail, and the staff was amazing. Made me feel like a queen! Shout out to our server Kim! Took the time to describe almost every dish in detail, and making great recommendations. Left feeling like old friends. Seafood Tower platter, Maine lobster bisque, King crab endive salad, Chicken Roti...all amazing! Chocolate macaroon with chocolate mouse inside also amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster Bisque
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Roti with mushroom bread pudding
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab Endive salad

teAH4S8jnuhOGW1FNpCTDg.text: Came here for my birthday not to long ago after dropping hints that this is where I wanted to come.  Located at the Aria you already knew this place was going to be a step above the majority of the restaurants on the strip. Gorgeous modern and nostalgic decor is noticed as soon as you walk onto the marble floor and into this eclectic brasserie.    It was a very busy night but we were seated immediately due to the fact that we had reservations. Definitely not a great place for a first date or a romantic evening, as the seats are rather Close together. Great for a night out with friends in town or to celebrate something special.  Started off with the French onion soup and the steak tartar. Onion soup was phenomenal. Large portion with excellent flavor. Caramelized onions with a generous helping of brioche style bread in a decadent beef broth. The cheese on top was melted to a golden brown. 5/5 Steak tartar.... wow enough said. Topped off with a quail egg and seved with row of crosscut chips. Seasoned beautifully it had a crisp and refreshing taste. 5/5.  Next was the scallops and fillet. Fillet was very tender and juicy. Standard fillet. Seasoned ok, salt and pepper. 4/5. Scallops were succulent and cooked perfectly as to not dry out. 5/5  Ended the night with the baked Alaska. Amazing table side flambe presentation but all in all a 3:5. Nothing spectacular.   Great atmosphere, pretty good service and amazing food make for a great combo here.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Alaska
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

kQxUAgyeLErYwGQCkgqLjA.text: This was such a great dining experience. It was my first Michael Mina restaurant and I loved it. My favorite part of this restaurant was by far the ambiance. I was transported to France and our waitress even had a french accent! We tried a variety of brunch dishes and each were spectacular. The croissant Benedicts are so freshly made and the croissants and perfectly flaky and delicious and the eggs were beautifully poached and runny. We made reservations so I recommend you do the same! Bon apetit!

xm6-bZL4XRKzAi18IXePrw.text: FIVE STARS!!!! My wife and I went into Bardot last week and had the chef tasting menu. It was unbelievable, and not like anything we had experienced before. The sommelier recommended a wine pairing and that was to die for. We will 100% be back!

VHhtMMxVayZVv44jq0ooWg.text: The octopus had a lot of flavor! It is worth trying! The lamb was not so good was missing meat and taste. The snails is well cooked and had a lot of garlic and taste. The seat is not as comfortable for a $$$ place. It would be better if the seats were more comfortable. Overall the food is very delicious!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WpCskS7-nZre2QSfBj4bmA.text: Our group was really dissapointed with our recent experience here.  We are locals and suggested this restaurant for dinner to accompany out of town guests as we have had brunch here on a number of occasions with great results. Unfortunately,  our dinner failed to impress in some areas.  Firstly, the good; the food was outstanding.  The menu has a good scope of few, but great options to supply exciting dishes for a multiple coursed dinner.  The drink and wine menu is superb.  Some may find it lacking in less expensive wine options, but this should be expected from a restaurant such as this on the strip.  The restaurant itself is also very attractive.  With that said, our issues were directly related to staff and service.  There was just an overall lack of friendliness or welcoming from anyone really.  Our server was clearly, with no doubts, annoyed by our presence.  There was a lack of overall attentiveness and also a clear feeling of being rushed out to move us on.  I assume this was because we hadnt ordered $300 bottles of wine like the table adjacent immediately upon seating.  We would have loved to have enjoyed multiple drinks however our glasses were prompltly cleared after our first round with no offer for anything more until something was said 20 minutes later by a member of our party.  Even the hostess upon departure said nothing at all.  It was also uncomfortably warm in the restaurant.  We shortened our evening and left the property promptly.  All this said, even with fantastic food and a beautiful restaurant, the service truly can be the degrading factor of the overall experience.  Locals, I recommend elsewhere.  There are too many great restaurants off the strip anymore to pay strip prices for extremely lackadaisical  experiences anyways.

mymDESeVyO0mfYfRVG4RCA.text: The decor of this place for both the interior and exterior is very French cafe style. The menu is straightforward, the service is attentive. Started out with Foie Gras Parfait, charcuterie board (try the grey stuff, it's delicious!), and cheese plate with the Comte, Mimolette Vielle, and Couronne de Fontenay. The Couronne pairs really well with the jam which is sweet, fruity, and floral.  The food was fabulous. We had the Beef Wellington, Scallops Veronique, and the rack of lamb. C'est magnifique!  Dessert was the chocolate macaron (so delicious), Mille feuille (meh bc I'm not a fan of the goat cheese here), and the baked Alaska which gets covered in rum and lit on fire.   Lovely interior and great French food made for a memorable evening.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior with lovely roses
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops Veronique

yzJb72x2oge23V0IJ4Qx1A.text: Wanted to try something new in the Aria and had a very good meal at Bardot Brasserie.  Started with the steak tartare, which was good but not exceptional.  The main, duck, was exceptional.  A large portion, prepared perfectly, with a wonderful sauce.  I would have given the restaurant 5 stars but in Vegas the expectations for 5 stars are incredibly high.

hCiVcf13rNHc_Ol-DW6EKA.text: I have been to Bardot a number of times.  Recently, 6 of us gathered here for dinner with Chef Josh Smith demonstrating once again why this is the best French food in Las Vegas and beyond.  Standouts were the Beef Wellington--a masterpiece of rare beef surrounded by mushroom duxelles and a flaky pasty, the endive and bleu cheese salad (refreshing and plated in a very pleasing fashion), the scallops, and the duck breast.  I have left out some of the other items but the whole meal was outstanding.    Desserts are a must.  The espresso creme brulee was so different and having the Baked Alaska once again is a show both for your eyes and your taste buds.  Service is always excellent.  Walking away having eaten too much but feeling very good, I was thinking about when next to return.  Kudos to Chef Smith and his staff!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sour cherry clafoutis.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espesso crèrme brûlée with beignets.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Alaska with banana rum ice cream.

wNbCt5PUwmw4kTJWTWXSUA.text: Checked this place out for Happy Hour and pleased we did. The restaurant is beautiful and the service we received sitting at the bar was flawless. The house choice of red wine, a pinot noir that evening was lovely and a decent pour for the $7-8 price. I enjoyed the fact our bartender was making sure anyone who wanted refills got them before the 7 pm cut off point. The HH menu is varied with petite portions, minus the Charcuterie Board, which, is larger, and a steal for $17. The menu items we received were delicious and made with love. You could easily make a meal out of two-three choices. If you are staying at the Aria or close by and want to dine on a budget, I highly recommend these folks between the hours of 5-7pm.

7GtDE2ZsvcPx1FG3wig9NA.text: Everything from the hostess to the table attendants are superb. The food is amazing and I'm pretty picky. So far my favorite restaurant in Vegas and I've been coming here for years.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast &amp; avocado Benedict

Wiu8424P89akeknjhHBPhw.text: This has to be one of the best breakfasts I've had in a while!   First off... the French toast is HUGE! Definitely can be split. It melts in your mouth and is accompanied with a very tasteful almond syrup concoction. This is all made even better by a light almond brittle that comes with it.  I split the above French toast and a croissant Benedict with the short rib. Adds a little more substance to your breakfast and has some fantastic flavor.   What could make this better? Why a bottomless rose to start your Vegas day off right.  Finally, a shout out to our server Tish! The entire experience was made even better by her attention to detail and infectious personality. Thanks for the fantastic dinning experience!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zebOaYmPnojsixaI_h2HVA.text: Top notch classy place in Aria.  I was here on a weekday for lunch with my husband, as work brought him to Vegas for the week. We had our 13 month old with us, and I instantly was nervous because walking in it was clear that the restaurant is posh and probably not keen on having babies in the dining room.  Luckily, it was pretty empty, and doubly lucky, my son was an angel and didn't throw any food! Our server was super professional and nice, and gave us lots of good recommendations on food and wine pairings. Hubby's coworker was dying to try escargot, and he said they were good, but he was disappointed that they weren't prepared classically.   French onion soup- I LOVE me a good onion soup covered in that melty cheesy goodness. This soup was good, but not too memorable.   Lobster bisque- Hubby ordered this, and he's not really a soup guy, or a rich thick food guy either, so I was surprised he ordered it. I thought it was good, it had a strong lobster flavor to it which was nice since usually you can't taste it.  World's best butter- the guy we were with ordered this, as he's never had French food before and wanted to go all out. You spread it on the bread, then sprinkle some sea salt on top. It was pretty tasty, I have to say, but their regular bread and butter was just fine to me too.  Chicken cordon bleu- Delicious! I've never had this dish before but I've always wanted to try it, and it was really yummy. Prepared perfectly, it had a nice crunch but the chicken inside was still juicy and moist. My baby loved it!  Steak frites- the two guys ordered this. The steak was great, prepared nicely, and their fries were delicious.  Overall, we had a very lovely, pleasant lunch here. Yes it's pricey, but the food was really good and I'd say worth the price. The restaurant space is gorgeous, and our service was top notch!

yRjEhF5YPG2Mon6DTIS_9A.text: So this is a brunch spot in the aria hotel I believe and honestly speaking it was just ok at best. Service was nice but super slow and my dishes were alright. I ordered the salmon benedict and I love the idea of using a croissant as a base but unfortunately the salmon was overcooked and not "smoked" at all. I also ordered the escargo which was super salty and I could really only taste the puff pastry surrounding the snail. Sad to say I won't be coming back here again for brunch.

lEwOAsa8vN939roI81aMtg.text: As French food goes this was a big meh. Went here for brunch, pretty busy and fairly expensive for the food - not great value. Nutella sticky bun was not very appetizing and very rich. Ham and cheese croque sammy was standard. French onion soup was ok, but the broth needed help. The buckwheat crepe with crab was the best part of the meal - fresh tasting and overall a pretty decent dish. Service was just ok. Way better french food options in town elsewhere.

MeMC7RJ9zmSoQpfiZ4pM0A.text: Reserved a table for 5 at 12:30 on Sunday and was seated within 5 minutes of arrival. We had the La Boulangerie starter, which comes with 4 pastries, (2 croissants, 1 raisin sweet roll and 1 other danish). I had a bite of the raisin danish and croissant, both of which were good. They also brought out two baguette loaves, but I didn't have any, as I didn't want to fill up on any more bread.   For the main course, I ordered the french toast. My jaw dropped when I saw the size of this dish. I wasn't super hungry, so I knew there was no way I was going to be able to finish. That being said, it was one of the best french toast dishes I've had. The brioche just melted in my mouth with every bite. I barely even needed any of the mascarpone or syrup. Unfortunately, I was only able to eat about half of it. I skipped the almond brittle, as I'm not a fan of brittle in general. Others at my table enjoyed it however.    I also ordered the double cut bacon and was not a huge fan. I admit, I had no idea on how thick it would be, as it was much thicker than I was expecting. I'll stick to the old fashioned thin and crispy version in the future.   The service was a bit slow on the water and unlimited champagne refills. Except for the bacon, everyone in my group enjoyed their meals.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with almond brittle

BmqhexILtJf4c9JSPBS07w.text: Edit: the manager took our concerns seriously and absolutely tried to make it right. I am appreciative of that and want to acknowledge.   Service was neglectful. Example: my husband did not touch his drink as it wasn't to his liking. Waiter never noticed/inquired. Food was all right - nothing we ordered - onion soup, lobster bisque, double cut ribeye, or mouses frites was a standout, but not bad either. Hoping they keep improving as concept is great.

24P3qBG4FGVeA-IYC9g3GQ.text: Love this place. Great service. Good for groups. Went with coworkers. We all got the group feed me option where they just bring you a variety of items. All so good and a great variety.

FMp3FwZ_IDPDCnSFok350Q.text: I was sad to see Michael Mina's American Fish close, but was more than assuaged after eating at Bardot.   The restaurant is beautiful--completely redone to go with the French brasserie theme with plenty of painted wood paneling, brass, Mercury glass, and detailing. All those hard surfaces result in a super noisy restaurant, but it's pretty to look at!  Bardot is open for brunch 10:00-2:00 on the weekends only, and dinner every day at 5:00. They offer happy hour with food and drink specials each night til 7:00 in the bar.   Loved the smoke and mirrors cocktail, with the sweet balanced out by the smoke.   My favorite thing, which was ordered as an afterthought, was the beet salad. A beautiful presentation, and it's even tastier than it looks. Lightly grilled goat cheese, hazelnut oil...mmmm.   Pretty restaurant, pretty food, pretty people...must be Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mille feuille
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fanciest side of avocado I&#39;ve ever seen
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab crepe

ieYr_zpTHTe2dqZeYKlmYQ.text: The Chef's Tasting Menu is only bested by the fabulous service at this beautiful brasserie. Even with a full house, service was attentive, non-intrusive and polished. The location is another wonderful benefit. BARDOT is centrally located but not hammered with noisy and/or annoying foot traffic. The setting is right out of a romantic movie set in the City of Lights.  The Mina Group is well known for hiring the well and solid, ongoing training. This is evidenced by a staff that actually look and feel like they enjoy what they do. The management are what you can expect from such a strong brand(s) - excellent, personable and superb at anticipating needs and wants.  Each dish, as with the hand-crafted cocktails, was thoughtful, sensational and flavorful. BARDOT ranks among my favorite places in Las Vegas. Your expectations will be exceeded and you will have a fun time to boot!

7up7AGemIwis_VUyLG1THw.text: Typically we are die hard Mon Ami Gabi fans but this trip we ended up going to Bardot three nights in a row for Happy Hour and then for Saturday brunch before our flight. Everything was great! We sat at the bar each time and the service was impeccable. We were so impressed by both Eric and Brooke!  They are the kind of bartenders that can provide professional service while chatting with each and every customer - and always with a smile! A thank you goes out to Alex too for remembering each time not to put ice in my water. Thanks for a great experience! p.s We loved the Tartare and each of the Tartines but my all time favorite was....And God Created Woman - a perfect cocktail! yum

RpCeC4ww1DRVRquzNNdmiQ.text: Food was excellent and so was the service! You could tell our food sat in the window for quite some time, but, it was delicious. I ordered the lamb burger with the onion bun and my husband had the turkey burger. The portions were great and the coffee was delicious. The prices are average and the beer specials are good too.

wrOFjWLn275SwucOlsFTNQ.text: Sea bass is cooked beautifully, very flaky and buttery. Pairs well with a crisp white wine and served with fingerling potatoes and onions. Hope you don't need to kiss someone immediately post meal. Bread offered but didn't try it. My neighbor ordered the chicken, which was served with green beans- he loved the chicken and his side of frites. Brass bar is beautiful with a good atmosphere. Make a reservation if able for main dining room.   Came for late HH tonight and am SO thankful I did!! I ordered the burger, and it is literally the best burger I've ever had. Do it!!!!!!!!!

KfDOrvvWZaexWkeV8YDjKQ.text: People at the front desk are horrible.  Foods great if you can get past the attitude. Told us to wait extra time for our reso while seating people in open seats in the lounge. Don't waste your time if you don't have to.

StRvHn1o-iqIW5_vTIMm4g.text: Went with my wife this past weekend and all I've got to say is WOW! I was blown away with the customer service and the amazing food. Everyone who served us was very attentive and made us feel like royalty.   Thank you to Raymond and our waitress, sorry I can't remember your name but you worked sat 1/12/19 630p, and to all the ancillary staff that made our experience at your restaurant a spectacular and unforgettable experience.

ZxwFNMJVGICKRvCVagEv-Q.text: My best friend took me here for my bday. We got the best chocolate macaroon for dessert and for the meal I got octopus and she got the chicken. We also got appetizers. I got a beef tartar; it wasn't to my liking but I didn't complain. She got pate and that was excellent. All in all I give it max stars because the staff was incredible and we had the best time. And aside from the one dish, it was the best food ever. Also the ambience was five star. Whoever designed the restaurant did a perfect job.

nwKwk8K1gNHpYi4v2MpBfQ.text: Splendid! My boyfriend and I came here back in September on sort of a last minute dinner decision, after we napped a bit too late (as one does in Vegas after a Saturday by the pool). We booked the last reservation of the evening at Bardot, somewhere around 10pm.   Hidden in the beautiful Aria, Bardot is a little Parisian delight! We were seated cordially at a candlelit table in the emptying bistro. The decor was adorable, the bar incredibly beautiful, and the service impeccable!  We started with wine, and found the perfect glasses per the expertise of our waiter. We decided on what I imagine to have been a seasonal appetizer at the time-- burrata with fresh stone fruit and seasonal squash. Positively scrumptious! Very refreshing, light, and an incredible blend of flavors.  We moved on to dinner, and ordered the 14oz ribeye to share and the blistered green beans to pair. Our steak and frites came out split  in advance, a very sweet gesture by the chef as well as our servers! We surely appreciated not having to awkwardly slice and section off a steak, which would surely crowd the table. We had eaten at multiple steakhouses in Vegas on our trip, and it was certain to both of us that Bardot's ribeye was the most flavorful cut with beautiful marbling. They served us the freshest, most raw horseradish per our request-- a rarity to get it so perfectly raw! The green beans with lemon and almonds were a wonderful touch to our meal that was splendid to begin with.  After dinner, the professional photographer (I believe her name was Brittany?) came along to offer us portraits, to which we happily obliged. She was an absolute sweetheart with a creative eye. We left Bardot satiated with a delightful meal with wonderful service as well as beautiful portraits we will surely cherish to remember the evening!

do6QrAy6bgSLvOUqHRlvJA.text: I have only sat at the bar here, which is great! There is nothing I have had so far that I didn't like. The Deluxe French Onion Soup is to frikin dis for... it has beef and egg inside it and truffles on top! So good!

BsAMxXlFJB6hV0mqTjgqXw.text: Oscar was fabulous! One of the best servers I ever had. Such great hospitality! The food was amazing as once the ambiance. Certainly a place for a Vegas brunch!

EF9_ud3SI1aI0AIBqxc-Qw.text: **FANTASTIC DINNER IN LAS VEGAS**  ABOUT ====== Classic French brasserie experience offering traditional brasserie fare by Michael Mina. Located inside the Aria.  AMBIANCE ========= Feels of dining at a Parisian cafe but with a modern craft kitchen. Dressy casual.  FOOD ===== FOIE GRAS PARFAIT - $18 Ruby port gelee with grilled country bread was the highlight of the meal. Beautiful and high quality. The fluffy taste is unbelievably good. Can't stop thinking about it and came back the next day for it. RATING: 5/5  ESCARGOTS BARDOT - $18 These wild burgundy snails with toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter and puff pastry shells were surprisingly different and wonderfully delicious. RATING: 4.5/5  BONE MARROW AU POIVRE - $17 The peppercorn-crusted bone marrow with burgundy onion jam and a side of grilled country bread was OK. Not as fatty and scrumptious as I would like. RATING: 3.5/5  MUSSELS MARINIERES* 29 These Prince Edward island mussels, in garlic butter, dolin vermouth,  and tarragon were juicy and tasty. The warm baguettes came in handy for the broth. RATING: 4/5  MACARONI & MIMOLETTE GRATINEE - $13 My least favorite dish. Not as traditional American as I would like, but it's French, so I get it.  Not gooey. A bit on the dry side. RATING: 3/5  DESSERTS - $13 each ========= MILLE FEUILLE My favorite! Caramelized puff pastry layered with vanilla creme patissiere. Classic and excellent. RATING: 5/5  CHOCOLATE MACARON French chocolate cookie with Valrhona chocolate mousse can be shared. It's big and very chocolatey. RATING: 4/5  CREME BRULEE Vanilla bean custard and turbinado croquant were OK. Wasn't the best I've had, but solid. RATING: 3.5/5  BEVERAGE - ~$15 ========= CLASSIC VODKA MARTINI Done perfectly, thank you. RATING: 5/5  APEROL SPRITZ Also done perfectly. RATING: 5/5  PRO TIP ====== Look into their Everlasting Rose during brunch for $20 (Saturday & Sunday | 10:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m.) Heard their Nutella Sticky Bun, Croissant Benedicts, and Hunter's Waffle were killers.  OVERALL ======== One of my favorite dining experiences in Vegas. Good for groups and dates.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras parfait and bone marrow!

1Cj7A2dSKolKbntUQjVbcw.text: If you are coming here for a good steak Avoid it at all costs. The steak was super dry and crusty even though I asked for medium rare. It was overly salted as well. We also ordered asparagus and it wasn't cooked through.   Vic stewards and the Eiffel Tower have the best steaks for the same 65$  Eiffel towers steak is the best

6lePHGgfO9vUgGKKYwA6VA.text: By far the BEST French restaurant in Vegas! Bardot is a hidden gem inside Aria casino. Food is amazing, I was surprised to see how many vegetarian options they have. We started with their endive, walnut and blue cheese salad which was amazing. My husband had  chicken and my 10 year old devoured the filet mignon. I had the parisian gnocchi which was the best I ever had. This place has the most creative and delicious sides. Their macaroni and cheese is truly unique, picture attached. We also tried their chick pea frites with eggplant caviar, so delicious!! Wine selection is very good, they have wines from all over the world. However full you are, dessert is a must try. We had their creme brulee and giant chocolate macaron and Mille feuille, couldn't decide which one was better.  They have a great happy hour too. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chick pea frites with eggplant caviar
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parisian Gnocchi

sht3rZNjsgW7pfpNSgEYoQ.text: Matthew was our server and we chose the dinner tasting menu. Matthew was very attentive and personable which made our experience even better. With a wide array of French cuisine such as fois gras and escargot, our taste buds had an adventurous evening. Would highly recommend.

SQqglK9q-wAQKwLXJixhlA.text: Wow is the word!  So we arrived and we're going to be seated in the dinning room, but ended up staying at the bar. Don't let this fool you! Great experience and amazing service form all the staff and managers. Bardot food and signature cocktails for sure are meant to be remembered.   We started with the Escargot Bardot which was so delicious that you don't want to stop eating!  It's a puff pastry made to perfection!  Foie Gras Parfait....wow!!! I'm not a huge fan of Foie Gras, but this was so good I seriously could not have enough. I'm sure my dinner partner was not happy since he loves it and I usually let him eat it all... Not this time!  It's a ruby port gelee and grilled country bread.  Another must have ! Duck A L'Orange- ( duck wings)  grilled wings, blood orange , sauce maltaise. cooked perfectly and just enough to keep you happy.   Charcuterie Board- it's super delicious and definitely a good dish to order if you have kids or picky eaters.  Looks like a flat bread pizza but taste like a million bucks! Very unique taste  housemade pate, heritage pork rillete and ham amazing.  Onion Soup with all the fixings was very tasty! Nothing to write home about, but if you like onion soup for sure a good choice !   Cocktails..... Well don't mind if I do!  lost Generation is a flavor of the old amazing flavors of what a conga cocktail should be. Great balance !  Also the The Ritz was   Very tasty and  "And God created  woman" was a great choice .  This place is a must visit when at Aria !  Overall Chef Mina does an amazing job  and i lol forward to coming by again to visit and try some other dishes as well as some wines !

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. charcuterie and tartar flambée
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion soup
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampling of our dishes !!

vhcJhcyIF32t70ArZLkWzw.text: Total disappointment. The menu looked so promising, brasserie classics, and unique starters. It was so loud that a conversation could not be held across the table, and on top of the echoing voices there was out of place club type music.  We started with the charcuterie board. Overall very nice, but we did not get to finish it because our food came out. There was not place on the table for the entree plates so I had to hold my hot plate while the food runner piled everything on the table on our half finished food. The waiter made us so uncomfortable about wanting to finish the starter that we just let him clear it.  My husband had a steak and fries, he enjoyed the steak, but the fries were not edible. We were able to squeeze grease out of them, and not just a drop. I had the pork, it came highly recommend from our server. It was overcooked, poorly butchered, and lacked flavor. The sauce was disappointing. The horseradish mashed potatoes tasted like raw garlic...which is strange. We only took one bite each, and decided they too would go uneaten.   The biggest problem came a few hours later, when we had to take turns in the restroom. A horrid end to our otherwise fantastic trip to Vegas.

nAM4fCt4wcWTfnzHWNCkpw.text: The Food was scrumptious  should have taken pictures , but too busy eating this amazing food.  Desert to die for Chocolate Macaroons. I am going back.

LMWvfbwN4JY260ur-h_QOg.text: Top notch restaurant.   I came here for a friends 30th birthday. We had to pick a nice restaurant to really treat him since he chartered a private jet and paid 3,000 for our suite. So this is what we chose and it lived up to our expectations.    Ambiance: modern take on traditional French architecture. Contrasted colors and brass everywhere. Very clean.    Drinks. I got a mescal drink with tobasco - it was not on the menu, but was fantastic.   Apps: I got bone marrow and escargot   Bone marrow : like always very good with chutney on the side.   Escargot: I didn't care for the fact that the snails were so hidden under so much stuff. But taste was good.   Food:  Lobster : amazing!  Definitely an a plus dish.   Sea bass : cooked perfectly.   Mac and cheese: neat take on the typical side dish. Seared on two sides. Also my looked like a pancake.    French onion soup: best I've ever had.

TwW9NZ5q9DNkQLeYmAMAYQ.text: Lovely brunch with great service.  Other reviewers are right, this place is LOUD.  The food was nicely presented and tasted good.   Although I wasn't a fan of the Salmon and lentils because the lentils had a very meaty taste that did not mesh well with the fish.  I had the unlimited rose wine for $20 - they aren't stingy and I left quite tipsy.

lQ0DYUByGW4UXDINdqNkvw.text: There are few times in my life that food has not been for a mere task of satisfying hunger, but actually been an experience and for satisfying all senses and desires! Obviously food can be sinful.   In this case Bardot was just that! A delectable, sinful experience that tantalizes all senses! We started off with a simple hors d'oeuvres such as the fruit plate which had the most amazing pistachio yogurt with it!not only where the tastes amazing but the display and pleading was exquisite. Nonetheless stopping at one appetizer would not do it. We also had a tasting plate of different pork pates` and presentation with crusty baguettes, thinly sliced cured ham, exquisite French mustard as well as butter that was to die for. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!   I had steak frites which seems safe, but it was nothing less than delectable! The fresh and cut fries were fried and salted to perfection. My mother had the salmon croissant eggs Benedict which was nothing less than a masterpiece for the eyes and a complete the affair to the stomach! Every creamy bite melted in your mouth! My cousin had French onion soup ( superb) and my son had beingnes ! Amazing!   Simply put the best French cuisine I have had In a while.   Some people  always rave about food but don't mention atmosphere in the review.. I'm not that gal!   Atmosphere was comfortable yet elegant. We had my two year old with us and the dinning room staff was so amazing to him and catered To us no differently than the business brunch group that arrived at the same time! Subtle lighting and clean modern French decor was romantic and fun.   I'd go back hands down!!

eY7nFzEHviii5ukRFccTvQ.text: One of our go-to happy hours when in Vegas, upstairs restaurant area of Aria.  Glitzy looking interior, lot's of brasswork around the bar.  Feels old and new at the same time.  Good cocktails and happy hour menu at the bar.  TV's at the bar, should you be in Vegas when your favorite teams are playing.  We enjoy the small plates to share for a quick pre-dinner meal and get boozy for the start of the evening!

l3uhJMzyTxZ0glYuG6BqzQ.text: Outstanding decor, our server was extremely knowledgeable. And the food was absolutely perfect. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Las Vegas. If you go ask to sit with Jamison

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck a l&#39;orange wings.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mille Feuille
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Crepe

qkW7phOe3bp6rAL6MM-A3A.text: Absolute disappointment!!! We were there this past Saturday a little before 5:00 p.m. The restaurant and bar are beautiful and it was the decor and ambiance that pulled us in. Unfortunately, the service at the bar was terrible. There were two male bartenders, a female bar back, and the bar itself was not busy at all. The bar back was completely attentive and on top of it with water refills. She actually had to remind the bartender twice that I was waiting for my second cocktail, which never came. After 25 minutes of waiting, I demanded our check, which included the cocktail he never brought. I told him he never brought my drink and then he remembered, he left it sitting on the other end of the bar. He asked, "Can I give you a to go cup so I don't have to take it off the bill?" Needless to say, I was furious at this point. He mentioned his bosses interrupted him and he forgot about my drink. Remember, the bar back reminded him twice that I was waiting. I told him to remove the drink from the bill and it took him another 15-20 minutes to get it removed. Dreadful service.

0fOd5WzIwRE3FBPWA24nBg.text: This place is soso bad in service!! Our waitress was so bad!! Her name is Nerdeia! So we sat down she must be having a bad day or something she didn't come to service us until 20ish min then came back take our order we order 2 bottle as a waitress u are subpost to pour us our drink but we end up pouring our own drink. She really was out of game. I have never been this upset at a waitress in my life!!Will never come back as long as she works there

MHZ2ghvgUG3dfNoOav2d4w.text: King crab crepe was generally good but the black stuff in the crepe wasn't properly cleaned so all I tasted was dirt. Service was lacking - It took about 20 minutes before someone popped up to ask if I needed any water.

Av5Mt3g8YDT4qeKw_bXDgA.text: We end there for brunch yesterday.... Absolutely amazing, from Decor and the open space sitting.... Food are Delish!!!! And they have $20 bottomless rose, definitely will be back again

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $20 bottomless rose
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab crepes

v_5VJp565qChCp8om9UefA.text: I went in with a group (Lip Smacking Foodie Tours) and was blown away.  The staff was friendly and professional and the food (deconstructed Nicoise salad and the duck wings are a MUST) was delicious.  I'm bringing my GF with me next time, a perfect "date night" spot.....  Cheers!

v0MEWt5BJ9TDHFnQ7Xyxiw.text: It was fine.  Very good service, very good cocktails, fair food, good ambience.  Excellent beer and wine selection.  Food took quite some time to come out, we were there for about two hours and we did not stay for dessert.    I really liked the place, it's just that the food itself was disappointing.

P6W1PCJhV9KduqKmP9nkXg.text: Just finished a great dinner at Bardot, but the most memorable part was the service and Nelson our waiter!  My husband ordered the pork chops which were VERY salty and just couldn't eat them...He wasn't sure if to say anything but decided to, Nelson replaced his order within minutes and also gave us two(!) desserts for the inconvenience..Such a sweet way to not make you feel like a tourist-one-time-comer that will not get good service.. Thanks for a wonderful evening and great food!

O4c4m8aQixWj4YyguNQxew.text: I think it is safe to say that whenever you start your day with French pastries and Rose that life is pretty darn good, and that's exactly how Bardot made me feel!   After a night out in Vegas there is nothing better than a beautiful brunch comprised of dishes ranging from out of this world fluffy french toast to savory steak and eggs. Lot's also not forget the most important party of brunch... The Bloody Mary. Staked with all the necessary accessories (a la olives, celery, pickle and lemon) this drink eliminated any pain caused the previous night and is possibly one of the best BM's ive had in Vegas, however be warned it is quite spicy but they are happy to make it to your tasting.   Bravo Bardot! Hope to see you again soon!  Thank you #YelpLADoesVegas!!!

wnJ4FFRALJ9URHLY24oK3g.text: The hostess was friendly but our waiter was just ok in terms of friendliness. We had steak and Alaskan cod. Good was cooked to perfection but it was too loud to have any intimate conversation. Also wish the waiter was bit more friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic crushed Alaskan cod
