7rBzlK-N5T7GVu7iFHJWyA.text: Exceptional! Everything was perfect!  Matthew was a great waiter and our food and drinks were delicious. Very large portions too, which made the prices seem reasonable for Vegas.

ADO-LpCxpBPwqcG5a03wKw.text: Fantastic food, great service in a beautiful restaurant. Make sure to try the escargot in puff pastry with chartreuse butter. To die for. Highly recommend this place

Wbhht6G7tN1v9UdKRg5deA.text: Amazing event the room is great and the food was stellar. I am looking forward to joining Mina's team for full dinner service soon. I can say that Bardot is going to be one of these great restaurants that many locals will drive down to the strip for.   Great job on the remodel and congrats to the Mina team.

hclghLHT0u1igHY5OWjTvQ.text: Fantastic meal at a reasonable price (for Vegas). Highly recommended, especially if you have a show to catch afterwards. We had tickets to O at the Bellagio and this was perfect.

4paB8PLLbW5JxLCIjTBdTQ.text: My most favorite dishes in the world: steak tartare, foie gras, escargot. All cooked to perfection! My fiance had a rib eye and it tasted like a filet, that's how tender it was! Fast service also. Our server was Latisha H. she was very nice and efficient :)

ILsLjZs_wUyLzGxL1Ragrg.text: I have nothing bad to say about this place. We went for dinner, our service was excellent, the food was delicious. Prices were very reasonable for what it was. We started with the escargot which was to die for. I had the gnocchi and my husband had the pork chop. Like all french dishes, the sauces on each entree were very rich. Unfortunately there was no room for desert.  Maybe next time!

s-lyY7dgvw3E6MGNbzxLag.text: Happy hour here was fabulous, as was the bartender's special.

Ok0GFeWUmd2z-fzqsnlQDA.text: i went to dinner with a group of friend we all ordered different menu items. The coup de mer was amazing the skin was nice and crisp! Everything was perfect. The food was served hot. And the service was spot on.

u1VCNs3Hllz9EjErTlvUDQ.text: Perfect. Jesus (our server)  and Kelly (The Sommelier) were fantastic! Food Quality was spot on, service was seamless, cannot say enough good things.

xOslLwHxz9KSOaRiWWuUmQ.text: edible expensive food but mediocre for French food.  the ambience is superior to food quality. the half chicken is deliciously cooked. the fresh green beans are bland American style.  the bread must be requested and is not uber fresh, a norm for a good French restaurant.  the escargot is sub mediocre.

WBwa7dVAOfsF6Y4LLlNEyg.text: What nice, elegant restaurant in the middle of all of Las Vegas' steak houses. The waiter was friendly and helpful. We had the cheese plate and sweetbreads to start. Both were excellent. We ordered 2 smoked pork chops which were very, very smoked. It was a bit salty, but still very good. We were a bit rushed to get to a concert so I'd like to go back and try dessert. Overall Michael Mina did it again!

Lfs8R29RTJDCdgK0HG_Ibw.text: Had reservations last night at 8:30 for 4. We're in from Dallas. I'm going to say it was a software problem? We arrived on time. Was asked to have a seat outside. No one stopped to offer us drinks. Although persons with trays came by. We gave up on that. We waited 45 min. A lot of employee activity at the checkin. Obviously a problem. Finally we were seated. I looked around and barely any tables had food on them only drinks. yikes. So possible staffing problem too. A mess. Our waitress was fabulous and the meal was super. We ordered the lamb for 2. Awesome! Could've been for 4. Foie gras was a miss, there was a consistency problem. Great banquettes and tasty butter. Gnocchi was great! Macaroni was excellent! Chicken was delicious and juicy! Prepared perfectly!  So, they came through in the end.  I believe fixing the hostess issue quicker than 45 min. With an experienced or aware manager I would've given them a 5 star.  $200 bottle of wine great choice...and de cantered. But the sommelier was very late on locating the bottle and seemed stressed. There were a lot of stressed employees. Need to work it out

MTx6Ywa11XgO85FuIrEaYw.text: Really nice decor, great ambiance and atmosphere. Impeccable service. Food was also delicious. Would definitely come back here!

QwasfpebBAD4fhQ0BLJU9Q.text: Terrific Service, Food & Ambiance!  Truly one of the best meals I've ever experienced in Vegas.  Our waiter "Nelson" was outstanding, he was attentive, but not overboard.  Lively atmosphere, great wines by the glass and the bartenders pride themselves on making your drink the way you like it.  Can't wait to go back.

r4fgG6c_UEiF8o6J0BrKHw.text: Lillian, makes it happen, behind the bar!  A lot of great cocktails and wonderful wine. Great food:  flat iron steak cooked to perfection, every plate hot and delicious.  Friendly atmosphere.  Definitely will come back!

doD565uOCmfk4tah2A1WYQ.text: Fabulous ambiance and service. You must try the escargot and duck wings for starter. Superb! the Lobster Thermidor was not what you would expect, all creamy and on rice, but sensational and even more succulent! Our server was the best but I can't remember his name though he was 100 percent French. Definitely a "do again".

XYlOmy6IJDreJ4KQv7Ns7g.text: 04/25/2015...went for brunch on Saturday & it was great. Attentive server was very helpful & friendly.  Had a Kir Royale...my fav champagne cocktail....Chambord & champagne & croque madam which was good but had way too much cheese sauce.  They bring a fresh mini baguette w/salted butter before your meal.  Also had the Mille feuille....a layered pastry with puff pastry & vanilla custard with a cinnamon sugar crunchy top. So good....I want to go here for dinner next time I'm in Vegas.

pwCJov6b7WnO8BhzqkL1Dg.text: Sunday brunch was impressive. If you like French Toast or Onion Soup & are ready for the next level, this is it.

myLpPLmDDjXpBZS4p4ch8w.text: Delicious French cuisine with the freshest ingredients, large portion sizes, great service, fair prices and the decor/ambiance absolutely beautiful. Ordered fresh-squeezed OJ, French press, fresh fruit bowl with a variety of fruits and ham croissant Benedict. Definitely coming back

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh-squeezed OJ, French press coffee, side fruit bowl, croissant eggs Benedict. Yum!

cMW1zH4Rk1XA8vqBKld5MQ.text: We came here for my honey's birthday brunch as he read great reviews about this restaurant.  When we were greeted by our server, I asked her if she could do something special for a birthday.  Her immediate response was not "Thank you for coming to celebrate with us or Happy Birthday" but instead it was a blunt - "We do not give free dessert."  Ummm.... really?!  Did I ask for free?!  I gave her a disgusted look and said, could the kitchen put a candle or something on a creme brulee or cake?!  She didn't even apologized for her tactless comment and simply said, "We can write Happy Birthday on the plate."  I replied and told her, "Yes, will you please ask the chef to do that after our brunch?" and she smiled (finally!) and said she'll be back to take our order.  After what seems like forever, she came back and took our order.  She recommended the Hunter's Waffle, which I ended up getting.  Sad to say, Michael Mina would have been disappointed at the dried, tasteless meat that was supposed to be "duck confit".  I never add salt to my meal, but I had no choice this time to give it some flavor!  I tried to catch our server's attention to let her know but she was no where to be found.  We tried to flag down other servers but all of them seem to have their eyes trained on looking down on the floor or tables -- and not on customers.  Granted -- it was a Saturday and they were busy but seriously, I was NOT impressed by the slow service -- or should I say the lack of service.  The only reason I gave this place a 2 star is because my honey's beef short ribs croissant benedicts was tasty.  Overall -- a truly disappointing dining experience...

XuppOPTjxkByul1u-lGbuQ.text: Two people ordered sparkling water and two of us asked for regular water... $18!?!  And we were NOT told that regular water would be $9 charge. Never heard of such a thing. Food was good though...especially the decadent French toast loaf which we shared four ways as a "dessert" after our brunch, it reminded me of angel food cake with crispy edges and almond syrup. Decor was pretty. Waiter was stereotypically French... He never smiled and was quite arrogant with us.

mb1D24fmJdGZm5TRBIkokw.text: Was really looking forward to dining here and was refused service because I was dressed too "provocative". It was dead inside and I was in disbelief that they would turn away business, rudely might I add. Definitely not coming back. They need to learn how to speak to patrons!!! Next pre shift topic maybe?

YgZTE56Ca8K__MeuACB0GA.text: Came here for Valentine's Day with my whole family.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and I'm giving them 4 stars based on the consensus of my group.  My boyfriend thought it was salty.  I had more of a 3 star experience - my filet mignon was not prepared as ordered and I sent it back.  I NEVER do that, but this steak was $54!!  I mean, come on!  It better be melt in your mouth orgasmic for that amount of money! And it truly was a very average filet, HOWEVER, after requesting it be redone, they did as I asked, fixed the problem and even took the item off the bill, so they more than compensated for the deficit.  I didn't mind paying for it but it just needed to be a $54 steak.  If you're gonna charge that, make it worth it.  But other than my solitary experience, like I said, the rest of my family seemed pleased, with their Salmon, Pork Chop, Chicken and less pricey steak.  Bread was yummy too.  Oh, and the ladies each got a long stem rose with dinner, for V Day.  Charming touch.  Nothing says romance like having dinner with your mother and two brothers.

fYfmybunG-9E4nVJIT87Yg.text: Ecellent service.  Our reservation requested a booth and although it was just the two of us, they seated us in one that accommodated eight.  The shrimp in the shrimp cocktail were enormous.   Brunch selections come with everything so no need to order a bunch of a la care items.   The Mille feuille was light as air, a perfect end to a lovely meal.

RZtlPBcINh3UsrF4QbMwRA.text: I have NO business going to a French restaurant.  I request everything sans beurre, sans frommage, sans lait, since my curse developed in later-life is to be unable to tolerate dairy (thank goodness it struck after an indulgent honeymoon eating through France.)  However, my dear friend wanted to enjoy a French meal, so we wondered into Bardot Brasserie.  First, I must say that the service was SUPERB, and to me, service is a make or break aspect to a meal. The waiter and wine attendant were both fun, knowledgable, informative, and just lovely.  Although the chef had every right to be un petit perturbed with a no-butter diner, he and the waiter conferred to decide what could be best modified for me, after I preemptively declined the salad nicoise.  Chacuterie plate with bread--yum!  Blue crab buckwheat crepe sans butter--good, not great-- although I did sneak a pinch of sauce on top.  Beet salad with arugula so good-fresh and nutty arugula with hazelnuts to accent the nutty flavor, went perfectly with the goat cheese (I had to have a bite of the cheese).  My friend was practically cooing with pleasure from her escargot wrapped in pastry; she said it was smooth and buttery goodness.  The suggested wine was a pleasant surprise.  I'm not a white gal (well, white wine, that is), but completely enjoyed the nectar-y German Kabinett.  Finishing sorbets--orange and mango--so fresh and clean and more fruit-filled than just icy.  Great espresso.  Overall, a wonderful, indulgent lunch and I look forward to going back soon.  SO, if this dairy-free gal can enjoy it so much, I imagine how good it is for those who are unencumbered.  5 stars for my enjoyment at Bardot Brassiere. And, I never would have known it was the 3rd day open--kudos to Bardot Brasserie!

uLhkMGjeZskh1gw1EiK5ag.text: This place was great! The service was outstanding, and the food was incredible. The steak tartare was the best I've had, the beet salad had so much flavor, and the mussels were absolutely incredible!

tNb2-vgOvOqmnxmr6CPllQ.text: One of our favorite brunch spots on or off the strip. Get there early cuz it does fill up pretty quickly

SD4GCw5PNIf9cfxxnyiTGQ.text: We ordered duck confit, escargot, onion soup, pork chop and steak. The food was good but to me a bit over seasoned and salty overall.  But the service was great.  I was eating pork chop which was slightly over cooked and the server brought a new one even before I tell them so! What a detailed oriented service.

CZBh6sIopqI92v00hcqeew.text: Wonderful French Bistro with a warm dark wood interior located on the Promenade level of The Aria Hotel and Spa in Las Vegas. The food was very good, as well as the drinks and desserts. We went there for dinner, as well as brunch. We received unlimited Rose during brunch, and the french toast was excellent. The sommelier, Kelly, was very nice, knowledgeable and professional. Both times we were there we had a wonderfully sweet and attentive server named Shannon. It's a great place to go if you enjoy quality French Fare with great service and a great atmosphere!

peSIOW0UzneCyzZn24XJMQ.text: This bistrot is truly a gastronomic delight with service to match.  Bistro cuisine with Maxim's prices, you will find something to delight your tastebuds from the truffled french fries to the luscious smoked duroc, double cut pork chops.  The food is fairly authentic and the wine list superb.  Be ready to let go of some serious cash for a 3-4 course meal with wine; however, in my opinion it would be better to spend your hard-earned dollars on some exquisite pate de campagne than blowing it at the casino tables! The former will leave you with some deliciously fond memories while the latter will leave you with a bitter taste in your maw!

1vNfnjJjLSnXQxFUIqUocg.text: We visited on the second evening that it was open.  Other than the host stating that he usually asks guests whether they have been here before, I discerned no indications of opening week jitters or kinks in the operation.  Our server was knowledgable and confident in the menu, fielding several questions on food and drink.  Timing and presentation were flawless with just the right amount of follow up.  Most importantly, all the dishes were a hit.  Gnochi, croque, flat iron steak, chicken, beet salad...all were a success.

Dy9qpFSPweiOG2JyJnKUhQ.text: onion soup was great, large portion and plenty of cheese. pate was very good. chickpea frites was an interesting dish, the eggplant dip went well with the frites (chickpeas mashed and fried like French fries). steak frites was a large portion also. pork chop was a little over cooked but the horseradish whipped potatoes were amazing; lots of horseradish. wine list is expensive! cocktails are good. very large beer list. daily happy hour I missed. I would return for sure. want to try the bone marrow next time

9YZ1XQ35Ef7oq-Rv4Ff_sA.text: The service was great, the food was really good and there was a cool atmosphere. And it was a really great value for a nice dinner too.

fkEYm1Un4ZdH4g1IbrZNcA.text: We went there for brunch and we had a really good time. It is a beautiful restaurant the food is great. Make sure to try the pastry basket. I had the Hunter's waffle and it was really good. Everyone in our party was happy with what they had ordered.

yUXXQwz82wNmAkURariqWQ.text: Classy ambience with amazing food and service. We ate brunch there and had the pastries as a starter. I don't think I can ever eat a store-bought pastry again. They were works of art and made to perfection. Beautiful, high-quality, and absolutely delicious.

HJKrDc-r9-fNZA9ZVBNcYg.text: The muddled mojitos were strong and above average. The French Onion soup had plenty gooey Gruyere. A bit thick, but very hearty (and filling). The duck wing appetizer was okay. The meat was great. The skin, however, should have been crispier. For entrees, we ordered the Lobster Thermidor and Cote de Beouf. Though the lobster tasted very good, $46 pp for 6 chunks of meat is nutty. Our server seemed perplexed when we asked what the difference was between Cote de Beouf and Ribeye. For all of you anglophones, the first is French for the second one. Anyway, it was excellent. The three accompanying sauces were amazing. The French fries were pretty darn good too. Yelpers rave about the macaroni gratinee. It tasted fine though the reason we thought it was fine is because we both liked Kraft Dinner and this was a baked version of that very boxed dish. One would expect to pay a lot for the sides, but $15 for this is crazy. All in all we enjoyed our dinner, but would not pay anywhere close to the $300+ tab if it weren't comped.

smj38VmVcgyJ1zDLQjmEgw.text: Incredible food and service!! I don't care for the strip but will go there for this place!!

9EY1jmCl0mDDh79FQHmE5A.text: My husband and I dined at Bardot Brasserie last night. We asked for a table in the middle of the restaurant and was immediately accommodated. There is an open air kitchen which is nice to see. The sommelier Kelly was very helpful and let us try a few samples of wine. We had clams and oysters which were fantastic. It is hard to find clams on the half shell in Las Vegas! Also the french onion soup and the skate dinner  was delicious.  Our waiter Michael was very attentive, and Roberto the manager came by to make sure everything was to our liking. We will definitely be back!!!

a2AIundBzyU9VI1_mAAxNg.text: Had an excellent French feast. Food, service and decor are all top notch.  Prices are reasonable for a strip restaurant.  Surprising when Michael Mina's name is attached to a strip restaurant.  Between a Bistro and Fine Dining.  Casual elegance.  Ingredients quality, menu variety and presentation were all excellent.

6rqF-CMR0o_cOMJC4-Uoog.text: My wife and I came here on a recent trip to Las Vegas along with a friend.  We had appetizers of bone marrow, foie gras parfait and beet salad.  Our friend really wanted the foie gras, but had glutten issues so could not have the bread.  The waiter had suggested the thin potato fries they make for another dish, but he wasn't sure how it would taste.  We ordered it with the chips on the side.  It was actually really delicious with the chips.  The beet salad was extremely good, but the bone marrow was not as flavorful as it could have been.  It was the only disappointment in an otherwise exceptional dinner.  For entrees we had Loup de Mer (sea bass), the salmon and the Parisian Gnocchi.  All three preparations was absolutely wonderful.  We had to try the Giant Chocolate Macaron, and it was as wonderful as it looked.  The service was great, and no one was rushed to finish.  Our waiter was really helpful with letting our friend know which dishes not to choose because of the gluten issue.  A very delightful evening.

7RVw4dwDil7XK9OX2HrLPA.text: On a cable show called Munchies, Chef Josh Smith of Bardot Brasserie at the Aria gathered some friends, most of them chefs, and went out on the town to a few of his favorite Las Vegas restaurants. Along the way, I learned a bunch about Josh's philosophies for food, preparation and creativity. He brought a good deal of his personality to Bardot Brasserie, and I wanted to experience French cuisine at it's finest. A True french bistro is a tough find when in Las Vegas recently, I had the opportunity to escape from my obligations to have dinner at the restaurant. I asked to speak with Josh and a short time later he came over to my table and I invited him to sit with me. I mentioned that I had seen him on Munchies, and we spoke of my longing for traditional french fare. I decided to stick with appetizers this evening (a bunch of them!) because I could indulge my cravings for the more traditional french offerings, but as Josh would say, with a bit of a modern twist. Just what the doctor ordered. Even though I was just having appetizers, the order in which they came to the table was carefully considered. Not all together, but in a measured, comfortable way. The sommelier came over to the table and reviewed what I was having and suggested a glass that would satisfy throughout all the dishes. I believe it was the Patrick Piuze Val De Mer Cremant de Bourgogne Rose - a burgundy from France. Wow. She was spot on. Ok, every single dish that came to the table was inspired and delicious. I mean really good. Seriously. There was escargot with toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse butter in pastry shells followed by pate de campagne - a traditional housemade pate with heritage pork, veal and pistachios. Next came the bone marrow au piovre - a peppercorn and remy martin vsop crusted bone marrow, burgundy onion jam with cornichons and grilled country bread. Right about then, Chef Josh sent over, as a wonderful surprise, the duck a l'orange - wood-grilled wings, cointreau glaze with sauce maltaise. But I wasn't done yet. I couldn't resist the prime steak tartare. What's fabulous about the steak tartare is that it is ground to order, with sauce verge, egg yolk and gaunter potatoes. Simply delicious. I gotta tell you that it was one of the finest meals I have ever had in Las Vegas. Just appetizers. Go figure.

IKEPYWMQZnqT1HhH0BVW-w.text: Great food, atmosphere, service and drinks. I'm not much of a 'yelper' but because of my experience here, and the fact that there is so much restaurant 'noise' in Las Vegas, I felt it was warranted. I've been to Vegas a ton of times, and have eaten in most of the high end places. I've eaten in many Michael Mina restaurants around the country as well. This time, I was here for a national sales meeting and had dinner at Bardot with my team of 12 from across the country. When I plan group dinners I prefer a prix fix as it's easier on everyone, and on my budget. Bardot had a great choice of menus in multiple price points that featured main courses that are high on the normal menu. Everything was great and everyone enjoyed their meals. What really set Bardot apart for me was in the service. Of course, we all enjoyed the food but for a 3 month old restaurant in Vegas, where there is so much transient help, I was impressed. I eat a vegan diet and also love to eat. In NY it's easy to eat where there are many inventive chefs and I'm not just getting a salad...in other places, it is hit or miss. At Bardot I got a great meal of multiple courses that followed the rest of the group. My dishes were plentiful in variety of ingredients and prepared quite well. Our entire service team, led by John Paul was great. He was attentive and responsive, timely and traditional in service. Explaining my vegan meal and the point of view of the chef de cuisine, which was greatly appreciated. Even after multiple rounds of champagne, wine and cocktails, managing a group of 12 women after all day meetings in Vegas, was easy for them all.  I will be back at the end of June and will visit again. We all enjoyed our experience (vegan and foie gras lovers alike) and would highly recommend Bardot.

RRirU3iS5zKIiFiFvgxTHw.text: Went to Bardot for breakfast yesterday on our last day in Vegas. We were looking forward to a relaxing great meal a little outside the casino craziness. Bardot could not have been MORE DISAPPOINTING. First typical Vegas lackluster service, which is almost expected but it only got worse.  Food took forever.  Quiche Lorriane is served almost cold The chef must never have read the recipe for "classic quiche Lorraine" because both had spinach and one didn't have any meat.  The only redemption was the manager took the quiche off the bill after we complained - but he never apologized nor did he even stop by to see how the replacement meal was... The replacement which was just the original meal reheated - took 20 minutes to reheat.   There is a reason this place is in the back corner of a mall. YOU ARE NOT SUPPOSED TO FIND IT. A DEFINITE SKIP IN LAS VEGAS.

RsXhmwfs8KLmBvrwoZAYXQ.text: LOVE this place! What I would say is that their food is delicous & the service is great! My husband ordered the duck waffles & it was overcooked but i ordered the Croque Madame & it was delicious! Despite that my husband asked to get the egg re-cooked, we loved the meal & couldn't have imagined a better place to eat brunch in Vegas!

ddcvFsjl2jFt_RxCvUE5Sg.text: Exceptional experience! Considering this place is brand new and probably still working out the kinks of opening a new restaurant, we had a fantastic experience here for dinner.  A few of the things we ordered included the foie gras parfait (delicious), charcuterie board and cheeses (had excellent selection on both boards). The pork chop was so tender.  My sister ordered the burger and loved it. Was very impressed by the meal as well as the beautiful decor.   I loved that our waitress really knew the menu and seemed excited about the dishes she recommended. The service was wonderful and we were very well taken care of. Can't wait to go back!

QTI2XRkwc-E2r2-qYc8lUw.text: We sat at the bar before I had to take my girlfriend to the airport for a flight and Brooke was incredible. They had a full menu at the bar and Brooke was so helpful with my dietary restrictions with her recommendations and accommodating once the order came out. Pro Tip: Ask for the soft bread instead of or in addition to the baguette before your meal

QTLSVpY-8tuG6EhBL9dQcA.text: An amazing dining experience from start to finish! As soon as we stepped through the doors of Bardot we felt transported back to Paris... And not the historical aged Paris of today, but a fresh, clean and newly built Paris of the 1920s. The shiny brass of the beautiful bar, the marble floor and the dark wood with gold accents of the dining room is stunning!   We were celebrating our anniversary and we had a show to go to (our dinner reservation was 5pm and we had to leave for our show at 6:45pm) so timing was very important to us. Nelson and Angel were both very accommodating, making our evening extra special AND getting us to the show on time without feeling rushed.   And every bite of food was unbelievably delicious! We started with the tarte flambee, then the escargot Bardot, duck wings a l'orange and Parisian gnocchi with black trumpet mushrooms, goat cheese and garlic emulsion (we honestly didn't NEED to order so much food - there were simply too many great options to choose from and we didn't want to miss out on anything!). For entrees we enjoyed the pork chop with bacon lardons and whole grain mustard, as well as the steak burger. Both were great, but the pork chop was the star of the show! The sides of macaroni gratinee and French fries were pure decadence. We finished dinner with the chocolate macaron - chocolate on top of chocolate on top of chocolate. Pure bliss and culinary perfection! Thank you Bardot!

a9JLjYNIKdy5L4xZDKxwQw.text: Let me start by saying I had 2 meals at the bar. The bartender who's name I don't remember was a very pretty brunette who was spot on with her service and very sociable too. The first meal I ordered 3 things. The chick pea fries which were good with lots of flavor, the tarte flambee was also very tasty but the best part of the meal was the foie gras parfait. This was maybe the best thing I have ever tasted. I spread it on my chick pea fries and my tarte . My second meal was the le steak burger. I am use to Michael Mina's burgers at Bourbon Steak in DC and this was nowhere close to those burgers. This one had good flavor but was crispy around the edges.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le steak burger
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tarte flambée
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chick pea fries

RH7-fwqVECWDI9-k3Vi8dw.text: If you're looking for a date spot in Vegas, Bardot could easily fit that.  You walk in, cuteness pops at you. It's a Michael Mina restaurant, which I didn't know who he was until I came here, but he made this restaurant be very classy. The decor is very inviting, sort of older, but still modern.  The hunters waffles and the French toast. Okay, so the hunters waffles were very much new to me. Now I've had the poached egg dish many times, but not like this. I haven't had duck with it. It really was different I think. The duck would've been better if it was shredded a bit more I think, but it was very good. The french toast was MASSIVE. A gigantic brick of french toast that had a nice, somewhat bitter flavor, that leaves you so stuffed, you'll regret attempting to finish it in one sitting. One thing I would've liked was instead of the almond syrup, if we had been given regular syrup. The almond syrup sounds more appealing, but I think it made it a bit too bitter.  Bardot was a fantastic experience that I plan on revisiting the next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunters Waffles

jNsSGYxyUkwHcnsj0SUuuw.text: French Toast heaven..imagine a largest brioche single cut of bread ever..pre-soaked in egg mixture (hours or night before) then fried by pan until every side is super crispy and fluffy.  Served with vanilla mascarpone, orgeat syrup, and almond brittle.  Everything else was good...French toast was the best..by my judgement...but judge for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy toilette stalls
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice hand towels in the rest room
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh cream for French toast

E2F54702hXeuixIwRAlxiw.text: LOVE this place!!! Went here for the second time...this time for my sister's bday.  I will admit, I am a food snob.  And this place did not disappoint.  We had a reservation at 7:15--(had a concert at 9).  We were immediately seated.  We ordered escargot, oysters, french onion soup, lamb, and 2 bottles of wine.  Everything was great.  The escargot was in a puff pastry--so yummy.  Oysters were fresh and delicious.  The french onion soup---I have come to find that not everyone can get it right.  This place however, did it very well.  Furthermore, their sommelier came to our table and talked with us for a while and then even gave suggestions and tastings of wine with some of our items!!!! It was sooo neat, and he clearly knew what he was doing, because each wine with the food enhanced everything.  Service was impeccable.  We were stuffed by the end, but not like sick stuffed, just the right amount.  I will be back for sure.

_vmlxBpAR6v4wZfTOAAa_g.text: Amazing! I went for brunch one day, and it lived up to its price tag. I had the hunter's waffle, which was a decadent construction of various savory things on top of a waffle. My boyfriend had the french toast, which was enormous, as it's a whole block of bread. Also, the baguettes, although a bit crust-heavy in my opinion, were addictive.  The service was very good; our server always checked on us and asked how everything was.

JzdGCH_bJoSgrKgek0P2ng.text: We celebrated our first night in Vegas at Bardot Brasserie. The cheese plate was beautiful, the escargot was delicious, the king crab crepe was amazing and the black truffle fries were addictive. The ambiance really presents a True French vibe with marble, wood paneling and cool light fixtures. A great place for a casual and fun celebration!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great ambiance

x7DRYQz1-32ArFXD2gpK1A.text: Atmosphere: Overall I loved the theme this place has going for it. It's kind of tucked away in the Aria. Most foot traffic wouldn't even know it was there unless they were looking for it.  Food: Our cocktails were delicious.  The bread they serviced was not sliced. I know its a small gripe but it can make a world of difference in an upscale restaurant. It also didn't help that the bread was baked to the point where cutting / breaking it at a table just made a big mess.  We had the gnocchi and filet mignon.  The gnocchi was good but not great. I was expecting more based on reviews.  The filet mignon I ordered medium and came out well. We were short on time so I didn't bother having it corrected. The meat overall was still good for it not being cooked to my liking.  Service: Service was outstanding. We had a reservation so we were seated quickly. Our waiter was very informative about the menu. I'm not sure if this was apart of the experience but our photos were taken by a worker. She had said she would get us a copy before we were done with dinner but we were gone before she came back.  Overall: I definitely will give Bardot another chance when I'm in town. I would definitely recommend it. I would also recommend not rushing through dinner here as well.

MXqfaqUr_-ymWAQcIAviHw.text: The food was excellent, the service was excellent, and the ambiance was great. If your from Vegas or just visiting Vegas this is a must try. One of if not the best Michael Mina restaurants I've been to. I highly recommend trying the beef tartare and the Duroc pork chop.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese plate!!!!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horseradish pomme purée!!!!!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duroc pork chop!!!!!

AUO4-fSuLn6X-7gy2vWKyg.text: Great wine selection. Interesting twist on many French staples including escargot in puff pastries and lobster Thermidor I had the Seabass with fennel and potatoes. Meet fennel and potatoes were severely under cooked and the fish lacked True flavor. My husband had the steak and frites which were delicious especially the Aoile that came with the fries. For dessert we had a creme brulee and the chocolate macaron I love macaroons but this one seemed more like a brownie, too much filling and syrup on top. Overall this place was pretty basic and with an elevated price.The Decour was very nice although the ambience was fairly loud

y5SUY25IyCqLcObpMOysSQ.text: Just ate here for brunch with my wife and we were both very impressed. Large portions, fair price, and gourmet dishes! I got the French toast and it was delicious with flavors of coconut, vanilla bean and toasted almonds. The French press coffee was strong and tasty. The presentation was perfect with a great wait staff that was attentive and pleasant. Wife got some French ham Benedict that she raved about. All fresh ingredients. Bacon is very thick cut and border lines on being slices of ham, regardless it was good. Orange juice was very fresh. Enough already, I'm sick of typing...just go there damn it!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb ass French toast!

firnARTTg0k0N4GOINVUFw.text: If your reading this just go, you wont be sorry.  And for a different experience go here and sit at the bar.  Dino, Tim and Erick are pros and will take good care of you and they serve full menu at the bar.  They have an everlasting Rose option for $30 which is exactly what it says you drink as much as you like.  Rose is not my first choice in wine, but it was summer time and I figured Id give it a try.  It was excellent.  And then there is the food.  All I have to say is bravo to the chefs that are clearly taking their jobs very seriously.  This review is actually referring to 2 different times I went there within 2 weeks.  Night 1 Drink:  Aperol White Wine Spritzer (if you have been to Italy you know what this is and Dino made it perfectly), Also had a glass of burgandy and a pinot. pretty solid. Food: Foie Gras Parfait- this was some of the best prepared Foie gras Ive ever had and Ive traveled in multiple parts of France.   Onion soup with egg and truffle-so good, Im kind of a purest so I wouldn't order it this way every time, but wow the flavors, and broth were outstanding.   Bread:  They have complimentary baguette and the butter tastes house made, very good.    Night 2: I decided to order the 4 course summer menu: TUNA NICOISE TARTINE-very solid and the quail egg was a nice touch DUCK WINGS A L'ORANGE-I love duck and these wings were cooked to perfection and the maltaise sauce served in a tangerine skin was such a nice touch LAMB RACK "FRITES": Cooked perfectly and the chick pea frites were exquisite, your brain is of course expecting a french fry, which makes for quite a surprise, but in a refined way that is in every way positive.   CHERRY CLAFOUTI- The cherrys in this are so flavorful and the pistachio cherry flavor combo is slightly reminiscent of home made spumoni ice cream.    The only constructive criticism I can muster on this place is that one or two lower cost (maybe $10) house red wines would be nice as the red wine starts at $16 per glass, but hey it is Vegas after all.  Otherwise price points are pretty solid.   Michael Mina delivers with this wonderful place, with stellar food that rivals many places Ive been in Paris, and spectacular service.  I could definitely become a regular at Bardot if I lived in Las Vegas.

UxsO0aEHQ1nxwOCingsGxQ.text: You can never go wrong with Michael Mina or Aria.  Although I had trouble deciphering the menu, the food was wonderful.  The ambience was great.  The place is beautiful. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I loved the French onion soup and would definitely return for the giant chocolate macaron.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This picture was taken after our first bite but it was still beautiful. My husband and I devoured the giant chocolate macaron.

KLl7-07fWY8Rz4v1Orv2Gg.text: Unfortunately a huge letdown! I was super excited to come here with my team being as I work next-door and have always wanted to come for brunch. We made reservations and indicated to birthdays that we are celebrating. My general manager, myself ( AGM) my production manager and some teammates Who work at a property next-door came in for brunch. We arrived on time and were greeted at the host stand. Only a five minute wait as we had a reservation we were walking to the backside of the dining room to be greeted by an empty dirty table. The hostess seem flustered and apologized saying that she thought the table was ready and it is not so we'd have to go back up front and wait. We waited for an additional 15 minutes upfront and we're finally sat at our table. Unfortunately the service kept going downhill because Server was late on the greet and we waited about 5 to 7 minutes and still took 10 to 15 minutes to even get water on the table. There was a couple items that we ordered but never made to the table as well. The food was good as we expected. My steak was cooked perfectly French toast was awesome.They never  acknowledged birthdays that we were celebrating as well. Completely disappointed in the service that someone has worked in the area at a restaurant next-door I couldn't believe it.

MFstJT8-hQekaWrDqrOLCQ.text: Outstanding brunch. Got the fois gras parfait. Creamy, yummy and it's balance with the gelee was amazing. It came with buttered brioche bread which was a perfect balance of crunchy yet soft. Then I got the famous French onion dip with the accompaniments. I don't even like that soup but this was incredible. Because it was two heavy dishes I opted to not finish them but they were delicious! They both are very rich so I'd rather sample and enjoy than overload. Service was lovely and they give u crunchy French bread with salted butter. So yummy! Great decor. Highly recommend.

RhnI00MxoltgLYuFsqh10g.text: This is a cool place. We came in for brunch. It was probably the yummiest brunch I've had in Vegas. I ordered the French Toast. Wow! It was huge. It was a loaf of brioche bread with candied almonds and almond syrup on the side. The crust was crunchy and caramelized. The inside was warm and so soft.  The almond syrup was a perfect complement to the french toast.  My wife had the Hunter's Waffle, although it seemed more like Eggs Benedict.  It had duck confit, poached eggs, and veggie hash.  It was amazing.  It was flavorful, and the eggs were poached perfectly.  The duck confit was yummy, and not greasy.  The food deserves 5-stars!  But I had to deduct a star because the service.  The people were nice, but we were left on our own a lot.  I had ordered coffee, and no one ever checked to see if I needed a refill.  We also emptied our water, and actually flagged down what appeared to be a manager checking up on the room.  So if we needed anything, or a refill, we needed to flag someone down.  It's a new place, so I'm sure the service will get better.  I'll be back for the food.

BPq5-QdGo3gP1lkNyp88NQ.text: Bardot @arialv brings #Bagel and #Lox to the next level. This is how #smokedsalmon should taste. Subtle, light, not too fatty, not fishy at all, melt in your mouth, slightly salty, with a kiss of smoke. Like the #Salmon was born to provide me with some essential brain #nutrients  #Healthy and #delicious is by far the hardest combo to achieve. Well done. Golf clap.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York worthy
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon at its best

K2c5j2u-7SciXmFkJ_MM-w.text: Oh wow. During my most recent three day stop in Vegas that included some of the city's finest - brunch at Bardot was hands down the highlight thanks to some of the best and most unique french toast I've ever had.   Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  In a city of hour plus waits for brunch and all sorts of other ridiculousness, Bardot has kept the classic model intact, and I was easily able to secure a 10:15 brunch reservation for four the Saturday morning of a music festival weekend. Our party was seated immediately and the service was fast, friendly, and knowledgeable. Star Granted.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  Bardot isn't cheap, but honestly it was entirely more reasonable than what I was expecting. I ordered the absolutely massive sticky bun for the table as a starter, and while yes $16.00 is absurd when you're of the mindset that you can get something somewhat similar at Cinnabon for 30% of that, the quality here was noteworthy.   For a better comparison, the Steakburger at Bardot is $19.00. That's above my $15.00 burger threshold but not by much.  My french toast, which could have comfortably fed two, came in at $19.00, which was entirely reasonable given the quality. Star Granted.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  My oh my. I've had some truly out of this world french toast in my day to include what came out of my own household as a child, but I'd never had anything that resembled the French Toast at Bardot.  While the massive block of bread was intimidating at first, I quickly realized that I could cut into it's buttery smooth texture with a quick swipe of the fork, and the airy texture was flawlessly combo'd with a butter-like whipping cream that I could have eaten all by itself and been perfectly happy. I'm not an almond guy, but the almond brittle and orgeat syrup went over well at the table, and all in all this was a truly stellar dish. Dual Stars Granted.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  I'll take Bardot over a Vegas buffet, or any other alternative, any day of the week. Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Sticky Bun: $16.00
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast: $19.00

Vzb-LSDqaEaigtn0E_P09A.text: Bonsior  I stopped into Bardot for a cocktail and appetizer with some extremely kind friends of mine! 11.26.16.  The ambiance is amazing and the employees were extremely kind. We sat at the bar and I ordered one of the best Lobster Bisque ever! Tons of bold flavor and delicious to the last bite (trust me I consumed every last drop).  I was able to sample the CHATEAU DE SANCERRE Loire Valley, France 2014 (white wine) before the bottle was purchased. Excellent choice the wine was amazing and after two glasses I felt even more amazing.   Great place to start your evening socializing with friends!!

EHoESOGKnuqOqv7gMs2yYw.text: The food was cold and flavorless. Service was slow. Champagne was good, though. And the manager was kind.

sjqAVEIitcuFLCzK5n9G4g.text: Always lovely and delicious with great staff and often a live singer. Cocktails are to die !!

BxTch8AC-UYVyBlmNsycVA.text: Very nice expensive French restaurant at the Aria.  Even the cheapest steak ($49 flat iron) is exquisite -- they clearly make use of sous vide to get a butter texture out of the meat.  I liked the brandy-peppercorn sauce, though it wasn't the best one I've had.  I almost wish I hadn't let the waiter convince me to get that instead of the blue cheese fondue.   The frites that accompany the steak were good, but a little salty and a little oily.  I did like the crispness and lack of starchiness.  The lobster bisque was very good as was the bread & butter on the table.  The bread is a french sourdough and the butter is smooth, spreadable, and the right temperature.  Service was good, but not fast even after we told them some members of our party were going to a show.    All in all a good and expensive meal.

zckcp5xZMB4m-fhVLZA3JA.text: Slow service at the bar but we eventually got a menu for the happy hour 5:30-730. Truth be told, the items are not available after 730 on the dinner menu. Crossing fingers with a burger, Cubano n the mac n cheese. French 75 only 7 bucks during happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour drinks 5:30-7:30
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour today!

yd6B8MFPjCPnRRPo0_gp-w.text: This place is just way too overpriced in my opinion. Came here for some bottomless rose, to find out there was only one option of rose so the waitress told us that she would give us a sample of it and not charge us to decided If it was doable or not. Along with that I purchased an Nutella sticky bun that was no where near worth $17. Once we had decided that we didn't want the bottomless rose because it was too dry to us, the waitress still charged me for the sample ..... I thought that was a con and I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're there for show and not the food or service.

nr3Q04x58cjRsAsRJZodGg.text: Came to BARDOT Brasserie for brunch with my significant other. DELICOUS! I couldn't have asked for anything more. We had an amazing brunch, great service, fantastic food, amazing cocktails and in a perfect setting. This is the second time we have came to BARDOT Brasserie and on both occasions we enjoyed ourselves. We will defiantly be coming back. Couple suggestions on things to order: Foie Gras Parfait, Double Decker Ham & Brie, Croissant Benedict (Prosciutto Di Parma) , Bardot Steak and Eggs, Pastry Basket (ALL DELICIOUS).

8LeH9dtJOUN6ZalAsISLMg.text: My gf's and I were staying at Aria and this restaurant was luckily downstairs. It's hard to find good French food/restaurant in LA so I was pretty excited to check out Bardot. The inside is very nice, romantic and dim. It looked very Parisian. As you are seated they give you complimentary baguette, which is amazing! You know it's a darn good bread if when you break it you can hear the crackle, but still be soft in the inside. Very fresh and just what a baguette should be. The butter was standard but even better when you added a pinch of sea salt. We all were in the mood for a bunch of appetizers, rather than big meals per se.   _Bardot Salad ($14) Gem lettuce, Dijon vinaigrette. Simple, yet very tasteful. The lettuce were huge, fresh and crisp. The vinaigrette was a tad sweet, acidic and tart. I love the lingering taste of the Dijon. A bit pricey for a very simple salad with just some greens, but also very good if you want something to start with. _Foie Gras Parfait ($18) Chilled mousse of la belle foie gras, ruby port gelee grilled country bread. This was an automatic for all of us. I mean can I get a amen or an amen! The 4 thick slices of baguette were crisp, yet soft in the outside. The parfait was silky, and not gamey. The ruby port on top helped to cut out any gamey flavor that may linger and give it a sweetness and tartness flavor that is always the best when eating a parfait. One of my favorite dishes of the night! A bit rich but worth unbuttoning your pants for :) _Escargots Bardot ($19) Wild burgundy snails wrapped individually in puff pastry, toasted hazelnuts chartreuse-garlic butter. This was pretty tiny and came in 6 servings. I got to eat one, although I wish I could have had more not only because It tasted so good but I felt one wasn't enough to really capture the flavor as they are so tiny. The puff pastry was nicely fried and a very thin layer at that, a little buttery and flaky. The snail flavor was a tad chewy, but overall cooked perfectly. The texture almost seemed more like mushrooms, if you did not know, you would not guess you were eating snails. _Black Truffle French Fries ($14) When we first got this our waitress made a mistake and brought us regular fries. My friend and I kept thinking and saying not only do I not taste truffle at all, I don't even smell it. Glad to know we switched it off for actual truffle fries. When it came you can already tell by the color and aroma it was truffle. The aioli was great and paired perfect with the fries, it actually brought out the truffle flavor more. I will say, our tables all agreed the fries were so darn oily! As I ate just one fry I can already see all the oil on my fingertips.  _Burrata Salad. This was a bit bland. The salad was more of about 4 small lettuces, a few snap peas, a few asparagus and 4 tiny slices of peaches. I will say the peaches were the highlight of the dish. Not even the burrata, but the peaches. They were so fresh and sweet. The burrata itself was a bit small and the texture was a bit disappointing. It did not have that silky and elasticity to it. I felt some balsamic or some type dressing would have made this a bit better.  _Heritage Chicken Roti ($34)  1/2 free-range chicken, mushroom bread pudding, green beans, sauce vin jaune. Good sized half chicken. The chicken was very moist and well cooked. Not dry whatsoever and the seasoning was pretty spot on. The skin was perfectly crisp, although I found it pretty salty. I can see why the chicken was a bit lighter on seasoning, since the skin itself was more on the salty side, it was a good balance. The mushroom bread pudding did not really do it for me. It was heavy, oily and buttery and did not compliment the chicken whatsoever, it was just random and unnecessary. The green beans were good.  _Chocolate Macaron ($13) French chocolate cookie, valrhona chocolate mousse. Being a bit chocolate fan, when I saw this on yelp, I had to get it. The dessert was the main reason I wanted to try this restaurant. This was a very huge portion, think of those small ones by Lette, but on steroids. As it came out, our waitress drizzled chocolate sauce all over the plate and macaron. At first bite it was divine, as well as the other few, but then it started to get real rich and heavy. I did like the texture of the macaron, it had a nice bite and the ganache was silky, but I would need to eat small bites of this and with some rest in between. I felt maybe the chocolate sauce was not necessary since it was already so rich, but regardless glad I got to try this.  _Mille Feuille ($13) Caramelized puff pastry, vanilla creme patisserie. I must say this was pretty good but I expected more. The puff pastry was perfectly thin and crisp, which I think is the most important part of mille feuille. The cream was light and not too rich. It was good to have this with the chocolate macaron since one was way sweeter and richer than the other.  Great experience, I would recommend checking Bardot out.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bardot Salad, simple but delicious.

lMQtecivIgQJKavuCvLHWQ.text: I heard a lot about their brunch so I had to try it out- everything lived up to the hype and then some! You have to try the French Toast.. I can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas!

RSghFQLazFnKGs0DR5r66Q.text: First night in town and decided to stop in for happy hour. $7 cocktails and some reduced price munchies. The happy hour side car was great, chose to drink two of them :)  We were heading out to dinner later so we decided to share an order of poutine. The fries were crispy, creamy curds, and a tasty french onion gravy topped off it all. The staff was very friendly and made some nice conversation with us. Being an east-coaster myself, it was great to converse with the bartender who was from Ohio. She knew my hometown in PA; we also talked about celebrity sightings and such. Had a few laughs with her and enjoyed our time at Bardot! Will return...

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. happy hour sidecar :-) deelish!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. happy hour poutine

OmQgQU37bsSYZoEJuXSWIw.text: The food is GREAT! The environment is on point. And they are gluten friendly! I have celiac disease and dining out always gives me some level of anxiety bc there is nothing worse than when you go to a restaurant and the waiter doesn't even know what gluten is (horrifying!) but our waiter communicated with the chef regarding my dietary restrictions and made me feel confident that anything I ordered could (for the majority of the menu) be made gluten free and THAT always is music to my ears! The reason why I'm reviewing 3 Stars our of 5 is because it is VERY loud in the restaurant, almost unsettling. Also, the service was slow. And I don't think it was related to my dietary restrictions or the fact that it was a Saturday night because even when the restaurant died down it was slow. I would definitely eat there again but next time probably at the bar where I think service may be a little quicker and out of the main room where all the noise is. Hope this helps!  Ps always get duck at French restaurants. WOW! And the bone marrow?! To die for.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RoayMATwZ7uyZDuujtyVjg.text: After a couple of meals at Bardot Brasserie, it's fair to say the hors d'oeuvres are more interesting than the entrees.  The initial visit had my wife and me tapping out after indulging in 5 appetizers and for the most recent visit, we went with six appetizers and two entrees for a party of 3.  PEI mussels, dayboat scallops and king salmon aren't normally things I turn my nose up to, but French food occasionally tickles my snobby bone, so I said "Reste loin de moi!" to all that.    The wood grilled duck wings a l'orange belong at a tailgate party for millionaires.  That distinct flavor that only duck has went splendidly with the blood orange glaze and the maltaise could challenge many a wing sauce to a duel and win.  This is an excellent starter to share or hog all to yourself.     Whether it's grilled, torchon, parfait, or rolled up into balls and thrown into my mouth by a circus clown, foie gras is fucking awesome.  Their seared version with beluga lentils, caramelized shallots and prune confiture was everything I was hoped for, everything I need.  Lightly smushing and spreading the prune on top with the back of a spoon ensured a nice tart fruit flavor in each bite.    Not my choice to order, but I found the filet mignon to be a total snoozefest.  Although I could NOT get enough of the "beef fat fries" that it came with.  Can I preorder "beef fat cake" for my birthday??  Crunchy, salty, and borderline immoral, I wished more places offered this.  Get the stellar "Lamb Rack Frites" for an entree over steak and ask for a side of fries.    - Ask for bread with the prime steak tartare.  It's much better than the potato chips. - The "onion soup gratinee" was too sweet for me.    So tapas it up and share it all!  Everlasting Rose for $30 makes life even more grand!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Foie Gras Lyonnaise: beluga lentils, carmelized shallots, prune confiture
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Rack Frites: roasted eggplant purée, ratatouille, persillade, chickpea frites

l5jU9SsFX0X9kWkt4IEAXA.text: I went back to Bardot and had another great experience!!  Bardot isn't just good, it is phenomenal!  It is the little things that make it such a cool experience.  I highly recommend that you get the basket of Pastries for Brunch.  They look a little pricey, that is until you taste them.  I lived in Germany for a couple years and have been to Paris.  These were hands down the best I have ever had.  I am including a picture this time.  Even the Butter is great and they claim it is the best in the world!  I'm not going to argue with them.  I also really enjoyed the Duck Waffles again and the Hash Browns were also great.  The best thing we tried this time though was the giant Chocolate Macaron!!!  I love Bardot and I will be back any time I get the chance and it has really made me want to check out all of Michael Mina's restaurants!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Waffles custom made!!!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash Browns!!!

uOXXe0MUywzsWTldnWFDUg.text: This is me and my wife's favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Every time we travel to Las Vegas, we HAVE to eat at Bardot!   The ambiance is incredible. It feels like we are eating in a 1920's French resturant.   You can't order anything wrong off the menu. Every time we eat here, we always try something different and have never regretted our meal. Their selection of cocktails is perfect.    The staff is VERY helpful and attentive. We were celebrating our engagement and they really went 100% to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.   We can't wait to go back and celebrate something special. Thanks again, Bardot!

2gkTeGBDkvafuxbUgEZJqA.text: We came here as a last minute change in plans and were very happy we did, it was shockingly good. The worlds best butter and onion soup were amazing appetizers. My fillet might be the best I've ever had.  The Mac and cheese was crazy good and the presentation was top notch. The service was a bit weak but the food shined through.

V8DxRcKPiBV7T8RQ17cHvw.text: Hello Mr. Mina speaking on behalf of myself and other owners from Veer Towers.  Please bring back the duck l'orange appetizer?!?! We want wings

uhx_15ri5upEYofB2Dra7A.text: My company organized a Christmas party here last month. The ambiance was nice but the service was mediocre at best. The food had to be sent back several times by my group and 1 hour after I got home I had food poisoning from something that was served that night. I was sick for two days so as a whole not a place I can recommend to friends and family.

aBAplk7r1YKwZMV0uxp48w.text: Overpriced and mediocre at best. My "rare" bone-in NY steak came medium-well. Food was bland. The bar and ambience are nice. Get a reservation across the way at Carbone instead

ZlNvMtE7FkiHvBAfjPJfew.text: This is definitely a good French spot at Aria- the food may seem a little pricy- but the flavors and ambience kinda make up for it. The French omelette was good, also, the food is decently portioned. Also, they have a great collection of drinks, ask for recommendation. We went there for Saturday brunch, and got seated without any wait.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French omelette

DDarWpm5Cg8pH2g8aRo9xQ.text: Chic French brasserie in the Aria Hotel and Casino. The decor is dark tones and dim lighting, which makes it an excellent, intimate setting. I would suggest dinner as a date spot but during the day (when I went) it was a lot of groups. Their brunch deal is pretty good for Vegas, and is  $25 for bottomless rose and then you pay for whatever entree you want.   They will try to sell you on the "worlds best butter", but honestly it was nothing great and tasted like the regular butter.   I decided to get the Hunter's Waffle, which is a Benedict on a waffle, had the typical poached egg and came with delicious duck confit. Overall a great take on a Benedict. I also added a side of the hash browns that were thick, crispy, and flavorful. My friend tried the French Toast, which was huge with the brioche bread. It was very good but a little too sweet for me.   Overall, the service was great and the ambiance was fun. Good brunch in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunter&#39;s Waffle, Hash Brown and French Toast

93y4jizy70AHt6Kp7u5aKg.text: You will find one of the best happy hour on the strips in the maze that is the Aria. Daily from 5pm-7pm in the bar & lounge, BARDOT Brasserie offers an incredible happy hour that includes cocktails, oysters & plates.  I started my evening with the French 75. Made with Calvados, Gin & Cognac, it was one of the best I've ever had and proceeded to have 2 more throughout the evening. Next up was their daily selection of oysters, which included both east and west coast. Served on a bed of ice, these were incredibly fresh and came with hot sauce, lemon, cocktail sauce and their amazing homemade mignonette sauce.   I also ordered their MUSSELS MARINARES- salt spring island mussels, garlic butter, white wine, tarragon, grilled country bread. These were absolutely PERFECTION. The best mussels I've ever had. The broth was so incredible I could have drank it. Thankfully, they give you plenty of buttery grilled country bread so no need to slurp.   On top of excellent food and attentive service, the atmosphere is divine. You really do feel like you're in an upscale brasserie in Paris. I will definitely be back.

t3z1jcoPjwSTBQjFkO951A.text: Quick summary: Bardot is a fine dining French restaurant in a major Las Vegas resort (the Aria), and as such is expensive, although not by Las Vegas standards.  Unlike most other similar Vegas restaurants, Bardot is worth the outlay.  The ambiance is very much old-school, with dark woods in an uncrowded setting and an unexpected view of the glass-enclosed kitchen.  Here, six or seven chefs were preparing your meal -- not just throwing it together but carefully crafting your plate with attention and care to detail.  The food is good because of their efforts and because the recipes (old style French) and the ingredients are excellent.  I won't recommend individual items because I think whatever strikes your fancy with also please your palette.  Service is, of course, perfect.  So was dessert.  Go ahead, spend the money; it's better than giving it to some blackjack dealer.

erqIyzlCfwnsIe3QzI5UGw.text: BARDOT Brasserie is a creation of Michael and Diane Mina, specializing in French fare. It is located on the second floor of the Aria Resort in Las Vegas. We kept coming across these appetizing pictures of its brunch offerings in Vegas hospitality magazines and finally decided to give it a try in July 2019. We had made reservations for brunch, and while it seemed fully booked, we were seated within a few minutes of our arrival. The place is classy and well-appointed. The decor is very appropriate and suited for an authentic French bistro. They start you off with these cute personal baguettes in paper bags, and wonderful creamy European butter. It has been said that a measure of how good a dining establishment is, is their butter. On this front, BARDOT did not disappoint! Our server Rositsa was very pleasant, polite, and attentive, and helped us by making quite a few good suggestions regarding our food and drink choices. We ordered the Hunters Waffle, the Steak and Eggs, the Prime Rib Dip, and the Prosciutto Benedict. All were well presented and delicious and hit the spot! I must say that the Brioche French Toast looked extremely tempting but I was looking for something more savory at the time. I will definitely try it the next time. All and all, BARDOT Brasserie provides great ambiance and excellent food. We plan to be back the next time we visit Vegas. Perhaps for lunch or dinner, or maybe for brunch again!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto Benedict
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bardot Steak and Eggs
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Dip

od_yGqDLHhKHVmaLVYOrTw.text: For the prices, this place definitely didn't deliver. The seafood tower leaves a lot to be desired, and on top of that both my co-worker and I got a bad oyster... You know exactly what I mean, it lingered on the palate to say the least, and there was barely any seafood on it. They think it's a good idea to cover their steaks in liquid smoke, and they're not fooling anyone; the result is a terrible chemical tasting hunk of meat. The mac and cheese and the butter was excellent, but sad that that's the only positive part of this place. The service was decent as well, though the empty-ish restaurant amongst a ton of other restaurants with long wait times should have been the clue!

FiH6zbqten0G7ZJczMnKnA.text: I had the opportunity to try their brunch and dinner menu and let me tell you that they do a fantastic job! There was not a dish that I did not like.  The ambiance is elegant and pretty. The service is phenomenal and food is amazing!! For dinner we started with some fresh oysters and the foie gras parfait. They were both great options but if you have to pick you must get the foie gras! This dish was just amazing!  For our main curse we got the oak smoked duroc pork chop and the prime steak filet mignon. The smoked pork chop had a great smoky taste, perfectly cooked and full of flavor.  The filet mignon was also delicious. They truly know how to cook their meats. For a side dish we got the mac and cheese! Which was phenomenal! And let's not forget about dessert. The macaron dessert and coffee creme brulee were equality fantastic. I couldn't decide which one I liked the most! . If you are here for brunch take advantage of the unlimited rose and you must try the french toast!

Pyv3FWH9KUnsQSwQfBQ-Pw.text: Another great French restaurant in Aria.   After check-out we decided to have a fancy breakfast/brunch with good French coffee..   First impression - really good. Big bar in the center of restaurant looks really impressing. Decor is French style, beautiful flowers and bottles of champaign Moet.   Restaurant is big enough, even tho is crowded there is place for anyone.  We had little but cozy table at the bar which I was fine with because we didnt want to spend to much time there.  Service was really fast and we got our food after 15 minutes since we ordered. Food was excellent but I wish they had at least some cherry tomatoes as a side dish. Croissant tasted good, was really fresh. Coffee is another plus, much better that coffee shops.   We were really satisfied and we will come back for dinner. Pity this restaurants works only until 11 PM even on Friday night. Otherwise we would already tried dinner there.  5/5

cPsEbv4rSAvKWzLOx4AW3g.text: Best French onion soup I've ever had and the table agreed.  All of the entrees were excellent.  The service here, as with all the Aria restaurants was horrible.  I can't remember an Aria experience that was good service, honestly.  This guy was inattentive, slow to bring drinks, and generally aloof.  Come on guys, it's Vegas, it's not THAT high class.  I expect value and service.  Period.

F7nZ2dos4D92TrJC8IEt_g.text: BARDOT was a great experience I got to try while in Vegas for a work trip.  A person we do business with had invited my coworkers and I to a dinner here one night.  BARDOT definitely looks and feels like a french restaurant.  I haven't gone to many but this place is definitely one of my favorites.  We started off with some drinks and hors d'oeuvres.  The steak tartare was the best I've ever had!  I would definitely recommend getting this.  We also got the escargots bardot which was definitely different than how I normally eat escargot.  The snails were wrapped individually in puff pastry and with toasted hazelnuts chartreuse-garlic butter.  I got the loup de mer au fenouil as my entree which was a roasted mediterranean sea bass with a caramelized lemon, fennel, and fingerling potatoes.  The fish was cooked perfectly but I was so full from the appetizers that I only ate about half of it.    Service was exceptional.  Our waiter explained everything very well and made good suggestions on items to get.  I would definitely go back if I get a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. loup de mer au fenouil

OBCkPrH4ac40KWESwq-Fog.text: Amazing brunch! We had a 10:30 reservation (reservations strongly recommend) and arrived about 10 minutes early. We were seated right away. The bottomless rose is the best deal for a cocktail which was currently $28. Our sever, Oscar, was excellent. Never left with an empty glass....right on top of everything, including informing us of extra charges on certain items which is vary rare.   As for the food. Wow! I had the breakfast sandwich. It was a huge homemade English muffin with sage breakfast sausage, omelet, & mimolette fondue. It came with hash browns that were not your standard diner style. They were in block form making the whole outside crispy and the inside tender. My husband had the prime rib French dip. It was so tender it melted in your mouth. He upgraded to truffle fries that were definitely worth the up charge!  We also got a side of double cut bacon. Smokey bacon heaven! Can't wait to return

Be5rK4MiKZZtWM6HWLs7WQ.text: Excellent!! What a great find! A bartender down stairs @ the Aria recommend. We could not have been happier, it was a total class act! The food was to dye for! Service was fantastic! I highly recommend, as I will be back!

dZc7btki8BeKihP_yhQ_5Q.text: When you want to try something different and being French food, you gotta make a pit stop here at least once whether you are a local or just visiting.  The fiance and I decided to make a trip down here during Valentines weekend. Just like everybody says, do make reservations at this place a lot of people go here to celebrate every occasion.   Located inside the beautiful Aria hotel on the second floor. The dark wood and the decor itself make it feel welcoming and warm. Since our reservation was around 11am we got seated right away. We  already looked over the menu and saw a few items that were calling our names. They do have starters, main course, raw bar, soups/salads, side and croissant Benedict's. So after looking over the menu one last time, we decided to go a little lighter since we did not know if the portions were big or not. Looking at the pics prior they looked regular sized. I decided to get the French toast (brioche bread accompanied by vanilla mascarpone and almond brittle, with orgeat syrup on the side). I also decided to get the seasonal fruit since they had the beignets. Who can turn these down? I love them! My fiance decided to go with the Le Prime Steakburger (prime rib steak patty, Comte cheese, garlic aioli, onions and hand cut fries).   Wait did take some time to prepare, so hopefully you can come by when you are enjoying a non-working day. Luckily, we did not feel rushed, but pressed for time since had work. So the food came, and I can say the French toast was big enough for two. The seasonal fruit was pretty and decorated, you kindda do not want to eat it. The beignets were also fresh! The steakburger looked appetizing, but you never can go wrong with prime rib patties. The first bite of the French toast with the orgeat syrup, crunchy on top and fluffy like clouds mixed with the light syrup! The almond brittle also added a sweet and salty taste, which added to the entire experience. The fruit, I finally decided to take a bite, and everything was perfectly sweet! You know at other places it would be too sour or bland. The best part was biting into the sugary beignets, as they were just like biting into cotton candy but with more fluff to it. As for my fiance, the bread was just as soft, the prime patty, was so tender he wished he had more. He also wanted more to the garlic aioli to give it that, I can give a run for your money kick. The fries were the best part for him.   Overall a good place to get some French food and to go to when you want something different. Price wise, expect to be spending $70 or higher with tip. Definitely will come back to try the other items on the menu.

gARJrjtLnXyBWKIxDP19yw.text: My new favorite restaurant! We had a seafood platter and escargot for apps. The crab legs were served chilled and it tasted perfectly, both freshness and texturally. The escargot wasn't the best I've ever had, but it was still good. We had a king crab Caesar salad and it was the best Caesar I've ever had, maybe it was the presentation of being served on individual lettuce stalks, but I could eat that every day! My husband had the onion soup and said it was the most "legit" onion soup he's ever had. FULL of onions, unlike many French onion soups he has had. My meal was the sea bass and it was most tender and juicy sea bass I've ever had. It was a full fish, without the head. The meal was pricey, of course, but it was all so good!

Fye9BCSfWnLp27xzD2xYGQ.text: Anyone who knows me, knows my love of duck - and let me just say the duck at Bardot Brasserie is un-be-liev-able. Easily the best duck I have ever had (including in France)!  (But wait - there's more!) The ambience here is fancy French cafe (if that's a thing) - beautiful space and very polished service. Everything we ordered was delicious! Given this is LV, the price point is fairly high - but entree portions are a decent size and well worth it.  The rundown on our meal: cheese plate - yes duck - double yes  scallops - yes salmon - yes rack of lamb - yes  A must if you are in Vegas! You won't regret it!

x4tNswh3Yrv3fEvKte-tNA.text: Great food, amazing service. From the time we walked in, Emily our server greeted us with a smile.  The onion soup and everything else is well portioned.  Great taste.  And can't emphasize Emily's service enough.  Great attention to detail, coming by after each course was brought to check on taste and if we needed anything else.  Amazing service.  Thank you.

gngBy-g3c4X5nsdCB2T9gg.text: Not worth the money spent. Cold foods , taste is horrible. Service seems to be way to busy to ask  about yours dinner. Honestly ?! For the amount they charge For dishes I would have better chef cook my food. Not worth a penny, considering I've bern to so many good expensive restaurants.

3hNHVUrt0zvVbYONJb3zkw.text: Our first stop on our Lip Smacking Foodie Tour and I am so glad this place was included.  I had heard of it before but had not really done any research into it.  Immediately I was blown away by the look of the place.  It is simple yet very complex.  It is brash yet very refined.  It is fancy yet rustic.  I loved the feel of this restaurant.     We got a selection of foods to try: Bread and butter:  Really good and the salted butter was amazing. Escargot bardot:  Tiny little escargot, breaded, with garlic butter all over them.  Could easily eat these like popcorn, by the handfuls. Chicken french dip:  Buttery, soft and very flavorful, especially with the dipping sauce.  I have never had chicken as tender as this.  It almost melted in my mouth. Duck wings a l'orange:  Sticky, citrusy, flavorful, and everything you look for in wings.  I liked them better without the sauce though.  I only got to try a little of each dish and did not get to pick these as they were part of our package but I loved everything and want to go back and have an actual meal here stat!  I feel like this kind of restaurant is what I am about.  Exquisite food that is approachable and recognizable.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky and delicious.  Duck wings a l&#39;orange.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous bar.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very tasty chicken french dip.

kmziadWehfZDjMLGd39uJQ.text: Definitely one of my new Vegas restaurants! The experience was great the second we walked in. We had reservations for 8PM and we arrived at 730pm and we were seated right away! We sat in a little room and it was nice and quiet which was very nice. The host and the wait staff were fantastic. They were attentive to our needs and they were very talkative and pleasant people.   We ordered the Escargot Bardot and World's Best Butter for starters. We did not know that the table came with bread so we ordered the butter but we ended up getting the standard butter and the World's Best Butter. The World's Best Butter was actually very creamy. The waitress told us that it is organic and hand churned in France. The actual table Butter was really tasty as well. It was definitely hard to decide which butter was better. The Escargot was amazing! It was wrapped in a puff pastry with garlic butter. It was nice and warm when it came out and they were decently sized. The crazy part was that the chef made a mistake and thought our food was delayed and gave us complimentary Foie Gras Parfait. I'm so glad he did because it was so tasty. The Foie Gras with the jelly and the cherries had a nice flavor. I would highly recommend it.   For our entrees we ordered the Scallops Meuniere and the bone in rib eye. Both choices were fantastic. The scallops were cooked to perfection and it was a nice flavorful. The steak was very tender and the sauces that came with it were perfect. I got it medium and I thought it was just right. The meat was very tender and it was a great portion. I opted for the truffle fries and they were nice and crispy which was nice. I like how they had it in a container so they wouldn't get soggy from the juices. We were stuffed and didn't do dessert. As for drinks, do yourself a favor and get the Smokey old fashioned and the midnight in Paris. Both drinks were good. The Smokey old fashioned was very Smokey tasting but it was enjoyable and light. The Midnight in Paris was very fruity and tasty and easy to drink.

86K7C4iImjG-ZsLNg41FCg.text: Great food paired with very poor service makes this tough to rate. The Parisian gnocchi was fantastic and one of the best I've had outside Europe. The orange duct was perfectly cooked and came with a. delicate orange sauce and nicely paired side vegetables. Also featured to was well curated wine list but keep in mind, these are strip priced bottles. Where everything came apart was the poor service. A very inattentive waiter who did not come for over 10 minutes after we sat. Did not introduce herself and it seemed she was overwhelmed. Spending over 250 for a meal, service is key and it's hard to justify coming back with other French options on the strip.

xopz-HjF5jnAErqtK3Vpnw.text: Very yummy for brunch & bottomless rose. The Nutella sticky buns was to die for, the escargot was decadent & the short rib eggs Benedict was good but a little too heavy. Service was great except for one bad egg who was "too busy" to take a photo of us #rude still gave it 5 stars though
