_4zN05Re_auvIQJ7OK8MrA.text: This was a great choice for dinner. Our server was very friendly from the first interaction which set the tone for the evening. We started with octopus as our starter which was delicious, perfectly cooked with a lively flavor. We decided on the pork chop and the flat iron steak for our entrees. The pork chop presentation was beautiful and the steak looked delicious. The meat texture and seasoning was excellent although my girlfriend said the steak bordered on too salty. One thing that stood out was how attentive the staff was. They got refills about 10 times during the meal and we were asked how everything was multiple times to ensure our satisfaction. It was a great experience.

7vUo2sy6jxj4Uld0Aht8Bw.text: Not impressed...  The food was tasteless, service was mediocre, the ambiance needs something to spice it up.  I will pick other restaurants and not return to this one.

krSf7RJN7oA_0gwKDSpzzw.text: Bardot was amazing! Atmosphere is inviting, warm, and cozy. Food was great and service was impeccable. We had several appetizers: the king crab crepe (which was my favorite and very tasty), the Foie Gras Parfait(which was also great), and the French onion soup. Wow, were they great teasers! For the main course my husband had the sea bass (which he loved and ate every last bite) while I had the lamb chops which was just delicious. Dessert: rum cake with a smooth cream topping (can't remember the name).  Overall this place was just great! Our server, Nelson, was even better. Very knowledgable about the menu, provided excellent recommendations and was very attentive! Definitely recommend this restaurant for all French food lovers!!!

GgsC8qIDNpQYK1JmOQLwlg.text: Excellent!! It's our second time here and I must say that this is one of our favorite Brasseries.  Service is great, food is delicious and drinks are well made.  Highly recommended.

euD1E56gY96A-VmQDQwFXA.text: This was one the best places my wife and I ate at while in LV this past May. It was fantastic! Modern french with no fuss. Sommelier was helpful. Waiting staff was professional, helpful, and made us feel comfortable. The food was outstanding. I would highly recommend this to anyone staying in Las Vegas. This was a breath of fresh air amongst many dated and clearly tired restaurants on the strip!

H9S7YLKH-5_JEZhJWQVwEw.text: Aside from beautiful interior, the duck wings which were supposed to be their signature item were not great. The foie gras patr was less than average, but the drinks were great... Overall not very impressed...

2bCcV41ZMRlP8bQpH2z41w.text: Honestly, for the price the place really isn't all that. The roast marrow bones could have used a tad more under the broiler, and they should not have had ketchup or bbq sauce or whatever that was slathered on them. It provided a nice tang, but in the end prevented any sort of caramelization of the marrow. The onion soup was so so -- too thick a crust of cheese that set up way too quickly. The lamb rack was delicious, if a little stringy in places. The tarte tatin was difficult to eat, due to the pastry being impervious to every provided utensil.  Good service, OK food, nice (but very heavily marked up) wine list.

Fz9RLTUdaQ7Y55VVfWJeOA.text: Ambience. Thumbs Up.  Cocktails and Wine. Double Thumbs Up.  Food? Overpriced Mediocrity.   I had Ribeye and Escargot. While the escargot was forgettable, I'm a steak man.   American Diner Steak? Excellent. Just make sure to throw an egg on it to add some taste.  Pocket Burning Steak? Double Excellent. I love the monthly piece that lets me indulge in my carnivorous pleasures.   This was a pocket burning diner steak. $65, hacksaw rough, slightly overcooked, and literally 1/3 fat. Not in between or around the edges fat, but literally an entire piece of the cut. Screw that mess.

Fi158E06LOchY0hURuylfw.text: This is one of the best places to eat in Vegas The service is really good The food is amazing I think the oysters are great, fresh, size is good The mussels are delicious I like the beer menu, with unique, and rare ales The crepe with crab is my favorite appetizer

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish escargot
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak frites
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The seafood sampler, fresh and yummy

_KPMRpC_5aRDflJab2pqVw.text: This is a really nice restaurant in the Aria.  You have to take the escalators upstairs from the casino to find it.  I was a little embarrassed waking in here with my shorts, but they didn't blink.  I guess I'm in Vegas.  Meanwhile, our waiter with the fake french accent and classy snobbish personality greeted us.  He made us aware of the specials, which I'm glad since we ordered two different ones.  The meal was pretty good too.  The price was high which is expected in a classy type joint.  I just think it was memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Fe0C-zYl19YiGn7q9e11Q.text: Food may appear better than it tastes, at least for me.  After seeing so many delectable photos on Yelp along with the high ratings, I decided that Bardot would be the restaurant of choice to use my dining credit as part of my stay at Aria.  My family and I had brunch here and it was only marginal.  Had better at Mon Ami Gabi.  Food also took too long to come to table which is unacceptable when the restaurant is not even half full at 10am.

rjm7QxveefkMvWFzEUeCkg.text: Lovely spot inside the aria. $7 for 4 hour parking. Came here for brunch. A little Too pricey for the size of the entrees. Got attracted to coming to this place by the billboard advertisement of the french toast facing the strip. Was unimpressed when it arrived. Way smaller and it tasted ok. A little over toasted but the sauce was good. The escargot crusted with a flakey bread was delicious. The clams was fresh. Overall a pretty decent place but dont plan to come back soon. Bill was $210 for us 3. A few entrees and one round of cocktails.

jGWCHQg2Q4XoxwwclcB28w.text: If you want to pay overprice for the basics of French cuisine, this is the right place for you. Oh, by the way, don't bother make a reservation, you will still wait to be seated and might not even have a waiter assign to yourself! Welcome to legendary French service!

t0-yih-UNvPfFH1v06EPZw.text: There's a warm, inviting atmosphere from the moment you walk into BARDOT, and it reflects the attention to detail that went into every part of the decor.  BARDOT makes the dining experience one of the most exceptional in all of the city of Las Vegas... and beyond.  One could not find a finer restaurant in NYC or LA; from the first taste of any of the incredible items on the menu to the attention given to the impeccable presentation, you are wrapped in amazing culinary talents and impressed with every member of the staff.   With all the options available in Las Vegas, BARDOT Brasserie should be at the top of your list.

Azgr7y25-Is_MKG1ygAxDg.text: We ate here during a recent visit . There was some promise once I saw the menu .  We ordered the charcuterie plate, bone marrow, the pork chop special and the beat salad.  Every dish was over salted. I am not one to usually complain about salt , in most cases it's a nice balance or welcoming. Every dish was heavily salted to the point where 3 of us couldn't finish our dishes. We brought it up after the meal because it was late and we really just wanted to leave because it was so busy and took about 45 min to get our check. When we did bring it up all that was said was sorry we will let chef know.  The manager on duty came by and offered to give us desert. Not really something we even wanted after with nothing but sodium on the palate .   After. $350 meal I expected more.

hvvQVjV6tCerKibDDm7HPw.text: Great spot for brunch delicious French dishes I would highly recommend a visit with friends

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon eggs Benedict and waffle duck

jHdkTqB5nNbAtFlkdO_Esw.text: Somehow I had missed this place opening, and I was taken here for a group meal. Those are always enjoyable, but the food normally fails to please. In this case the food was fantastic, and I need to come back again for a normal meal here. The place and decor are very cool, the prices are pretty reasonable, and the food was spot on. Highly reccomend.

mteyn44mkULPE1yIYkbtKw.text: If you do nothing else stop in for a chicken while your in the neighborhood.. The bites of leek stuffing alone make it worth it and you have not even gotten to the award winning skin and perfectly cook meat.. How are the legs & thighs both cooked perfectly while still attached?? It's a mystery, but why doesn't matter.. What matters is the chicken, go get the chicken.

YVmuzYb-Gm5itP0GoMSXSQ.text: Prime beef at it's best. Delicious king crab crepes with an inventive twist. Service good. Drinks good. If you are a blue cheese olive fan, order! Delicious.  A Las Vegas treasure ! Ask for Oscar Alfaro exceptional service, extensive knowledge of the menu and gave great recommendations! Take the time to enjoy this exceptional restaurant !

KmAl25I0Lg1l4UUlVYArjA.text: This is my boyfriends favorite French restaurant!   We have eaten here on numerous occasions and the food is always awesome! For brunch I highly recommend les moules e frites (mussels), and the Maine lobster scramble. The French toast is also good but MASSIVE so I suggest you share it with at least one other person. My boyfriend loves the fruit plate, hunters waffle, and prime rib sandwich. The quiches here are also to die for, especially the mushroom and goat cheese!  For dinner, we come here less often, but we enjoy the escargot appetizer, and the steaks are decent. They have lots of special tasting/meal menus that change on the regular!   The reason this restaurant has 4 instead of 5 stars is the service. It is hit or miss. There are times where the service has been average, and bearable, but there have been two times where the service has been absolutely AWFUL (I won't bore you with the details). I've never had service here that I thought was outstanding. It's always either average or poor.  Overall, I'll be back because it's the best French food in Vegas! Just don't eat here if you're in a hurry!

GjfUg9zQNaFZ4y7HIKYOYA.text: Another meal, another Michael Mina restaurant. Never a disappointment.  We started with a few items to share like their escargot which is a little different from the traditional plates/skillets with circular dents to hold the snails. These were not drenched in butter/sauce and were still delicious. I should also mention that their complimentary baguettes were delicious with butter.  I decided to order the Chicken French Dip. I'm usually not a fan of french dip sandwiches, but this one stood out to me because it had mushroom bread pudding in it. One bite was like a mouthful of Thanksgiving except the turkey part. When you think about it, it makes sense: the luscious bread pudding texture with mushrooms, and the haricot verts (much like a green bean casserole) and with pieces of chicken that were moist (unlike dry turkey). I was really happy with my choice.  I also had a bite of their Hunter's waffle which is another popular choice with duck confit in it. Think of an eggs benedict but with a waffle and duck confit.  Service was fantastic. Our waitress kept stopping by to warm up my coffee and they were absolutely attentive with picking up plates and even providing us recommendations. It's kind of a hard choice between whether or not I like Bardot more than Bouchon, but if you really want more pastries, go for Bouchon. I think Bardot has a more extensive menu of rich and savory plates.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baguette and butter
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken French dip

txM2boMMrrwBpAyTg4CVKQ.text: Well, I've successfully found the perfect romantic dinner spot in Vegas. Bardot Brasserie was classy and sophisticated from the outer decor, fresh flowers in the foyer, French modern interior decor, exceptional service, well-crafted drinks, and fabulous food.   We went for a bachelorette and this place made us feel like we were living our absolute best lives. I would recommend this spot for Bachelorette parties (perfect photo ops and excellent dirty martinis) but would also want to go back for a date with my husband. This place was a breath of fresh air from the typical tacky Vegas vibes. I will be back!

fCxHmDObjulajxw46hmCFQ.text: Bardot's probably the new kid @ Aria and I think it's a case of better late than never.  I love the whole set up although I was very apprehensive when I was only reading the intro.   I had the pan seated foil gras and it was melt in your mouth good. Went on the the entree and I ordered the Pork Chop was recommend by Yelp. It was superbly cooked, pink and tender inside.   Will be back to try the other dishes for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ColI5cr54UDpJ1X-RLUaUg.text: LOVED this new French Brasserie at Aria! We went there twice during our stay, it was a very good location for us since it was right next to the second floor entrance of Sky Suites. The bar and lounge opens early evening so it was very convenient for us to grab some drinks and bar food.   During our bar times, we tried a few cocktails, they all tasted so good and strong. They use classic martini glasses, which is very upscale and elegant. Hubby tried French onion soup, it was very delicious and comforting.   Our dinner was AMAZING, very slow cause it's a French restaurant, but everything came out perfectly, we really enjoyed our Christmas Day dinner!   Starters: French bread with butter: fresh and yummy.  Escargots pastry puff: very tender and flavorful escargots, but I never liked pastry puff too much, I always get very nervous if I have to eat carbs. Hubby loved it.   Entrees: Filet rare plus with French fries: a beautiful cut of filet cooked to perfection, just the way hubby liked it, housemade sauce was so good, I loved the French fries, the very best I have ever tasted!   Branzino head and bones off, with onions and fingerling potatoes: FANTASTIC fish, so fresh and tender, flavors were very well balanced, loved it!   Side of mushrooms: rich flavors, very delicious!  Dessert creme brulee: it was chilled in stead of warm, very soft and sweet, so yummy.   Bottle of reserved Perrier was so good, espresso martini was strong and tasty, hubby liked his espresso shots too.    It was a great dinner, they had a photographer taking photos of dining people, loved the photos she took, very cute! Definitely one of the best dining experiences we have ever had!   Just love this restaurant and bar, think we will eat and drink here every time we stay at Aria!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

edIOUgcAr9GTEKBodZJzwQ.text: My review is a tad but late but it does not change how much I loved the interior and the food of course!   I came in about two weeks ago with my better half for brunch. We had been viewing they're menu for some time now and finally decided to pull the trigger!  Haha   We showed up and fell in love with the bar they have at the entrance.   Our server was a French girl I believe sorry if I'm wrong but she was amazing!!   We ordered the foie gras parfait with toast the port jelly on there was nice tart and sweet for the richness of the foie..  The lobster scramble with caviar was frikkin awesome! Perfect amount of caviar it will not be over whelming I will definitely order this again.   Of course being a Sunday we both ordered bottomless Rose that they offer and our server made sure to keep it flowing!!!   Thank you Bardot!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9tcvtKXyO7wb-UmQcwq8KA.text: Went there for dinner a few weeks ago after a Cirque du Soleil show on Saturday. The place was packed and our server was really slow (took her 15 min just to bring water...) but that was the only negative comment I can make on this restaurant. We mainly went there to try the foie gras which was perfect! It comes with fresh toasts and had so much flavor! It was definitely the highlight of our dinner.  For entrees I got the mussels and my girlfriend got the salmon. Regarding the mussels, the dish was okay, not the best I ever had but it was decent, comes with Baguette to dip in the sauce. The salmon was delicious, melting in your mouth and the sauce was great.   Overall good atmosphere, just wish our service was a little better otherwise I would have given 5 stars.

62vLSm5XineD6ZanuMPE4w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas, we always plan our trip around coming to brunch here. The steak and eggs are the best thing I have ever put in my mouth. The eggs melted in my mouth and the steak had the best flavor. All of the other dishes are excellent. I would recommend BARDOT to anyone looking for an excellent meal.

o-jiqRhIZO4zKehT1pYTrw.text: We came for brunch our first day in Vegas. The restaurant is tucked away inside the second story inside the Aria hotel and is beautiful inside. Lots of rose centerpieces, soft lighting and gorgeous bar with gold shelves holding their liquor including an impressive selection of chartreuse. We showed up for our 1:30p reservation 10 minutes late as we had a difficult time finding it and the hostess let us know the kitchen would close in 5 minutes so we had to order quickly. We were seated and right away I knew I wanted a Benedict. I tried the short rib Benedict served on croissants and a cappuccino. The cappuccino was wonderful, also came with a hefty $6 price tag. In the Benedict I loved the texture and flavor of the short rib, and would've liked a bit more hollandaise sauce and fresher croissants as they tasted a bit stale. The butter that accomplished the complimentary bread was to die for, the bread was nothing special. I'm glad I ate here though not a place I would return to with so many options in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful bar
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib Benedict

E6BfUE7xF58acbiXEZp8oA.text: Really love the decor and atmosphere here - captures the essence of an upscale brasserie. I wish I could go with 3.5 stars, because the atmosphere was lovely and the food was good, but I've definitely had better French cuisine elsewhere.  Food:  - "World's Best Butter": really average; didn't taste like anything; the free butter tasted better  - Escargots Bardot: each escargot was wrapped in puff pastry - it made the snails have more of a savory taste, vs. a seafood taste; the garlic butter wasn't as noticeable as when snails are prepped more traditionally; a very novel take on a traditional dish  - Halibut: the fish pulled apart really easily and the sauce was awesome, but because halibut is a firmer fish, it felt a little under seasoned  Drinks: Awesome bar with an accommodating bartender.

c6RHAKvAPv2l9iGYmfGcxA.text: Beautiful decor. Outstanding escargot and charcuterie.  The food here is incredible.  This is a must go to for brunch.  Wait staff is exceptionally well trained and professional.  David our waiter was extremely well versed in wine and gave me quite an education on the fine points of burgundy.  Some free tastings to guide me through the region were a big help. David, thank you, we will be back because of your tremendous service and passion for what you do. Greg A Coventryville, PA

dlkcgL0iB9fTlwHUknve_g.text: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night.  Easily got reservations via OpenTable and no problems getting seated.  Very nice ambience with a classy yet old-fashioned decor.  The noise level is not very loud, and great for conversation without having to yell.  Ordered the special for that night - Bluefin and tuna belly.  The fish was absolutely delicious!  The bluefin was cooked to perfection and the tuna belly was so tender it melted in my mouth.  My gf got the flank steak, which was also tasty.  A somme also came by and paired our wine with our dinner to perfection.  They even gave us a comped mousse macaroon for dessert.  Overall, great dining experience at Bardot!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bluefin and tuna belly

Dz2DgMV1kV96mI-1FF4gtw.text: Amazing decor and food. We went for brunch and the $25 bottomless rose was actually delicious and not just a cheap wine (normally $15/glass). The Nutella sticky bun was to die for and the french toast was the best I have ever had! It is HUGE!! Probably 2-3 people could share it. The prosciutto Benedict was very good but a little bit too salty for my taste. The best part of our time was our server Tish! She was amazing and I would recommend asking to be in her section if you go!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $25 bottomless Rose...yes please
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella sticky bun! Amazing!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nu9TzdpPaxKqRNIjOeu3Ig.text: Fun restaurant but the food was okay. seating was too jam packed and for the price I expect to be wowed but as a local I have high expectations. It's a solid 3 Star.   I had the beet and goat cheese salad to start which was very good but nothing I haven't had before. The sea bass as my main course. I was pretty disappointed it was oily and bland. I wanted to order the cod but they were out. And for dessert I had the espresso Creme brulee which was excellent.  My husband had the lobster bisque which was good and then a steak which was not special in anyway and also shared the dessert with me.   The drinks were probably my favorite part i got the "and God made woman" but since i went for the food and was not wowed i give it a solid 3 Star. Probably won't be back.

2XKGKK5-VVP2NlotIxJvaw.text: Came here on a Lip Smacking Foodie tour (which also awesome - check them out) but we got the Blood Orange duck wings and omg they were phenomenal!!!  I've also come for their boozy brunch which is a total hangover lifesaver. That French toast is unbelievable.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blood orange duck wings

v3_EAasaKykQcz4Om0u3ww.text: Wonderful! We came here for Sunday Brunch and wow was it amazing!  We were a group of 7 and all got various different items. I personally had the Short Rib Benedict and shared the Prime Rib Dip with my husband. Both were delicious! I also HIGHLY recommend getting the French Toast, it's definitely something to be shared but so worth it! Our waitress was also great! We came here for my cousins birthday and so we had ordered a cake from the bakery downstairs in the hotel. She did a really great job with bringing the cake out on this beautiful marble trolley. Overall great experience and would love to come try the dinner one day when we are back in Vegas.

qxSLw91BpcExwABTYFnlgQ.text: Amazing staff!! So classy and they made me us feel right at home. Brooke, Missy, Dino, Marcus, and Alex are amazing bartenders and gave us an amazing experience!!!

OohHVI8Dxy8p3o7N67pE8Q.text: My favorite watering hole in Vegas, this place is my absolute favorite. Will return every time I come, bet you can't find better bartenders than the crew here. Brooke, Missy, Dino,Alex and especially Marcus are fantastic, they make you feel like family.

3HpJ-UtmnzWipTAcSaMQww.text: The advertisement for BARDOT playing on Aria sign off Las Vegas strip drew me in, congrats.   Concierge  at Aria made a reservation for me. I arrived promptly at my reservation time and was seated in the bar area. I received a glass of water and menu. Then I sat there for over ten minutes looking over the menu, I had decided that I was going to have the lobster.   Another few minutes passed, still no sign of a server, just a stream of staff walking past me. I looked again at the menu, got up and walked out.   I really wanted to eat here, but couldn't allow myself to spend this kind of money to wait 10-15 mins just for a server to get to my table. Management should be closely watching the activity of their restaurant, you let money walk out the door.

7MUqQZ6LC2qe29yJFKxiHw.text: Excellent customer service!!! Michelle and Alex are the funnest bartenders ever they made me and my best friend laugh AND Michelle made me a blue martini which isn't even on the menu :) coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-xI_yqq7ysP0-FovNJK-KQ.text: My husband and I were very impressed by the food and service at Michael Mina's BARDOT Brasserie!   We made dinner reservations for our first night in Vegas and we felt like we were taken to Paris with fine ingredients, French decor, and our spectacular and charming server!   Even though the menu isn't too extensive, we were unsure of what to order at first. Everything sounded so good. We finally decided to share the grilled duck wings a l'orange and bone marrow appetizers, beets salad, and Parisian gnocchi with a side of fois gras.   We had to add the fois gras after reading several good reviews and my goodness, it was just fatty delicacy! My hubby loved it. The Parisian gnocchi was fluffy and pillowy soft. I thought the gnocchi and fois gras combination made that particular dish a bit on the heavy side, especially with the addition of cream. But it was a small portion size so it wasn't hard to finish. The shaved black truffles was also a nice touch to the dish.   I loved how the beets salad had huge chunks of red and orange beets. The vinaigrette and baked Brie and goat cheeses were a nice touch. We really liked that dish.   The bone marrow was also fatty goodness as I try to scoop up every ounce of it with the thick toast. I thought there was little bone marrow for the price and wished for more of it than bread.   I've never had duck wings before but it was meaty (doesn't look like it in the pictures) and had a nice sweet glaze that combines well with the cream that had a hint of orange flavor.   We thoroughly enjoyed the food and definitely ordered more than we can finish. The service was excellent and the restaurant is just beautiful that we would love to return when we're back in Vegas.

-0p1UYQNRff-k0p50KWIyA.text: Made our way here  for dinner on my wifey's birthday and had a great experience.   We started with the formage plate with three different cheeses. It also came with a few other added on goodies that really went nicely with the toasted bread.  I had the double cut ribeye, which was marbeled  perfectly and cooked to perfection. She had the New York strip which was obviously a bit leaner but exactly what she wanted. The Charing on the steak was delicious and I went with the blue cheese fondue for a sauce on the steak. For the sides the hand cut fries and the mushroom dish that came on a croissant with a cream sauce really tasted spot on.  To drink the waitress was really helpful with helping us pick a couple full body Reds that went with these Choice cuts well.  Good times!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom side dish. So hearty
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing ribeye
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese please

CQEpuU_7H5Mkef8U0tgK2A.text: I don't know where to start. We brought our kids to Vegas and it's a first for us. My kids are foodies and wanted to give them a taste of France.   We ordered up an array of things so they can sample tastes of Paris.   Ordered French onion soup, lobster bisque, stake tar tare, foie gras..this was all very yummy. My son who's 14 loves trying new things.   I had a glass of cab with an 8oz fillet mignon w/ lobster tail, truffle fries, and Bacon with Brussel Sprouts. This was so yummy.   My son ordered scallops, my husband ordered NY steak, and my daughter who's 11 ordered the 8oz fillet mignon...this little girl loved the fillet so much She ate four ounces of mine too. So, to say if it was good..that's an understatement. It was grilled to perfection.   To end our night, we ordered the trio-chocolate macaroon, Coffee creme brulee "so yummy!" And a goat cheese dessert.    The service was so wonderful and gave us such a special night out with our kids. Thank you

6erlP4I_WijivBji5JusfA.text: Here is the 3-1-1:   Food: Michael Mina is mostly known for his seafood but his French style restaurant really has great flavors. For starters the Foie Gras parfait is definitely a shared appetizer as it is very rich for just one person. The foie gras is topped with a gelle that has a raspberry flavor and paired with perfectly toasted French bread; very rich but the foie gras flavor is suttle. Entrees included a roast chicken which I doubted at first but it was one of the best roasted chickens I ever had and was served with a mushroom bread pudding saute green beans. The salmon had a nice sear on the skin and was definitely pan roasted in butter as the fish was tender throughout. Accompanied with lentils that help balance the flavor. All in all both entrees were very rich as the portions were more than enough to not have room for dessert.  Service: Since it was a quiet week in vegas and our dinner time was early the number of staff was more than the number of diners so the service was great. Timing and recommendations was helpful and perfect.  Ambiance: Its vegas so the decor is classy and high end. Clean, elegant and since it was an early dining time the noise level was pleasantly quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Chicken &amp; mushroom bread pudding
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Parfait

Hhjjnw8zKb8bVrvzRxTqAg.text: Top 5 meal of my life. This has got to be one of the best brunch places in Vegas too.

g7a_gLoB3h2IDYHHzKhnwQ.text: The food is delicious but the music was so loud the sound was distorted and we couldn't hear each other well in conversation.  They did turn it down a little which was appreciated.  Beautiful food presentation.  The French onion soup was as good as what i have had in New Orleans.

gGuSjywp-4IS0_QHDrfKBg.text: Trying to find someplace different for brunch on a Saturday my husband and I decided to come here without a reservation around 10 am.   We were told that only seats available were in the bar area, which was fine for us.     We shared charcuterie board, beet salad, and seared foie gras ( this is served only at dinner time but the server checked with the chef and said it was okay).   The beet salad with goat cheese was very good. I liked the bright colors of the beets and they tasted good.  The rest of the food was okay. Paying $29 for foie gras was not worth the money.  My $7 green tea had neither color nor taste.  Asked the server to bring me another pot but it was not much better.   Service was great.

KXb1dNWxjZwKEKWTsXXACQ.text: Alert Alert----- typical Vegas strip service and prices.  Service is slow and inattentive.  Food was so so.  Steak was super salty.  Fish was good.  Drinks were 16 bucks each with a single giant block of ice which took up 70 percent of the volume.    As a local it's hard to see my city turning into such a service nightmare.  The unions are part of the problem.  Many employees in cruise control.  The hotel can't put the best people where they want because seniority rules and performance is an after thought.    Bardot is standard strip over priced stop.  Steer clear.

SyuPrJS5rD5XZPmPrlGF6Q.text: Bardot Brasserie was a favorite in Vegas. Went to some high profile places, but the excellent food and Oscar's attentive, approachable service made Bardot stand out from the rest. Highly recommend the fruit and frozen yogurt parfait, braised beef short rib croissant Benedict, and oysters. Oscar had great recommendations, and really made a genuine connection with us with all of his insider tips. We'll be back next time!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised beef short rib croissant Benedict

Rg3bLyn1v3yTMSz2_57wtg.text: We used to love this place for brunch.  Today's brunch was so disappointing.   The restaurant was bustling as it usually is on the weekends.  Our server Clementine was not a good server and could only do one thing at a time.  In other words, she was shi!@$y. No other way to explain it.    We waited a good 15 min to order as we sat with menus in front of us and had to ask for coffee and water refills.  My favorite smoked salmon dish is now a pastrami cured salmon.  It's now served on a profiterole.  Dry and scraps of salmon.  So poor.  Don't order this if you loved their smoked salmon.  For $19, definitely not worth it.  Thank you Chef for your kind & courteous response.  I appreciate your thoughts and your commitment to excellence.    I know it's hard to remove and replace menu items.  The old smoked salmon was perfection.  There was so much thought put into the dish and each garnish was placed with perfection.  This new salmon does not stand up to the old one.  I'm not asking to bring back the old salmon, but wanted to share with you my thoughts on the new.   The salmon was dry.  I'm sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry, tasteless scraps of salmon.  The old smoked salmon was 150% better.  This version is just poor and should not be served for $19

urWey-HmnuOCs3bY_1LOcQ.text: Great ambience, amazing wine list and French cuisine made to perfection! IG: brew_moments

bpdPyhNHWrPBvfW8GB8daQ.text: Celebrated our birthday dinner at BARDOT Brasserie last night.  Everything was superb from the grand entrance set with beautiful pink roses, to the service, and most importantly, the food.  I love it when restaurants don't rush to bring you course after course, as the staff at BARDOT Brasserie allow you to take your time with your dinner and enjoy conversation.  BARDOT Brasserie did not disappoint in that sense.  We enjoyed a toasty warm French baguette, lobster bisque, shared haricots varts as our side dish, my husband had the lamb, and I had the steak frites.  Everything was served hot and DELISH!  We ended our birthday dinner with the most delicious chocolate macaroon filled with chocolate mousse ever.  Looking forward to dining at BARDOT Brasserie again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tLOZn5iRWK7UXnkAEZetUA.text: Full disclosure - we came here as part of a food tour.   This is a beautiful, richly decorated restaurant.   The bread and butter they serve is soooooo good.     The food was on the heavier side and very rich.    We had the Escargots Bardot, Duck Wings a l'orange  and the Roasted Chicken French Dip.    All dishes were well prepared and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

zlaUPy7uK9EjioeLUDNXIQ.text: A few days in Vegas and thousands of places to eat. The hubby and I chose Bardot Brasserie both to treat ourselves to a great night out (we hoped) and to try a few new things (we hoped). Tick off both boxes!  We were seated right away in the beautifully appointed bistro. Dimmed lighting gave it a really intimate feel. Our server was attentive and offered helpful suggestions on a cheese course starter--aged Mimolette will be your new favorite! The hubby had the pork chop and I had the sea bass-skin on by the way--nice touch. Both items were on point and worthy of the prices. Other menu items caught our eye, definitely something for everyone.  We were most impressed with the staff. Sharp and with high attention to detail. We were doubly impressed with a kind gesture we witnessed. The intimate room we were sitting in with a handful of patrons was suddenly and quietly rearranged to hold a boisterous group of 15. A cute couple had been seated just before the group arrived, and staff immediately recognized that their quiet evening together was doomed----although they had already ordered drinks, the couple was offered another table. It was a classy move and the hubby and I appreciated the effort for the couple.  You won't be disappointed at Bardot Brasserie-- we know we hit the Jackpot!!

TbmiXgQbc_xVO4xwS0Uqcw.text: Just a FYI, brunch menu only available Saturday and Sunday.  Ordered off the lunch menu. Place was pretty empty for Thursday lunch. Ordered the strawberry lavender lemonade and king crab caesar. Lemonade was just ok. The ceasar was cool because they made it like nacho bites. I did wish they had more crab. Looked like it was just maybe like 3 2 crab legs. Also it was just a little too salty, but still delicious.

LwW0yWmzrWgJSAEy0IT5Ww.text: Bartender Eric is the absolute best since day one two years ago!  He has the best recommendations & never lets my Bottomless Rose get to the bottom.  Brunch on the weekend is one of my fav times to come in.  I am definitely a Bardot regular so will steer you in the right direction.    BEST first!    HUNTER WAFFLES.. waffles w/ Duck Confit is to die for delish w/ the oozing poached egg & sauce maltaise on top.  A must!    WARM BEET & GOAT CHEESE SALAD!  Toasted hazelnuts, wild arugula & cassis vinaigrette.  Presentation & flavors are an A+ every time chef's.  I compare every beet salad to Bardot's.  The BEST LEMON MERINGUE!  Gorgeous.  All the elements are equally perfect.  My go-to dessert & I'm not a dessert person, if so it's usually chocolate.    PATE DE CAMPAGNE .. best I've ever had.  Beautiful traditional housemade pate w/ heritage pork, veal & pistachios w/ mustard. CHARCUTERIE comes w/ a nice half of the pate, Pork rillettes, saucisson sec, Bayonne ham & mustard.   Either one is perfect as an app or whole meal.  I've ordered it to-go for a lunch party at my house, which worked remarkably.  Paired w/ a nice bottle of wine & take your time enjoying.   ADD the Pastry & Breads as a side!  (See pic) OR  LE FROMAGE!  The cheese dish is phenomenal!  They change up, but my fav is the one I posted.  Toasted hazelnuts, Cremeux de Bourgogne, Epoisse de Berthaut, & Bleu de Causses, all cow, Secret de Compostelle (sheep) & Valencay Affino (goat).  MILLE FEUILLE Another amazing DESSERT!  Caramelized puff pastry, vanilla creme patisserie phenomenal.  Best, but first try the Lemon Meringue!  HEARTH BAKED QUICHE ... classic lorraine, bacon, kale, creamy delish!  Large slice & filling!    CROQUE MADAME pain de mie, Paris ham, gruyere fondue topped w/ the usual organic egg.  Over the weekend I asked if they could do a Salmon Monsieur, which turned out unbelievable!  Thank you chef's!  MAINE LOBSTER THERMIDOR over garlic mashed potatoes, mushrooms duxelles, fine herbs, smothered in sauce bearnaise.  Oh mmm!  A must!  FOIE GRAS PARFAIT thoroughly enjoy every melt-in-your-mouth moment.  Ruby port gelee on grilled country bread.  Savory & sweet for brunch or dinner!  Top 5.  CREME BRULEE.. vanilla bean custard, turbinado croquant, all I need to say.  Mmm!  AMERICAN IN PARIS .. a large more traditional breakfast w/ a square Crispy hashbrowns, sausage, scrambled eggs & toast.  Fantastic!  LE STEAKBURGER... if you're in the mood for a tender Prime Rib Patty, soft bun, comte cheese, garlic aioli, watercress, hand-cut fries, side of bordelaise onions & lettuce.    SMOKED SALMON BRIOCHE chive mascarpone, traditional garnitures.  Everything to love!    PRIME STEAK TARTARE ground-to-order, sauce verte, egg yolk & toasted baguette!    FRENCH TOAST is not only picture worthy, like everything here, but enormous.  Brioche French toast w/ vanilla mascarpone, a crunchy nut brittle & orgeat syrup!  Definitely shareable & my whole fix for the year it's so decadent.    KING CRAB CREPE... mmm the buckwheat crepe, black Truffle mushroom, sunny side-up egg, cider beurre blanc... disappointing if you don't mix it all together w/ the crab & get the full flavors, even w/ the green apple.  ESCARGOT BARDOT wild burgundy snails, toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter in puff pastry shells.  Beautiful if you're a fan.    LOBSTER BENEDICT W/ KALE... Can't go wrong with Lobster or the Benedict.   CHICKEN FRENCH DIP.. gruyere cheese, mushroom bread pudding, haricot verts, vin jaune au jus.  Almost taste like Chicken Thanksgiving, but my least favorite.  Tad bit mushy & maybe less of an ingredient.    If you like fish, I've tried these two, neither was fantastic, just ok.  I think Bardot has better dinner items.    HERB-CRUSTED ALASKAN COD.. The English peas, sweet corn, saffron beurre blanc give it a nice lite touch.  LOUP DE MER.. roasted Mediterranean Sea bass, caramelized lemon, fennel, steamed potatoes.    Yes, an extensive review that is a year overdue.  There's also a drink call 'And God Created Woman' that's unique along w/ other & a wonderful wine list.  Michael Mina never fails & the chef's are Food Network stars to me.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Monseiur
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Cod
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loup de Mer

y3zNSYUq77-qPBzlMCDBlw.text: Such a fantastic treat to be able to dine here. Although casual, dining here feels very upscale and this is very much reflected in the quality of food. Bardot was recommended to us for our anniversary. We received attentive service and our waitress never over looked any detail during our dinner. I was pleasantly surprised that the managers special on this night was Dover Sole, my absolute favorite! Absolutely, hands down, the best I have ever tasted! My husband ordered a pork chop for which he was very pleased with. Sizes are well proportioned, presented beautifully and most importantly, so yummy! Knowing we were dining that particular occasion for our anniversary, our waitress also delivered a plate of variety deserts! Again, I love the attention to detail and the amazing customer service shown, they definitely went above and beyond. I would love another opportunity to dine here when I venture back to the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chop
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Sampler along with a baked Alaska (not to be missed)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dover Sole

u5UfjBbs9VKPewaFGvl14A.text: Finally!  A celebrity chef restaurant that was impressive!  I'll get right to it...we ordered the cheese plate and octopus to start...we let the server pick out the three different types of cheese and were very happy with her selection. The octopus was tender as was applied by chorizo and beans...super yummy!  For our entrees we ordered the Branzino and the scallops.  I'm not sure I could pick a favorite because they were both delicious.  For our sides we ordered the mushrooms (yummy!!!') and the Brussels sprouts.  I was not too impressed with the sprouts because they had a lot of vinegar by the mushrooms...craveable.  I will be i Vegas again in a week and even though it's pricey (but so are all of the good Vegas restaurants) I will probably be going back for those scallops and mushrooms!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

aKvuPqLTNdNrF2q6h9P_QA.text: The only bad thing about going to BARDOT Brasserie is it is impossible to decide what to choose from the wide range of unique, highly thoughtful offerings. Our party of four went for Sunday Brunch. Immediately we were poured delicate glasses of a dry, sparking Rose (bottomless at brunch). The service is old school French sophistication with a touch of American warmth. For appetizers, we selected a variety of dishes for all to try including king crab stuffed baby endive and prime steak tartare. Yum! Entrees were awesome. I had the Short Rib Benedict- a croissant with poached egg, sauteed kale and bearnaise covered tender short rib - a choice I'd definitely recommend for Brunch.  Michael Mina's restaurants always deliver memorable experiences and brunch today at the BARDOT in the Aria Resort was no exception. Just one suggestion, if you want Brunch make advance reservations - its a well known hotspot in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruit, frozen yogurt and nut bar with hot chocolate beignets.

kcWd4tS22KMtUx0Y-q44jA.text: My mother-in-law, my daughter and I were celebrating my husbands birthday. The Host was wonderful, the lead and other waiters were very welcoming, but our waiter looked like he was having a bad night. We were very kind and we understand it happens, you get rude guest sometimes who think they're entitled. But the moment we took our drink order and we just wanted a bottle of sparkling water and we DID NOT want an alcoholic beverage his demeanor changed. How do I know? Because I use to be a server myself, and I knew people like him. They think, Oh they must be cheap they just want water... NO, we have a 2 year-old sir and I know I'm only 32 but my husband doesn't drink and we are very responsible parents.  - Our finished plates were not cleaned off of our table. So I ended up piling the plates up myself and giving them to our server.  - we ordered Truffle fries, and we took the rest home; GOT home and today we see regular fries in our Togo box. So we either got someone else's fries or we pissed him off some how and he gave us plain fries. That's cross contamination you know that right?!   So Mr. CHRISTOPHER S.!!! Just so you know my husband and I own a mental health company, we make 6 figures a year and have enough to buy everything on the menu if we wanted to. My husband and I are healthy people, we don't drink, so I'm so sorry we ordered a soup and Lobster salad. My mother-in-law did have the salmon, which was AMAZING by the way. But yeah, please don't wear your heart on your sleeve at work because you don't know everyone's story.   I hope you guys hear us out because with an extravagant restaurant, such as Bardot, EVERYONE should have exceptional service.   Thank You

XypsPaHHd5CAs_6T1RvkNQ.text: I cannot stop thinking about the amazing gnocchi. Black mushrooms. Goat cheese. Garlic cream sauce. It was absolute perfection - so much that we went two nights in a row!   When it came to dessert, I was wondering what kind of macaroon was worth $12 and boy did I discover it.  I never thought I would question my unwavering obsession with macaroons from Bouchon, but it happened.   All in all,  perfect mellow date spot on the strip with plenty of options to share plates (or not share since it's that good).    Recommend:  Gnocchi.  Mussels (perfect for sharing). Chocolate Macaroon.  French press coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Macaroon.

vE4YuPa0PEa1pJ_hIe2-oA.text: Had the buckwheat king crab crepe with apple slices and mushrooms, which was a great mix of flavors.  Followed it with the oak-smoked pork chop, which was a large portion and probably the best pork chop of my life.  It had savory, smoky flavor with just the right amount of fat, was cooked perfectly, and was complemented by the sweetness of carrots it was topped with.  Service was attentive and speedy.  Overall a top-notch meal... although the price tag matched. :-)  I wish I had room for dessert.

B3Cm9wWe6Xdp885a4OhViA.text: This is one of the most excellent restaurants in Vegas! If you are visiting, you must go and eat here. Great date place. Food is fantastic, and service is top-notch. You will not be disappointed!!!

IzOdmpcwNKNOEzl_aUiLtA.text: Sexy bar, great food, awesome service. Have dined here before but decided to sit at the bar recently for drinks and a couple of small bites. Can't go wrong with the steak tartare and the cheese plate. Do yourself a favor and have an old fashioned. Trust me.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That cheese though

1_DokAZ2H5PgmVS0bE8PNw.text: A charming place!  From the moment you walk up to it, the facade with the cafe tables outside instantly create a lovely environment.  My husband and I sat at the bar and had great conversation with the bartender Joe.  We originally went just for some cocktails and to scope out the place: - And God Created Woman - a subtle drink with a very fancy "B" embedded into the foam.  Almost too pretty to drink.  This one was pretty, but not very much flavor to it. - Le Detroit - again, they make these drinks look like art!  This one has flowers and an ice sphere that almost looks like it glows thanks to the green chartreuse.  The chartreuse is pretty strong on the palate, so if you don't like that liquor, I'd skip this one. - Notre Dame - by far my favorite.  It had a little bit of everything I like: gin, citrus flavor, and champagne.  It was like a kicked up French 75. - Man About Town - similar to a Negroni, but not as much spice.  Well, once the liquor started settling in, we got hungry, naturally: - Charcuterie - this dish is $25 and you do not get a lot of meat.  My husband is obsessed with charcuterie, so we've had it at many a restaurant, and the price is comparable to other restaurants, but the amount of meat is not.  It was delicious pate, prosciutto, salumi, and rillette...but a very small amount. - French Onion Soup - Oh man, this comes out covered in bubbly cheese and is a bit salty, but in a good way. - Mac and Cheese Gratinee - it's like a sculpted square of mac and cheese in this yummy, delicate sauce.  I liked it. - Chocolate Macaron - if you like chocolate, this will be your jam. - Strawberry Coupe Glacee - it was basically strawberry ice cream with crunchy, melt in your mouth meringue bits.  Pretty tasty.  What was really cool, though, was that Michael Mina himself came out to talk to some people at the bar and asked us how the food and drinks were.  Very cool getting to meet the man in charge of a restaurant empire!  I would definitely come again.  The bar was delightful, but the restaurant itself would make for a fabulous birthday/anniversary/special event dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And God Created Woman.  I mean.....they put a &#34;B&#34; in the foam.  That&#39;s pretty fancy.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Detroit.  Doesn&#39;t it look like the ice sphere is glowing?

Wkzaejgly1nfjznLmwSA1A.text: LAMB CHOPS. The best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and laid on top of a bed of cooked greens. You get a full rack for the price which is more than what more places offer. The atmosphere is romantic and the service was great.

Hl4ihSoJjlwzG5MiCZLSsw.text: Omg this place is my favorite in Vegas and I've been to many high end French restaurants here in town. Great Forbes 5 star service as expected at the Aria. The food is great. Everything that we ordered was like a piece of art. The mixture of different flavors and textures in the buckwheat crepe was mindblowing. Foie gras brulee = food orgasm. Best advice - go there very hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe and foie gras = food orgasm.

uJSFptc5NxDMsZy5FtK4Eg.text: After numerous trips to this city of broken dreams and wallets we still love to come visit. It is a wonderful weekend getaway.  French is typically the food of choice to satisfy that craving for all things great. The bar crafted drinks were extremely tasty (although can't recall the names now they were all solid). The oysters were yum, the beef tartare well executed and the lemon merengue dessert - totally delish!  C'est magnifique!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

refxsUqfFQEV_t112QAEHA.text: I do not write reviews often, but tonight's meal compelled me to do so.  First off, the service here is amazing, the hostess and server were outstanding.  The appetizers we had are amazing, and the entrees exquisite.  The cocktails equally so.  I omitted my description of the food my lovely date and I had because I challenge, you the reader, to judge your dining experience for yourself!  Bon Appetite!

dFeFQMGYYJvk2ZsUgPRPyA.text: We came here for brunch and all I have to say is.... YUM! The pastries r to die for... So Ooooo gooood.. And the hunters waffle was awesome.. The staff was friendly n attentive.. I definitely will be coming back.

tNJ1kLPkw2rWLkucUr_FCw.text: I believe I had better French food in the ghettos of Paris next to the guy pissing with near subway station. Michael Mina should be a shamed of the overpriced menu grilled macaroni that my seven-year-old can make better.  Avoid like a bad virus on French bread.

-46KSV4ieWp4Bjv6x-VuHg.text: One word: Oscar. We came here for brunch today and anticipated delicious food, of course, but our expectations were incredibly surpassed. I work in the service industry and I have never had an experience like this before - Oscar is the best server I have ever had in my life. The kindness, patience, generosity, and joy that this man exudes is above and beyond the call of duty and we could not have been more appreciative. One of the best meals and experiences I have ever had. Oscar - you are one for the books and we will never forget today! We adore you!

PHxdm6KKtRrdmOq7MjgGNw.text: Hands down the best steak tartare I've had ANYWHERE. Every dish we had here was phenomenal and the steak just melts in your mouth. The staff are top notch and extremely personable, they will give you excellent recommendations and pairings. Makes for a lovely date and dining experience.

-AdEgyoV4xXDzrk5zPwEng.text: Love it!  Very unique dishes.  I do love ordering a bunch of small plates though!  Our group enjoyed the foie gras parfait, escargot, truffle fries, French onion soup, and the seasonal fruit with frozen yogurt and beignets.  All the starters were very delicious and unique!!  For the main entree, I tried the duck confit with waffles.  It doesn't compare to Bouchon's chicken and waffles though!  But I did thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant.  I would love to come here again and just get all of the starters --- yummy!!!  Still so many that I have tried.. can't wait to come back!

4-Umw6YHR5FN2vg3QYmd4A.text: Bardot Brasserie could be my new favorite restaurant in LV. Seriously.  First of all, the decor is beautiful. And the service was impeccable. Our waiter was very helpful in making selections and even knew how to mix in some humor as he checked in on us periodically. Perfect.  As for the food, we had the following:  Onion soup - gobs of Gruyere cheese and flavorful broth. yummy.  King crab crepe - one of my favorite things of the night. so simple yet sophisticated and delicious!  Seared foie gras lyonnaise - decadent. foie gras lovers' dream.  Bone Marrow - was hoping for a little more from this dish but pretty standard. still deelish.  Bone in Dry Aged ribeye - O.M.G. This steak sliced open like buttah. Meat was so tender and flavorful that I already knew that no steak in Hawaii could compare.  I can't wait to go back and try more!

o2xb1TnqKCE-Tmr0YptRpw.text: We brought a party of 20 here for a rehearsal dinner and it was a great experience. Very attentive service. The food was excellent. We chose between chicken, steak, and fish - everyone loved the entrees. Appetizers included escargot, duck wings l'orange, and charcuterie board. They were all fantastic. I also had the "enhanced" french onion soup and was not disappointed. If you're looking for a casual french steak/seafood option this place is great.

KhbnWmN6FaNyikuL75kHjQ.text: I highly recommend Bardot if you're looking for an elegant and relaxing dinner. The space is beautiful, food delicious, and price surprisingly reasonable given this is Vegas, on the strip, and a Michael Mina restaurant.  I ordered the 4-course summer tasting set, and I chose:  -Tuna Tartare: fresh, refreshing, and a little bit different than your usual tuna tartare with the additions of chopped olives -Scallops: delicious and sweet, although I tried my friend's choice of Duck L'orange wings for this course, and I would have ordered those instead. The wings were so tender, juicy, and flavorful and if I had been eating these at home by myself I probably would have done a much better job polishing off the wing. -Sea Bass: very generous serving and delicious, although a smidge on the plain side. My friends ordered the sole for this course and said it was amazing so I would have chosen that instead. -Strawberry Pavlova: Served with lavender ice cream a la mode and a tiny but fragrant piece of fresh lavender, this dessert was humongous and I could only finish the lavender ice cream before calling it quits.  My friends and I also shared the seared foie gras, foie gras parfait, and bone marrow. All extremely decadent and delicious, but I would have to choose the parfait as my favorite. It was creamy and savory, and I loved the Rose Port gelee that provided a tiny bit of tartness to the dish.  I would definitely come back and try their other dishes! They also have a daily Happy Hour (weekends included!) with some more casual fare like tartines, oysters, and tartares that could definitely be a meal.

BiDMGkrtT3N6X8wlIvuTaw.text: Dined at Bardot last Sunday and for their chef dinner with Chef Calum Franklin. What a amazing dinner. The team killed it and the food was perfect. The duck press was something I have always wanted to try and it was truly special to get to experience it. Bardot is always 5 stars to me but that dinner was a 10! Thank you to the entire staff and to chef and his team. Also tip, snag a seat at the bar and ask for Brooke she's the best!

jFYrA0WZXJWqBW6LzjGQkA.text: OMG, I could eat every meal here!   It was our last day and didn't want to be in the buffet line, way too long so I'm glad it forced us to go to Bardot :) We sat at the bar and got to look around, people watch ;)  Hubby got the steak brekkie and I got the lobster croissant benedict. OMGOMGOMG! I'm still day dreaming over it. Salivating as I type. It was perfect. Croissant was still crunchy, the sauce was divine, lobster pieces were generous. I wolfed it down! Oh so goooooood! I'm back in Vegas in Oct so I can't wait! I regrettably gave my hubby a bite. Even though I had a bite of his steak, the lobster benedict eclipsed the taste of the steak that I can't even remember what it was like.   I also noticed that they have lots of baked goods on display. I loved that they had canele. Yum! I'm grateful that the bartender let me try one as the display had not been changed. I got one worthy to play hockey with. He was very apologetic and appalled. He went to the kitchen and got fresh ones. Didn't get compensated but at least I got an apology.  This place is on my list to 'must try'!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rose
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak brekkie
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster benedict that I will not share! YUM!

ntPYbCmFpjOO6ZpIbD17rA.text: We come here for brunch every time we're in Vegas and it never disappoints! Bottomless sparkling rose and absolutely delicious food will keep us coming back. Make sure to get the smoke salmon plate - one of the best!

FSLxtZO-9hFGKCM8di5GHg.text: We have been there twice for Brunch, and will definitely be back.  The food is always incredible, and Rosie has become our favorite server in all of Vegas.    So far, we've had the Ham & Gruyere Croque, the Paris Ham Croissant Benedicts, the Hunter's Waffle, and the French Omelette, and we are looking forward to trying a number of other selections on the Brunch menu.  The bottomless champagne is completely worth the $25 also, as your glass will never be empty.    Try the coffee.  It's the best in Vegas.    Miss you, Rosie!  See you again soon!

JQWOQu-sTvapu-d-CxZatQ.text: This place is an amazing gastronomic experience! We were at the Aria for a work conference and spoiled for choice, but this ended up being our favorite as evidenced by repeat visits. When you walk in the first thing that strikes you is the floor with these tiny tiles that I swear shimmer like diamonds. If you've ever done a DIY project, you know how much work goes into laying tiny tiles and that let me know right off the bat that I was in for a fine dining experience.  The hostesses are lovely, it didn't seem to matter whether we had a reservation or was simply walking in - they were gracious both ways. Walking in the bar is immediately to your left and it's set up beautifully. The ambience is so lovely, like an upscale Parisian bistro/cafe. The customer experience is also top notch and they are very much attuned to when to serve and when to interrupt.   Our dinner included:  French 75s: perfectly bubbly and lemony made! We asked for this drink at Alibi, Lift, Julian Serranos and none of them came close to Bardot's. Seriously, I had 4 in a row and did not pay the price in the morning.   Classic Shrimp Cocktail: certainly passable, but nothing special - the shrimp is large and the sauce seemed standard. I would liked a bit more horseradish to kick it up.   Charcuterie Board: this is an exquisite group appetizer with housemade pate, pork rillettes (similar to pate), saucisson sec (thick, dry cured sausage), and bayonne ham. It was served with crostini type bread and was unbelievably flavorful!  Onion Soup Gratinee: this includes classic beef broth, baguette crostini, cave-aged gruyere. I added the beef bourguignon and black truffle, & omitted the poached egg. This soup was everything onion soup should be: flavorful broth, super cheesy topping, caramelized onions, I could go on. It was spectacular and filling!  Roasted Beets & Caramelized Goat Cheese Salad: this came with roasted red/gold beets, wild arugula, toasted hazelnuts, and tossed in a cassis vinaigrette. The beets were delicious but the goat cheese came in a round block and it wasn't that appetizing once you deconstructed the salad. It was yummy, but I would prefer for them to add the goat cheese in chunks.   Double Cut Ribeye: oh my god, this cut of ribeye and the beef fat fries were simply unbelievable! I made the mistake of filling up on the onion soup before this and regret that decision to this day. But the half that I was able to consume was incredible. I can't remember what sauce I ordered on the side, but I didn't eat it because the steak needed no doctoring up.

C248uSewK3AwkS-i4a5DUQ.text: Let's just say the reviews are definitely mixed and quality depends on the time you dine... First, we booked the reservation after checking in at the ARIA, great hotel; terrible dining experience. We had a 10pm reservation and felt rushed to order and unimpressed with the menu. French... Not ! The floors are tiled so sound carries- very loud to the point we had to repeat ourselves to the waiter and could barely hear each other to hold a basic conversation. Sad... It was my boyfriend's birthday who's an executive chef and knows his cuisines. This place wasn't as french as we thought. Had to add salt to our meals and didn't even acknowledge his birthday..   Another fine dining restaurant on strip who provided a sample dessert with a gift from the chef.   Complained to the hotel rewards counter who sympathize for the terrible experience and offered a 50 dollar comp.. Thanks Aria-

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster dish.. Just ok
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow appetizer

_xXrFXTw98O9Vb1WqFKYCg.text: That steak burger kicked to crap out of Gordan Ramsey's across the street. Service was excellent and very friendly. Highly recommend.

FE_sV0mXnGCPYZ7sAagIbQ.text: I've been to Bardot for the 3rd time 2 weeks ago and I think Bardot has become my favorite lunch/brunch place at one of my favorite hotels(Aria). I feel like most of their items are great -amazing.   Their egg Benedict is amazing and they really stand out because instead of your regular english muffin, they used croissant as the  base where where they topped it off with the egg and ingredients. If you really wanna go ballin, I would say get the lobster(but they have 4 other choices: PARIS HAM,BEEF BOURGIGNON,SMOKED SALMON, SURF AND TURF) because it's just so damn good. However, I have finally tried their hunter's waffle which is amazing and it's pretty much another version of egg benedict but instead they have it w/ duck confit. The duck is so flavorful, tender, and tasty.  Some other recommendations would be mussels and frites, chicken french dip, french onion soup(make sure you add the perigord truffle, braised short rib & poached egg for a few extra bucks to really elevate the soup. I won't go into the mussels and frites which is self-explanatory but the chicken french dip is really good. Most of the dishes doesn't look like it comes w/ a lot but a lot of their dishes are really hearty and heavy that when you finished it, you would be full. The bread is so good, the chicken is so flavorful, the "dip" goes so well w/ it, the mushroom bread budding is lovely. The side of salad really helps with this dish considering it's so heavy.  Anyway, Bardot has become one of my favorite lunch/brunch place at a good price and very filling. I would recommend it to anybody who would ask me what to eat at vegas as a must.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TjBoCV9fqEAuHXUyfeAwJw.text: Classic French style cookery at this Michael Mina restaurant with reasonable prices (especially for Vegas) with deeeeelicious food. I ordered the tasting menu ($65) fir dinner, which consisted of:  Summer melon with cheese (fresh burrata), cantaloupe, honey dew, and a balsamic reduction. The fruit was amazingly sweet and the burrata paired so well with the fruit! It was soft, creamy and delicate.  A play on duck a l'orange, where duck breast was replaced with duck wings. They were tender and perfectly cooked. But! I wanted duck skin and did not get it. It was fine but less preferred. It came with 3 wings.   Sole meuniere...stop all the clocks.. lol. If you like fish, butter, and artichoke flavors, this dish is a must. I loved it! Little bit of capers, two fillets of sole rolled and placed on top of an artichoke puree... all tied together with butter.. it was tres tres perfect. This is a dish I'll remember for a while!   For dessert, the cherry clafoutis. They did not keep the cherry pits in (like traditional ones), but it was still yummy, if just a tad on the sweet side. I loved how It paired with the nutty and less sweet pistachio ice cream!   Now go!! Reservation not needed. :)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sole meuniere!!

uLwd3Mlj5k8O_QWRi3OxvA.text: I wish I could snack on Bardot's escargots every day. Great atmosphere, Beautiful space, French fare on point, and great whiskey selection. :)

eIfieily6d9qN-Z9WKyFTw.text: This is our second trip to Bardot Brasserie. We love it here! The bottomless rose is top notch and you can even get a to-go cup! If you love bacon... order a side. It's heavenly! Our server Kristina, was just lovely and ever so helpful. Thank you!! xo

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TAS9ME7zg0BZcppd_15OIg.text: This place is as good as it gets! We felt like True royalty here. The service was impeccable and the food was divine. My husband and I don't usually go out to brunch so we really felt spoiled here. First off, the bread is amazing! From the baguette to the incredible pastries. Let's not forget that amazing butter! We were feeling a bit adventurous and tried the escardots bardots and the foie gras parfait and were pleasantly surprised. If any chef can make me like those things, they have True talent! For the main course I ordered a prime rib French dip with truffle fries. The bread was so soft and wow, that mimolette cheese fondue was so good! My husband ordered the steak and eggs and loved it. He's hardly ever impressed with steak in restaurants but this one disappeared from his plate in no time. Then, to top it all off, we HAD to try the famous French toast. We were already so full but boy was it worth it! Probably the best French toast I've ever had. That's saying a lot because I don't like eggs and French toast is my go to breakfast choice. It was such a unique take with this beautiful vanilla marscarpone and almond brittle on top. Now I can't wait to come back to try that Nutella sticky bun that we missed. All in all, the staff was top notch and you can tell that the chef has a real passion for food. It most definitely did not disappoint!

8FVxSiL1Qh3tFbhNhPp0pw.text: I love Brasserie food and ambiance although I saw not a hint of Bridgette Bardot anywhere - so beautiful. I had the Duck Wings a l'Orange which were not greasy ( natural fats in Duck were baked off and no frying) with a great sauce.  The Lamb Rack with Pommes Frites was crazy good - not enough but great food.  The deserts my friends had, Pear related cake/cobbler like but fluffy with crazy sauce was huge and yummy - enough for 3 people.  Service was excellent.

veX6CS2w4LSLvovhW8rEAw.text: Ambiance---traditional style Food----it's cool and not your everyday brekafast, lunch or dinner  Service---well trained staff ; they know what they're doing

dPwVTqyRJLaiQuA0w6VyQQ.text: What a surprise find!   They had a summer tasting menu for $65, and it is so worth it! The entree alone by itself would have been $49.   The set menu comes with 4 courses, and all of them are on the regular priced menu. I chose the summer melon (cheese was the highlight!), scallops (tender, but also heard great things about the duck wings), seabass (maybe my least favorite, but still very good), and the strawberry pavlova for dessert. Portions were hearty, but lots of attention to delivery.   We also separately ordered the foie gras parfait, the seared foie gras and the bone marrow to try. So decadent. All were delicious, but my favorite of the three would be the foie gras parfait, light and airy, a refreshing change to the usually dense foie gras pate.   Overall, great experience, great food, great ambience, great price, strongly recommend.

9XcPOIvseFSPyj9m0rWa4g.text: Had a large group for lunch on a Saturday. No wait at around 1pm. The restaurant was gorgeous and everyone enjoyed their food. I ordered the king crab crepe, which was surprisingly filling and really delicious. My husband ordered the smoked salmon croissant benedict which had two per order. The croissants were flaky, filled with nicely flavored spinach, and the perfect ratio of eggs and sauce. Everything came together very well.   For dessert we had the mille feuille (Napolean). It was quite large, probably best to be shared between three people. It was very very very delicious. I loved the flaky pastry and the light vanilla cream in between the layers.   Service was amazing. And the bill was very reasonable. Most of our entrees were $19/person.

uewEcxS7F_DqMB3EjR1zEQ.text: My husband and I have dined here a few times over the years and it is our favorite restaurant in Vegas.  This week we brought my mom and sister along and we once again had a fabulous meal.  We started with the charcuterie board which was absolutely delicious.  My mom had the scallops and my sister had the duck.  Both were cooked and seasoned to perfection.  However, the run away favorite of the evening was the beef wellington!  Their chicken is one of my favorites, but my husband loves beef wellington, and it was for 2 so I obliged.  I did not regret my decision. It is, without a doubt, the best we have ever had. It is no exaggeration.  The puff pastry was golden and crispy on the outside while the fillet was perfectly medium well.  The prosciutto, mushroom dexelles, accompanying sauce we're complimentary and not overpowering or too rich.  As a side note, it says it's for 2 but would easily feed 3-4.  Not wanting to let it go to waste, we ended up eating more than we would normally!  The downside of that is that we had no room for dessert.  Love their chocolate macaron, but just couldn't do it.  If there is anything I would criticize, it's that the room is rather loud.  But who cares about that when you have this wonderful food to concentrate on.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T7kl1Cb-aoGcskNYQuyiIw.text: Aria has so many tempting restaurants, and Bardot Brasserie came in on top of my list of must-tries.  No reservations? No problem. Bardot has a wonderfully large lounge with over 20 bar stools & a dozen two-seater tables, all serving the full dinner menu. The dining room looks beautiful as well, so I would recommend reserving a table for larger parties or for a more intimate night out.  The duck a l'orange is fantastic! So rich, tender, and fall off the bone delicious. It's maltaise sauce is beautifully presented in a hollowed mini orange, & it's so creamy with an amazing yet subtle flavor. The onion soup gratinee is everything I wanted it to be - soft caramelized onions and baguette in a rich brown broth, all topped with a generous amount of gruyere. Perfect!  Bardot's bar became really busy past 10p and looked like the perfect place to hang out before heading to a club.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck À L&#39;Orange with the most amazing maltaise sauce... So good!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck À L&#39;Orange &amp; Onion Soup Gratinée

Um4g9Pw1NDuC5xQTjle8XQ.text: Came here for brunch with a few friends and we all enjoyed most of our time here. The king crab crepe with trumpet mushrooms and egg was very rich and flavorful, a can't miss. The Nutella sticky bun was a big portion and delicious as well. We all thought the smoked salmon with brioche was just okay, although the chive mascarpone that came with it was great. We all enjoyed our main courses except one, who ordered her steak medium rare but received it pretty well done (pictured). Service was a tad bit slow as we waited at least ten minutes to put a drink order in. But that didn't deter us from having a good time. Overall, we enjoyed everything, but if I came back, I would want to try their dinner menu.
