Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris Ham Benedict on a crossaint
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab crepe - delicious

UDyVnAGU8oCx6ZEDKqNSow.text: Very good brunch! LOVED the croissant Benedict's and the croque monsieur.  The service was it bad but nothing impressive. I'd go back again for brunch!

oy5JAjm1ArwwGL3xG1nHWw.text: Ate here last time we stayed in Aria, the food was excellent. I really loved the Duck and my friends loved their steak and chicken. The beef wellington was the size of a football, it could probably feed 4 ppl. The lamb chops were good but were not Frenched correctly since I kept spitting up pieces. The services is very slow, I feel like they had one waiter working the whole place. We had to beg for drinks and the food took forever to bring out. But everything was  tasty, there is room for improvement but I would come back for sure!

Dz0il1b8WsK3HD7iPfDT6A.text: This review is for their 2016 Las Vegas Restaurant Week $80 menu.  Bardot is both a solid brunch and dinner spot. The food is delectable, and the service is unpretentious.   The three-course Las Vegas Restaurant Week menu may be more than enough food, but I'd suggest ordering an extra appetizer or two to share.  Appetizer - Escargots Bardot: Can't stand the sight of SNAILS? Well, these are wrapped in a puff pastry. These are savory, buttery, and delicious -- you can't eat just one.   Appetizer - Seared Foie Gras Lyonnaise: If you've ever tried Filipino-style adobo, the sauce in this dish has a familiar adobo flavor to me. I wasn't a fan of the beluga lentils, but I liked the combination of foie gras and the prune confiture.   First Course - King Crab Crepe: A crab and black trumpet mixture folded into a buckwheat crepe with a sunny side egg right in the center. Yum.  Second Course - Maine Lobster Thermidor: Truthfully, I'm not a fan of lobster, but I gave this a try any way and it was delicious. This was my first time trying this dish, and it reminded  me of a "dynamite" that you can order at some Japanese restaurants. I loved the mixture of the mushrooms, bernaise sauce, and the tender chunks of lobster meat. The creamy mashed potatoes were bomb; I wish I had a bowl of just that on the side.   Third Course - Chocolate Macaron: Rich and decadent. This is a deluxe version of a regular macaron. Sandwiched in between chocolate cookies were dollops of chocolate mousse. Chocolate sauce and chocolate shavings topped it off.   For French cuisine on The Strip, Bardot's my top pick. I cannot wait to return.

1V9L5o-Uj-6oe2GjLl1o0A.text: Oscar took amazing care of us for brunch - our second time back and not disappointed!  A must stop when you are in Vegas - Thanks Oscar!

bbupNWBVNuTOOhzUBw_tqQ.text: Details matter. From every aspect of the decor to the carefully curated menu, Bardot Brasserie has been thoughtfully presented.   The atmosphere is a joy to be in, reminiscent of many bistros and brasseries in France albeit less worn and perfectly new obviously built with a nice budget!   This was my second visit, last April my wife and I enjoyed their weekend brunch which on the plus side did offer more variety including wonderful fresh baked croissants and bottomless rose which both were not available on this visit.   This time around we were with our children and friends mid week. The restaurant wasn't too busy but the menu offering wasn't as grand.   The sourdough baguette with butter imported from France is worth the extra spend. One thing i especially enjoy when going to France is the silky rich butter with a much higher fat content than we eat. Treat yourself!   I had the onion soup gratinee which although good is a 7/10 if you've had other great ones. We live in Montreal which enjoys a French culture and there are better soups to compare this with. I will however say that it is the best in recent memory stateside. The quality of gruyere was nice and salty with a perfect crust on top and just the right amount of chew, the broth lacked some richness and there was way too much bread that soaked up a good amount of the broth.   My wife had the Maine lobster nicoise and was very pleased. The baby gem lettuce was thoughtfully assembled on the plate with a large plump lobster claw front and center.   Two of our party enjoyed the French herb omelette. It was incredibly cooked without a blemish or burnt spot to be seen and perfectly rolled. A few of us discussed how they prepared it, with butter in the egg or just at very low heat in a non stick pan. The side salad that accompanied the omelette was crisp and delicious and also thoughtfully assembled with all leaves pointing upward. The hash brown, was a little too dense and dry but could not put a damper on what was otherwise perfection.   There was a croque madame and steak burger all enjoyed as well but what stood out was believe it or not a side dish that my daughter had! The macaroni mimolette gratinee is not to be missed! In essence haute Mac and cheese, it is presented as what looks like a slice of toast but is in fact macaroni noodles perfectly assembled in soldier position with a delicious cheese crust on top. The square of noodles is beautifully placed on a bed of bechamel sauce, and in addition to the presentation, the taste is divine and incredibly rich.   While not French, chef Michael Mina has in my view made the French proud and that is not easily attainable lol!   I highly recommend the food, the decor and the experience for a non rushed beautiful meal but be prepared to pay a heavy price.

vrD8EbiBThE4wLDisfmj4w.text: I was initially disappointed when American Fish closed down, being a big fan of the happy hour they offered. I will say that disappointment was eased when I walked into Bardot Brasserie for brunch one day with the ladies.   Home to the Everlasting Rose, this is brunch on another level. This brunch is elevated. Rose is one way to stand out on Champagne Sunday! There's lots of light, and there's some wonderful dishes including croissant benedicts in lobster and surf & turf varieties.   For a decadent French onion soup, try adding the perigord truffle, braised short rib & poached egg. It's mouthwateringly good.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

SXYL_alfsSpsXWCko6jsmw.text: Overall good experience. Nothing to thrill over. Steak was great but our fries were burnt to the point you couldn't even eat them. A friend ordered truffle fries for an additional fee and you couldn't tell the difference. Portions are crazyyyyyy small. Would maybe come back but nothing to rave about.

6NXT6vOLIxTibnnFvjR5SQ.text: Bar staff was amazing, they are a great team!! Thank you Brooke and Dino, I'm sorry I don't remember the other bartenders name but they were all so friendly :) thank you guys!!

TNp043eyi8xLS_teQKI2Bw.text: I've been here twice for the weekend brunch and this would be one of my favorite French restaurant. Chef Michael Mina did a great job on the variety of menu it has to offer. Let's start with complimentary french bread that is toasty on the exterior and soft on the inside with house butter.   Appetizers: french onion soup with truffle, shortrib, poached egg, and gruyere cheese - This is goood $16 bowl of french onion which taste so home -made and delicious. The beef broth was not salty and doesnt taste like it's from the can beef broth. It's not heavily dumped with onions. This is one darn good bowl of french onion soup.   steak tartare - it was good and fresh, but i've had better. It comes in half or full order.   escargot - Nicely presented and the escargot is wrapped in pastry puff.   French toast with vanilla mascarpone and almond brittle - This is a huge brick of bread! Literally, it's probably about 2.5inches thickness and 4x6inches in length/width. I was only able to eat half of the french toast. Outside is toasty, but the inside was soft and quite mushy, but tasty. It's not your typical french toast.   Burger with aioli fries - Juicy, huge, and tasty! the fries is a must have!  Ham croissant benedict - Interesting combo and the sauce was delish!  Hunter waffle with duck confit - It 's a good plain waffle atop with duck confit. It was just okay.   Apple tart - Not your typical apple pie or tart, but it's really good. Not soo sweet, but full of apple flavor.   Vanilla creme brulee - Full of vanilla flavor and creamy! One of the better creme brulees!  I would definitely return to try the happy hour menu in the bar area next time i'm in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee - SO Good!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. famous apple tartine
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. steak tartare (small order)

hWweQviVqYedb0_QpgbbJQ.text: Wonderful service wonderful food especially the gnocchi! Best I have ever had. Beer salad and baked Alaska excellent. Service and wine likewise great

Zibs7j3M_W_KSwpJ7zx3ig.text: Came here for Mother's Day brunch. Would recommend this place, as it had a pretty extensive and unique French menu compared to some other places.   AMBIENCE = Great! Beautiful brasserie.  SERVICE = Great, generally attentive.  FOOD REVIEW:  COMPLIMENTARY BAGUETTE & SALTED BUTTER They give you a baguette loaf for 2 people. Salted butter is nicely whipped and creamy.  ESCARGOTS BARDOT: toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter, puff pastry shells --- Pretty good; wish there was a bit more garlic butter flavor though... but it wasn't greasy at all.  HAND CUT TRUFFLE FRIES (no photo) --- Could hardly taste the truffle... wasn't worth the price.  KING CRAB CREPE: buckwheat crepe, black trumpet mushrooms, sunny-side egg, normandy cider beurre blanc --- It was ok. I'm not sure I'm a fan of the taste, but my mom really enjoyed it.   BARDOT STEAK & EGGS: prime rib eye, two fried eggs, hash browns, sauce verte  --- I didn't try it but the steak seemed pretty good. Tried a bit of the hash brown and I didn't like it. Tasted like dry cardboard with some herbs.  HUNTER'S WAFFLE: glazed duck confit, poached eggs, sauce maltaise --- I didn't get to try this, but looks decent.  FRENCH TOAST: brioche french toast, vanilla mascarpone, almond brittle, orgeat syrup --- Wow, epic french toast! Really well done! Even though the toast was really thick, it had a nice bread pudding consistency to it (i.e. not dry at all, not too bready) and when you take a bite with the mascarpone and almond syrup... WOW... Amazing combination! Strongly recommend it and highlight of the meal.   DOUBLE-CUT BACON (no photo) --- Didn't try this but brothers were impressed with it. Compared this to smokey brisket.  SMOKED SALMON CROISSANT BENEDICTS: two poached eggs, sauteed kale, bearnaise --- Looked amazing, but smoked salmon was way too salty. Wish there was a bit more kale to offset the saltiness. But overall I enjoyed this and love that it's on a croissant pastry.  MILLE FEUILLE: caramelized puff pastry, vanilla creme patisserie --- Mmmm... so good!!! The puff pastry was so crispy and flakey. Really delicious. Highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MILLE FEUILLE caramelized puff pastry, vanilla crème patisserie
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SMOKED SALMON CROISSANT BENEDICTS two poached eggs, sautéed kale, béarnaise
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FRENCH TOAST brioche french toast, vanilla mascarpone, almond brittle, orgeat syrup

CZoRAu-caPxX0yDxOGrIbA.text: I absolutely love this place!  The food was good, the service was great, the ambiance was intimate, but similar looking to a pub.    Their menu has great selections.  I couldn't decided between the escargots, foie gras, or bone marrow, but after some thinking, I decided to go with the bone marrow.  That was a great choice!  I've had bone marrow elsewhere.  In some places, I've gotten bone that are large but with little marrow.  This one had smaller bones, but generous portions of marrow! The bone marrow comes in two pieces and 3 slices of toasted bread.  You use the marrow to spread on the bread...like butter and yes, better than butter!!  If it's your first time having bone marrow ever, or if you're not a fan of the bone marrow taste itself, I'd recommend using the side of caramelized onions.  The caramelized onions will take over the bone marrow taste.  Got the mussels for the entree.  The light garlic buttery wine sauce was flavorful, and it didn't feel too buttery.  The only disappointment was the size of the mussels.  I'm used to large jumbo mussels almost as big as oysters, but these mussels were just slightly bigger than clams.  Regardless, they tasted excellent.    I'd like to come back to try the escargots and the foie gras!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels entree
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow

O859xT_1l6ZXI2dovZUyKQ.text: UPDATE: Nice half-ass "apology" by the staff. Your customer service is even saltier than your food.  Excellent service, okay food, but not worth the price. Spent $400 ($300 plus tip) since we were there on a special occasion (our 10th anniversary), but everything was so salty I barely had any room for the food because I was downing a cup of water between every bite. Every bite was like a straight sip from a salt shaker: the bread with the fancy butter that cost extra on top of the free bread and butter, the seafood tower, the lamb chops, and the steak with foie gras. It was so depressing because I was so full from water I couldn't finish my half of the foie gras (we shared everything). The giant macaron dessert was fun. I was concerned that it was kind of gimmicky but it was a decent macaron, with crisp, delicate outsides and perfect feet.  Should have stayed in LA and gone to the Arroyo Chop House in Pasadena where they make me a perfectly seasoned blue rare steak every time, and we eat like kings for $150. Too bad Fusion closed down; their steak with foie gras was orgasmic.

1zJpQMgg7pQ89grEKuYymw.text: Bardot is a great place. Came here for my first anniversary with a group of six, so we were able to share and try a lot of things. Highlights for me were the Duck L'Orange wings and the mussels. My husband loved the tuna tartare and the cheese plate. And of course, the giant macaron is the stuff that dreams are made of.  Service was top-notch and the restaurant itself is beautiful. We will definitely return.

R7j0nXcpz5J3BuEHJuWSig.text: Was recently here again, as this is also my go-to brunch spot, whenever I am in Vegas, and I have to say how huge disappointment it was. The service was one of the worst. When we first arrive to BARDOT, we sat in our seats for good 10-15min before a server or even a busser came in greet us or asking us for drinks. (I feel that even 10min is bit too long for us just sit there without any greeting or asking us what we like to drink) We had to signal the waiter for us to even see us. The worst part was that the place was fairly empty (which is unusual for BARDOT for saturday brunch) except for the one big birthday party in the corner. However the our waiter did awknlodge the fact that it did take them really long time to take our order. We ordered the  BARDOT breakfast sandwhich, (which was pretty much bigger version of egg mcmuffin) it was way too heavy and and salty. I also got the crossaint smoked salmon egg benedict, and that was good. But right when I was about to use my kniffe to cut the egg, all my utensils were covered in butter, (someone either not clean the utencils or just left it there. As I ask for new utensils, even our waiter mentioned "we are def messing up on you guys today, I apologized". And As we were eating, there was group of 4 came and sat next to us, and they too  were sitting there for good 15 minutes before the server came and awknolodge them. It took them 20 min to get their food. I can tell everyone in that table were confused to why the service was so slow when there was barely anyone in the restaruant. I felt the management of the restaurant was poorly managed because I can see that lot of the waiters had to attend the big birthday party which cause to neglect the other paying customers. The service and food was really only one star. Another restaurant in ARIA that I'm really disappointed, especially because it was one of my go to for brunch!

f1h48pmMPox7eMFfhGELAQ.text: Bardot Brasserie definitely captures a very busy and modern French bistro vibe! The Steak tartare was spot on and delicious. L'Oreilles de Cochon (crispy breaded pig ears & sauce bearnaise) were mildly crispy, slightly salted and tasty. My wife decided to have the Alaskan King Crab and Macaroni & Mimolette gratinee as entrees. It was a delight, as I was told. My Oak-Smoked Duroc Pork Chop, was super tender and full of flavor. Pretty smoky though, as advertised. The bartenders and wait staffs were not perfectly fluid, in the way they engage, anticipate my needs and communication. Just a bit rough around the edge. Just need slightly more training to make this restaurant top notch! But Overall a good meal...

ypcJ8XIyF6YcgAfuIcdoMg.text: I had a steak for lunch.  I couldn't cut the steak with my knife, nor could the other people at my table.  My steak was undercooked, and the waitress never returned to check on us.  When some came to the table, it was to remove the plates.   Therefore, I didn't get to have an edible meal.   I will not return and will not recommend it.  It was a very bad lunch experience.  As a follow up, I have received a reply from the restaurant and feel they are very apologetic about the situation.  I will give them another opportunity in the future.

QiP3g7D35zQWcSlSWMlRdA.text: Had brunch this past weekend. They know what they are doing. We loved their cocktails (order the lemon drop), good bloody mary and a friend enjoyed the bottomless brunch rose. Love the baguettes and butter they start the meal with, I had Maine Lobster Benedict which was delicious. Husband had and loved the traditional burger, friend ordered a big bowl of delicious mussels and French Onion soup and truffle fries. All of it was amazing. Would definitely go again.

tgtwdfQv2pOtIu52hoHOgg.text: Had brunch here before our flight back home. The hostess was prompt to seat is after checking us in for our reservation. Aloof, polite service and a trendy French atmosphere. My partner got the loaded French onion soup that had short rib and an egg in it. I chose the smoked salmon plate which was beautifully presented and delicious. Would have been great for sharing. I'd consider coming back and would recommend to pink wine drinkers as they have an unlimited Rose option with brunch.

LjiLoA0Jp4hPwqKQLPmfOg.text: Another great brunch.  No where else in Vegas can you get authentic French cuisine with bottomless.This time I went with croque madame.  Amazing bread, goeey goodness, and runny egg.  Not much more you can do to impress me at a restaurant. The bubbles keep goinan the wait staff is always helpful and doesn't force you to finish the meal.  I love brunch so much and on the strip this is a top 3 no doubt

bDLVSzv_Cgfl0bCcjW2rNQ.text: A nice find in the Aria. I had the double pork chop which was phenomenal. Good service and would recommend.

kxFjIS4YTECJ5cXkrdSm7Q.text: The atmosphere is elegant and relaxed. The service is flawless and food a joy. My favorite place on the strip for fine dining.

R0xR0rHwHBAb46CaMwwIqg.text: Came here for brunch and had the most incredible experience! The food and service was excellent and our server was very helpful and knowledgeable. I ordered the short rib croissant Benedict and it was absolutely wonderful. Also have bottomless rose which is always a bonus. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a nice brunch in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib croissant Benedict

Q1Id0seVHc3uuMId9HfKxA.text: Every dish is amazing. Especiall Foie Gras, Steak Tartare and Lamb. My new favorite Vegas.

W0xjVcZvTRyv-jUSUHJ3cg.text: Fancy french at Aria hotel by Michael Mina. The decor here is fantastic. Bar is really pretty and also inside looks like real french brasserie. It's looks pretty classic. The flower decoration inside the restaurant is really pretty too. We went in for the sunday brunch for the restaurant's famous french toast.  Food is good. Service is professional. We had the almost $25 frenchy toast and the almost $25 french omelet. Frenchy toast is enough to share amongst 3 people. It's a huge block of bread with huge scoop of better/cream and almond glazed garnish on top. Inside french toast is so moist I think they put a lot if eggs and butter. It's so soft and goes well with the cream on top. But the dish is so heavy with all heavy flavors. French omelet was a bit disappointing compared to the french toast though. It was served very nicely, clean looking but the omelet was basically just rolled egg and the hash brown was hash rock. It was so hard we couldn't chew it. Drinks here were nice as well though.   The whole experience really great. Definitely worth a visit in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast and french omelet

AoLGI2BNMTBlc92nRCZHHw.text: All I can say is WOW. This place was so good! I originally tried to visit the restaurant across the way because pasta sounded great. But they were all booked so I wandered over to BARDOT and found a spot at the bar. Despite being incredible busy, the bartenders were very friendly and accommodating to my little party of 1. I was promptly served and the food was fantastic! I ordered the Parisian Gnocchi and that should really be renamed to Parisian PILLOWS. The Gnocchi was so soft and fluffy, I've never had anything like it!! I'm amazed.  This dish is a must have!

ZLc6q9IWtmtQxDsnnwW-nQ.text: Business traveler here   Pros - great atmosphere and ambiance, the food was pretty good, the servers and managers were friendly  Cons - extremely inattentive service. Had the order appetizers and drinks with the bartender bc we didn't see our server for the first 23 minutes of dinner, then she came out said she was very busy, then ghosted for the next 30 mins.... our service was so bad that the manager comped our meal.    Advice - it was the only meal I've ever had comped but I would have much rather paid for good service. I had a reservation here the next day with some clients which I cancelled and rebooked for Joes seafood and steaks.

ok65JUXfkXkDkA4a_OtSLA.text: Dinner at Bardot Brasserie was one of my favourite meals in Las Vegas. They are managed by Mina group, who specializes in creating and operating high end restaurants, led by Chef Michael Mina. The servers were well-trained and patiently took their time to explain each dish, providing us with recommendations. We ordered 2 mains and 1 appetizer  Freshly grounded Steak tartare ($24): prime filet, egg yolk, sauce verte, potato chip Beef tartare is one of those simple dishes that are extremely hard to master since there are only a few simple ingredients; the simpler the ingredients, the less room there is for hiding. The beef must be top quality and have a good balance of meat-to-fat ratio, which can make or break the dish. It was a very addicting dish and we could have ate it all day, but we wanted to eat the entrees, too. Flavour: 9/10  Double Cut Pork Chop ($49): oak-smoked duro pork, bacon lardons, root vegetables, red pearl onions, horseradish pomme puree, grain mustard beurre blanc Porkchop for an entree is out of my comfort zone, but it was recommended by our waitress so I gave it a try. The flavours of this dish weren't bad, although it could use some acidity to cut down the fat a little, and the extra bacon lardon wasn't necessary. The pork chop was a little tough for me. I think they could improve a little on the cooking time for it. Flavour: 4/10 Scallops Veronique ($51): Roasted cauliflower, sultana raisins, broccoli spigarello, caper brown butter, perigord verjus, and preserved lemon. Hands down best dish of the evening. All of the scallops were jumbo-sized. Each one was seared to perfection. The brown butter brings out the sweetness of the tender scallops. I will say I had hoped for a prettier dish. I think they can put more effort on the plating since Bardot is an up-scale venue. Flavour: 9/10  Total: $124 USD Flavour Averages: 7 Value: 6 Service: 8

dM0rhrXFpk75Liy-1y3WBg.text: Escargot in Puff Pastry was soooooo good!  The Puff pastry add a layer to the traditional escargot.  French Onion Soup - not the best but still very good.  Sea Bass - good and tender but normal.  Rib Eye - pretty good and the fries was crispy and yummy.  Something China cocktail was complex and strong.  Service was extraordinary here!

ybPPgpIR7z7MSlWQ0eQu_A.text: When we are in the mood to splurge this is our go to spot! Our two favorite things on the menu are the heritage chicken and the diver scallops, which are both very tasty and cooked to perfection. The service is always great no matter how busy they are, which is to be expected at such a nice place.   My only issue is it can get pretty loud, as they do have a tv at the bar. I'd suggest requesting one of the more secluded areas or at least a table where the television is not in view. To me, it's just not fitting to pay $200 for a meal (for 2) while watching a sporting event on the tele. It just doesn't go, at least not for me.   Aside from that, everything is ALWAYS amazing which is why we return, but more importantly venture to the strip. If you're a Vegas local, you'll understand that statement.

_MT7cVTQili31EgIq-f_8w.text: So sad about this  we made a 12:15 reservation for Saturday brunch. We showed up early and were told it would be closer to 12:15 (totally fine that was our res time)....we get sat at 12:47 at a tiny table in the bar room which is right across from where waiters pick up drinks from bartenders. It wouldn't be a problem really but there were 4 open two tops in the restaurant (one of which was right on the other side of us and stayed open the entire brunch)  So on to ordering, we were interested in the "world's best butter" and asked what it came with, the waitress scoffed "bread" and then laughed and said we offer bread and butter free you really don't need to get that...what the heck?! We ordered it anyway. We also got a breakfast sandwich and the croissant Benedict with prosciutto. Plus beers from their really excellent selection of draft beers.   The butter was fun, but comes w cold hard bread (which is the same as the complimentary bread.) the breakfast sandwich was so bad it was actually funny. It comes with one of those pre-cooked egg pucks (see pic ) and tastes exactlylike an egg McMuffin according to my husband. The Benedict was ok minus the spinach which was clearly frozen then reheated and was not seasoned at all.   I could go on but I really don't need to, we would have ordered more beers but the waitress just told us "she would be right back with our check" when the table was bused...over all: rude service, bad food, and a really disappointing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vLdbmNVkmseo1BjxPj1UgQ.text: Another great meal at BARDOT! Believe them when they say they have the best butter ever. Also make sure to get the bottomless sparkling rose!! I has the French onion soup, and escargot. Amazing, our server was also on point and a pleasure to chat with!!! Must go if your in Vegas!!!

LbkEJ7N37Vm6t7AGBUvIEw.text: You can't go wrong with trying any of Michael Mina's restaurants and Bardot Brasserie is no exception to the rule.   There's a bar, a semi private room, large booths, and tables towards the center of the restaurant.   We were celebrating my birthday and our servers made the night very enjoyable.   Two of us ordered the special of the day, which was prime rib. I had the filet mignon well done and it was perfect! My other friend ordered gnocchi, which was a great vegetarian option. My friends shared duck wings and oysters, but I didn't partake. They were all raving about the oysters. My starter was mediocre -  I've had better beet salads. For dessert, the descriptions threw my friends for a loop. The espresso creme brulee was a bit overwhelming, but the beignets were decent. We were not expecting the cheesecake to look or taste like it did. I think it was too creamy or lemony?! My chocolate macaron on the other hand was stellar!!

a6I5WUIKVcHW4OElsVssVQ.text: Restaurant is so beautiful.  Went in for brunch time  Amazing food and attentive service.   I definitely recommend the French toast!!

UvXCGxLW0NVdA6s4Kd-myQ.text: The food here is pretty good... Came here with a group of my colleagues and we got to try a little bit of everything. Loved the fresh baguette, the escargot wrapped in pastry puff, the oysters, the beef Wellington, and plus they have a good wine selection. The octopus was a bit salty though, and service wasn't that great. However the manager did comped us a few desserts to make up for the poor service.

XsjlUPJxk1SeJvBlceA_aQ.text: When my wife and I come to Vegas, it is almost entirely focused on food. We have tried so many restaurants but our meal at Bardot was our absolute favorite. We are very fond of the service and food at Eiffel Tower restaurant but we both had to admit that this one took the cake. You simply must try the escargot, the 'pop tarte' and the fois gras with short rib. I have never been so happy to have leftovers the next day

7UeuxP5KNqh2VYL_e5KS7w.text: Wow, talk about an overhyped restaurant that seems to be rated high because of the atmosphere. It's always hard to tell reviews in Las Vegas because I figure people can be drunk when deciding over food quality. I was famished when I came to BARDOT but the food was so subpar that even in that state of being, my tastebuds could not be tricked into submission. The only thing I can say is that their butter with hot bread was the best- and now I know they have announced that on their menu for a reason: to assure you that something here does make it worthwhile.   Loup De Mer Au Fenoil: $56. This Dish smelled distinctly. The Sea Bass was flaky but tasted like nothing. There was only one fingerling potato buried under the fish along with one artichoke. The flavors clashed: I felt like I was eating boiled fish and when I tried to put it in the sauce/juice the sourness was overpowering. Could not taste any subtle taste in this fish. I went home hungry and kept thinking I was eating Lean Cuisine. it was that bad.  Bone In Strip: $61 . Apparently was good, we had a comparison for two other steak restaurants on the strip and this did not compare those those and was $10 more expensive  Brussel Sprouts: $14 - it was okay  Chickpea Frites: $15 - the dip was the only thing great about this  King Crab & Endive Salad: $20+ range. Another uneventful dish that lacked substance and taste. Our rep finished it only because he was hungry.  Bardot Salad: $17 - okay.   The food quality was so bad that I will not come back here again- no matter how the service is. I went over to Paris to get some dessert since I was too scared to try it here - needed to get rid of the taste in my mouth.   As a positive their bathrooms are fancy.

I personally don't even like French food and I can't wait to go back! Bravo to the kitchen for excelling in everything that was brought out. The ambiance suberb. I felt like I was in a Brasserie in France. The decor the lighting, superb.   Everyone was very polite and professional. There is nothing bad to say other than fine tuning the attention to detail.   Thank you for the wonderful experience. We will be back.

8l0mZck_jXlx4-iZoCXbyg.text: Came for an intimate brunch and it proved to be exceptional.  The atmosphere and "feel" was special and the service was impeccable.  We both had the lobster scramble - it was very nice and a very ample serving, neither of us could finish.  The baguette was French and their butter is as advertised - great !  We split the cheese cake which had Luxardo cherries on the side - super !  A pricy breakfast but an wonderful experience.  I highly recommend - you will definitely enjoy !!!!

C_P6hN4wg1_I8CSt_WKnow.text: My second time dining at BARDOT. Already knew the food was going to be good bc I love Michael Mina's restaurants. Made day of reservations for a party of a 8 on a weeknight. Thrilled to see that the restaurant was able to accommodate us.   Service: our server was Mr. Grumpy pants at first but he did warm up later in the evening. He was pretty short with our table and kept leaving our table when we were in mid sentence. Like I said he got better throughout the night.   Food: was really really good. I think I enjoyed the food this time around than I did last time. We started off with the seafood tower of assortments. I think it was one of the best towers I've seen. I had the chicken with the mushroom bread pudding. Amazing. The chicken was cooked beautifully. NOT DRY. Thank you!  Can never go wrong w Brussel sprouts. They were really good.   Also to people who like butter. I'd get their worlds best butter. It's starkly different than the regular butter they serve with the baguettes. The worlds best butter is less salty? More smooth and has a nice scent to it.   Recommend grabbing a drink at their bar. Which has a nice display. Then grab a bite to eat! Nice ambience, it tends to be pretty loud so heads up!

HTQKy_x0-ipLJNNFgdeJjg.text: Did someone say...bottomless rose?? I've never had this taken literally before, but I actually never saw the bottom of my glass, with my waitress refilling it every chance she got. I came on the later side of brunch hours so to maximize the deal she gave me a to-go cup to take with me to the pool. Awesome!  French toast with foie gras - All the pics made this look so amazing, but I was gravely disappointed. Sure it's a thick slice of bread, but that's about it. Where's all the flavor? If the bread itself was good I wouldn't have had such an issue (think Asian bakery). Alas, it was more akin to plain white toast. The marscapone and brittle on top barely added to the dish and the foie gras made me sick.   Overall, great service but I'd shy away from the french toast.

MG1ulTyEc_M5JUnzjozD4w.text: Been wanting to come here for awhile. Well today was the day! What drew me here was the bottomless Rose. I know Vegas has a great selection of bottomless brunch experience . I've had my experiences and wanted to add BARDOT to the list . Our server was wonderful and greeted us right away and assured us our glasses would never be empty ! And she was right !! Such a sweetie, she had a French accent and made our experience delightful . Me and my bf sat in the bar area , it was perfect as the restaurant is pretty open and it's gorgeous inside ! The bar is mesmerizing , rose gold everything ! My entree of choice was the scrambled eggs with lobster . It was delicious but I wish I got something else at the end . The eggs were a bit dry. Otherwise they serve you a hot mini banquette with butter and I suggest doing the bottomless rose !

_LwDG1xoXHDWtwdYGUQ1jg.text: Visited Bardot on demands of friends and wife, which they had visited on their prior trip.  Trusting their palettes, I decided to do zero research and opted to not put up a fight on restaurant selection.  Verdict?  Best brunch experience thus far in Vegas!  Complimentary mini baguettes came in these paper baggies along with a dish of pearly butter.  The best way to start your journey at Bardot - tear into that bread and smell that freshly-baked wonder, and spread that butter across the steamy soft center.  Moules frites:  the classic Belgium dish of mussels and fries.  The mussels were so tender and fresh (best I've had in years).  There's always the option of upping your game by going with truffle fries (so damn good...).  The best part of the dish?  Soaking that complimentary baguette with the pungent vermouth mussel juice in the pot!  French toast:  made with a block of tasted brioche, the French toast came with generous serving of vanilla mascarpone, almond brittles, and hearty almond syrup.  A beautiful piece of work that we were afraid to cut into.  We ended up spending more time gazing at the golden brick than devouring it.  Crunchy on the outside while buttery and soft on the inside.    One of the best dining experiences we had in Vegas for sure!  Look forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict croissants
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moules frites

D6eHgjSOAcU1uLhqYGI9Jw.text: Blown away. This was the best brunch i've ever had.  Should you start with the bottomless sparking rose? Yes, you should. My brother and I both got that, and I would venture to guess, that between the two of us, we went through at least two bottles and change. The waitress just kept coming over and topping us off; I don't think we actually ever had completely empty glasses.  Carbs? Yep. If you're jumping on the bottomless train, you best supplement with breads of many varieties. We got the basket of bread/pastries, a basket of sourdough, as well as "the world's best butter" - I think between this carb-festival and the rose, I could have stopped right there.  But did we? Of course not. We also HAD to start with the Nutella cinnamon bun to get that initial fat explosion we needed to really get our metabolisms going. We divided that up between all of us, because only a crazy person (or someone with an iron stomach) could house that whole thing themself.  From there, you can't really go wrong with what you order. Our table had some salmon, some french toast, and steak and eggs floating around, and they were all fantastic. I had the steak and eggs, which was grass fed NY beef (local for me, less so for LV) nice and rare, with perfectly over easy eggs and fat sourdough to soak it all up.  This easily outdoes any NYC/NJ brunch i've ever had - where else can you get bottomless sparking French rose for $25?  Again, not the cheapest meal you'll eat, but most certainly worth every penny. Next time I am in Vegas, Aria or not, I will be back.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast?

sETJSISSpTMxkXpA77lyyg.text: Another extraordinary night at Bardot, perfect execution with diverse flavors, stimulating through night end!  The Foie Gras here served two ways, both as delectable and decadent as they come. The Beluga Lentils an interesting yet fitting combination, the parfait variety a MUST have every visit!  The surprising winner here being an out of this world Creekstone Prime Rib, putting to shame anything that you've yet encountered with the prime rib label. Both flavor, texture and welcomed array of accompanying sauces putting to rest any preconceived perception of the classic dish. Order!  The Smoked Salmon Paris Brest taking same route, with an explosion of flavor and balance of taste, jading every lox and bagel forward. The caviar elevating even further and Chive Mascarpone adding a subtle sweetness and fresh bite.  And last but not least, the new Beef Wellington for Two, a generous portion, arguably enough for Four, with a fair spread of other enjoyables. Delicate beef wrapped in Prosciutto, cooked in a flaky puff pastry and stuffed with Mushroom Duxelles and soaked in Foie Gras-Madeira Veloute. Mouthwatering!  If you have not been to Bardot yet, you're missing out ;)

0xtr8MpVGfpjMqROghZj4Q.text: Elegant yet approachable. We went here for a nice birthday dinner and some of us had never had escargot before. Our waiter was amazing, his explanations of the food were relatable, and his recommendations were on point. The food was delicious and I would highly recommend.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot

mjWOB2pX_n5Uc58Xn65tAA.text: I'd previously dined at Bardot Brasserie back in March on my last trip to Las Vegas and was unimpressed.  Not one to be deterred, the wife and I went there to see if happy hour on a Monday evening was a better experience.  While we didn't take advantage of the happy hour drink specials (I had a regular priced cocktail, a Vieux Carre instead), we did partake in the food off of the HH menu.  We shared orders of the Prime Steak Tartare and the Braised Short Rib Tartine.  I'll admit without any shame that I'm a cocktail snob.  My drink possessed all of the expected notes of the classic Vieux Carre, however, it didn't seem properly chilled.  Since it didn't taste over-diluted, I can only guess that either my drink wasn't sufficiently stirred or it was served in warm rocks glass.   Either way, it wasn't as cold and as good as it should've been.  Our food was, similarly, hit or miss.  The steak tartare was served on thin, waffle-cut, potato chips.  It was tender, meaty, and flavorful.  It was a hit with us.  The Braised Short Rib Tartine was an unfortunate miss.  The braised short rib on the tartine was rich in flavor, moist and tender.  It was made even richer with the fried egg that also came atop the tartine.  The downfall of the dish was the bread itself, which was overbaked, required sawing through it with a knife to cut it into halves for sharing, tough, and very chewy.  Don't get me wrong, it tasted fine and it wasn't worth the time and hassle of sending it back.  Still, for whatever reasons, in my experience, Bardot Brasserie continues to be the outlier in an otherwise excellent group of Michael Mina restaurants in Las Vegas.

BLByB0ZEj7jyIS82IdjKUA.text: On the way to Zion National Park for our 10th anniversary, my husband and I thought it'd be fun to stay a night at the Aria just to break up the drive from Peoria where we live. We always stay at the Aria, and I've seen so many photos and reviews that I was inspired to try this place for dinner. I'll admit, it was an odd night for a celebration, a Wednesday night at around just after 9pm, when it's close to closing I'm assuming. The restaurant was fairly open, except for a few people grabbing drinks at the bar, and maybe two other couples and one small group. There was no hostess originally at the entrance, so we awkwardly looked around. The friendly bartender assured us someone would soon be with us, and eventually after maybe 10 minutes, we were rescued and finally guided to a table.  Our waitress was super nice. She grabbed my cocktail order, Le Peche Mode. Cute name, so the cocktail just had to be good... It had Hennessy, peach cream, lemon, ginger and mint. I'm not the biggest fan of mint, but luckily it was subtle. I enjoyed it much more than the Lime in Da Abricot, which also had cognac, apricot puree, and mint. While waiting for my cocktail to make its presence, we were given a French bread baguette in a paper bag lightly toasted and served with non melted butter. It wasn't pre sliced so we made a hell of a mess breaking it apart and sharing it. Our bad...   The Escargots Bardot consisted of wild burgundy snails wrapped in puff pastries, and they were toasted with hazelnuts sprinkled on top and delicately bathed in chartreuse-garlic butter. The pastry was very light and perfect. We really loved this appetizer.   The Steak Tartare had freshly ground prime filet with egg yolk served with gaufrette potato chips. This was my husband's choice, because he is a sucker for most tartares, and this one did not disappoint. The salty chips fit well with the raw filet meat.   Since I'm a huge fan of Branzino type fish, it was a no brained for me to try the Loup de Mer Au Fenouil. It had roasted Mediterranean Sea bass, caramel iced lemon, fennel, and fingerling potatoes. It looked exactly like the photo in our hotel room advertisement for Bardot. It was also perfectly done not only in aesthetics but in taste.   My husband ordered the double cut pork chop. It was oak smoked pork with bacon lardons, root veggies, horseradish potato puree and grain mustard bearer bland. Funny enough, this was also featured on the advertisement for Bardot in our hotel room, but I swear, we ordered these 2 entrees without even seeing the advertisement. I just recognized the 2 entrees' photo when we returned to the room!   The food is absolutely close to phenomenal especially as far as how the escargot and the Loup de Mer. Our waitress was really good and friendly especially for working late on a Wednesday night, a slower night. I think what got to me was the long waits we encountered. We waited a while to sit down and there seemed like too much time between dishes. If it had been a weekend, then I'd totally understand, but it really didn't seem like that were that many people there. There was a photographer there too with an assistant, nabbing memorable photos of the night. It was just slightly on the pushy side with posing our photos for us, and then they returned at the end of dinner to present us with prints of our photos. It was around $100 or so to get the prints and that's only a select few of the prints. She was right... it was our 10th anniversary so we were suckered into getting some.. It was still awkward though.   If we return, it'd just be to grab a cocktail and maybe some of the escargot pastries again.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ordered these exact menu items (the pork loin and &amp; loup de Mer) coincidentally not knowing these were advertised in our hotel room
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apricot cognac cocktail
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loup de Mer

6MGlz8OIXrRxDBfXk5UC_w.text: My family and I had been dying to try brunch at Bardot Brasserie, we had heard so many great things and decided to take grandma for her 73rd birthday. Unfortunately I write this review with a heavy heart. I am True believer in great customer service and that the customer service can make or break the experience. Unfortunately it broke the experience for this occasion. Our waiter never asked if it was our first time at Bardot so when we sat down and looked at the menu for the drink section we were lost. Our waiter did not inform us that there was no drink menu, so I had to flag another waiter down to ask and be informed by another about this. After ordering drinks, my mom had to wait 20mins just for coffee while everyone already had their drinks. Yikes. Our waiter rarely checked on us or asked if we needed anything else. Another yikes. Once we were ready to order our food, we had to wait til we found him to flag him down to get his attention. Now don't get me wrong, I understand that brunch is a very popular time to dine, hence Sunday funday, but if a restaurant is 4 stars, should this be happening? Now when it comes to the food, I would give it a solid B+. My mom and I both ordered the steak and eggs and we both wanted our steaks done medium rare, none of this cooked well done. Yuck. Well, one steak came out perfectly pink, the other not so much. As she cut deeper and deeper into her fillet, it got less and less pink. As she got to the end, it was cooked well done. I write this review with a heavy heart because like I said we had been looking forward to dining here, but if we paid $220 for a 4 person brunch at a 4 star restaurant, wouldn't you be a little heart broken too?

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Omelette

K9wYT3sC_cEO0tlMdJcAWw.text: I may have jinxed this because I went there for lunch on Monday before they closed. (I was craving their burger) and I will never go there any other time that isn't Sunday brunch. I was so disappointed by the service. Complete opposite from the Sunday brunch crew at the bar. We walked in and sat at the bar where we always sit. The bar tender asked what drinks we wanted and we told him we were not there for drinks and ordered a burger. He caught the worse attitude and decided to card us (no problem) I had left my bigger heavier bag in the car and only took my smaller bag with me and I left my DL in the bag in the car. I told him I didn't have it with me and he told us we couldn't sit at the bar even though we weren't drinking and I've sat there all the other 4 times I've been there. We sat at a table where our waiter also had a crappy attitude took the order and we never saw or heard from him again even though there were only 2 other busy tables. It was the busboy who was kind enough to bring water, bread, butter, oil n vinegar more bread and asked how everything was. Needless to say when the check came I payed my bill and gave the busboy a tip instead of the waiter. Like I said the food is amazing here and I definitely plan to be back but I will make sure it's only on Sunday brunch. I don't mind paying $25 for a good burger but I don't remember asking for a side of attitude with it.

qBAdJT6dxJHcMBH95CZwTA.text: Bardot is a gorgeous restaurant...the space is beautifully done and makes you feel like you're in a 1920's movie!  The staff is attentive and our waiter even spoke with a french accent (it was good enough that I couldn't tell if it was real or fake!)  We started off with a couple of specialty cocktails - I can't for the life of me remember their names but I think one was called a Great Woman or something along those lines.  It was a pink egg white drink and on top of the egg one they had a B on it in pink...nice touch for sure!    We started with the escargot and seared foie gras.  Both were really rich dishes for sure!  The seared foie gras was perfectly cooked on a bed of rice and red cabbage.  As it was so rich I actually ate a little baguette with it to cut the flavor a bit.  The escargot wrapped in puff pastry was good but the garlic over powered it a bit.    For entrees we shared the french onion soup and parisian gnocchi.  We are suckers for amazing french onion soup and this one didn't disappoint.  They have add ons like an egg or short rib but I think it is delicious on its own.  The last dish we had was the Parisian Gnocchi...and wow was that amazing.  The morels, truffles and spring vegetables were perfect among the pillowly gnocchi. We were so full that we didn't finish either dish but they were both fantastic.    I'd definitely come back for another dinner...we were too full for dessert so I'll have to wait until next time.

Pcm3m7uKEviT4AljNL7TOw.text: Why is it so F-ing hard to pick place to eat in Las Vegas? It's like somebody smashed all of the world's restaurants into a Disneyland circus of drink-from-the-fire hose dining.    So Is BARDOT good? Yes it's fantastic. Why is it good? (Cuz maybe you don't like my idea of good)  Because it's French classics served to absolute perfection. Brilliant French baguette, butter from France, foie gras, duck l'orange, croque madame, escargot, fantastic French wine list and all of your familiar friends from the Champs Elysees.     If you're coming here I hope you like French food. If so, you're in luck. The demanding preparation of French staples is done to perfection. (Not easy, and if you're not a picky foody you might not notice that the temperature of every dish was perfectly hot, the skin on the chicken was exactingly crispy, the sear on the duck left the inside warm but tender, the baguette was fresh that day, that everything was seasoned impeccably and on and on.    Is it pricey? It ain't cheap. You're in a big Vegas hotel, no surprises here. You're getting what you pay for.   Service? Perfect. The GM made a point to greet us, the waitress was astute and attentive, able to answer any question and accommodate any food allergy. (I'm allergic to potatoes, True story)   It's a great place if this is what you're looking for. You could easily complain that there were no creative and surprising small plates or gold leaf on an iberico ham taco bite (Jaleo is in Cosmo). You could complain that there's no nachos or lots of fried comfort food and yes, you can eat cheaper at Guy Fierry's burger hole. You'll love this place if your a bit of a foody Francophile.  If you're looking for the $5 Fried Cupcake and Bacon Burger Sunday there's a buffet at the Stratosphere I think you'd enjoy more.

OKs75eM3kMv6sjufcl6aZg.text: Me and my friend both left work and were hungry. I picked the hotel and we kinda wandered around until we found here. I was greeted by a polite host and we wanted to sit at the bar because we prefer there. They said open seating at the bar and we went in and nothing was open. We walked back and was quickly sat by the manager. The server Jesus was a pleasure. He was respectful and had a great personality.   I had an incident where I cut my arm and sleeve on the sharp edge of the table. I told the host just as a precaution so it didn't happen to anyone else. I wasn't upset except that my sleeve ripped. The manager came over and was very empathetic and took care of the situation. He introduced himself but I forgot his name but he was a big help. They bought me and my friend dessert and coffee.  Best part about this meal was the food. I had the blood orange duck wings. I totally would pay more if they were bottomless :) my friend enjoy his perfectly cooked steak: the French fries were even great. Great job kitchen!  Def would come back here another time. Being a local I hope to be welcomed back :)

5ak-poThcIWQbU4DPICJ-Q.text: The food was amazing but the real winner was our server Oscar! We have never been treated so well by someone at a restaurant. Every part of our experience was tailored to perfection by Oscar. He went above and beyond and made it a meal we will never forget! Thank you Oscar!

4vSpJ6_J2aHAJ6kgAwdWFA.text: Bardot has been a favorite of mine for many years now.  Ever since my first experience in 2015, I kept returning every time I visited Las Vegas.  It's located in the Aria Casino, upstairs by the Buffet and it is great for both Brunch and Dinner.    My first experience was dinner and they have one of the best Beef Bourguignon I have ever had.  It is a bit salty, probably from all the reduction it goes through, but pair it with their bread which is served warm with soft creamy butter.  If you don't get the bread after you order, politely ask your waiter for warm bread and butter, trust me, you do not want to miss out on the bread and butter.   I tried their brunch the other day and I was so impressed and I just wish I could eat here everyday to try everything on their menu....one day. haha.    Dinner Recommendations:  - ESCARGOTS BARDOT - ONION SOUP GRATINEE - if you decide to get the soup....MUST MUST MUST add perigord truffle, braised oxtail & soft poached egg.  Best "appetizer" dish but more like an entree with all the additions.  I get so full off of this so best to share with someone.   - HERITAGE CHICKEN ROTI - Very tender chicken and flavorful.   - BLACK TRUFFLE FRENCH FRIES - Truffle and fries...do I need to say more?  - MACARONI & MIMOLETTE GRATINEE - More for the presentation, delicious but standard.  - Beef Bourguignon - The best on their menu IMO.  As for extra bread when you order this!   Dessert - CHOCOLATE MACARON - Their signature dessert, super chocolaty for those chocoholics and definitely will satisfy your chocolate cravings.  Large so will need to share.    Brunch - NUTELLA STICKY BUN - Delicious, warm and comes in a metal pot.  Wish there was more nutella on top.  - HUNTER'S WAFFLE - HOLY MOLY!  DELICIOUS!  Duck confit on top of a waffle topped with a poached egg and yummy sauce.  If you like duck, you will enjoy this dish.   - CROISSANT BENEDICTS with MAINE LOBSTER - Fresh lobster, delicious, and a perfect combo to share with your friend who ordered the Hunter's Waffle.   - TRUFFLE FRIES, GARLI AIOLI   Service: 5/5..  Great and attentive.  Knowledgable waiters with great recommendations.  Hostess sat us quickly.   Ambience: 5/5 - Clean and 1800-1900 Parisian style interior.    Parking: 3/5 - you have to pay for parking now at the Aria which sucks, but if you gamble and have the M Resort card, I think parking is complimentary.  Other than that, first hour is free, next hour is $7.  =(    Michael Mina, I am impressed and I cannot wait to try your other restaurants cause I know I will be getting a quality meal with great service.

Sy-jKXK4zlvuRa-BELkYNQ.text: My wife and hardly go to the Strip, especially for food but we always to find ourselves coming back to Bardot. Not only is the food exquisite but the service is exceptional. Kim S. And Eric H. are both very knowledgeable of the menu and friendly in the highest regard. We came dressed in full costume for Halloween (Ursula and Cruella) and they personalized our dinning experience regardless. Way to show a WOW experience!   Beef Wellington is amazing. Perfect red core and flaky outer shell. Make sure to order this right away because it takes 40 minutes to reach your table. The steak tartare is the main reason we go back. It is a healthy portion for an appetizer. Subtle flavor but the texture is where it is at. This is highly recommended.   'Twas a great Halloween date night!

RlOMpGRqiF7qUKZIMA9nIA.text: Disappointed, as a french woman i expected something i do t know more authentic  from outside the view of their bar is very fancy. staff is pleasant. Passed the bar is the restaurant, very sober and simple. wood table and chairs, no white table cloth that would bring more class (in my opinion) i ordered some cocktail while we look at the menu. we decided for the "assiette de charcuterie" that we shared. i ordered a steak tartare served with some crunchy chips (i expected something more raffine my chips were very hard). i picked the small portion of the tartare, it could come as a main entree. then we ordered the salmon with lentilles and the ribeye cut. dessert we opted for the apple tarte tatin. dinner was ok. i was desappointed because i had higher expectations for some reason.  i prefer Bouchon at the venitian/palazzo or Mon Ami Gabi at Paris hotel where you truly experience a french brasserie spirit and class

9lceit5wAcNTZBedBzhxBw.text: Place is great. I was in a few months ago and came back for the best gourmet hotdog I've ever had but am super bummed they changed the menu.

MalLPWvDeaO5OhPnU_yvMg.text: This was by far the best brunch spot we've ever been to (and we brunch HARD so)... Oscar, our server, was also the best server we've ever had. Detailed everything on the menu and made us want everything. We ended up starting with the bottomless sparkling rose, Foie gras parfait, and roasted beet and goat cheese salad. Both were awesome and lasted through the whole meal. The best butter in the world was good as well. Needless to say anything you order you won't be disappointed!  Make sure you get Oscar as your server! He is hands down great at what he does, totally on the ball, and turns your meal experience into an art. Cheers and bon appetite! You will not regret it. We are going to have to plan another trip to Vegas just for this brunch!

xvcLuo4YxNzl8v-l_nSDRQ.text: BARDOT Brasserie Review - From the moment we first stepped into Michael Mina's BARDOT Brasserie, a cute French bistro tucked into a corner next door to Jean George Steak House on the second-floor Promenade level of the Aria Hotel, we knew we were going to become regulars.  Was it the beautiful bar? Or the French accordionist serenading the guests? The crusty french bread? Actually, I think it was the "Everlasting Champagne" that accompanied an amazing menu.  Who doesn't find themselves three sheets to the wind in Vegas at noon at least once in their lives?  Decor The entire restaurant is fashioned in a classic but modern French bistro setting. Rustic treatments, artwork, and gold splash the walls tastefully and not overbearingly so. The bar itself is such a showpiece I had to include a picture of it to show the grandeur of the bar. The seating was surprisingly comfortable and after half a dozen visits over the past year, we haven't felt any seat/table was 'bad'.  Food After several visits to Bardot, and having had many of the menu items, we have yet to find a dish we didn't like, much less love.  Something as simple as a Smoked Salmon Plate is executed so well, that it sets a whole new standard. Here are some of our favorites, albeit not an all-inclusive list:  Foie Gras Parfait Recently I've discovered a newfound love of Foie Gras, and this parfait was a surprise to me. I usually love a grilled Foie Gras alone or atop a steak. Although Foie Gras parfaits are a classic preparation, I had never really tried, until Bardot. The flavor of the Foie Gras mellowed the sweetness of the port gelee so that spreading atop crusty grilled sliced bread felt so natural.  Smoked Salmon Bardot executes smoked salmon better- just better. Not only are the ingredients fresh and of high quality, but more importantly, the seasoning and flavors are so well balanced that it just tastes better. There's no other way that I can really describe it any better. The smoked salmon plate is loaded with smoked salmon, sliced brioche, chive mascarpone, cherry tomatoes, avocado, and traditional garnishes. Sipping champagne while noshing on these gems make the day so great!  Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad The beet and goat cheese salad has made me love beets again. After I first had this salad, I immediately added beets to my grocery list. I already love goat cheese, but the cana de cabra cheese in this salad was like goat brie or bucheron. The creaminess of the cheese and bite of the beets were all carefully balanced with the wild arugula, hazelnuts, and mild vinaigrette. I've also added hazelnuts to my grocery list to throw on my salads!  There are too many other great dishes that can be had at BARDOT that I haven't listed here. Go and try them - whether it be brunch or dinner, you won't go wrong here.  Service  An additional highlight of Bardot is their consistently high level and quality of service. We have been there on weekdays, weekends, brunch, dinner, holidays, and off days. Every visit has been met with just the right amount of attentiveness while maintaining excellent service.

7iWZXaKCtzycaob9IDRrUA.text: I came Saturday night with my brothers & cousins & we left happy with how the food & atmosphere was... The service on the other hand, awful.. I work in the service industry & I truly have never experienced this level of being ignored while dining out. Once we got our food, our sever never checked up on us to see how everything was. We wanted more wine from the bottle we ordered but we never saw that again even though there was enough left for at least 2 1/2 more glasses when they took it away after pouring it for us. When we finally did see our server she quickly came to our table scooped up the glasses of wine & walked away. At that point we didn't want to stay any longer. So I paid for a bottle of wine I didn't finish, awesome. But I truly wish our server was as attentive to us as she was to literally everyone else around us. Ruined it for me, everything else was 5 stars excellent.

yy1_UZUZuSp08sxxTuaraQ.text: No words can describe how unbelievable this place is. I can barely write this because my mind is in such a euphoric state. It all started when I sipped the extremely fresh squeezed and sweet orange juice. I can't believe I've never tasted orange juice like this before. Then the bread and BUTTER came. I could write a 2 page review just on the butter alone.  What happened next only happens in dreams... The French toast arrived. I've only felt this type of happiness the day my daughter was born :).  The crunchy outside and buttery smooth inside was topped with the creamiest vanilla ice cream and drizzled with heaven sauce which was orgasmic. Two words--- mind blowing!  The double cut bacon almost made me cry it was so good. There isn't another restaurant in Las Vegas you should even consider for brunch. Hands down the best I've ever had.   I almost forgot to mention that the inside is absolutely gorgeous and makes you feel like you're in France

8kUP3SvbYCTz8Z18xI_Ikg.text: Holy butter!  French comfort food is the perfect description for this upscale French bistro from Michael Mina. Be prepared because the food is rich.  So many delicious items on the menu, I couldn't decide what to order... guess I'll have to come back to try the things I missed!  So we ended up with- Apps- Seared Foie Lyonnais - rich beyond belief... foie was perfectly seared... the balance of the dish was perfectly complementary to the foie.  King Crab Crepe- so good... buerre blanc and sunny side egg combined with the crab was a flavor explosion.   Entrees- Lamb Rack Frites- perfectly cooked, well seasoned... the chickpea frites were interesting in a good way. Sole Meuniere- nice and delicate... decent, but the weakest dish of the night. Dessert- Baba au rhum- holy crap this was good... literally a mouthful of butter, cream and rum soaked up by a spongy cake.   Service and setting were spot on.  Food is delicious and decadent. Thumbs up.

pBWTUdQ59cdgEurey33IeA.text: One of the best overall dining experience we've had for a while. Our server was very kind and down to earth. She recommended some great wines and drinks with our food. The salted butter and bread to start was delicious. The shrimp cocktail was amazing, soft, tender and fresh. They gave us hot plates before our food got to the table. The Parisian Gnocchi was divine and the Mac and Cheese was unlike anything on this planet. The way it was prepared was definitely worth taking a quick instagram. To finish we had the Chocolate Macaron which are the best and biggest I've ever had. The place does't skimp on attention to detail with the French glassware, the interior design, the graphic identity, the kitchen, and even the restrooms had character. This is a place worth your time...and money of course.

Zpqah2hUXaR_sr3f00nIkA.text: We had a wonderful meal with attentive service. They give you a taste of wine before they pour you a glass, which is typical, but what is not typical is the friendly attitude encouraging you to try another wine if you're not 100% satisfied with your first choice. The breads were great, the seafood tower was amazing, and the dessert options (we got an array) were all impeccable. I love the design of the place and the fact that it's not too loud.

fyNWFRYrjhVkSQcal1oCsQ.text: What's not to like about Bardot? It's reminiscent of any bistro in Paris - right down to the actual menu items. Service was impeccable and you can never go wrong with the classics.   I had the escargot appetizer. Each piece was like a little pillow of savory flavor.  We had some other shared appetizers at the table but my memory is failing me what they were.   For my entree I chose the mussels. Delicious, if not a little gritty. A friend had the salmon with lentils and this was amazing. So much flavor from two items typically lacking in any kind of taste. Definitely a stand-out on the menu.   And oh my god the chocolate macaron. It's definitely for sharing. But do it. Seriously. Save room for it or just take it to go. Vegas creates lots of regrets, and not having this macaron for dessert will be high on that list

yPGWc9hmncOVzDjrX03vgg.text: Food *** Price ** Service *****  Came here on Sunday.  There was no wait.  Nice ambience.  Great service.  Bread was nice and warm.  King crab crepe was awesome!  However, the flat iron steak was a huge disappointment.  Very chewy.  I also got a coke, which was kind of flat.  So I was not happy paying $5 for a flat soda with no refills.  To me this restaurant is 2.5 stars.  I bumped it up to 3 because of their great service and awesome crepe.

WxbjkDmI4pbbiK946-Sqgg.text: BEST. FRENCH. TOAST. EVER. Came to Bardot on New Year's Day in definite need of some carbohydrates after NYE on the strip. Our waiter was extremely kind and charismatic, despite the rather long wait for items. Restaurant is beautiful, with perhaps one of the most beautiful bars on the strip. Everyone enjoyed their food tremendously. For those who enjoy bread and butter, definitely recommend the beurre dechire. SO tasty. The eggs Benedict, burger, croque madame and hunter's waffle were all extremely tasty. The real star of the show however was their french toast. My husband will usually never eat french toast, waffles or pancakes without extra syrup. The almond/orange syrup offered with the meal made him forget what table syrup was! Only regret we had was not having big enough stomachs to also order the Nutella sticky bun. Next time!!!

iOJdDTB6pMFqvenCKofL3A.text: Came for brunch, ordered frisee salad and the quiche. Both were very good, they also offer $20 bottomless rose which we didn't get but seemed like a good deal. Place is cute on the inside and for Vegas  decently reasonable. I would go back.

bwpqjQG5JiUQB65MnHKF5Q.text: great brunch! the food was flavorful, beautiful, and unique! we ordered the yogurt parfait with fruit and buckwheat beignets ( parfait was like an ice cream, fruit was fresh, and beignets were like a buckwheat doughnut hole), french omelet with truffles, and the chicken french dip sandwich with amazing mushroom stuffing. each dish was special. and to top it off, the service was excellent! best meal i've had in vegas.

1V_jCY31YVVDPG8ZcdW31w.text: Best brunch/breakfast I have had in Vegas. Service was great and the food was everything I expected it to be. Don't skip the basket of pastries to start your meal.

IUdqN9ucg7if7ngbSWPbVQ.text: Wow! One of the best meals and experience I have had in Vegas. First, I loved the decor inside and the staff was awesome.  Next, the cocktails we got were tremendous... Seems some bars around Vegas have a hard time making good whiskey drinks. They are perfect here.  Our Escargot was good, not the best I have had but still good. The Pork Chop I got was delicious and cooked to perfection. Even the salad my wife got was above and beyond.  I ended the meal with just a simple French press coffee which was much better than I expected.  I will come back!

Ko_ISNywKBPI5zf7YlAftA.text: Very good. Foods great. Service is great. Foie gras is amazing. Lobster thermadore. Bone marrow. Duck wings.

s3PPS8Bg6dEIzCqdfyTrQA.text: ENVIRONMENT Beautiful modern take on traditional French architecture with some Art Deco influencers. The bar is amazing with gorgeous brass suspended shelves.  APPS Bone Marrow - Excellent! Marinated very well and just the perfect serving.  Escargot - Tasty little morsels served in a puff pastry. A good gateway for anyone trying escargot for the first time.  French Onion Soup - Very well done. The croutons have a unique flavor that changes up the traditional dish.  ENTREE  Filet Mignon - Ordered rare and it was cooked perfectly. The piece of meat was exceptional and tender.  Maine Lobster Thermidor - Delicious and creamy dish with hints of dill.    Seabass - Great quality fish that is lightly seasoned with oil and lemon. This is my go to when I don't wan something heavy and rich.   SIDES Green Beans - garnished with almonds. This is my favorite preparation of green beans. It's salty lemon goodness.

CznL64g6DWr6s4sDR33PGA.text: This is a relatively new restaurant in Aria. The setting is romantic and quiet. Service is excellent.  I ordered the warm beet and goat cheese salad, foie gras parfait and 1/2 dozen oysters. The foie gras with the port gelee is to die for, super creamy and tasty,  The oyster is pretty small and don't think it is any special.  The warm beet salad is excellent.  I highly recommend this place for brunch!!

sLgd2KkXyAPP7Q0IWFcAvA.text: We've all seen the reviews saying service sucks, or is slow, or "fill in your adjective here." Let me say to those morons this is not In n Out burger where you can order your foie gras 'animal style.'  This is a for real, down to earth, as God is my witness, 5 Star Restaurant.  We had dinner there on a Thursday night. The Executive Chef was cooking. How can you be sure the Executive Chef is there? Ask. Simple enough.  We told our server, John Paul, we were in no hurry, and he got it. The first thing he asked was would we like a cocktail THEN he gave us menus. Nice. He got it. No hurry.  If you, dear reader, are in more of a hurry, tell your server. These guys and gals are pros. They get it IF you tell them. Most people willing to drop a couple hundred on dinner would rather savior the moment. Better yet, if you're in a rush, go to the crappy buffet and complain about that.  The two of us took 3 hours and spent almost $300. We're not rich, but enjoy a good meal. Yes, that included several drinks and dessert with no comps.  Ask yourself how many times you've walked out of a mediocre restaurant after spending a hundred or more completely disappointed? THIS is worth it.  What we ate   Charcuterie Board. A huge app good for three or more. We pigged out with the two of us. In house salami, Pate' and an amazing rillette. It came with grilled French bread, cornichon pickles and a house made Dijon. Fabulous.  After that we moved onto a wonderful red wine suggested by our somalier. Again. We asked. I told her I didn't want to spend $50 on a glass of wine. She suggested this gem at 12 bucks a glass. A bargain to any wine drinker. (Sorry, I don't  recall what it was) After we ate that our server return for what we wanted to order next. Get it? Take your time. They're cool with that.  We had the frisee aux lardon. Bacon, lettuce, and a delicious vinegrette. Light, tasty, wonderful.  Main course was bouillabaisse for me and a French sea bass for me better half. The fennel on hers was out of this world. My soup was extraordinary worthy of any reward.  Our server talked us into trying the chocolate macaroon for dessert. Again, superb.  Ya, this is too wordy, and any editor would chop it up, but I'm hoping you got the point.  To summerize, just slow down, and enjoy an amazing meal.

FePVLD_hJPyYpqjwBXMugA.text: This restaurant has been the highlight of our dining experiences in Vegas.   From the moment we set foot in the door, we were treated to candlelit lighting and a venture into classic Parisian style. The grandiose bar upon entry was simply stunning and I almost requested a perch just to admire it.   We were lead to a booth seat which allowed for a view of the kitchen, and granted we enjoyed a late-night (after 10pm) meal, we noticed every member of the staff carried themselves as if it was the dinner rush, with the same hustle and care you might expect.   Our server Kim, or LIl' Kim as she was labeled by her colleagues treated us with utmost respect, care and offered genuine suggestions to assist in our meal. Cocktails were super yummy and the pace at which the food arrived was seamless.   In fact, the second round of cocktails my partner ordered was not as good as the first and our server happily exchanged it without billing us for the switch.   We ordered the chickpea frites, the Chiteaux cheese, the Tarte Flambee and the Croque Madame. The first two options came on wooden and marble slabs, respectively and the portions were perfect for an amuse buche, In all honesty, I was feeling rather full after the appetizers. Our mains were scrumptious and clearly made to please. Savoury and well-orchestrated was the norm for the food we enjoyed here.   The ambience is lends itself to being both modern & romantic. From the presentation to the portion size to the flavour Bardot's food went over and above our expectations. Their Chef is a wizard and we were delighted with every bite.   If you are staying in Vegas and wish to blow your date away, take them here. Unpretentious service and reasonably-priced, decadent food - you simply cannot go wrong. Thank-you for a treat of an evening Bardot Brasserie -- we will most definitely be back!

jKRfdJLz7FCQPmYeikd66g.text: We first found out about Bardot Brasserie through Jeannie and a former college dorm mate of mine.  Jeannie had been snatched up from Aria's Five50 to run the Brasserie.  We went the first time on the second day the Brasserie was open.  The interior truly looks like a period Parisian brasserie, from the wood used inside to the wait staff's uniforms.  We started with the oysters on the half shell (to be honest we try to always start with oysters on the half shell), and then split the crown rack of lamb.  We paired each course with a different glass of wine - the by the glass menu is extensive, and reasonably priced.  We came back a few months later, and our second visit confirmed Bardot as our absolute favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  The wait staff was beautifully attentive without hovering.  The poured wine portions were generous.  The food was magnificent yet again.  Everything was timed to perfection. Right  as we completed our cocktails, the oysters were brought out to the table, and our empty glasses were replaced with a beautifully flinty chablis.  We had a nice amount of time to eat the oysters, and talk and engage our neighbors at the next table (their daughter was adorable).  Our main course arrived shortly after the oyster remains were whisked away, accompanied by another, different glass of wine.  Again, everything perfectly cooked and absolutely scrumptious.  Jeannie graced us with her presence, and I think we really gushed with how much we enjoyed her restaurant, and how impressively she runs her kitchen.  At the end of dinner, Jeannie sent out her signature dessert - an apple tart.  Oh. My. God.  It was completely fantastic.  We will continue to return on each visit to Vegas.  There really is no better place to eat on the strip.
