Eqsm5RXGEvtPDEdhRUzKhQ.text: Awful don't waist your hard earned dollars on rude bad service!  And then they won't admit it snd give you something else to eat.  Left Hungry. Ugh over rated!!  Read other reviews they are not goodies I'm French and it's more show than substance!! If you think this is a 5 you don't know much about food !!!!

en3deRutK8FO6vUdYGwGFw.text: Had drinks and snacks at the bar. At first the bar tender was pretty cold but he lightened up a little later. The setting was cozy and the food and drinks were good, but not memorable enough to go into detail

ydDirfihIp73izZO8bt4iw.text: Went there for Sunday brunch our last day in Vegas.  Even without reservations we were seated in under 30 minutes.  Our server was great and brought out bread and butter promptly.  It would have been better if the baguette was warm.  Had the bloody mary which was a featured drink, nothing special about it.  We started with the escargots.  Honestly, was a bit disappointed as the order only had 4 escargots and previous pictures on Yelp showed 6.  They were tasty but very small.  For our main course we ordered, the croque madame, nutella sticky bun, and French toast.  The egg on the croque madame was perfect, runny and warm.  The French toast is huge.  It's definitely a dish that can be shared.  Really liked how they were able to keep the inside soft and custardy and the contrast of the almond brittle and vanilla mascarpone was perfect.  My favorite dish was the nutella sticky bun.  A little pricey for one sticky bun but well worth the calories and very memorable.  We'll definitely be back.

h9MdsgGypBwk8gFqrb8NrQ.text: Truly delicious breakfast. Great service. Any place that gives you sliced bread and a jar of Foie Gras and calls it breakfast is tops on my list.

OHx0wH2kVGGc6lqXciOq_A.text: What a great new place!!! The restaurant is just gorgeous, I felt like I really was in France!!! Service was outstanding, very attentive and detail-oriented. Food - pure heaven! The escargot are served in puff pastries and its just sooooo delicious, my salmon was also just cooked to perfection. This is my new favorite French restaurant and we will definitely be back!!!

FOZeq7gOjukoKsD5P5jgjg.text: I Celebrated my birthday at this French restaurant which was amazing.  You walk in and it feels like you are in Paris. The atmosphere is awesome and the food was fabulous. I highly recommend to start with the Bardot Royale, a seafood tower with crab, lobster, clams, shrimp and oysters.  We then orderd the Duroc Pork Chops and Filet, which was perfectly cooked.  Thank you again to Nicholas our server and to Chef Michael Mina for the unforgettable dinner.  We will be back.

IVWa0w11yIexvhh1qzQlgA.text: I have been here a few times since the restaurant opened for both dinner and at the bar. I am just in love with everything from the ambiance to the food! The room is absolutely stunning and it makes me feel like i'm in Paris again. I would recommend the Foie Gras Parfait and Duck L'Orange for the appetizers and of course the French Onion soup which is amazing. For the main course the chicken is great as well as the croque madame - which is a classic! I am also looking forward to trying the Brunch on weekends soon.

cAFvtkEjlDz-EohFqLYYpg.text: I've eaten here twice. First of all the room is gorgeous. Music is a bit odd and doesn't particularly fit the ambiance, but that can easily be over looked once the food arrives. Had the pleasure of trying most of the menu. All of which was amazing. Strongly recommend their steak tartar that is ground to order. It's clear someone has put a lot of love into these classics. You can get lost in their beverage program. 60+ beers, crazy cognac selection, and an amazing bar. Too much to list, staff was amazing, food is good. Definitely a must try!!

RCVXxX86PSRlBd1B-j4Z6w.text: Beautiful restaurant and bar, attentive service, classic menu, great wine selection. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Jrg5MFXSK4K9jSniljDDrw.text: This place is very good. Had tartare and bine marrow to start which were both good. The baguette is as good as i remember in Paris and the butter is outstanding.  I had the branzino which was cooked perfectly and perfectly seasoned.  Would definitely come back. Dessert was ok. Chocolate macaron.

nWYIM24FeaYE7AmXJxisFA.text: The restaurant is a little difficult to get to but worth the find. Beautiful interior definitely more of a dinner ambience.  Surprised that they had their own house brewed beer and great cocktails.  We enjoyed an assortment of classic french appetizers including bone marrow,  foie parfait, and a deluxe french onion soup with oxtail egg and truffle in it.  Really hit the spot before watching zarkana. Really wanna try the loup d'mer and the new Paris breast.

7gJ7pdfMx4lGa_4OAvDZ3Q.text: I went here on the recommendation of one of my coworkers.  Me and the man friend weren't celebrating anything just a date and a night out.  I really like french food and nicer restaurants, but he hasn't been to a lot of them. The atmosphere and the look of the restaurant is very cook, brassy and mirrors and glass everywhere its very cute and I really enjoyed it.  We made reservations for 7:30 and arrived a little early, they were able to seat us right away.  We were led by whom I believe to be the maitre d' or perhaps one of the managers, to a table for four people, even though we were only 2, that also had a card on the table.  Once I sat down I realized that the name on the card was not mine nor my man friends.   I asked the gentleman who had sat us if he needed this, to which he replied and stated to my man friend, "you're not victor?", my man friend stated no, and I made a joke about him seating us at the wrong table, (I work in the hospitality industry, and have worked in restaurants before, so I understand that things happen), the gentleman's response was a half laugh and to ask again if he was not Victor.  Still not Victor. The entire encounter was a bit strange but again I understand. The waiter then came over to take our drink orders, and bring us some menus as we had not been given them when sat.  I asked for a recommendation on a wine that was similar to a Merlot, and the man friend got an old fashioned. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and asked if we had any questions or anything. We got escargot for a starter which I love and the man friend isn't normally a fan of, but he really liked them as did I. They were cooked perfectly, seasoned very well, and the crescent crust they are surrounded in was amazing.  I have eaten at bouchon and they do something similar there, but this is amazing as well, very impressed for just having opened up.   I got the gnocchi for my main dish and he got the chicken, we got the macaroni to share for a side.   The waiter complimented our choices and stated that we would indeed enjoy them. He was a very great guy, shame that I never did get his name, he did not tell us, and wasn't wearing a name tag to my  knowledge.   The mean was amazing, every thing tasted amazing, the chicken was cooked perfectly, my gnocchi was amazing and the macaroni was to die for.  We then decided to have some desert which was amazing, we got the chocolate macaron, and I am a fan of macarons so that was already a plus.  Its an over sized chocolate macaron, with salted caramel and a chocolate ganoch over the top of it. Melted in my mouth, was so very rich and decadent.   I also got an after dinner drink that the waiter recommended and stated would taste sort of like a chocolate shake, he was indeed right. Delicious!   Our overall experience was amazing! I will certainly be coming back again and recommend it to my friends and those who come into the hotel I work for. They have a few bumps that need to be worked out, but I am confident that they will have a wonderful go of it in Las Vegas and a very successful restaurant and bar.

N4aOvh81_iBEjtD-WZQ5AQ.text: Definitely worth the visit -- Pork chop entree was absolutely amazing; tender, flavorful and the best I've ever had. The bone marrow appetizer was tasty and flavorful. Dessert was OK; the Mille Feille was so-so, however the Chocolate Macaron is chocolate lovers delight and good enough to share. French wines in particular the Sancerre white was crisp, fresh, fruity and had a clean finish. Was recently told they do weekend brunches and ask for Shannon to be your server, she is a gem and provided outstanding service.

VLv9ogiRGzfVMwJqiDz8Hg.text: Great burger. Happy hour snacks were cheap and delicious. The bone marrow for five dollars was excellent. A few drink specials during happy hour.  The restaurant was pretty empty however they had only been open 10 days.  The service was very good and actually better than expected considering they had just opened.

7pdobcsBxI_7SGqq8XEnuw.text: Really enjoyed Bardot for lunch. Love that whipped softened butter that they serve with the crispy baguette. I ordered their escargot, which was very delicious as well. Secondly I ordereed the lobster Benedict. It was well prepared but not my favorite. I just think the lobster flavor overpowered everything in it. Still I would return to try more on the menu. I liked the service and ambiance and the food showed a lot of promise.

-76kt1cJlnjr-0UT5E5pTQ.text: HANDS DOWN THE BEST FRENCH TOAST I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!  It is pillowy soft heaven on a plate.  Apparently, they soak the massively thick cut brioche in their custard mixture overnight to get it so moist and delicious!  It is so creamy yet light in texture and not too sweet.  You may not even need to spread that dollop of vanilla mascarpone but it is loaded with vanilla bean--yum!  It certainly adds more decadent richness to the dish.  The French toast is set off quite nicely with crunchy almond brittle.  It is also paired with an orgeat (almond) syrup, which just adds another flavor layer to the party...but honestly, the French toast on its own is superb!  This is definitely a must have if dining here for brunch.  I also added the double cut bacon (pork belly fans will love this) and poached eggs which were cooked perfectly.  It turned out to be a lot of food so next time I'll just have the French toast with the bacon!  Service and ambiance were great as well.  Can't wait to try Bardot for dinner next time we're in Vegas.

_vZ2txfS0x_f1_VKjvaJzg.text: Saturday brunch- My husband thought this was the best steak burger and French fries he'd ever had. He also had the Nutella sticky bun, which he really liked. The gluten-free buckwheat beignets were a lot like dry hush puppies with a little table sugar on the outside. Wouldn't order it again.

zeeLCEUFb-L3bYychn9wHw.text: What a perfect place to start a Vegas weekend. Great atmosphere, superb service, top notch drinks and really good food - and the prices were good considering the excellent food. Definitely recommended to anyone staying in or around the ARIA.

ipy_vkuMiXfDPAGYH0JO1Q.text: Amazing food and service. In Vegas for a work conference and stumbled upon this gem while looking for a nice dinner destination.  Happened to arrive when it was time for happy hour and thoroughly enjoyed the drinks and the menu (very reasonably priced I spent less than $40 for a meal and two drinks). The Service was excellent the bartenders were extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the menu selections!

16p2Cw1HYd50MSHLv2Tqkw.text: Great service and restaurant, fairly priced! Amazing oysters and foie gras. Steak and cod also awesome. We were so stuffed that we didn't even have room for dessert, we had the cod, the oysters, foie gras, tuna Nicoise salad was also amazing. This place was all around great, just missing a bit of ambience.

w66vWgQY2uRQFQFTAsDpYw.text: Great ambiance and nice menu selection. I enjoyed their escargot and bone marrow appetizers. You also Clcan't go wrong with their steak frites or gnocchi. Save room for the giant macaron dessert!! Our server was amazing! I think his name was Nelson.

HoykCT_b5aVsbLjLYoS0sQ.text: Very good salad! Just giving it 4 stars because the onion soup of my husband was cold. But the place is beautiful and the servers very cordial.

K_alR8asH276iZjuLl0saQ.text: Excellent service. Great food. Great place to hang out.  Right off the bat, they serve you bread (baguette) and butter. For some reason, it was the best tasting butter I ever had.  French toast: super massive. Couldn't finish it. Highly addicting. Great texture. Crisp outside, soft middle. Mascarpone highly necessary and really does taste like vanilla bean. Seemed like the syrup had some almond undertones as well.  Croque madame: this wasn't the croque madame that resembled the one I ate in Paris, but still good. It involves a lot of bread and sauce. The salad came in whole leaves, so you have to cut it yourself or eat it like a rabbit would. The salad dressing was delicious.  Side of double cut bacon: I think it came in 4 pieces. You must eat it right away while it's still hot. Once it gets cold, it's harder to cut into. Very smoky and very salty. Good.  Side of hash browns: It's not your normal hashbrowns. They come in rectangles with an added nuance of herbs mixed into the potatoes. Super crispy outside. Soft in the inside. For some reason, this was only thing that I felt like we didn't have to order. It was okay. I eventually asked for ketchup to add some flavor to it.  Coffee was really good.

KIdd6newwsHqTup_6phCKA.text: When I hear "Michael Mina" I immediately think of his Bourbon Steak in my home town Miami... I follow him for steaks not anything else, therefore I've had the fish/french dishes and they were ok. I recently gave this restaurant a 2nd try for steak and drinks and I was blown away not only by the quality of the food but the service I received from the best bartender ever Brooke. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great ambiance and amazing dishes.

Fi5NS_bBeVPalEPoqJRMKw.text: This was a great place for dinner. Had a couple great pomegranate martinis along with a great steak dinner. Excellent service nice atmosphere.

hZ2ry08o7DhHOVjO9aL3rw.text: If a menu has seared foie and a foie gras parfait you can't really go wrong. I also tried the mussels which were delicious. The chocolate macaron was a bit much and definitely is better as a shared dessert. If you are a chocolate lover though, it is decadent and there is a lot of it.

l2AEfjoASFHS35D5ueI6TA.text: Excellent food and service!!! 5 STARS!!!!! Phenomenal escargot appetizer, perfectly cooked beef and lamb. Friendly and knowledgeable sommelier and waitress and Chef Smith personally came out to greet us and ask us about our dining experience!  A+++++++

spI7AWaGlASCMtHNfdXRwA.text: This was my 2nd time to Bardot. My husband and I are locals and we rarely like to visit the strip except for special occasions. Just walking into Aria is fun and finding Bardot is like a hidden treasure. Show up early and sip a cocktail at the awesome bar!   We got to sit at a booth and peek into the awesome kitchen. The server was adorable and she explained the menu and even answered my questions. We eat out often and are pretty adventurous and will try mostly anything.   Let's start with warm french bread that is toasty on the exterior and soft on the inside with house butter.... house butter?  oh man that butter could be eaten buy the spoonful! I had to control myself.   My highlights... We had the Steak tartare - it was sooo good and fresh.  Escargot - Beautifully presented wrapped in a fluffy pastry puff.  Duck wings... one word...delicious.   Roasted beet and goat cheese salad-  Whenever I see a beet salad on a menu, I have to order it, I love beet salad. This was perfectly dressed and the goat cheese was to die for.   Ribeye Steak - Worth every frickin' penny. I always get worried that a chef is going to ruin a good steak that I pay good money for... but in this case it was a wast of time to worry... juicy, perfect and soooo much flavor!! Making my mouth water as I type this. The mashed potatoes were my favorite. I love mashed potatoes and I didn't realize how bad mine suck until I tried these.   Mac & Cheese-My husband had the Mac and Cheese. Holy cow!! How do they do this? I really wanted to take a photo, but we made a deal to keep our phones off at dinner.  AND... It tased better than it looked and trust me it looks amazing!! I feel bad for the guy that has to prep that plate! Im sure you can find a photo of it somewhere. It probably has its own Instagram account. If not for any other reason... Go to Bardot and get your MAC& CHEESE on!!! FOR REAL  I was full... but hubby always wants dessert. The Chocolate Macaron was .... Oh so macaron! Melt in your mouth worth every calorie, paired well with the hot and strong coffee.   We have lots of amazing places to eat here in LV, and its always fun to try something new but I won't passing up the chance to  return to Bardot. The server was telling us about brunch. We have family coming to town for the holidays and we are definitely doing the brunch next!!! We cant wait!

-GYjZrbNeUH9Q1a3ftSanw.text: Great experience having brunch here! The ambiance is impeccable, with classy decor, some dude playing accordion, and very attentive waiting staff with French accents.   Food itself was great too. We ordered a pastry basket just to realize they actually also give out free fresh baked baguettes, but the croissants and danishes were so tasty we don't regret having double the amount of carbs than we intended.   For the starter I had a French onion soup, which was somehow both sweeter and saltier than I would have liked. Considering I also find most onion soups in Paris salty perhaps this is just the way it's supposed to be?  For the entree I ordered mussels and frites, which comes with a large bowl of mussels and fries with mayo (and some ketch up... guess you didn't stick to your guns to being European).  One thing to note that perhaps also speaks to their authenticity - the portions are also pretty small. My bowl of mussels was sizable, but the hunter's waffle my friend ordered was tiny (more like two 1/4 waffles with some toppings).

BEIldxkaD4YKVdKZ_eIKkg.text: So decided to come here to have brunch on my last day in Las Vegas and was satisfied with the food and service got pretty lucky came in like 1130am right before two large parties came in at 1215 so got my food and drinks quick the tables next to me were waiting for 20 to 30 minutes for service.This was my second time here and brunch has not disappointed never been here for dinner or lunch maybe next time would check it out my bill came out to a little over 100 but was worth it got bottomless sparkling wine with the Hunters Waffles and the Le Steakburger the meat in this burger was very juice and tasty and the taste on the duck confit was also very good this is a must try dishes and place for brunch nice place and atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Steakburger
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunters waffles

IvT1CocbTbN9VCIcK4_9ZQ.text: Had a pre-fixe menu for brunch and added the bottomless rose. The food was amazing...but I think we ordered too much. My favorite was the Bardot steak and eggs, truffle omelette, charcuterie board and Nutella sticky bun....oh yes and the bottomless Rose!

rUzjVIZ5eqgCThlmj5XTxg.text: When in Vegas, we foie gras.   It's become a bit of a tradition for the boyfriend and I to seek out the buttery, savory delicacy when we're in town and last night was no exception. A Yelp search for foie gras turned up a newcomer since our last trip in Michael Mina's BARDOT. With overwhelmingly high marks we decided to reserve via Open Table.  An after-thought caused Brandon to follow up with a phone call to request a booth and mention that we were celebrating a special occasion (my birthday is in a week).  We arrived and were seated right away at a two-top table centrally located in the dining room, which was most certainly not the more private booth that we'd requested. If you like hearing every word from your neighboring diners this is the place for you! I mean, so loud at times that he had to lean over the table and ask me to repeat myself. If you're expecting a romantic bistro, this isn't it.  Wine drinkers, take heed. Their menu is exorbitantly priced. I generally drink Chardonnay, but their cheapest glass was $17. I opted to order the $38 half bottle of white Bordeaux, knowing I'd likely have two glasses over the course of our meal.  The seared foie gras appetizer over lentils and shallots was stunning. We both agreed that we could have polished off about five more, but at $29 we refrained. Melt-in-your-mouth delicious and a nice portion to share (between two!)  I'd wanted to try their French Onion soup, but ringing in at $17 (I believe), I just couldn't justify the addition.   For our entree, Brandon and I decided to share the Surf and Turf combo of 14oz ribeye and king crab. $88 + $29 for the crab. Expecting a True "surf and turf" I was surprised when our respective plates came out, ribeye divided with crab meat topping each half. A $117 entree and you cut our steak in half and top each one with about 4 ounces of crab meat? Where I come from that's called a steak served Oscar style. Even in Vegas I wouldn't expect that to cost more than $100 and...You. Cut. My. $88. Steak. *sad face*  All said, the steak was seasoned well and cooked as requested and the crab was delicious though scant. The accompanying French fries weren't anything very special, however the garlic aioli served alongside was fantastic and elevated the side.  Service seemed slow but Jesus was pleasant and kept my wine glass filled throughout the meal.  I just expected more for what we ended up paying. And not a mention of our special occassion was made. *sigh*   Bardot, I wanted you to romance me in a classic, swooning French kind-of way.  Instead I left feeling like a tourist who'd been pick pocketed while admiring the Eiffel Tower.   That foie, though...*drool*

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even the cutlery is French

gUJN0uDiHcEgP85SxoeJDA.text: Brunch was amazing. If you can sit in Tish's section, you should DEFINITELY request to do it. She is absolutely fantastic and made the already incredible meal so much better. Her recommendations were spot on (not the "oh it depends on what you want..." type thing, she is ACTUALLY helpful), she was so nice and personable, and she was incredibly attentive to every detail. The food was delicious as well. I got the burger and the fries with garlic aioli, and I could have licked the plate afterward if we weren't in public. The manager, Matej, is also amazing and extremely attentive. If you're on the fence, do yourself a favor and come here. Food, ambiance, service are all top notch.  Thank you for making our brunch (and my husband's 30th birthday meal) so perfect.

vuT0TrogEIy_JwMKjS5wSQ.text: As expected from a fine dining establishment everything was amazing - the Mac and cheese is a must try

Ae3XGKyPaOLKTvJK8WVTZg.text: I've heard good things about Michael Mina and really wanted to try one of his restaurants. We happened to stay near ARIA so BARDOT was close by. I convinced my friends to come for weekend brunch after a wedding rehearsal. We had made reservations but had to add some extra people last minute; the hostess was very accommodating and we got our table in 15min.  They started us with complimentary French bread and vveeerrry smooth butter which was yum.  Shortly after, our food came.  Then the meal turned...average.  I had ordered an appie and an entree - both came at the same time instead of one after the other, which was kind of odd.  So I ended up eating my Fois Gras with the ruby port gelee and country bread alongside my Hunter's Waffle which I was worried would be getting cold while I ate my appie.  Hm... As for the dishes itself, I don't know if I played it too safe with my dish selections as I didn't feel wowed by either dishes.  The Fois Gras was smooth and the ruby port gelee provided a nice jelly texture mixed in, but overall taste was just OK and not memorable.  I've had better, and probably won't get it again if I come back.  The portion was huge though as I needed help finishing this dish!  The Hunter's Waffle was like a duck confit benedict on waffle; it was nice, but I expected better.  Each component tasted good separately but the combination of the parts didn't elevate the dish.  I tried my friend's Beef Bourgignon Croissant Benedict and we both agreed, it was good but also like the Hunter's Waffle, the flavors failed to combine into a memorable dish.  For the price point, we expected more. Also expected more on the service side.  Maybe it was just because I didn't order a drink (?) as I had 1 glass of water the entire meal not refilled.  I hope my friends at the other end of the table who ordered the bottomless Rose had more luck getting refills.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fois Gras parfait with ruby port gelee starter ($18).  Hunters Waffle with Duck Confit benedict ($21).

R-hI97h7EGHVwVFEEwR5pA.text: Very overrated.  Dined twice at Bardot, first time the order was lost and never made it to the kitchen and 45 minutes later the waiter finally realized our food was not on the table.  Food tasted burnt and quickly thrown together.  Staff seemed untrained.  Second time ordered the most expensive steak and requested medium rare which it ended up being well done and was a thin cut not as advertised.  Did get an upset stomach after eating there that night.  The quality of the service and the dishes do not measure up to a 5 star restaurant reputation.  Food needs work as it seems to be diner food quality for the high prices you pay.  However the cocktails were good.

LKRLd-w44VAiSyybOVS4HA.text: Kind of hard to find but once you do you will not regret this amazing French location. Service is amazing, food is exquisite, the decor is divine, the photographer Britney was friendly. The service was consistent and efficient, they made my anniversary very special. The prices for the food is worth it because not only do they have big plates but it follows with big portions. The bread and butter is life changing and overall a great place for good old fashion French cuisine!

gLl8mmoUjPtWLlySdzY9dA.text: My husband and I wanted to have a light healthy meal and we were really happy with the choices at Bardot Brasserie. He had the Salmon over Lentils. We also ordered chickpea fries and beet salad.  The funny thing was when we sat down our waiter greeted us with a "French" accent...my husband is English but also speaks French and turned to me and said that he doesn't really speak French...:)  We ordered a glass of wine and were really shocked at how small a pour it was..it was below the mid-line of glass and my husband mentioned it to the waiter when he went by him.  The waiter did come back to our table and filled up his wine glass, so we really appreciated the gesture..One thing to point out is that he LOST his French accent and became an American...  The food was great.

h6A7pK7XzwenIlCD0fw__A.text: Let me start off by saying the food, service, and decor at Bardot have always been excellent.  It has been a standard for other so-called fine French restaurants to admire.  Bringing friends and family to here was the highlight of any trip to Las Vegas.  This last visit however was a disappointment, in a different way.  My guests and were enjoying a meal, when the hostess seated large group behind us.  Suddenly a big hairy dog appeared next to me, and sprawled out on the aisle floor. It was an unpleasant surprise in such a nice place. It wasn't clear if the hostess had seated them with it, or they had snuck it in. It's hard to imagine anyone missed a giant golden retriever.  After quite a while, and several guest stepping over the thing, a hostess approached the owners.  She asked if it was a service dog, they said it was and belonged to their sister who was coming late.  This was clearly the usual diversionary tactic. The dog was a pet: it had no gear or collar indicating any kind of legitimate service to anyone. The "sister" never did materialize. Toward the end of the visit another hostess came by the group and said she really should have them leave but "this dog is too so darn cute", and proceeded with to pet it while juggling menus.  This was inexcusable behavior - none of the staff had the discipline to enforce the rules.  So, I called an end our meal.  On the way out, I spotting a table that had been hiding a small dog in a bag, and was taking it out for scraps from the table.  I pointed this out a hostess in passing, but they just smiled and thanked us for coming.  I can somewhat tolerate the recent lowering of standards for attire, but animals have no place in decent restaurants.  It's not cute in any way: just unappetizing and disgusting.  I'll be taking my guests and money elsewhere, until there is a policy change.

lkOU97rmY3doePZPtXDF6g.text: Always a favorite stop when in Vegas. The Lobster Bisque is amazing! Really wish they still had the duck wings, were definitely the best thing on the menu!

hTeqj1JMZH8ZZMNeEqOrGQ.text: What can I say, impeccable service from a great service staff(Thank you Esteve) wonderful food and an lovely ambience. Just an overall great experience. It is pricey and I enjoyed it throughly. Don't forget desert. With their French press coffee a total delight!

ex0wWyQrf1JR_YyeywDijw.text: The happy hour was amazing and the atmosphere is so impressive! The bartender did a great job with the drinks. Decided to try things that I had never had before and was very impressed.

SIXvv44Gd_DgEPWblWNIEA.text: My first review on Yelp but felt compelled to do so after another amazing experience at BARDOT Brasserie!  Have had breakfast or lunch there 3 times over the past 3 months...the food has always been fantastic (and we've had quite an assortment...highly recommend the short rib benedict...it was amazing!).  What really made our experience exceptional was our waiter, Oscar, who has waited on us all 3 meals.  He was outstanding...very customer service oriented, attentive to details, and his knowledge of not only the food but also their wine and spirits was incredible.  Every meal has been an educational experience and I always leave looking forward to coming back for another.  If you have gone before or haven't been yet... I highly recommend this restaurant...and request Oscar if he is available.

aVlwTDDLa9I2zK1cU5Hpqw.text: Nice restaurant in a great hotel!  The atmosphere is fun the service is great but I felt the menu was a little light.  Could have used a few more choices and more complex options for the price.  I would go back and give it another shot as I hear they change the menu quite a bit there.  Did not have the french flare I was looking for, but good quality food none the less.

PM3CiIqtZPaWDXogqMrzhg.text: Went for raw bar and mussels and did not disappoint again!  Went again over Labor Day weekend while staying at Aria. This time around was a disappointment.  We went after being at the pool for a little while and went during brunch.  It was very busy and food was coming out fast. Unfortunately mine was wrong, I specifically asked for lobster Benedict and ended up with smoked salmon. I mentioned it to the bartender and they looked at the computer and said that I did order lobster.  After looking forward to it and not being a real fan of smoked salmon I was not thrilled with the meal. Then there was a problem with charging the bill to the room so this was well below the experience of my last few visits and hopefully not an indicator of what the future holds.

N9Gf2QzevF6DK6CShf2L-A.text: Bardot is one of the best dining experiences I've had in Vegas, and I'm local. From the beginning to end they leave nothing behind to make the experience wonderful. Beautiful pairings on every dish from the Sommolier, very knowledgeable servers, and incredible executive chef Josh Smith. If you're looking to indulge in incredible French food, hands down the best in Las Vegas. Not to mention stunning bar with very talented bartenders! Can't wait to come back!

2S9skJPXVuEIGdtShMdMRw.text: This is probably my top place to eat in Vegas ! Everything from the ambiance to the food is spot on . My wife and I have had the pleasure of dinning  there 3 times and each time it gets better . We look forward to our next visit ! Must haves are the duck wings ...the French onion soup with the added truffle and poached egg ! .. and any one of the steaks on the menu ...the chef and the staff are genuinely caring and you can taste it and see it in the dinning room .. can't wait till the next time

nLUXZR1m_71Ijw5KQXoJzg.text: Was extremely pleased with the service and quality of food at this restaurant. I was staying at the aria resort and casino for business and decided to try this place for dinner. Not disappointed one single bit. The waiter was fantastic and suggested a great beer prior to dinner. He was extremely knowledgable of the menu. I highly recommend this place.

D_dKx1HhWBjpAYHe1CpKBA.text: We came here for dinner Thursday night at 7pm and the restaurant was about 1/3 full.  It absolutely pains me to write this review and only give 3 stars because I feel like there's so much potential here!  The menu is enticing, service absolutely 5 stars, prices are very fair and ambiance is perfection.  The catch is....the food was mehhh 3 stars at best.  Considering this is a restaurant review, I have to base my stars on the quality of the food.  What we ordered:  1. Foie Gras Parfait- 4* delicious and creamy but it was more filler (i.e. cream) than foie gras.  still very yummy though 2. Beef Wellington for 2 people- 3* SO SALTY!! the filet was cooked beautifully and that along with the foie gras sauce would have been perfection together.  But the dry outer crust and the insanely salty duxelle made it unpalatable.  My hubby and I had to scrape the outer parts off and just eat the steak and sauce.  Plus it was $130 for the two portions and it didn't even come with a side.  That's expensive even by Vegas standards. 3. Black truffle french fries- 0* terrible.  The first batch we got was stale and not even warm so we sent it back.  The second batch we got was still stale and the truffle flavor wasn't even detectable.  You could see the black flecks of supposed truffle but there was absolutely no taste of truffle at all.  We didn't want to be a bother and send it back again so just left it untouched.  tragic  We skipped dessert because we didn't want to be disappointed further.  Our bill amount to $230 including a glass of wine.  Not bad- but not worth it.  There's potential here if they could get their kitchen to execute as well as their front of house staff.

Cj5RDfvtb4fL_V-a4Qwkvg.text: Phenomenal service and food. Chef Josh provides a once in a lifetime experience. Don't miss out on an incredible experience. Location is amazing. I will definitely be back!

3wYDgNCHnG1ZA4mb23KWkA.text: I had high expectations for this place and it was very average for me. I got the New York steak which was highly recommended and I thought it was tough and grizzly. The service was fast and attentive and the appetizers   was excellent but I really thought  the steak was average at best. If I'm staying at the aria I'm going to Sage in a heartbeat over this place

sfTCyderBzNGD1yEP4nIRA.text: Extremely rude staff, made reservations, still had to wait half an hour. My daughter called to see why there was a wait the hostess by the name of Aurora was extremely rude, she needs to be trained again, or not work in customer service. When asked why there was a wait she said that there was just a wait, when asked why if there was a reservation she said we are just busy. In addition to this she was asked for a table away from the kitchen she said there was not other.... once the waiter got to the table we asked him if there was any chance that he could move us, he said of course theres another table that we can move you to. This restaurant would have been such a great experience that we were all looking forward to since we were coming in from Astralia until we met the hostess Aurora... such a rude person that should not be working in hospitality or should be trained again... even the masedonian water.. such rude staff...

aYfCWmqRto6NH4ANtnBPog.text: Our favorites of the night were the king crab crepe and rib eye with the Bordelaise sauce. The oak smoked Duroc pork chop tasted great but was too dry and disappointed a bit. We also had the mille feuille for dessert which was very good.  Our favorite dish of the night was the king crab crepe. My wife really liked the taste of the buckwheat crepe which was pretty good by itself. The crepe was topped with king crab, trumpet mushrooms, a sunny-side egg and a waiter-poured beurre blanc sauce. The dish worked as a whole, was flavorful and was a great way to start the meal.  We ordered the rib eye steak frites since this was a brasserie, and it was mighty tasty. The fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, paired with a tasty garlic aoli. The fries were good by themselves and apparently cooked in beef fat, but they were also good with the garlic aoli. The rib eye was also pretty tasty, not as good as dry aged rib eye from a steak house like Mastro's, but still pretty good by itself. While the rib eye was great by itself, it was even better with the Bordelaise sauce.   The oak smoked Duroc pork chop tasted a bit like bacon, given that it was smoked and salty. While the taste was great, unfortunately, it was very dry. This was the most disappointing thing about the dinner. Otherwise, the pork chop was served with bacon, some root vegetables and slices of cornichon.   Our waiter recommended the mille feuille for dessert, and it was a great way to end the meal. Essentially, the mille feuille is made of layers of thin caramelized puff pastry sheets separated by vanilla pastry cream (creme patisserie). The difference in texture between the delicately crispy puff pastry sheets and the soft pastry cream really worked. The dessert was sweet but not overly so and was surprisingly good.  Overall, everything was flavorful and well-executed for the most part, with the exception of the pork chop. However, even with that slight misstep, we would come back if we were in the mood for French brasserie cuisine.

QoGos5wWRsaD5emrelS9KQ.text: Came here Saturday 2/27 at 5:00 pm for a happy hour menu that doesn't exist anymore. Ordered drinks and Duck Wings A L'Orange. Returned 2/28 for brunch which was absolutely fabulous. We ordered La Boulangerie, Hunter's Waffle, Mussels & Frites, and finished with creme brulee.    The wait staff was quick and attentive, constantly refilling waters and coffees.  I would definitely return for brunch!   Every meal is served with a fresh warm baguette and homemade butter which I could have eaten 3 loafs of.   Duck Wings A L'Orange: sweet, sticky, and savory. Not something I'd order again.   La Boulangerie: Croissant was a disappointment, but the other 3 breads were very yummy!   Hunter's Waffle: Lot's of savory duck, perfect poached egg, rich maltaise sauce. The waffle could have been a lot crispier, and I think had it been I would have been in love with this dish had the waffle not been soggy.  Mussels & Frites: These were the largest mussels I have ever seen or eaten, and every single one was huge. The french fries were typical and served with ketchup and a truffle aioli.   Creme Brulee: Everything you could expect and want from a creme brulee, perfectly and traditionally prepared.

LwflRwP8QZ2zHOLkZwQ7ZA.text: We had Steve as our server, and he was superb.  Knowledgeable, courteous, and on point.  The food was spectacular. The drinks were delicious.  Couldn't have had a better experience.

0E8lU-xE21zkYTh3o0vKKw.text: As always, Michael Mina restaurants provide the perfect setting for a great meal. The seared foie gras served on top of beluga lentils was a nice start to our meal. Perfectly seared, buttery and delicious. We also tried the duck wings a l'orange which were ok, but didn't cause much of an impression on me. The salmon entree was served also with beluga lentils. Nice and crispy on the outside, however mine was slightly overcooked. Nonetheless the flavors were on point. The wine list, including by the glass, was as expected excellent with lots of French options. Dessert was the baba au rhum which was not a traditional cake, it was more like a loaf of bread, with lots of rum and light chantilly cream.

ax91f-r1Zvmn-LfwBI-93Q.text: I've been to Vegas about 100 times over the years.  This is hands down the best brunch I've had, not only in Vegas but in my life.  The service is top notch and the French Toast tastes like something out of this world.  And the burger, the rose, eggs Benedict.  You got to be kidding me!

GdHsFwA71XtZOJVn0Hv8oA.text: Pork chop was recommended as an entree (besides steak options) but it was a little dry. I wish it was more juicy and tender.  Liked king crab crepe as appetizer. If we had time we would have tried the chocolate macaron. Saved for next time! (and we are thinking about perhaps coming back for brunch next time) Service could be better...

2z74vRSaOTy1ciZNM4QS7w.text: My husband and I dined there on a whim and a taste for French and the whole experience from the moment we entered until the last sip of espresso was drunk, was amazing! The flavor combinations that the chef prepares are divine and the upscale high quality service and cuisine do not disappoint. Although this is a very high end restaurant, we arrived in jeans and sneakers and did not feel u comfortable at all! Staff was wonderful and attentive. The food was outrageous. We started with the specialty crepe: Lobster and egg with pear and sweet butter. Need I say more? Main course of lamb and polenta with polenta fries that were so crispy and moist they almost stole the show! For dessert, it was nothing less than fine French baked pastries and cream puffs. We will for sure return the next time we are in Vegas! One of the best dining experiences we've had.

1hPPi_wFxUbc66WeeNbLdQ.text: It was an amazing experience! The food was outstanding and the service even better. Oscar was attentive, went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of and was so friendly. We even talked about the World Cup and he made me feel better about my country playing England later this week. Thanks Oscar!

l0fpZ-DM0bXpYOE-3lZXzg.text: We come to Vegas a lot. Each time we stop here because the breakfast is nothing short of outstanding. Wow. Where do I begin. Wait there's no point order everything. So good.

Hut82WnWXtaxOmcIjeo2Lw.text: Food 5/5 Decor 5/5 Ambiance 5/5 Staff&Service 5/5 The ratings says it all, everything about this evening was perfect. Our waiter knew everything about the menu, and gave us the best recommendation for drinks based on what we liked. For desert we had the chocolate macaron, I am not a fan of chocolate mousse but this was incredible. Would go back every night if I could. A must try when in Vegas.

0Mehu1iliVHtVfHnz8tdhg.text: The entire meal, from salads through entrees were incredibly salty, although all items were well presented. The apps and entrees were either heavily salted or tasteless. Nice restaurant decor wise, decent service, great sounding menu, but almost inedible due to the heavy hand. The exception was the escargot which was actually quite good, but otherwise even the salads were salty. I had the house smoked pork chop, which was almost inedible when you combine the smokiness with the saltiness, and finish with a mustard sauce. My wife's salmon was well prepared but salty as well, while the beluga lentils underneath were tasteless.

kUBX87EC8F_HHs9nYq3VZQ.text: Had the most Uh-mazing onion soup gratinee "deluxe" style with black truffle & poached egg... I died!

b4ojLyqU953aj6Dw2d18jQ.text: I was really excited to try this restaurant but had a terrible experience. The service was awful and it ruined the entire experience. Would not recommend going especially as expensive as it is.

dZqavHdSOnz5zwBMV6NX6w.text: I love salmon but HATE the skin.  Ordered it here and it was just mouth watering.  Came with skin but it was prepared nice and crunchy and I absolutely loved it.  Blew my mind.  We also shared couple of deserts.  Everything was delicious.

CafR_9y3bwGc-iQpONusTw.text: For me, even if the food isn't an insanely good gastronomic experience, if the service is on point, then the restaurant earns a 5 star-rating. Bardot is the rare combination where the food was flavorful (and filling!) and the service was top notch.  I ordered the Warm Beet Salad to share with a friend and a French Toast all for myself. Let me say that the French Toast can EASILY be split two ways. It's massive! The fluffy toast was served with crunchy almond brittle, vanilla mascarpone, and orgeat (almond-y) syrup. It's a well thought out dish and the perfect combination of dense, moist, and caramelization.  The beet salad was pretty good. The vinaigrette was subtle and didn't take flavor away from the beets, goat cheese, or arugula. For an $18 salad, attention to detail was expected and accordingly presented.  The coffee was pleasant and the servers made sure my cup was never empty. I was impressed with their speed despite a busy Sunday brunch crowd.   To add icing on the already pleasant experience, Bardot presented each diner with a complimentary cinnamon roll in celebration of their 1 year birthday.   Overall, the ambiance, the service, the huge French Toast portion, and the free cinnamon roll blew me away. LOVED!

AZNjsGcSxNcywPj5hUTTMA.text: Everything about this restaurant was 5 stars! Everything on the menu is amazing, great service and decor. You have to try the French toast!!!

YygFN5V8DGPHVNTqjPyQhA.text: I'm a Las Vegas local and a high roller in the MGM family, Bardot did not live up to my expectations at all.  It's loud and obnoxious,  and the prices are nowhere in line with the quality.   I ordered the most expensive steak on the menu, and honestly, I  may have enjoyed an Applebee's steak just as much.   From someone who spends tens of thousands of dollars each year at MGM properties, Bardot,  you're getting a thumbs down from me.  Michael Mina, you're name may draw tourists but let's keep it real and live up to the standard you're trying to portray.

0oEROlD7ARsRM63VHrVnlw.text: 3.5 stars.  You know, everything was really tasty, from the fresh warm mini-baguettes fresh out of the oven to the steak frites.  But, there was heavy-handedness in the salting of the entrees, so much so, that I woke up feeling hung over and completely bloated.  It was a great experience while we were there, but I won't return because of the over-salting issue.  Steaks delicious, though one of my dining partners ordered medium-well and got medium to medium rare.  Can't understand how that type of establishment can goof up on the cook.  I would have given 4.5 stars, if not for the excess salt issue.

9aoFFm9lfAe0OtKFPJwlng.text: Wow, this place has great food and service.  The wait staff are knowledgeable and super friendly.  The food is outstanding, one of the best espressos I found in Las Vegas.  Try the chocolate macaroons it is fantastic.

h4U3LPJP0xn9fPr-parFLQ.text: Had Mother's Day brunch and everything was excellent! We had foie gras, hunter's waffle, pan bagnat, eggs, bacon and fruit. And apple tarte tatin for dessert. Servers were very attentive. Our coffee cups were never empty! As part of their Mother's Day treat, they were giving moms glass bowls with fresh flowers made on site and free photos. We loved it that the regular menu was offered in addition to their pre fixed Mother's Day menu. One comment on the pan bagnat: it would be better if it was a Nicoise salad instead of a sandwich. Would definitely go back.

O2tmf_5AHH-F0dp56-9NNA.text: Really nice French intro with great french food . amazing French decor , great service . Also aria is a great casino . hate the fact that they are charging 20$ for parking and the walk to the restaurant is annoying . but restaurant is really nice and I recommend it for sure . great french experience

00Gn4qdGdu7vLJJ9NU23LQ.text: Inviting and tasty, Bardot brasserie was our most enjoyable meal on our recent trip to Las Vegas. We dined here on a Sunday night so the restaurant was about half empty, but from the moment we stepped up to the hostess stand the service was nothing but exceptional. My wife and I both ordered cocktails, my wife had the moulin rouge and I had the Le peche mode. Both were fragrant and quite tasty. The food was generally good but I felt that some of the dishes were lacking that certain je ne sais quoi for me to give this restaurant 5 stars. For starters we decided on the escargot, king crab crepe and the bone marrow. The bone marrow was rich and smoky, and the escargot was good, but not memorable. However, the king crab crepe was exceptional. The crepe was delicate and light and the filling was seasoned to perfection. For our entree we shared the loup de mer which was quite delicious as well. Overall an enjoyable dining experience!

Toq28aRlouwgDoUE3aW4hg.text: Four stars from my husband. Dined here with the Lip Smacking Food Tour. Sampled foods that were both familiar and unfamiliar. Food presented well, portions were large. Husband would like to come back for more tastings.

a_1wD3REqSRF5R4maaJpUA.text: To start off I will say that the food at Bardot was good, however, due to the HORRENDOUS service I can't rate it any higher then one star. We came in with a group of 16 girls for brunch on a Saturday morning. They had split us into two separate tables- which was fine we didn't complain about that and sat down right away happy to be there. It was all downhill from there. We started off by ordering the bottomless rose. Our waiter walked off and came by later to take our food order, and we nicely asked him if our rose was on the way he told us to relax. Quite a rude comment to say to a paying customer, especially when we are asking a question about our meal. He proceeded to make rude comments throughout the meal. He told us to relax upwards of 10 times, commented on someone "drinking too fast", told someone else to "relax with the wine". He made condescending comments each time he came to the table. He wouldn't let us edit our order for a salad to not have beets in it (which seems very strange considering people have allergies). Every time we asked for something he told us to relax. When we asked for ketchup he told us to relax. Perhaps his worst comment of the meal was telling my friend she wasn't eating enough food, I don't think it's his place to comment on someone's eating habits. The service got so bad I had to speak with a manager half way through the meal, and while he listened to my concerns, he didn't do anything about it. He didn't have the waiter apologize, and he didn't even give us the option to leave our own tips. Our bill arrived and the tip was already included, which he most definitely didn't deserve that amount after we complained about our poor service. Unless you want to be judged and spoken down to for your entire meal I do NOT recommend eating here.

zDhn4qi-Y1sTBIK_eNW0qg.text: Overrated. Worst omelet I've ever had (how do you screw that up?). Could have gotten better food in the hotel lounge.

H_ymn5_noaFaGWCO3vPz5Q.text: This place was just ok. I would give it 2.5 stars if I could but yelp doesn't do that. The menu isn't huge but does offer a pretty decent amount of options. One of my biggest complaints is the prices for what you are getting. I mean I work in fine dining and totally understand having to charge top price for quality ingredients but this place seemed to have just randomly started assigning outrageous prices all over the menu. Not to mention I felt guilt tripped by the server for not wanting to order a bottle of wine, like I'm sorry I wasn't looking for wine tonight I'm just as pleased with my beer and my bfs cocktail stop asking me if I'm sure. And the sommelier was rude, if u are going to ask how a meal was at least pretend to even listen to the response before walking away. Now onto the food cuz as I said I work in the industry and respect quality food at a high price, but even there the food was lacking. We had the oysters, good standard oysters nothing too special. Then we had the escargot which I wanted to love, but honestly wrapping them in the pastry totally took away everything and that's all you could taste, very disappointed. I had the NY Strip which was fine, once again nothing special or stand out about it and mine seemed a little too fatty, a good 1/4 of my steak was all fat which I know creates flavor but when you are getting a 12 Oz steak and at least 3oz of it is straight fat it's disappointing. My bf had the lobster which was good except the fact the bernaisse sauce overwhelmed the dish so much he couldn't even enjoy it. Plus is side of polenta with mushrooms and peas was so under seasoned we each took 1 bite and pushed it to the side to never be touched again. Overall a disappointing experience, neither of us wish to return again and defn will not be recommending this place to anyone in the future. With so many great restaurants in Las Vegas this one defn should be skipped.

VLuEALerEiG0BzsHfDFE-A.text: From the service to the food, this place is outstanding! The restaurant is absolutely beautiful and has such a cool vibe! I came here with my boyfriend for the first time and I loved it! Our server Christina was extremely helpful and attentive! The manager Stephen stopped by to check on us and was very nice. The sommelier Andrew, and Chef Jd were so welcoming and sweet. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone! I'll be back! #foisgras #duckwings #seabass

yCDQnbNutnR8VmIpuwLl_g.text: Great looking place with some nice reviews, however service is/was atrocious...the bartender took 20 minutes to just hand us a menu. When we ordered 2 drinks guy acted like I was asking him for a kidney.   eternity is much faster

YlJfg7LEH_Zr5k-hix0SVw.text: This is our favorite French restaurant in Las Vegas. Starting the meal with a glass of their excellent rose is a must. Nice  selection of cheeses: Valencay Affine OMG! Love Bardo's roasted beets and goat cheese salad and onion soup. You cans add truffle, braised oxtail and poached egg to your soup for a very special treat. My husband is a big fan of Bardo's steaks and lamb rack frites. Great atmosphere and service even during holidays when Las Vegas strip restaurants a lot of times are overrun and can't deliver.

e6JQXZxdhthWqlroOeFUhQ.text: Good food, super friendly staff.  The only disappointment for me was that I didn't go with their prix fix menu.  I don't remember the cost, but there was a good selection of options for the three courses, but I'd had my heart set on the escargot.  Escargot is one of those things - if it's on the menu, I will get it, and I will choose the rest of my menu around it, so since that was not one of the appetizer options I went a la carte.  Unfortunately, the escargot was not what I expected. I knew it came wrapped in a pastry puff, and I like anything in a pastry puff, but this just didn't do it for me.  Not bad, just not great.  A bit on the dry and chewy side.  The mussels that I had for dinner made up for it.  A huge bowl of plump mussels in a delicious creamy broth that I just soaked up with the warm baguette that came with it.  I wish I had room for dessert but I was stuffed at that point.  The wait staff was friendly and attentive, checking-in regularly to see if we were ok, or if we needed anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot

Z8-U05d_glWZIx65rzZCwg.text: We went for my birthday and were very disappointed. I can say this was mediocre at best.  The ambience is very loud. We were seated at a table that I could not even hear my husband. We asked to move and were accommodated which we appreciated. I agree with other postings that it is very expensive for the quality. I do not mind paying if the food and ambience are superior but this restaurant falls short. First, the price for a glass of wine was ridiculous - $20 a glass. Our server didn't even pour our wine until after our appetizer was served. My husband ordered the oysters and said he felt sorry eating the baby oysters. We had to ask where they were from because they were so small ($21 for 6 babies). I ordered the burrata salad with peaches - 4 very small slices of peaches, a small tasteless piece of burrata with some julienned vegetables that were non descriptive ($21). My entre was the lobster bisque which was very good but my husband's steak ($67) was very salty and inconsistent (some parts good, some not edible). Yes, Las Vegas is expensive but spend your money somewhere else.

brtRDE2fFcAv4yscN7yzvw.text: The worst French food I ever ate in Vegas... The cheese is atrocious... The bread of the croque Madame is like wonder bread.... As French man I would not recommend this place the experience real French bistro cuisine... Over all the ambiance was real nice and the personnel was friendly but the food was subpar... It feels like they try to cut cost on quality of ingredients... Talked to the manager and he said the cheese was imported from France lmfao...

jZXuSKqO7o-KqYIqDk8KEg.text: If you want to spend a fortune on a highly unremarkable meal, this is your spot.  The Prime Rib, at $55, was no better than a steak at Sizzler. Simply nothing notable about this place to justify a $140 tab for two main courses and 6 Oysters, no wine, no dessert.  Highway robbery. Friendly enough service.

UY_dx-Vkx0EN4KWnl7ymTA.text: Phenomenal service and phenomenal food. Worth the high price tag. Get the duck wings a l'orange and the halibut! Definitely recommend for a romantic evening.

PZjTJS2JlO7I06SBVw88-w.text: Had such a lovely experience dining at Bardot.  The service was great.  Fun atmosphere but a little loud in the main dining area.  The food was excellent!  Our server personally offered items that he tried himself and they were great choices.  I look forward to coming back here on any future trips to LV.

J-qYoLLC6OmEiNvmzsaMOg.text: A MUST eat. Only got to step in so far for an appetizer of duck wing and a fine crafted glass of whiskey (was able to see him make it) that had lemon and an herb that I can't quite remember, but oh was it all I needed at the time. Perfect taste, perfect service. The atmosphere left me relaxed and only wanting to eat more if I could. Unfortunately, that will have to wait till next time. I will be back for you Bardot and as hungry as ever. Make your sure to save a glass of chilled whiskey for me! ;)

uFgXy4T7c35FFhCzN4BDIA.text: Excellent French food experience. We started with a fruit and Beignet plate and a bottle of rose. Then I moved to the Duck confit . hollandaise sauce over a freshly made waffle. Simply delicious and I would stop by for brunch any time I am in Vegas!

7R8E_IlYLP982MfwLVCZsA.text: Great brunch menu, probably the best selection in town. Great service and atmosphere. Highly recommend!!!

E-sRmgOPZXwGr0diMn27mA.text: The Michael Mina group really knows how to take care of their guests.  We had an awesome time.  The food is so RICH! It was so amazing.  I left so full that I fell asleep in Vegas at 11pm.  I would go back for sure!

KhLzcJTnJPxNnN3j5kn0NA.text: Came here for happy hour on Friday.  Restaurant and bar is very nice.  We dressed nicely but not fancy (khaki shorts and polo) and it wasn't a problem, but we were sitting in the bar.  Staff was excellent.  Very friendly, helpful and accommodating.  Food was really good, we ordered from the Happy Hour menu and also got a cheese plate.  Everything was delicious, will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas.

lNv6D0chpVwpzD59JYIMbw.text: Wow - Felt like we were in Paris.  Been here for dinner & brunch. Both were outstanding!

KzrzyJaCgKVogMlRNRIaxg.text: My favorite French restaurant in Las Vegas everything is perfect there, it's pleasure to come, thank you!!!

kOlhvfSAwj0uc48Xy4TU3g.text: We had Valentine's Day dinner, at the bar. The atmosphere transforms you to a small bistro in France. The staff was very, very busy, but was still very attentive to guests at their tables and the bar.   I started with the French Onion Soup. It was some of the best I have ever had! It was in a large crock with lots of melted cheese on top. They serve warm baguette in paper bags with soft butter. Yummy! My husband started with the late and he said it too was very good.   The entrees were let downs for both of us. I had the sea bass. It was slightly over cooked and left it dry. He ordered the lamb frites and was disappointed when the plate only had 4 thick fries. When he asked how long it would take to order a side of fries he was told 15-20 minutes. He passed. He did say that the lamb was prepared well. When the manager saw the bartender remove my plate he immediately came over and asked why I didn't finish it. His concern was greatly appreciated. Although it wasn't necessary he did send us desert on him.   Overall I give them a little slack since it was Valentine's Day and they were completely booked. The staff clearly was busting their butts to make it a memorable evening for everyone. Thank you! Bee would try them again.

wxnUHvmZ7APxXCbNCB5cSg.text: Amazing!!!! The food and service were fantastic, this was a great pick for my birthday celebration!!

34LVHAP7r-8Wrj7WkiwCbg.text: Bardot was just a joke! It's an elegant venue with impeccable service but the  kitchen is without a vision. Poor ingredients, flavourless meals, ridiculous pricey list of wine make your experience at Bardot just awful. Vegas is plenty of restaurants with serious chefs and meals. Stay away from this place.

hPXu1HMAD584juxPKK82Eg.text: We have been to Bardot three times since it opened--every 2015 trip to Vegas. The food and service is exceptional. Great wine list and cocktails too. We love the bar design, the vibe and the bustling dining room. My only complaint would be the photographer. We noticed her for the first time when we were dining there for my husband's birthday in September. It has always seemed tacky to me that fine dining restaurants in Vegas send around a photographer charging for pictures. We've always declined being photographed at other places, but since it was a special occasion, we agreed to let her take our photos. When she came back later and told us the price was $25 per picture for both print and digital, we said, "no thanks." She got really snotty about it and said, "I'm sorry you didn't like my pictures." We didn't appreciate her attitude, and I think it's ridiculous that a restaurant would charge that much money and have that customer photo strategy in 2015. We were a table of eight adults in our 30s and 40s. Why would we want 8 x 10 photo prints to carry around when we keep all of our photos on Facebook? They could've charged us $10 per couple for digital and made 80 bucks. Instead, they got nothing and turned us off.

46_IsgAARohuhPCc3jzfAg.text: Wow, you walk inside a brasserie in Paris. Our server was french too. The food was excellent. We took advantage of the fab happy hour menu combined with some apps from the dinner menu. The drinks were amazing too. An excellent experience all around.

1JVbITZhTQg9KBrNsh5l2Q.text: So French and so cute. I loved the Nutella sticky buns and the service was absolutely exceptional. Steak and eggs was great, lobster Benedict was great, French toast was a sight to see and was like a bread pudding--so good!  Would pass on the charcuterie (salami was oily and not fresh...) everything else was great

IkK6xO10V5pf0UaKG2Bu0Q.text: Bardot's Brasserie will remain on my list of places to visit every time I visit Las Vegas!  The entire experience is wonderful.

qylKEMCnOGYk_eCH3TO9OQ.text: Had a really nice brunch.  The service was very good. Food was ok. French toast was huge was pre-cooked then finished off before serving.  You can see sheet pans of the prepped toast in the kitchen.  Eggs Benny was a solid choice.

wWpVid5xyQ67BW370ySdhg.text: Since I heard Michael Mina set off to refresh American Fish with a new brasserie concept, I was thrilled - it could've been a welcome addition to the scene with the likes of Bouchon Bistro and db Brasserie. So we decided we would go there for brunch.  The execution however, was less than ideal I must say.  - Onion Soup Gratinee with Perigord truffle, braised oxtail, soft poached egg -$25 - King Crab Crepe - buckwheat crepe, wild mushrooms, normandy beurre blanc $16 - Mussels Marinieres - garlic butter, dolin vermouth, warm baguette $26  A small baguette and salted butter were served first, and the baguette was cold - not fresh out of the oven, not even warmed up. A simple way to tell if a restaurant cares about details, if at all serving a hot bread counts as details.  The Onion Soup Gratinee was good, but to enjoy the deluxe version with those ingredients like truffle, oxtail and poached egg, we had to pay double.  King Crab Crepe was also an interesting concept. As it's aptly categorized as Hors-d'uvre, it was pretty small. The wild mushrooms were a bit too salty, but it's well done overall.  The flavor of Mussels Marinieres was good, but the mussels were undercooked - almost raw. Not only that, it was cooked unevenly - one part of the shellfish was cold and another was warm. It struck me as a failure.  And they didn't bring me a bowl for empty shells. Well... how was I supposed to eat them without it?? I was so curious that I decided to see when they would realize if I put those empty shells to a bread plate and... as I almost expected, it was when I finished the plate 99% and the bread plate was about to unleash an avalanche with the mountain of empty shells.  The food was a OK, service was less than average, and payout $85 including tax and tip. Will return? I don't think so - we have better options.

1vx8bwD41pD3csBLrJ7EOg.text: Came here with my girlfriend for her birthday bc we wanted to try at least one gourmet restaurant and I love French food.   Great decor, very brasserie/French feeling. It was bougie and anything but pretentious, the people at the table next to us were in fanny packs (blast from the past much?)  We started by splitting a French onion soup (my first not counting what they serve at Panera) and it was deliciously indulgent. The melted Gruyere was to die for, and overall very flavorful.   My girlfriend ordered the cod/bass (I forget which one but I'm too lazy to look it up) and I tried hers, it was quite excellent. Me, I'm a fan of a perfectly cooked roast chicken and I was served just that here. My only gripe was that the Au jus/drippings served on the side, the server poured it all over my chicken rather than letting me do it myself. Hence my bird was on the saltier end, more than I would like, but it was not unpleasant in the slightest.   The biggest surprise was the mushroom bread pudding which came with my chicken. I didn't think two things such as mushrooms and bread pudding could be combined so deliciously but they were. My girlfriend hates Mushrooms but even she was floored by how good it tasted.   The portions are gigantic btw so just be warned. I didn't think I could ever feel defeated by a meal but my gut was stuffed beyond doubt when I hit the 3/4th mark. My girlfriend threw in the towel much earlier so as such, neither of us could enjoy the dessert menu. However in our food coma states, we were not so secretly staring down the Mille feuille that the fanny pack folks were digging into next to us bc it looked delicious.

icLH-kZc4wKSqXhFUmAtxQ.text: Omg. This place is a must. Shannon served us and she was spectacular. The steak burger is off the charts. French toast, and crab crape are delicious. $25 bottomless rose... I'm a huge fan!! Such a great experience!

-wtoS7BCfBC7YNtCASwaYA.text: Bardot could exist nicely in Paris.  The interior is totally authentic and reminded me of the times I have spent in Paris. The food matches the ambiance and the service was impeccable.  We both had the salmon and it was superb. I don't know how they got the skin perfectly grilled but it was.  I started with the goat cheese beet salad and it also was very good with the baked goat cheese being outstanding.   I used to eat in the same space when it was American Fish which was very beautiful and served great food.  It is amazing how in Las Vegas a place as nice as American Fish can be replaced with another outstanding restaurant.

dI8KbUKytDfI2VobV3AHGQ.text: Had a very good, but not great, dinner at Bardot on a Friday evening.  Bardot has a large dining room, and when it is full (as it was when we dined there) it can be quite noisy.  I'm not saying this is a bad thing, it creates a good atmosphere.  But, if you are celebrating an anniversary or looking for a place to propose, I probably would look someplace else.  It'd be tough to get a romantic evening with this atmosphere.  We were seated in a large, and very comfortable, booth for our evening.  It made passing items a little tougher, but I liked it overall.  We were approached very quickly by our server and I immediately asked for the sommelier.  I really liked this guy, we told him what we were looking for, price range, and when we wanted them.  He took care of the rest, bringing wine out as we either finished a bottle or finished a course.  It was great, he only brought us fantastic stuff, and it prevented us from having to get the list out every time we needed something new.  Since none of us are knowledgeable about French wines, it was nice to tell him what we liked and have him handle it.  And, he didn't try to upsell us, he stayed within our stated budget.  As this group typically does, we shared a lot of dishes.  To start, we had the:  escargots, the royale shellfish platter, the foie gras parfait, the charcuterie board, and the hearth-fired marrow.  All were fantastic, but my favorites were the charcuterie board and marrow.  The marrow was buttery and rich, just like it should be.  It was fantastic on the toast points provided.  Were I to eat here again, I'd order two of this appetizer.  The charcuterie board had so much stuff on it we had to ask for more toast.  The pate and foie gras were excellent, which is no surprise.  The chilled shellfish was also great, save the oysters.  They were on the small side and weren't very flavorful.  The table agreed that these were the weakest part of all of the appetizers, and they are the reason Bardot doesn't get 5 stars from me.  I expected much better oysters from this place.  The escargots were served in puff pastry, which I'd not had before.  But, they had the traditional buttery rich flavor and were still winners.  For dinner, we shared:  Parisian gnocchi, croque madame, and the lamb crown roast.  The gnocchi was PHENOMENAL, probably the best gnocchi I've eaten.  It was served with wild mushrooms, goat cheese, and roasted garlic (never a bad addition to any dish).  My second favorite was probably the madame.  It was cheesy, hammy, decadence.  It's what grilled ham and cheese sandwiches want to be when they grow up.  My "least" favorite was the lamb.  And, it was still fantastic.  Juicy, cooked to a perfect medium rare, and served with a very tasty gravy on the side.  It came with a few frites, which were perfectly fried and seasoned well.  We selected some very solid entrees.    Service was very good throughout the evening.  The place was crowded, but we never felt like we were waiting for anything.  I'd absolutely eat here again.

1yITZViDMT31smfmBMvE5A.text: Simple and Sweet  This place is an extremely romantic place to have dinner! As for my case i went here with friends and it was really amazing. The seafood tower (appetizer) we ordered was amazing. The waitresses explained each seafood's origin and my goodness were they fresh!  The crab, shrimp, lobster, and oysters were just spot on! I personally also got the french onion soup and for me it was a tad salty but the taste was really good. The caramelized onions just melted in my mouth and with the sharp swiss cheese its a perfect bite.   The main entree that i ordered was the steak and frites. Their steak options are limited which i like because id rather that restaurants be amazing at a few things than mediocre at many. The steak was grilled perfectly and seasoned nicely. The sauce that i chose to pair my steak with was a bearnaise sauce which was quite nice.   The dessert that i got was the apple tarte tartin which was a good way to finish up a heavy meal *.* I also got a coffee to go with the apple tarte which made it even more divine. Their coffee is amazing so make sure to pair with any of their desserts because they are a bit sweet.   The price I would say is pretty fair considering the ambiance, quantity, quality, and location. Lucky for me i did not have to pay but had i had to my bill would have been about $100. Nevertheless i would come back! It was really tasty and quality is quite amazing. Also thanks to the amazing staff here for being so friendly and helpful to us!   Cheers!

gAmW2R5UyGxta-cZHQyW1A.text: I'm very disappointed We came here 3 years ago spent 500 dollars had the time of our lives we decided to try them again made our reservations very excited for our New Years plans. We ended up sick as a Dog Throwing up ETC on our New Years Eve Party ended the night sick as a dog in our room ruined our New Years Eve. Went to talk to the manger the next day instead of helping us sent us to security ( WHY ) made me feel like he didn't believe us we had to fill out a bunch of paperwork and no answers from management Do Not Go here there are a lot of places in LV enjoy elsewhere

RRpV04SzAx5ZrpiNdXo4mg.text: Are we sure this is a Michael Mina restaurant? We had about 12 people in our party when we decided to dine at Bardot, and not a single person at the table was impressed with their meal. The decor an ambiance was very nice, but I can't say the same for our dishes. I ordered the Moules Frites which wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't anything special. I also ordered the Second Coalition from the cocktail menu which is made up of bulldog gin, strawberry-lime cordial and sparkling wine. The drink was very sweet and honestly just tasted like strawberry syrup with sparkling wine. It definitely was not worth the price.   I would have to say the worst part of the experience was the service. The waiter never checked on us to make sure everyone was happy with their meal, cocktail or to refresh any drinks or water. He offered to get me a different drink at the very end of the meal when I was asking for my check (insert eye roll). Needless to say, I don't think I will be returning here anytime soon.

pIEDtJoBQixRUNW3PbvQ6w.text: What was once a beautiful, rustic space with American Fish has been transformed into a lavish and elegant interior every bit equal to the $5 million they spent to renovate. They made this new Michael Mina spot more inviting and approachable by moving the bar to the front of the restaurant and added a small patio area. The impressive kitchen remains unchanged. Large windows encasing it allows diners a great view into the heart of the restaurant.  Many of the appetizers we sampled were stellar, particularly the pate de campagne ($13), foie gras parfait ($15), and blue crab crepe ($16). The port gelee topping the parfait was just sweet enough to balance the savoriness of the creamy foie. Less successful dishes included the escargots Bardot ($17), which I found to be too salty and garlic-heavy, and the tarte flambee ($14).  If you dine there for brunch, the Hunter's waffle ($19) and croque madame ($18) are both solid dishes, but French toast ($12) is a must. Despite it's impressive size, the thick cut brioche was surprisingly light and airy, even with the interior retaining much of the custard it was soaked in.  Of the savory dishes we tried the Heritage chicken roti ($29) was a standout with it's crispy skin and well seasoned meat. The Parisian gnocchi ($23) was beautifully presented with it's mix of pillowy soft pasta, mushrooms, and goat cheese.  Despite splitting the dishes with four other people most of us were stuffed. That didn't stop us from getting dessert. The mille feuille ($12) and apple tarte tatin ($12) were both excellent, but the chocolate macaron ($12) was my favorite. The crispy macaron shell, smooth chocolate cream in the center, sprinkling of salt and warm chocolate sauce poured table-side make it a chocoholic's dream come True.  Michael Mina restaurants can be hit or miss, but he's got a winner with this one. His team has taken a rather ho-hum brasserie concept and given it new life. With a mix of traditional and new dishes, it has the potential to attract many to French cuisine for the first time or a return visit.
