5ZT2xeFAOaO6JGfNNLWF1w.text: Was on the hunt for a good French onion soup after having cocktails at Alibi Lounge inside of Aria- and wow am I glad I came across Bardot!  Las Vegas has so many good restaurants to eat at, on and off the strip there are celebrity chefs and delicious options, so service is really important to me and is what sets a restaurant and culinary experience apart in my opinion.   Upon walking up, the hostesses greeted us kindly and took us in without a reservation. Sadly enough, its rare to find friendly hostesses on the strip, but not here! Very personable.  Andrea was my server and the experience was flawless from start to finish.   We ordered the:  French Onion Soup (and I added the truffle, short rib, poached egg)- a must! This is all I planned on getting but it was so good I had to try more.   Heritage Chicken- This was the star of the meal. So juicy, I'm not typically a fan of meat on the bone but this was so tender it literally fell off. Even came with a side of green beans and mushroom bread pudding!  Pork Chop- Yummmmy. If you like pork chops, you will love this one.  Mac & Cheese- This macaroni and cheese had an awesome presentation, the noodles are individually standing up, very impressive. I wanted to take a picture but it looked so good I had to dig in!!   For Dessert, I had the infamous chocolate macaroon they advertise and it was very, very rich. If you're a chocolate lover, this will be your go to. I wanted to finish it so bad but I was so full I  almost rolled out of this place.  The restaurant is loud like previous reviews said, but I was still able to have conversation without a problem. I loved how I felt like I was in Paris. The service was very attentive but not overbearing. The hostess and manager even asked how we enjoyed our meal on the way out!  Bardot- I will be back!

s_nemF8KpJJXoYxABu6syQ.text: This was my first time visiting BARDOT, and I had the pleasure of sitting in Oscar's section. He did a wonderful job at making recommendations on food and wine. We had the French onion soup, Lobster scramble, Avacado Vinagrette, Hash Browns with fondue, and a monster slice of French toast. All of the food was delicious!

HAVxY-6vdWfUdapkyHWQow.text: ********************* 1249 **********************      BARDOT Brasserie, Las Vegas' debut French concept from James Beard award-winning chef Michael Mina, is now open for dinner and weekend brunch at ARIA Resort & Casino. Paying homage to the skillful culinary techniques, celebrated libations and sexy atmosphere for which The City of Light is renowned, Chef Mina has created a stylish and unforgettable interpretation of a Parisian brasserie in the center of The Strip.      Created by Bishop Pass Interior Architectural Design Studio, BARDOT's space exudes a dark and sexy, almost enigmatic atmosphere. I couldn't believe this was former American Fish's space, it's lavishly beautiful, chic, and elegant at the same time.       BARDOT's main dining room offers a traditional yet luxurious dining space. Walls of black lacquer are paneled with gold pen striping, surrounding a series of Parisian columns. Burgundy leather booths and bistro-style tables spread across a pristine marble floor, where guests can sneak a peek inside the restaurant's show kitchen as they watch their meals come to life.      Sidewalk Cafe - A nod to Parisian sidewalk cafes, BARDOT features intimate seating outside of the restaurant for an entertaining dining and people-watching experience. Situated in the courtyard overlooking ARIA's second-floor promenade, the locale's French-inspired storefront and high windows transport guests to a 20th century literary cafe in Paris.      Innovative Cocktails by none other than Mina Group's Director of Cocktails Carlo Splendorini and ARIA's Mixologist Craig Schoettler salute French drinking tradition with an inventive beverage menu. The restaurant's cocktail program combines the best of French culture and Las Vegas style. Signature sips include And God Created Women, a satisfying layering of French spirits and egg whites; and the Voltaire, a cider-based cocktail that dazzles the senses with baked apple bitters and housemade ginger syrup.       Finest Wines - Wine Director Kim Wood curated one of the most extensive by-the-glass programs, as well as the largest selection of French wines in Las Vegas at BARDOT, highlighting the finest small production and rare vintages from across the globe.      Happy Hour at Bar and Lounge 5-7 PM daily, very reasonable at $2-$6. Try these dishes:   - PRIME STEAK TARTARE $6 sauce verte, slow cooked egg, gaufrette potatoes  - ESCARGOTS $6 toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse butter, puff pastry shells  - DUCK WINGS A L'ORANGE $4 wood grilled duck wings, seasonal citrus, sauce maltaise  - BONE MARROW $5 roasted bone marrow, red wine onion jam, grilled country bread     The brunch menu is pricier, of course, but dinner is by far the best.   - FOIE GRAS PARFAIT ruby port gelee, grilled country bread - delicious  - ONION SOUP GRATINEE you must add Perigord truffle, braised oxtail & soft poached egg.   - HEARTH-FIRED MARROW burgundy onion jam, grilled country bread, so tasty!  -  CARLSBAD MUSSELS MARINIERES garlic butter, dolin vermouth, warm baguette, this broth was flavorful, well balanced, and the mussels were perfect in size.   - Les Steak Frites - a must try, with filet mignon and  foie gras butter sauce, ummm it was so tender and melting in your mouth good!      And don't forget to try the Champagne Cart with my favorite Champagne KRUG GRANDE CUVEE REIMS is only $38 by the glass!       Service by the same GM of American Fish before, a Michael Mina Group veteran Roberto Liendo, always a pleasure to dine here. I'm looking forward to return and try other dishes.

6MQwTkO7bsL5esRPueg09Q.text: Wonderful service once seated. Seafood tower was amazing. The most perfect crab and oysters. Their French press coffee was awesome. Our server was wonderful. They seated us 10 minutes after opening and seemed they were running a little behind. But then we asked for almond milk with coffee; they didn't have it but looked across the hotel to try to find some. Really above and beyond.  Would highly recommend this Bardot for a wonderful brunch.

AsREQLR5Hk2P6K5sdhDI9Q.text: We went to Sage, Partage and Bardot on our recent trip to Vegas.  Had onion soup and the salmon.  Everything was good, but cannot compare to the great meals we had at the other two restaurants.  For the same price point Partage just dominated this meal.  Again, it was not bad, but there is better out there.

a_w3kzxZ3g1Iy3_yCwSQRw.text: I am very selective about my 5-Star ratings and am exceptionally happy to add one more to this short list.  I went to Bardot while staying at the Aria hotel/resort.  I honestly didn't think much of the typical fancy places in Vegas, which is maybe why Bardot was such a revelation.  Most of the fancy places are all decor and no real substance.  Bardot was the rare exception.  If I go back to Vegas, I'll be sure to dine there every night.  Bardot has your typical French decor: Beautiful tiled floor, lots of brass at the bar, and elegant seating.    Along with that decor comes a great bar and great bartenders.  These folks are genuinely happy to see you.  The customer service here is second to none.  Bartenders are experienced and knowledgable on all beers and spirits.  I tried a few beers before deciding that Hors D'age was going to be the one.  I highly recommend it, especially considering that you can only get it at Mina restaurants (or so I was told).  The food?  Delicious!  If you go for brunch, challenge yourself to finish the french toast.  It's like nothing you've ever had before.  Close to half a loaf, this delicious piece of heaven comes with a fantastic almond syrup thing that enhances the experience.  You've read enough of my rattling, go and try it.  You will not be disappointed.

Gp99w_cvmCvU2msMNPGmxw.text: Michael Mina does not disappoint--food had great flavor, presentation was great, and decor & ambiance were on point. Went for lunch on Sunday and was immediately impressed  by the interior of the restaurant when I walked in (esp the gold alcohol rack above the bar). However, service was not on the same level. The restaurant wasn't very busy, but our waitress was slow and not very personable (i.e. menus weren't given to us until 5 mins after we sat down, sister ordered an Arnold Palmer which wasn't brought to the table for 15 mins, seemed irritated that we asked if she could move closer to my sister who was ordering for the table).  MUST HAVES - French toast: a thick brick of brioche--super moist and custardy; the mascarpone and syrup was an delicious combination that added just the right amount of sweetness to the dish  - crab crepe: packed some really good flavor; the combination of the egg, crab meat, mushrooms and the apples = perfection - salmon benedict: perfectly poached eggs, smoked salmon was not too salty, and the bernaise sauce was the perfect consistency  OKAY TO HAVE  - Onion soup: just your average French onion soup--price tag is pretty steep for what it is but the portion is fairly large - escargot borgot: an interesting twist on escargot--inside a puff pastry shell w/ butter and hazelnuts. I did like it but it was cold by the time it came out to our table, which bummed me out - hunter's waffle: waffle and egg was perfectly done and the meat was tender.   DONT NEED TO HAVE - croque madame: nothing special--just ur average prep of a croque madame (bread, ham, cheese, egg). This was the greasiest and heaviest out of everything we got. If u want a croque Madame that'll blow ur mind, try the one at hatfields in LA. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunter&#39;s waffle

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast

m_C3VW_43MbACynXhYyf_w.text: Hospitality starts at the entrance, where a friendly hostess greeted and escorted me to my seat. My server promptly welcomed and presented me with the menu. Although service was professional, there was no sense of warmth in the service provided ... orders were taken, delivered and the occasional courtesy check was intermittently made.  No complaint at all from me ... again service was very professional. The food was nicely presented and very well seasoned.  Absolutely no need for the salt and pepper shakers at the table. All ingredients used were very fresh and cooked to perfection.  I highly recommend Bardot Brasserie to any culinarian who would like to experience a great meal.

CcfTBSrdgd1Yy_Ie6j4qKg.text: If only for the Sea Bass and Frisse Salad. The decor was ok.  Quintessential "French" ambiance ...sorta.  But the food was divine.  A huge huge Frisse salad with just enough tang in the dressing, lots of flavor, perfect egg.   Enough to share and the Sea Bass was a large and beautifully prepared piece of fish that was fresh, flavorful...yummy.   I'm definitely a fan!!

oYRoZil16AUCQ6e1TtwnrA.text: First of all I want to start by thanking the staff and management for the  excellent service they gave us and for stepping up to the plate which I didn't expect.. If you like a little new twist on French food, you're definitely going to like this place!! ..  I'm not going to get into details of what we ordered but I can definitely say this the food was good and from what I saw on the rest of the tables around us there was no leftovers on the plates, so that should tell you something. When I stated that management step up to the plate, the reason for that was because they didn't have some of the items ( seasonal ) we want to order. Management felt they needed to make it up to us, which they really didn't have to because I can understand that from time to time somethings are seasonal so they brought some killer ass dessert for us, which we really appreciate it! So I would highly recommend this place when you come to Vegas.

YxNtvzTXqOdkr0UQ69VUBQ.text: We came to Las Vegas to visit our son and his partner. Our plans on where to eat a Thanksgiving dinner had been overlooked.   We went on the internet and Bardot in the Aria by Michael Mina was recommended. We called and got a reservation for 3PM which was perfect for us and happened to be opening time for the restaurant.  I was a bit skeptical before we arrived because I wanted something more classic Thanksgiving dinner than a chef's wild creation.  We got just enough of both to make it perfect. The food was simply delicious.  Every bite was superb.  It was a fixed price menu and I had no issues with any of the choices.  My wife started with the Lobster salad and I had the chestnut soup. We both liked our selections. The turkey dinner was absolutely delicious.  For dessert I had the apple tart with vanilla ice cream which was super and the perfect ending to this wonderful dinner.  The service was equivalent to the amazing food.  Our waiter, Oscar, was there when needed but not pushy. He made our meal all the more enjoyable.  The wine steward suggested a Pomerol within my budget which turned out to be excellent.  We decided to have another bottle of wine and Oscar suggested one from the haut medoc area which was also good.   If you are in Las Vegas, I would strongly recommend Bardot to anyone wanting to enjoy a fine meal and excellent service at reasonable prices. We will be back!

1cyUar2DcSCUwqmUzD7QMA.text: Not impressed .. taste was mixed bag and service did not align with the $ pricing.  Great dishes - Seared Foie Gras - Bone Marrow En Persillade - Octopus a la Basquaise  Average dishes - Escargot Bardots - Onion Soup Gratinee  Bad dishes - Charcuterie Board (surprised that it was less than average) - Heritage Chicken Roti (bland) - Rack of Lamb Printaniere (worst dish ... bland)

NOaqRaNRlUfFCktax8enYg.text: Oscar made the entire experience unforgettable!  He was warm, welcoming and genuine. He truly presented a phenomenal time and meal that we will never forget!

K14valEDHS18BVNXIUgJMw.text: I recently dined here for Brunch on Saturday and it's safe to say that I enjoy Michael Mina restaurants.   You will find this location on their second level next of Aria. Look for the Zarkana Theater and Buffet to help you locate it. Super cute bistro with brown walls and tons of windows. They have a bar area that displays various liquor bottles and next two that a table that shows some of their various baked pastries.   We started with that pastry basket. It had 4 kinds of bread I loved the two sweeter ones. I can't remember the names for the life of me haha   The steak tartare was the bomb. I could order one on my own. Probably one of my favorite dishes of the meal with taste and presentation. We also had the King Crab Crepe. If you like crab and mushrooms then this is up your alley. Also very yummy.  For the entree we had steak frites and salmon Benedict.... Talk about already full when these came. I had the hardest time deciding which main entree to get and these two were good. I think I would talk more about it if the starters didn't already blow me away.   Aaaanddd of course we had to have dessert. The chocolate macaron was so good but we could not finish it haha. Definitely good for at least 3-4 unless you want diabetes for one.   So yes to this place for that nice brunch. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That king crab crepe though...
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare. My favorite!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict on top of a croissant.

2NwUSvk0CJ2lWN5iexZW-Q.text: Our server Shannon's service was awesome and professional...we will come back here again every time we go to Vegas just for her service alone. The food is great as well...Shannon's service was icing on the cake

ITd5VqfcySvXYOhcMFPTUw.text: Haven't had mediocre food combined with a long wait, and bad service in a long time. Not only was it bad enough that the food was late over one hour, but it also wasn't up to par. On top of that, the server didn't take instructions very well, didn't manage our expectations, and was at one point, nowhere to be found. I waited a few days to write this review, hoping that I'd be more fair, so here it is, my fair review. We went during brunch on a Sunday, and if you must go, then have their pastry bowl and tartare, which was about the only items that were decent.

YQyjBM1Z3KOqtPZf-pRZIA.text: BARDOT is nothing less than incredible. From the moment the  hostess seated us, you could tell just the dining experience was going to be amazing. Then our server Kim came. She was the cutest, most helpful server anyone could ask for. Her knowledge and suggestions for the menu were spot on. Then the food came out.  I have never had so much deliciousness before in my life. The chef is pretty much a miracle worker with the food he prepares. I have already recommended BARDOT!

0r2YkoTaAcvNf_FZBF1IzA.text: The food is pretty good here. The sea bass is very tender and the decor is great in the main dining hall.  It is conveniently located across from The Buffet in Aria.  The small oysters are very fresh and I just cant get enough of that (should have ordered more).  Will come back next time.

RGrtWLfQONHztEWbMjLTRA.text: We had high hopes based on the reviews but we must have hit them on an off night. The service was extremely slow. Took a solid 10 minutes to be acknowledged and take our drink order.  The atmosphere was bright and loud. Something off with the vibe. The food and drinks were very good but not amazing. Overall the experience was ok and we don't feel the need to go back.   Odd vibe!

SQu_QpuPAs56ay96TSFRtw.text: I consider French food to be the pinnacle of gastronomic bliss. Quality of ingredients, preparation expertise, presentation, and service ~when on point~ allow one to understand why the French deserve lofty attitudes regarding their cuisine. Our dinner meal was sublime and the service (in True French style) was leisurely and attentive. I feel there's a "give and take" between a diner and the establishment, and that not every restaurant appreciates that nuance. It's a courtship of sorts. Bardot Brasserie and Chef Joshua Smith....I am smitten.

RdCsrVwBacbEWFCQFjiWbA.text: We enjoyed our dinner at BARDOT, the pork chops are a must. Oscar is the best waiter we've experienced. BARDOT is our new go to place when we come to Las Vegas.

atVzAv9yRetxDrogTIHTUA.text: One of the most unique experiences ever! We had the chefs choice where they selected everything for us. It was a 6 course meal that turned out to be like 15 and we al got different things! We were pleasantly surprised and stuffed, def recommend!!

Bv0zlx3MjyKznFGPqioeFg.text: We just had another amazing dining experience at a Michael Mina restaurant. This guy does not disappoint. We've been to his restaurants in Seattle, San Francisco, and now Vegas.   We sat at our table and began perusing the menu. We had our eyes set on the tuna tartine appetizer when the waiter remembered to tell us about the tasting menu. Thank goodness she did because once we saw it we could not pass it up.   We got the summer melon and tuna tartine to start. That was followed by gnocchi for the second course. For the third course we got the lamb and sole, followed by each of the two desserts. I have to say I'm usually apprehensive about cherry desserts, but I loved the bing cherry clafouti. We wine paired the menu and were not disappointed.   This was a very classy restaurant and the food was phenomenal!

pL2kLau7HyA7nxV0G4jMjg.text: When I went here for brunch, there was an accordion player strolling around the tables. If that was for authenticity, it wasn't at all necessary: you're transported to France from the first bite of the French baguette with a perfectly crispy crust and soft dough. I ordered the Benedict with Prosciutto (can also get it with smoked salmon and a couple of other things). The croissant they serve their perfectly poached and seasoned eggs on is a delicacy onto itself. I don't know if I'll ever be able to eat eggs Benedict on an English muffin again. The service is prompt and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mo6nzpm5sIuqu9HdEdsX7w.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants at the Aria!  The decor and ambiance are perfect for a quiet dinner.  The service is impeccable.  The sommelier knows his wine and is on the dinning room floor at all times to attend to guests.  The food is excellent.  The bone marrow, endive salad, and fillet are a must.  The steaks come with fries but you can substitute them.  I would recommend you substitute the fries for the Brussels sprouts.  They are cooked to perfection and taste so yummy.  Even if you don't like Brussels sprouts you should try them, you'll change your mind about them.  Bardot is a must when staying at the Aria!

bjeAaAfCNCGgRCRrtaqpmA.text: (4) ~ very good overall food & service  DRINKS: ** Water(still) = (4) very good * Caipirinha = (3.75) Good * Espresso = (3.75) Good  FOOD: ** Waygu Bone Marrow = (5) Excellent!  Best I've had so far... ** Mac & Mimolette(cheese) = (4.25) Very good & Unique take on a Classic. ** French Baguette & Butter(Free) = (4) very good * Double Cut Pork Chop = (3.75) Good & Smokey * Chocolate Macaron = (3.25) pretty good, but it looked much better than it tasted, which tends to happen with pastries:(

qMd5XGihITH1yVX6sZM-qA.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND! First time in Vegas and this brunch has been absolutely fantastic. All the food was delicious and our server Tish was one of the BEST servers I've ever had. Tish was so friendly and gave the best recommendations of food and was sweet and prompt about everything. Our table ordered the French toast and hash browns with Gruyere (picture below), onion soup (picture below), mussels, steak burger, steak Benedict and oysters and everything was delicious. One of the best brunches I've ever been to and bottomless rose for $25 which was always refilled and we all enjoyed! If you're in Vegas you should 100% try this brunch and make sure to request Tish as your server. Matej was the manager on the floor that day and was also so kind and came over to talk with us to ensure we enjoyed our time. Come to Vegas and come to Bardot.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DWduhCNLomqVjLv8Yp7aFg.text: Our first fine dining experience in Vegas!  Bardot came highly recommended, so we made reservations for Monday dinner. It was our anniversary so we were surprised with a signed card at check-in from Bardot staff wishing us a happy anniversary. (No other out-of-the-way gestures pertaining to our celebration though.)  Once settled, BF started off with a smokey old fashioned. He had the seat facing the bar so he was able to see the bartender making his drink. He was impressed with the way the bartender mixed his drink and with the execution of said drink. It was his favorite iteration of all the old fashioneds he has had so far. Bread service was a fresh, hot baguette with salted butter. It blew all other baguettes we've had before out of the water. Right as we finished the bread, our steak tartare starter arrived. Mix the egg yolk in with the steak tartare and use the spoon to scoop the tartare onto the chips -- the chips are too fragile to directly use as a scoop for the tartare. The slightly salty chips balance the taste of the tartare. If you still have some baguette left over, the steak tartare tastes great with it too!  We had watched the Lego Batman movie a while ago and the lobster thermidor left an impression with us. Why does Lego Batman love it so much? What is it? When we saw it on the menu, we just had to order it. Since it was a bit of a gamble, we played it safe by picking a steak for the second entree. So it turns out the lobster thermidor is super creamy -- so much that halfway through, I had to clear off the excess sauce from the lobster pieces in order to eat it. The thermidor came with an excellent side -- mashed potatoes with peas, mushrooms, etc. The flat iron steak, however, was the star of the meal. I'm trying to remember when I had that good a steak and nothing comparable come to mind. It was lean, tender, and flavorful. The meal up to this point was going to be a 3 stars kind of meal, but the flat iron knocked it up to 4 stars. The meat was delicious, but the side (beef fat fries) could've been better. The side felt too greasy and heavy compared to the lean main dish. It would've been better if they married the flat iron with the side from the thermidor. What a knockout dish that would've been!   We couldn't leave without dessert and with the recommendation of our server, we ordered the  kouign amann, which was topped with a scoop of ice cream. We were so full, we struggled to finish it. It was good, though it was not replacing any of our all-time fave desserts off our list.  Service was a mixed bag. Right from the get go, the table was set up, but the bench seats were full of food crumbs from the previous patrons. It was obvious they did not dust off food from bench seats while resetting tables. During our meal, it was hard to find someone to flag down to refill drinks, though they were quick to come by to ask BF if he wanted another old fashioned when he finished that drink. When our server was around, he was pretty good with conversation and recommendations. One thing I thought was weird was that if you charge the meal to your room, you don't get a receipt. We sat for quite a bit before we found our server and asked for a receipt.  Aria's concierge advertised this place as a romantic fine dining environment, but it's pretty loud, like a lounge. The noisiness makes it hard to hear each other, detracting from an otherwise excellent fine dining meal. The old fashioned drink, the bread, and the flat iron steak will remain in our memory for years to come when we think of Bardot.

xHP3uYBKUc45jTxP-pm-Ew.text: Need I say more - 5 stars - well deserved. The service: impeccable. The food - dear lord, I may invent a new word: mouthgasmic.  I was lucky enough to be here during Restaurant Week and there was no disappointment with the tasting menu.  I am in Las Vegas for work and ate alone, trying the fixed menu of the Bardot Salad, Pork chop and chocolate macaron. My mouth is in heaven.  Perfection. Every. Last. Bite.  I will be back Bardot. I hope you are here.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chi late macaron - perfection!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TSza9nXnGVFNK1E_5GxM3w.text: Another night in Vegas and time to try a new place. We went to Bardot on 06/28 and it was so very good. The wait staff were very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. I started with the onion soup and it was delicious with so much melted cheese (maybe a bit big for a first course). I then had then scallops for dinner with a side of green beans (hey sue me, I like green beans) and the scallops were seared beautifully and the green beans delicious (maybe a bit to much salt on the green beans-one less shake of the salt shaker would have been okay)  For desert I had the warm cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream. I wasn't sure about the pairing of cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream but it works beautifully together. The cherry pudding was full of cherries!!  This is a very rich dessert and I could not finish it all but it sure was good

AzmWBN59X9iIa2Xyr7OV-w.text: I feel rather conflicted reviewing this place...if there was an option to give 3.5 stars, that would probably be more accurate. I so very much want to rate this place 4 stars. The decor and ambiance are top notch, exuding a classy feel of a refined and upscale Parisian bistro. I also love the look and layout of their bar. Beyond this, that's where my disappointment started trickling in. Their house bread was for my preference, too hard. My latte was rather average. Their French omelette I'll have to say boasted great flavors. The cheese inside the omelette was very tasty, and the side salad with the vinaigrette cuts nicely into the heaviness/richness from the omelette. Before my main dish, I started off with their puff pastry escargot, and that I hate to admit was my biggest disappointment. Escargot is my favorite Parisian delicacy (I eat them almost everyday whenever I'm in Paris...probably not the healthiest thing to do). I definitely appreciate the different way they prepare them here, but it was quite honestly rather bland. If you're curious about trying this restaurant, I would still recommend giving it a go. Maybe at some point, I'll come back and try dinner...but I unfortunately had a less than stellar first  experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Omelette with Shallots, Gruyére Cheese, Fine Herbs, and Petit Salade Vert
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargots Bardot with Hazelnuts and Puff Pastry

hduRhl4kPkj8MC29zkU4Tw.text: Truly incredible experience from beginning to end. Our sommelier was friendly and very knowledgeable and eager to help us choose the wine that would best accompany our taste buds as well as the entire meal we had planned. The food was amazing. There are a few other comparable French restaurants in the Las Vegas area that I usually frequent when in town (out of courtesy I'll refrain from naming names) but this was my first visit to Bardot and it is hands down the best dining experience I've ever had in Las Vegas. The food was exquisite and everything was cooked perfectly. I tried a little bit of everything but the highlights worth noting (at least for me) were the foie gras parfait, the duck wings a l'orange, the mac and cheese (yeah you heard me right) and the chickpea fries with ratatouille and eggplant puree. Everything was perfect. I'm not very good at describing good food in text, but this was amazing and you have to try it for yourself.

VhVjO-MJMGmRwXAfGa4ncQ.text: Very disappointed to say the least.  We arrived early to a half full restaurant, and they wanted us to wait about half hour for our reservation time.   No worries - we'll sit at the bar. After 20 Minutes of waiting for a drink, a bar tender finally asked what we wanted. 10 more minutes and our drinks were ready, but we had to drag them out of the bar since our table was ready at that point.  Got to the table where we were promptly greeted. Unfortunately, when the waiter left, it was another 20-30 minutes before he came back. He took our order and when the food came, the options were tiny and the taste was that of an everyday store bought steak. Very disappointing.   We ordered a number of different wines by the glass, one of which was full of sediment. They took it off the bill, but at $34, it was still a disappointment.   We didn't bother trying desert as it would've taken another hour I'm sure. Overall, I would not recommend.  Bad service, bad bartenders, overpriced/under portioned entres.

PU4717iTfVJmQQVkIYpTGg.text: Have been wanting to try Bardot since I saw the ads for it during summer time. Long story short did not disappoint at all. The courses were timed perfectly, the service was amazing and helped make the meal. Onto the food every course was great a must try would be the duck wings and the chocolate macaron for dessert.

kVg4rwh87ilkMZta71uSpA.text: This place is  OK , good service, fair food, and wine selection.  I preferred American Fish  before.  lets see how long it lasts.  I heard brunch is good and will go back for that.

xsiWFbVraOjcZqlYW30XGA.text: Tried Bardot for brunch and we were not disappointed. Very nice Helene cocktail to start. The French omelet was simply, lovely, and delicious. The hash browns and toast served alongside made for a hearty breakfast. The bacon is amazing, super thick and crispy, I recommend a side of that. The croque Madame was a massive serving, rich and very good as well. I probably would not recommend the French toast. It is one huge hunk of bread. It's ok, but most of it doesn't have the griddled flavor as it is so large.

M091u9uuvH-N_IAP15GY2A.text: Delicious food with subtle attention to detail. The blue cheese endive salad and gnocchi were fantastic.

HnO9ObkSDSZD_cTldDAbsw.text: The food is highly overrated and overpriced. Not impressed. In addition, dining room very loud. Save your money and eat elsewhere

MMjbACu2Jo1Mp14p0Mt7ag.text: The food took a really long time to come out, even long for french restaurant standards. There were 8 of us.  We all ordered drinks, apps, entrees, and desserts.  The apps took an hour to come out after we ordered them.  The rest of the food was pretty timely but I feel that the service could've been better.  I'm not sure if it was the server or the kitchen's fault (the server was very nice.) But, we weren't updated on the status of our food until the food came out (an hour later.)

T4m8fl_y-e8X_PQoZgLNnA.text: Really terrific experience.  We ate at the bar to watch NBA Playoffs while eating steak frittes...Had the lardon frisee salad which was also delicious...Bartenders and staff were very friendly and attentive...and great bread!  Check it out!

F0WNwIYT_ZsT96zVPI-n-A.text: Unbelievable food. Perfect service.  One of the best steaks I've ever had. Better than most high steak houses on he strip and it's not even a steak house

CTfKXoUtteWcHOlX_SWT7A.text: My daughter and I love brunch and have eaten at many locations but this was the best brunch we've ever eaten. The omelette was perfection, the brioche French toast is to die for and the fruit plate has a frozen yogurt that is unique and refreshing. We will eat here again for certain!

UDl7uvak8bjJJfZ1P9gzFg.text: Last night i experienced the best meal I've ever had. From the friendly and inviting hostesses happily walking us to our table, the sommelier helping me pick a wine I would not usually have ordered, but LOVED, and then to our waiter who explained the food so eloquently and who ensured we were always doing great. We sat in a booth where you could peek at the magic that the kitchen was brewing. The restaurant was gorgeous to sit in, but nothing could outshine the food. We started off with the Foie Gras Parfait (insane) and the King Crab Buckwheat Crepe (omg) we accompanied our starters with the Beet Salad with goat cheese (amazing). We moved onto our entrees where we shared the gnocchi (too good) and the special that evening was a 22oz prime rib with a Bordelaise sauce (we were crying it was so perfectly made). We ended with dessert that sealed the deal that Bardot Brasserie is our favorite place on the strip.

hjbnD-y0m8L_GqDfwIK2qw.text: Very good food. Impressive customer service. Would recommend to try. A lot to choose for vegetarian menu.

YPLV9sl6VDkyssoLwtf_4w.text: Really great brunch.   I'm a vegetable person and there weren't many veggies on the menu.  I know this is a French place, but I wish there were more vegetables on things....otherwise I'd give this a 5 star review

DRciWiy9LmOuFjNETq37rg.text: We went here based on the previous glowing Yelp reviews for the happy hour. The restaurant itself is beautiful, particularly the bar. We got there at 6pm, planning to get a few drinks and some snacks before our show that evening. I had to ask the bartender if they were serving happy hour which he then presented only the drink menu. I knew from fellow yelpers (and after calling the Aria concierge) that their happy hour -food and drink-is everyday from 5-7. I asked to see the HH food menu to which he replied "we don't have that right now". Ok...at the time I thought I must have misread something or got the times mixed up.  We  ended up ordering a few drinks and some food from the lounge menu. The steak burger was good, but the charcuterie plate's contents looked and tasted as if they had been sitting out in the open air for quite awhile. I was pretty bummed about the experience, especially since we made a point of walking here from the Cosmo before our show at Caesars. Next time I want a decent "brasserie" experience in Vegas I'll shlep over to Bouchon.

nAc0INXwkNjxL7xfzJzcGQ.text: We enjoyed the les Fromages for our first course and the chicken and steak for our main course. Everything was delish, but the coupe glacee for desert and service really made it a special experience. For a pricey French bistro it is worth a special occasion.

HkNLaLVoEPydemx2kICdmA.text: Another great Michael Mina restaurant!  We had a lovely evening starting with happy hour. Happy hour was great (nice beverage choices at a really good price) followed by a great meal. The service was also really good. We will return for sure!!

Odrgy2ZH5CHdgn7tDs1Rng.text: Ok, so, WOW. Let's start this off our whole family was late on Mothers Day weekend brunch and they were still so lovely. Then as we are waiting, a photographer came around and took a complimentary family photo and printed as many copies we desired! Whaaaat? Then. Ok. The food. Oh holy. THE MOST AMAZING BRUNCH EVER. We all ordered a lot of food and tried everyone's food and EVERYTHING was beyond amazing! To the point where we all kept saying we couldn't try anything more. Yet still kept tasting, and finishing, everyone's dishes. Oh yes! And $20 bottomless rose! So the food- the best ever: carpaccio, onion soup (since it's a French restaurant don't need qualify), beet salad, quiche, burger, fries, croque monsieur, bacon, and so much more I can't think of. Oh wait! The complimentary pastries - oh yessssss.  Beyond delicious. And on top of all the deliciousness (and major shoutout to those in the kitchen), our server, Oscar, was so fantastic.  So helpful and gracious with all of us! And did I mention we had two toddlers?! Yes. That was it. I was generously treated by my bro and sis so can't speak on the cost, but I can tell you I am a local and even when I have to pay will definitely be back it was that fantastic of an experience!

TZmiWtSWINeaR2wz1GRBpw.text: I will start by saying the food was fantastic. We had the hunter's waffle, king crab crepe, foie gras, and escargot. Stunning presentation and absolutely delicious! I wish the service and atmosphere were onboard. Our server would ask questions (frequently) as soon as either had a mouthful of food, and then stood awkwardly as we would chew, swallow, and then respond. He hurried our experience, and didn't seem to understand the European style allowing for the enjoyment of a delicious meal and spirits. The other clientele just simply ruined our experience. They were obnoxiously loud and rude (at 2:00 pm). I love Las Vegas and the fine dining opportunities afforded here. Unfortunately, this was loud, unorganized, and uncomfortable.

5MI8KEGzTaH0UR_diTJuGg.text: After some very disappointing meals and terrible service, Bardot redeemed my Las Vegas culinary experience.   Service was extraordinary. Ambiance and decor was like sitting on the champs elysees in Paris. The wine list was extensive and the wine we ordered was available (a first in Vegas). The food was great. Fabulous flavours. The macaroni cheese side is oh my goodness - wow! The tartes light and flavoursome - the goat cheese Apple combo was scrummy as was my sauteed skate wing. We just wish that we had time for dessert but we had a show to dash to. All round - a great culinary scrummy experience. Very much recommended!

0x7S3v2fjBRzIzf94LGCTg.text: Our server was really great. We try the escargots which was different, wrap around pastry. Not bad. I had the sea bass and it was really delicious with the fennel and potatoes. The double rib eye with the different sauces was great also. Fries was not crispy, just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

KV2y5WLfzZFtfwfL5cS7zw.text: We set out on a Vegas evening with an idea of having steaks in our minds and better yet in our bellies. I had heard that this place had replaced the Michael Mina American fish restaurant and had seen some photos that had me interested for sure. First off this place is gorgeous on the inside with lovely fresh flowers everywhere and a classy European bistro feel. The other yelpers were speaking truth in that this is a noisy place which can feel exciting at night if you have a loud group of friends but maybe not a good place to catch up with older parents constantly yelling 'what?'. While we looked at the menu we realized there was far more than steaks that looked good to us and we decided that the three of us would do a French style tapas and have a bunch of dishes to share that way we could taste a lot without over stuffing ourselves. I had to ask the waitress to describe the fantastic and interesting way they do their macaroni & cheese because the photos from yelp make it look like a grilled slice of honeycomb that is hard to wrap your brain around but she says they use long noodles and bundle them together. It was my goal to order this dish and yet we were too full to.  We really enjoyed the mussels, the oysters, the bone marrow the onion soup with the deluxe options of oxtail and truffle (we decided not to get the egg). We were having trouble navigating the wine list and so our server sent over sommelier who was a very knowledgeable young woman with wine stained mouth I say this NOT to be disparaging but to include the tidbit that she really is doing the work of drinking and talking about wine and she's doing it well. She was cool! She suggested a very nice cinsaut that went quite well with everything and was at a perfect temp just a bit chilly. We tasted several desert wines before deciding on a Michael Mina wine that was Riesling and Chardonnay desert mix. It was all fantastic! Will most assuredly be back soon and often!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most adorable espresso
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing mussels with a fennel twist! So good! And the bread to sop up all the goodness

fFDSG8D3QiW70kc_k5T_Mw.text: I celebrated my birthday here. We had 10 people in our party. We loved everything we ordered and we ordered a lot. Service here is wonderful and they even gave me a birthday card and a dessert (maybe my friends paid). This was my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Really loved their dessert martinis too. Will definitely come back. Thank you for making my birthday so special.

GqIac5vnacoKeP-6HtL68Q.text: I was so excited to try this restaurant with my family! The atmosphere is great. The hostess was very friendly.   The service was lacking. I don't know if our server had too many tables - or what the deal was. We hardly ever saw him. We had to ask him to stop so we could order more champagne, a few times.   The food was fantastic though. That really made up for it! I would definitely go back for the food, it was great.   We ended up ordering dessert and after 25 minutes we hadn't received it so we had to ask him to box it up. Not the best way to end a meal, but it was fabulous.   I would definitely go back and give them another shot.

rX_Khh0Pik6gor_kLat4vQ.text: Absolutely divine food. Brooke our server was wonderful. I love Bouchon but... This was even better! Stellar. So  delicious and a beautiful French atmosphere.

hBKrCZK6U1I6YExOvezgLg.text: The food was fantastic. The steak tartar was good, not the best I've had but good none the less. The filet mignon was excellent. My husband had the pork chops, which they cook medium rare ( pork, not well cook, hmmm?) I guess no reports of any death from patrons there so he tried it anyway.It was good if it wasn't so dang salty. All in all we really like the variety of the menu. The service was good and overall great place to eat

JEJhLsgrW-Mm5eyZZwCHGg.text: Best breakfast in vegas!  Just delicious!  It helped that we could get a reservation and not wait in a long buffet line at the peak of our hunger.  But what else can beat bellinis, well prepared steak and eggs and a surf and turf Benedict?  Well, maybe adding the french toast next time.  The table next to us devoured it, and it was huge!

3y8MWpUWBGFA9oohd38zDw.text: Very nice spot for dinner! I had the smoked pork chop. It was simply delicious and the potatoes were amazing! They have horseradish in them so it gives them a nice kick. The macaroni and cheese was great as well, very rich! They serve the macaroni standing up with a creamy sauce on bottom and cheese that looks like it was melted with a torch on top. Great presentations!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked pork chop with mashed potatoes. Simply delicious meal!

ahQzlf_l5TS1Q5N5QWZ2ag.text: So good. Such good food and the nicest staff! The lobster scramble was so good and they brought a cute dessert for our bachelorette celebration. Bottomless rose brunch is

yb-2G8GgtfB0eecdNmPknw.text: The food here is excellent. We came on a Sunday morning for brunch and made a reservation. They were very busy as it was Labor Day weekend. We ordered the assorted pastries as appetizers which were great. I got the French toast which was massive! My husband got the French-American breakfast. Definitely try the bacon and the hash browns! They were delicious! The only complaint I have is that the service was very slow. The chef made up for it by giving us a complimentary sticky bun.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ti15SKaIcsNAV4pupIz--w.text: After going to Michael Mina great restaurant RN74 in San Francisco I was hoping for same result here . The overall experience was disappointing . The restaurant is beautiful but found the food disappointing . My salad was a non descript mess . The rest of my dates and I food was forgettable The waiter would disappear for long stretches of time . 2 hours after this forgettable experience the pleasant manager called me to inform me that my credit card wasn't swiped properly and I owed for dinner . Lol. They should have comped me for this  .You can only go by your own experience as I am sure on another night it would have been better . Unfortunately there will not be a next time .

1_BECmiv8kUGKlcgQAl27g.text: It's been two weeks since we thoroughly enjoyed a French bistro brunch weekend in Las Vegas and the tastes and sights linger strongly in memory.  Before reviewing our Sunday brunch experience at Aria's Bardot, allow a few words about Saturday's brunch at Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris. We had been looking forward to MAG for quite a while and made reservations through Open Table.   Three quick Mon Ami Gabi observations... 1) a seat at an open air pavilion table, while not directly overlooking the strip is still a most pleasant repast which didn't require a wait.  2) I've never seen a wait staff hustle through tight aisles so effortlessly, while balancing large trays of dishes high above their heads on extended arms and fingertips. Very impressive.  3) we had an issue with over cooked poached eggs. They were immediately replaced by not only freshly and perfectly poached eggs, but with an entirely new plate of corned beef hash (delicious, moist, well seasoned), along with a replacement of their wonderful hash browns and toast. This was True customer service...correct a mistake with an apology and a smile. Well done and much appreciated MAG!  Now, for the second half of our brunch weekend...Bardot Brasserie  While the newly designed space (formerly American Fish, also from Michael Mina) is elegant and very comfortable, there is no outside dining option as it's located on the Promenade level at Aria.  We started with the most unique Bloody Mary's we have tasted. Apparently, the barkeepers use freshly made vegetable juice and the addition of a cucumber strip in the drink adds a delightful taste and somehow lightens the drink. Delicious!  As I was about to break off a piece of the crusty loaf of French bread which was served in a paper bag, our brunch choices arrived. Previous reviews indicated that the brioche french toast was a must have dish. Have you ever been served a meal that required that you just stare at it as if you're trying to believe what you're seeing? Well, we did that. A huge thick (but light) serving which was crisp on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside. Accompanied by vanilla mascarpone and maple syrup, this, as well as the beautifully presented Swiss chard eggs Benedict made for a totally enjoyable and memorable Sunday morning treat. And there was no way we were not going to finish off that great loaf of French bread and butter.  The kicker, however was the side of bacon. Sourced from Neuske's, this must have been their triple thick bacon. A five dollar order was plenty for us to share and as good as the date glazed bacon was at MAG the previous day, the Bardot bacon was well, even better.  Excellent service...and coffee rounded out this experience.  Our bill was in the $50 range, but well worth it for such a wonderful brunch and quite frankly culinary memory.   Our only regret was that with plans already for our remaining two evenings, we didn't get a chance to come back for what I assume would be a great happy hour. Next time for sure.

hRpeZuR3pFqP_LHOPf6sPw.text: Great service and menu selection! Get the French toast for the table to share! The chicken French dip and croque madame were amazing! If you're looking for a something refreshing get an Bellini!

4mSCcKQ7YjdsYHT9yibcig.text: This place is hot for a reason, it is amazing!  Out of the many high end restaurants I have been to in Vegas this year, the only one that beats Bardot is Picasso.  I was a little worried because I found the Micheal Mina restaurant at Bellagio to be pretty disappointing.  However, it is obvious there is major passion for this venue from either Mina or the executive chef as every item in every dish was executed with care and attention to detail.  First off, duck wings "a l'orange" is absolutely a brilliant idea and were every bit as tasty as you could want.  The accompanying whipped orange sauce was divine, came in a burnt hollowed out half-orange which somehow added extra complexity to the flavor.  Amazing!  The baguette and French butter were very good, up to the quality at Bouchon.  I went with the roast chicken as it's supposed to be the signature dish here, I usually would have ordered the cod but I had to admit this dish was beautifully prepared.  The "mushroom bread pudding" will be more like thanksgiving stuffing to us Americans and was delicious when the vin juane sauce was poured over the top.  For dessert an expert apple tarte tatin, a notoriously hard dish to get right and this was the best one I've ever had.  I only wish there had been two scoops of the artisan ice cream, so creamy and tasty.    Servers were running around like crazy and things are far from polished on that end.  Only the person who brought my wine (a great glass of Sancerre) seemed to have everything under control.  The server who brought my chicken missed the pronunciation for the sauce. This is still a pretty new place but I think they could invest more in training the staff.  Also, although the space is pretty the noise level is pretty high.  Definitely check this place out.  There were many Europeans dining there that night and I can see why.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres romantique

UoecjyeljYLj4ibdbszxuA.text: My family and I came for Mother's Day brunch. Like other reviewers have said, it is quite loud. Not so much that it's annoying, but if you're looking for a quiet romantic dinner then it may not be the best place.   The restaurant itself is pretty cool and classy. Dark wood, high ceilings, lowish lighting. Comfortable booth seats.   We started off with steak tartare and the pate. Both were delicious but the tartare especially so. Very flavorful and came with crunchy potato chips. It was a hit. The large order was plenty for the four of us. The pate was good too, but not a must try.   Main courses: steak frites, steakburger, chicken French Dip, and oysters. I got the chicken sandwich. It was very tasty. Chicken tasted fresh and soft. Good bread helped and came with some crispy fries.  The steaks were cooked perfectly. Soft meat and decent flavor. I didn't try the steakburger but it looked great. I had a side of a macaroni and cheese dish which was really well made. Oysters looked fairly standard. All told, the meals were very good, but not mind blowing. Simple good meals with not a lot of frills.   Desserts: apple tart, chocolate macaroon, mille feuille, and lemon meringue tart. The desserts were all excellent, probably the best part of the meal. The apple tart was especially good and had great vanilla ice cream on top. Macaroon was rich, chocolaty, and big. My lemon tart was great, very strong lemon flavor. Definitely worth saving room for dessert here.   Service was decent, not amazing. Prices were okay. Overall a good place to go for fresh food prepared well and not outrageously priced.

bat-qkqheK7-pyhfbDFU5g.text: Chef is the man! He welcomed my party with grand entrance. The kitchen has a great attitude and worked with my dietary restrictions. I would recommend this place as one the top eateries in town!

TLrnx8gaFAz04tSTSint9g.text: My daughter and I went to brunch today and were overwhelmed with the excellent service and excellent food!!!! Our server John Paul was outstanding!!!!! We will surely recommend this restaurant to all our friends!!!! Wonderful atmosphere and amazing food!!!!

XCg4Hw9eLNDaig1eAyCZeA.text: I wanted to try the brunch that was offered at Bardot and I am so glad that I did.  From the moment we entered the establishment, I was impressed.  The decor was tasteful and classy.  The service was friendly and attentive.  We ordered a few items to share.  I recommend doing this so that you can taste all of the deliciousness!  We selected the Pastry Basket, the French Toast, and the French Omelet.  The portions were absolutely huge and we could not finish our food.  The French Toast was massive!  I think that we could have been satisfied with just that one piece to share.  Yet, I was happy we ordered a few different items, as everything was better than expected.  I cannot wait to go back!

CWNExMLBDwo10ptXUQ6DPg.text: The pork chops and truffle mac and cheese are friggin awesome... and Eric at the bar is the best!  Super good food and a cool bar tender... This place kicks @ss!!

ajP-le9400X0LzBOra3_fw.text: Love love the food. Came here for a bachelorette dinner with 11 other ladies. Everything was so scrumptious, but it was just too much food. We could've done a 3 course meal and it would've been more than enough. But I guess it's Vegas, so go big or go home.   1st course consists of family style appetizers: charcuterie board, duck wings a l'orange and escargot Bardot.   2nd- I ordered shrimp cocktail and a friend of mine ordered steak tartare. Normally not a big fan of steak tartare, but this was delicious.   3rd- I got the rack of lamb which just melted in my mouth. It was so so tender and bloody, the way I like my meat.   4th- dessert trio (creme brulee, chocolate macaron and profiteroles)

0Zn86eOLrQAS4esfqZvkAA.text: This place has become a traditional first brunch stop in vegas. Shannon, our waitress yesterday, phenomenal. Attentive and friendly.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0_d6R-l7s9ROeLkMTUrKaQ.text: Stopped in for a late dinner. Jesus our server was incredible. Professional yet very warm. Recommended some delicious dishes and took the experience to the next level.  For starters we did the duck wings a l'orange, escargots bardot, and bone marrow en persillade. All incredible flavors. The sauce for the wings was a perfect sweetness allowing for the wood grilled flavors to still come through combined with a mayonnaise based dipping sauce. Escargots strong as well. Unique dish with each piece wrapped in puff pastry. Bone marrow incredible. Very rich flavors supplemented with grilled bread to balance.   For entrees we did the king crab crepe, rack of lamb frites, and loup de mer ah fenouil (sea bass). Very delicious blend of flavors in the crepe. The crab flavor shines through despite the mix of apple, mushrooms, and egg. Lamb was perfectly tender. Large portions with a perfect mix of flavors. Interesting chickpea fries with spinach and tomato. Sea bass delicious. Light but flavorful. Cooked to perfection.   Dessert we had both the creme brulee and frozen Paris-Brest. Perfect sweetness and unique flavors in the latter. Almost like a fancy donut.   All in all definitely would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen Paris-Brest
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loup de mer au fenouil

5_7LYU1Ex89OK91M78dJwA.text: Amazing food.   We went her for an early dinner last Friday based simply because it was the first result on OpenTable when I was in a pinch to pick a place while on the phone. Boy did we get lucky. Bardot is great.  The bread and salted butter are to die for. I could have these for every meal and die happy (and 400 pounds).  To start i enjoyed the beef tartare which was killer. the potato chips that they provide to put the tartare on were the perfect complement to the nicely seasoned combination of quail egg and beef. Definitely amongst the best raw beef dishes I've ever had, if not the best -- and I love raw beef.  I followed this up with the Loup-de-mare which was fantastic. The fennel combined with the fish made for a perfectly balanced flavor profile and texture with each bite. I loved this so much I finished it in about 5 minutes...well before anyone else finished their meals....I just couldn't control myself.  I highly recommend Bardot and can't wait to come back and try more of the menu...now if Michael Mina would just open a restaurant in Los Angeles proper - Dana Point and Glendale aren't Los Angeles, if they were they wouldn't be in other cities.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tartar
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loud de mar

D6HKNFSYLCJmdnuuOQKiBQ.text: Bardot is such a beautiful restaurant, that we had to give it another try and really glad that we did!!  We went with another couple for a Saturday brunch...and had an absolutely WOW experience!   The Rose was slightly better than the first time - as our glasses were never left empty! I had the Croq Madame again and was perfection! Lobster scramble was good, as was the Croissant benedict. Tried their escargot; I'm not an escargot person but their version wrapped in puff pastry was a nice touch. Also shared their signature item; French Toast! Out of this world...definitely recommend it as a 'dessert' for a group; it's massive for one person!  It's a thick slice of brioche french toast, vanilla mascarpone (outstanding!), almond brittle (delicious!).    Thanks, Bardot, for a fabulous, elegant Brunch experience! We'll be back!

kozJ1PH6JzRqAulV2SJAtg.text: Went here for weekend brunch. Had the French toast, breakfast sandwich, and American in Paris. French toast was amazing. Loved the almond brittle! It was crispy on the outside but soft and custard like on the inside. The breakfast sandwich was ok. Tasted like a giant sausage McMuffin from McDonald's. American in Paris had thick cut bacon that was delicious. Hash browns came with both and were very crispy. I would recommend just note that it's kinda pricey but the potions are generous. The lady who helped us with water and boxes gave great customer service! Didn't really see our waitress except for when she took our order and gave us the bill.

HPFCo0qtRA40QeWlRY37_w.text: BARDOT has become my favorite place to eat in Vegas. The service is great and the food is second to none! I the bartenders here never fail to deliver on what in my opinion is the best old fashioned.   In this occasion I was undecided between a couple entrees so my bartender Gino recommended the Pork Chop and it was amazing! The sear in the pork chop was perfect and kept the inside moist. Pomme pure also on point with a hint of horseradish and together with the Chop is a medley of flavors that can't be beat.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s-Q8wJSJQXMp0GboALgntQ.text: Been a few times on weekend for brunch. Really good stuff! Great pastries, appetizers, unique French-style breakfast selections. Tables a touch on the small side, but booths are ample. Only annoyance: having a reservation, showing up on time, and then still having to wait 10-15 minutes to be seated. Why bother taking reservations if you have to wait every time even with reservation?  Clearly doesn't stop me from coming back though...

QnY5r1EfTLwYX8MVFp1JfQ.text: This restaurant was insanely good. The decor was breathtaking. The escargot and French onion soup were amazing.

9ItXRJFG8G-QA48P-9Pr2w.text: The restaurant has a nice feel of a modern European cafe environment. Everything was gustatory.  Must order.. Prime Steak Tartare, charcuterie board, food grass parfait, escargots Bardot, bone marrow pouvre, Parisian gnocchi, loud de mar Au fenouil, and lastly chocolate cake.

G1RY6jQXxX2EN5tBDp9Prg.text: Had a great drink, burger, and an awesome dessert (Baked Alaska) here with my wife at the bar with great service. Their Sidecar was at 1/2 price (Happy Hour) and was smooth and superb. Paying $21 for a burger might seem extreme but it wasn't here. Their's was ground prime fillet and was perhaps the most juicy burger (and best?) I have ever inhaled. Think of the burger as a half priced steak that happens to be ground. Their Baked Alaska dessert was flamed table side using pineapple cider. The ice cream was smooth and rich, and the banana bread bottom provided a nice contrast to the sweetness of the ice cream. Great stop!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sidecar drink + Prosecco
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible steakburger, fries were perfect

lmmbZlT4GEd0KAC3mR7N0A.text: Best brunch in town! I only wish that every time I dined it was an experience like this. Came in on a Saturday and even though the place was packed, Oscar, our server was very attentive, answered all our questions and his recommendations were perfect. My friend and I got the French Onion soup. It is literally a craving even when it's 100 plus degrees outside. We ended brunch with the Baked Alaska and it was definitely a show stopper that words do not do justice and it tastes even better. A MUST!! We are huge coffee lovers. The latte was so good I had to get it twice. And the cold brew was the best I've had yet. The manager said the chef created the creamer from scratch, you can even see the vanilla beans floating.

0yt2RhLEz06ot_PcZNiFJQ.text: If you're staying in the aria or nearby, highly recommend checking this place out. Brunch was amazing. our server oscar was very professional and friendly, made the whole experience that much better

416jk100MB09fBs3itFF3w.text: Back in Vegas, and as a must eat place when I visit Vegas it has to happen except this time I brought my parents who had never been here.  I would say reservations are a must.  We arrived at 6 and it wasn't all too busy but within the hour the place was hoppin.    I stuck with what I liked, the filet with Roquefort Fondue and black truffle fries.  Now I didn't want to get my hopes all high because it's happened in the past where I'll totally love a steak from someplace and when I go back again the mouth watering taste just isn't the same.  Not this place!  The steak was just as good as I remembered it if not better.  Still the best steak I've ever had.  We also did try the "worlds best butter" too and it was ok...it was nice and creamy and we actually found it better without the salt that it came with.    Thanks again Bardot Brasserie for blowing my tastebuds away.  I will be dragging all my friends and family here to bring them to this food paradise.

eYnxGPn829THSytLtSm0Ow.text: I forgot to check in and take pictures of my food, because we came here for a wedding reception. I gave four stars because it's hard to rate service when you're dealing with a large party.   As for the food, our starters and sides were pre-selected. We had chick-pea frittes (delicious, if you didn't know they were made from chick-peas, you'd think they were French fries.) Steak Tartare (just ok).  For our sides we had green beans and Mac n cheese which they left the plastic wrapping left on it and so I wonder if it's made from scratch or pre-packaged.   We had a choice of entree's from vegetarian pasta, pork chop (it looked delicious), chicken, and flat iron steak. We selected the steak and it was really good, very tender but the demi glaze (aka gravy) made it even better.   Dessert was an Espresso creme brulee and needless to say, mine got demolished. Not super sweet and it didn't have the eggy, custard taste to it, which made it different from the usual creme brulee.   I love French cuisine, so if I had the opportunity to explore their more exquisite French options, I'd give it a try.

QpdL2qFz8R3VSEzydXuHfw.text: inedible.   Made the mistake of coming here for lunch. The staff/head chef are obviously phoning it in for lunch.   The $36 prefix was a small bowl of cold soup, a freezer burned overcooked dried out entree (that was either made days before or directly out of a Swanson frozen dinner box of 24 from Costco). Additionally there was an uninspired dessert square stamped out of pure sugar. My sense is they setup a lunch assembly line construct-o-matic meals that untrained staff could shovel out to the lunchtime rush. Obviously a tourist trap recipe. Aria should be ashamed and my respect/trust for this casino has been greatly diminished.

cmzUcWA79RYEHaN9VZOLLg.text: This review is for their happy hour menu which is on point. The quality of the ingredeints shine and you get what you pay for. In a hoity toity hotel and a high end restaurant, this is quite hard to come by. The service was excellent and, for a family of four dressed in casual wear, we were treated no different than the business suits sitting a table next to us.  The highlights include the baguette with salted butter that our family ate with joy. Yes its complimentary but its darn good too.  We ordered the poutine, the beef tartare, and three different tartines. Everything was good, but my favorite was the beef tartine. Reduced in red wine and served on a crispy tartine, they crack a hella fresh egg in top and what you get is pure awesomeness.  I don't get the opportunity to eat at an establishment like this, but when im glad that my experience here was a good one.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happiest of hours

GlvzeJr5EYxldhCLCIWBYw.text: Shannon was an absolute delight and made our evening outstanding!! The Chef was out of this world amazing and I highly recommend the fete' Royale

jGVtjvOklxBO_Ho4JFKoVQ.text: Overhyped brunch. The sweets were delicious. Everything else was nothing to write home about.

SZ5WHBEapR7X0NwUwsJDQw.text: I had been drooling over the menu for weeks before our Vegas trip and was so looking forward to the brunch experience. There were three in our party and we opted for the bottomless Rose and this was a bright spot, as the Rose was very good. Order: Escargots Bardot, Nutella Sticky Bun, Truffle Fries, French Toast, Double Decker Ham and Brie, Croissant Benedict with Short Rib. Two best items were the fries and sticky bun - both were really really good and I'd recommend as a must have. The escargots had a weird texture (mushy) and a TON of garlic - and I'm a fan of garlic. We only ate a few because they were so off putting. The French Toast had a weird flavor, a bit over done and was definitely not rave worthy.  Double decker ham and Brie was dry and the flavor profile was not as anticipated. The croissant Benedict was very disappointing - very little hollandaise and the croissant was overdone. I'm writing this as someone who really enjoys food and has enjoyed versions of each of the items ordered from other restaurants, and this just didn't live up to the hype or my expectations at all. :(

Qfl1bC73GltHbCF3C5Lxuw.text: I can always count on Bardot to make my celebrations extra special. I've been for two of my birthdays, Valentine's Day, and brought my mom for her birthday, and each time I leave feeling like memories were created that everyone will always remember. The service staff goes above and beyond to ensure that you never need water, another cocktail, or have an empty plate in front of you. They are both professional and personable when interacting with you which of course ups the experience.   While I think I prefer going for dinner over brunch, I love the vibes given off during the day time. French pastries with amazing coffee, bottomless rose, and entrees like benedicts served on croissants and lobster scrambles-- how could you possibly not have a good time?   On my last experience our server Shannon took excellent care of us, and when I accidentally knocked over a wine glass *cringe* I was immediately asked if I was okay, and that it would be taken care of ASAP. The manager Gerti stopped by and also made sure that everyone was enjoying themselves and having a good time. I can't commend the staff at Bardot highly enough.

DXeQDfI4meRH3sUr7VOGjA.text: Wow.  Big ups to my girls for trying this place with me but what a disappointing venture. We rocked up a bit late hoping for brunch ...But it was over at 3. However, what we were not told was that dinner service starts at 5 but orders could start at 430p.m. So, we could have just started with our cheese platter and drinks!!!. What???? Anyhow, service was exceptionally sub-par on Saturday March 23 from the front staff to the bar staff.  I asked for an espresso with one shot of milk . The dude gives me a deconstructed flat white with one shot espresso and cold milk on the side. Right. It took him ages to prep that and the other drinks.  Then, we waited about 25 mins just to get the cheese platter..which was good but at that point the neuroglycopenia ( hanger) kicked in. And we saw they were taking dinner orders.  Poor service for sure.

plYKZRJaIUrtZGotO3-mrQ.text: Experience was disappointing. Was super excited for this dinner. Wished I had gone to Nobu like my friend suggested since we were already at Caesar's. But I was adamant as there was a list I had to try at Bardot. First I had mentioned that I detest chives and scallions. And guess what... chives sprinkled all over. Bartender tried to tell me maybe it's parsley... really... then when we paid, I looked at the check and found that a few dishes had the wrong price on it. Instead of apologizing, the manager was like. Oh yeah the prices were different from Saturday. Yeah today is Monday, you should just "do your job" like check all the prices on the POS system before your shift. Also did not acknowledge my friends bday...   dining room was beautiful. Wish service and food was better and we would have tried the Wellington which looked super good!!! Foie was itself was good. 2 stars for the beautiful room

qR9VoOoQbZYw_JFViFlwGA.text: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night before clubbing with my girlfriend. We were greeted fairly quickly by our server, who was awesome.  I ordered a sidecar to start, but it had too much lemon juice and made the cocktail pretty sour.  We like to order several appetizers instead of entrees so we can nibble on things while we drink. The french onion soup is the best I've had. Perfectly balanced and not salty. The charcuterie board featured a delicious pate and pork rillette that you can spread on the nice pieces of toast that they provide. Be warned, however, there is no cheese on the board... you have to order that separately,  The beef tartare was very good, but I feel like it needed some earthiness of truffles or truffle oil. The potato chips were a bit too salty for my taste as well. The lobster thermidor was excellent, although a bit pricey. The pop tarte flambe was also an awesome dish, with cream and cheese oozing out.  For dessert, we ordered the dessert trio, which consists of chocolate macaron, a cheesecake napoleon, and creme brulee. When it arrived at our table we noticed that we received four different kinds of dessert. The last one was a small beignet looking pastry that was fluffy and delicious.  Overall, we had a great dining experience. Food was excellent and the service was even better. Had to knock off a star for the sidecar being too sour, and also for the table we were seated at for being too small for the dishes we ordered.  Dinner here is more superb than their brunch in my opinion.

TkqxGXx82n-spq78d1TvuA.text: One of the many great Aria restaurants.  One of my favorite pastimes is to sit at the bar for cocktails and snacks.  The bar is lovely, and you can be casual at the bar...no dressing up is necessary. Service at the bar is top notch.  Cocktails are artfully prepared and the wine list is very French.  The bartenders are also super cool and fun to chat with. The Midnight in Paris cocktail is super bright and refreshing.  Perfect on warm Vegas days.  The frites are delicious and come with a garlicky aioli.  The steak tartare is also solid. If you want to do an Aria crawl, I suggest cocktails and snacks at each of the bars throughout the resort.  Carbone is just across the way, but I've never been to Jean-Georges.  Julian Serrano, Catch, and Sage are downstairs.  I've never been interested in Herringbone.  It's the coolest way to dine around Aria during a short trip.

Zjbydu0vzzmOp-4kLY8D5g.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas   Very convenient location, easy to find. Nice service good environment and nice food

RiDYo4wPVVulSl6murHEuA.text: Amazing decor and the food is pretty but just wasn't good and expensive. I saw the French toast on Food Network's Best Thing I Ever Ate as recommended by Scott Conant and noticed the stellar reviews on Yelp so had to try it out.   Ordered:  World's best butter Good butter... but not that much better than the free butter. Not worth the cost at all for $5/each. It should just be a $2 upgrade option at most. Complimentary bread is good.   Nutella sticky bun If you like nutella then go for it but wouldn't recommend since it can spoil your appetite, especially if you're going to have the French toast.  French toast It looks spectacular and tastes more like bread pudding than traditional French toast, very eggy and not too sweet. I definitely had higher expectations. Though, I think I would've enjoyed it a lot more if it wasn't for the Nutella sticky bun. It's definitely the best looking French toast I've ever ate.   Maine lobster scramble Horrible, literally just tasted like scrambled eggs with some herbs, spinach and cheese thrown in. Was very bland, a couple bits of overcooked lobster meat. Arguably the worst brunch item I've ever had, especially for $30.  Truffle fries I would come back just to order this to-go.   Herb hash browns This was good, well seasoned and huge portions but gets heavy quick.  Captain's Shandy Very refreshing  Probably one the most expensive and worst brunch I've had, which is unfortunate because I was really excited about this restaurant. The best things were the bread, sides and drink.

YjpKFyXOkSHe9Pi_bsgRAg.text: This place was solid! It lived up to the hype and we were all utterly satisfied. The delicious mix of flavors were doing cartwheels in our mouths! The ambiance brings me back to our Paris-travels.  Totally legit!   The reason I couldn't give it a 5-star was the service. Our waiter, Oscar seemed uninterested with us. No eye contact, no smile, no life. It almost felt like he was annoyed with serving us. Our party of 4 spent nearly $250 with tip, I think we deserve a little smile :) just saying....

44KDC19_mrdWE3pMifTO8w.text: Michael Mina presents a spectacular brunch in a gorgeous setting. I'm not even brunch person yet Bardot got me hooked into coming back twice in 1 month from Los Angeles! I also love that they offer Everlasting bottomless rose for a proper boozy brunch.  Standouts: Kushi oysters, King Crab & Endive Salad, Prime Steak Tartare, Double Decker Ham & Brie, Chocolate Macaron, and the Nutella Sticky Bun. For Sides I recommend the Hand Cut Truffle Fries over the salad or hash brown.  Decent: Croissant Benedicts, Le Steakburger, Bardot Salad, French Toast, French Omelette  Skip: Bardot Breakfast Sandwich (Muffin was so hard we could not cut with a knife), Hearth Baked Quiche, and Seasonal Fruit.  I can't wait to return for dinner and try more of the menu!

q85BADeVKZ9YkhszxjcEVw.text: Inside the Aria hotel. French inspired brunch place on the second level.  I actually like the place.  The service was good, so I was impressed even for a backwards cap hoodie wearing guy. Everyone else was more smart casual. Confused me a little but whatever.   Ok, the scrambled eggs are great. Honestly they are. I got the steak and eggs. Wasn't impressed with steak so I'm gonna pass on that. We also tried the shrimp and egg scramble and that was really good.  Really enjoyed this place. I would come back.
