v6meipcftae_yB4jlEn4jQ.text: During our recent stay at Aria we chose Bardot Brasserie as our restaurant for the evening. It was a wonderful dining experience and what I believe to be a highly underrated restaurant. We made reservations for 7:30pm and were promptly seated in a cozy, intimate corner at a table for two.The restaurant and bar area certainly carry the French vibe I was accustomed to during my travels in France.  Our server was very helpful and professional. We started off with a Hennessy based cocktail which was delicious (and dangerous) while looking at the menu. Everything we picked was great.  We started off with a Charcuterie Board consisting of prosciutto di parma, french dry salame, country pate, pork rillettes. I know many cringe at the sheer thought of pate, but it was one of my favorites growing up in Europe. Everything on the board was consumed with sheer satisfaction, and possibly un lady like urgency (I was hungry)! We also shared Octopus a la Basquaise featuring wood grilled spanish octopus, tarbais beans, chorizo escabechebanyuls vinegar, espelette chili, saffron rouille. This was another decadent dish which was light yet packed flavor. I also had french onion soup which is hands down the best french onion soup I've had to date (and I've had many).   Another lighter yet delicious selection was King Crab and Endive salad with Belgian endive, parmesan cheese, caper aioli, herbed bread crumbs. I could not believe how something that in theory sounds possibly bland was so refreshing and flavorful. We topped off our selections with Wagyu Wellington for two which was amazing but I don't remember too much as food coma (and those darn delicious cocktails) were starting to set in by this point. The bill was very reasonable taking into account the quantity and quality of the dishes sampled. I would go back and recommend this restaurant in a heartbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab endives salad
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most delicious French onion soup ever

SA5U7yT90qBe1zr9hmW4dQ.text: Bardot Brasserie has been on my list of places to try for a while now, and I was finally able to check it off on my most recent trip to Vegas.  Bardot had a really nice interior - perfect for that classy meal.  We started with the Octopus a la Basquaise and had the Loup de Mer Provencal and Scallops Veronique for our entrees.  I also tried a little bit of the Beef Wellington.  Dessert was the Baked Alaska.  Everything was perfectly cooked and presented.  The tableside prep was pretty cool too - they carved the Beef Wellington (which was huge, btw) and set the Baked Alaska on fire for you right next to the table.  Service was outstanding.  Our waitress was friendly, able to answer all our questions, and was on top of making sure we had everything we needed.

leDtVpvOlM9vq_U0FmWx4g.text: Great happy hour for oysters! We sat at the bar and the staff was super great! We e fed up with oysters and the steak tartar-both amazing!  Definitely a place to check out for happy hour. We would have stayed but we had reservations at Catch!

dR_O8_ifx5z92C6cHeahJQ.text: Very beautiful inside and attentive service. That's pretty much it. I recommend you go there for a drink and the pictures and leave. Definitely do not go for brunch. Overpriced and the food wasn't good. The bread they bring out at the start was literally the only thing I liked. My friend was deeply disappointed by her sandwich as was I with my French toast. I didn't even eat 1/4 of it. It had a weird taste, I think it was the glaze.

U0PQC9GU8bg226y2mh1GMQ.text: What do you do when Carbone doesn't have any availability but you're hungry and you see a gorgeous brasserie just across the way that, while empty, looks stunning, but boasts a fancy pants menu that may be a little too sophisticated than what you had in mind for dinner? You post up at their bar for a drink and then get lured in by the very friendly bartenders and the "world's best butter" as an amuse bouche until you figure out your next plan of attack!  Had a lovely time chatting with the bartenders and munching on their fluffy but at the same time dense bread (that accompanied said superfluous condiment) and beef tartare. I had a different image in mind for the "world's best butter," and while the presentation was fancy, it wasn't anything more than something you'd find at a diner (if that butter got into the closet of a royal for a night and decided to play dress up). The accompanying salt was my favorite part. And, to be perfectly honest, the bread was a standout on its own. The tartare was executed to perfection. The light, airy chips flanking it were a delight, but more decoration than a substantial vessel for the beef . I preferred lathering the tartare on to the bread. Did I mention I really loved the bread?  Fantastic service, great tunes, and a lively atmosphere once things picked up (clearly these bartenders are favorites amongst guests, as they drew a crowd of regulars) round out the opulent aesthetic and great bar program.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;World&#39;s best butter&#34;

qkIPnCRaO_VZxBMLYQACjg.text: There's no denying it is delicious. There's is also no denying it's strip expensive. I ordered the Hunter waffles and boy was it heavy. Rich, savory and dinner just right, but stuck to your gut. I don't mean that as a deterrent, just to note. Anyways, with the waffles, it only comes with two quarters of a waffle which made me sad. If no one else orders that dish, what happens to the other half of my waffle? Wasted? Goes cold and soggy waiting for the next order? You should just give it to me.

OqErJeJUPzwf8buFAKYURw.text: I came here to celebrate a dear friend's birthday on 3/9/19.   AMBIENCE:  Excellent. Beautiful brasserie style restaurant. Comfortable seating and nice dim lighting and great decorations.  FOOD: Excellent. Ordered the duck whereas my dining companion ordered the scallops both were excellent. For dessert I ordered espresso creme brulee which was excellent. My friend ordered an apple type dish that was quite large.  SERVICE:  Our waitress was great. Her name escapes me but her wine suggestions were EXCELLENT and she was accommodating, thoughtful and answered all of our questions. It was her birthday recently as well and she was super sweet and even brought out a little candle with my friend's dessert.   I come to Vegas at least 1x a year and if staying at the Aria again would definitely opt to eat here again for a nice, elegant dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

JW8SJ0tsTLWMG0FTrXOw-Q.text: I made sure to make a brunch reservation for Bardot Brasserie for my weekend trip in Vegas after seeing all the posts from my friends on Instagram.  Great ambiance w/ high ceilings, it feels like you're at a fancy restaurant in France!! Excellent service too, since the tables are small the waiters make sure to pay attention to you to take away used plates, etc.  The food on the other hand, was not so remarkable.  Nutella Sticky Bun - This was pretty good, but probably because it was the first thing I had and I was pretty hungry. It's a warm cinnamon bun with nutella! Can't go wrong with that :)  Omelette - This was meh....I can probably make a better omelette at home myself. I don't think we even finished it.  Avocado Benedict - It was my first time trying an avocado benedict so I have to say this is definitely worth a try if you're a fan of avocado like I am.  Everything is overpriced in Vegas so that was expected. I left the place feeling pretty full, but I guess my expectations were too high.

M5VnJROUczkhDLy3_CYiaQ.text: I can't believe I waited so long to dine here...best decision to make a finally make a visit! We were a party of 6 celebrating a birthday and immediately upon arrival we were greeted by our server, Shannon, who was already recommended drinks and offered to answer any questions. I ordered the bottomless rose offered on brunch on Saturday's (best bang for your buck!). My glass was never half pass empty.   Shannon made herself available to questions on the menu and made honest recommendations. We tasted almost about everything for starters: escargot, steak tartare, pastrami cures salmon, their delicious charcuterie board, and an assortment of breakfast pastries and breads with their famous French butter.   I opted for the Hunter's Waffle and substituted scrambled eggs since I am not a fan of poached eggs, and also we had a couple of plates to shared of the French toast (I am not lying when I say this has to be the most delicious French toast I've had so far in my life).   For dessert we had an assortment of their chocolate cakes and their famous baked Alaska.   Shannon was a delightful the whole time and made our experience (a lot of us dining here for the first time) unforgettable. I would definitely recommend their brunch and would love to divulge in their dinner menu!

92W5_RW_hovLYVQDNoi7bg.text: 4.5 stars.  A stunning bar just past the entrance with one of the better happy hours in all of the Strip ($7 sidecars all day !!). Though admittedly the HH menu is limited to the bar area only.  Our group of 6 did both the happy hour and dinner last Friday night.    As for dinner, all three main dishes were a hit.  Especially the double cut pork chops and rack of lamb.  Honorary mention to the chicken roti. The seared foie gras appetizer was delicious though I was less enthusiastic about the beet and goat cheese one.  Throw in tasty warm bread and butter, and you can easily get your high-quality fare and fill here.    Service was just about right and I look forward to coming back to Bardot to try out other dishes in the near future.

Fqe9YdDVbdMMCyGeA3fM1A.text: Very, very good.  - Very nice space.  Open and not too loud - Service was excellent.  Attentive and knowledgeable - The charcuterie board, especially the chicken liver pate which was rich, smooth, and had a nice bite - The cheese board was excellent.  A nice hard goat and a semi-stinky soft cheese were both full of flavor and went very nicely with the marmalade and pears - The lamb was perfectly cooked.  I didn't like the vegetable puree and would probably had it prepared a little differently to better bring out the lamb flavor - The bouillabaisse was off the charts good.  Very rich and the seafood was perfectly cooked

hkHhBuavzAP7C1oKPhcE8g.text: I enjoyed the appetizer and dessert the most here. There are too many other places you can go for good, fresh oysters so I won't mention that here. Having said that, all chocolate lovers must try their CHOCOLATE MACARON (french chocolate cookie and valrhona chocolate mousse). This dessert for the win!!!

q0RzmBjJHz-Wg_cH5v_wPA.text: My guy and I are not the "fancy type" but we appreciate great food that a lot of thought has been put into.  We have been here twice and they have never disappointed-great food, great wines, great wait staff and wonderful atmosphere!  We love dressing up and coming here for a nice evening out.  Never are we rushed and always are we taken very well care of.  Not cheap, but not as pricy as some of the other equally top notch nice restaurants on the strip.  Great value and makes always for one of our most memorable nights out!

q2MMoGpgH2B5MIm0Jsxf_Q.text: Wife and I stopped here for lunch - had a great meal.  It is quiet at lunch time and the food was fantastic!!

3AGsqEOaz73RtPT-ByzazA.text: 5am. Cant sleep. Might as well drop a constructive review!  By far, my favorite was:  FOIE GRAS PARFAIT w/ ruby port gelee, grilled country bread- I want to return just for this (we ordered both this & the SEARED FOIE GRAS). If you are not fond of foie gras w strong liver taste, this is the smoothest foie gras paired perfectly w sweet jam-like gelee, spread on a toasty country bread. If anything, their bread will make everything taste better. One of the best ive ever had.   ONION SOUP GRATINEE w/ cave-aged gruyere - Whatever happens in the cave stays in the c...heese??  I like restaurants that champion in their basics. You cant (or you shouldnt) go wrong w french onion soup in a french restaurant. *drool drool*  big enough to share for two.  I also had BONE MARROW AU POIVRE, but too greasy for my taste.. Maybe the onion jam will make it bearable. -------------------------------------  Honestly, was kinda full from appetizers and their killer country bread (beware!) but must finish review.  For Entrees/ Sides, we had:  BOUILLABAISSE MARSEILLAISE  SPINACH/ CHEESE SOUFFLE (daily special) - dont really know what this is supposed to taste like - it was like a bland pudding.. I was envisioning something like a spinach-cheese dip in taste, but not even close. You had me at.... souffle.... My soul is crying..  20 oz. dry-aged bone-in ribeye w bearnaise sauce 8 oz. filet mignon  Hmm, I guess you can't go wrong with steak.. But I think I liked the ribeye better. Honestly I need to return to rate the entrees again.. Good night.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20oz dry aged ribeye
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Cheese Souffle... Wanna cry it was pretty bad..
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Foie Gras w lentils

xxvjr3yX6HXHHd1i1yRK6A.text: I am a huge fan of Bardot for dinner and believe they offer one of the best, if not the best Brunch in Las Vegas. I was informed of a special dinner where they flew in a renowned Chef from the UK (Calum Franklin) to team up with their Executive Chef (who has also won awards) to prepare a special feast that what seemed to me was a meal fit for the royal family. It was my best meal I've had all year with a wine pairing that fit perfect. Desserts were presented to share and everyone couldn't believe their eyes and how they scaled up the portions. An outstanding sold out event and can't wait for the next one!

LYmaRd5RFjPUtaRR1hNWCA.text: I LOVED it here.  We came here for brunch and it certainly did not disappoint. The only minor complaint would be a bit of a wait even though we had reservations but it was no biggie.   My husband and I were celebrating our birthdays and we received a cute card signed by the staff. Everything on the menu looked great and we had a hard time deciding what to get. We ended up getting the onion soup, the french toast, and a short rib benedict.   The service was great, and the food was delicious. My favorite was definitely the french toast. It was huge and we couldn't finish but I probably would order it again if I ever return. The onion soup was also amazing.   I would love to come back to try more things on the menu and bring friends/family too.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French pastries!

JSFQlxM35PqA8r-qldygiw.text: We wanted a great brunch location so we googled top rated restaurants, Bardot was the top and they did not disappoint. Delicious meal and cappuccino.

SSK3kO8zUPSSSuiEgx1WlQ.text: Bardot is a beautiful restaurant and feel really french. Tried the crab crepe, escargot, oignon soup and everything was good. I think my favorite was the oignon soup. For the entree, we all tried the rack of lamb and everybody loved jt. For dessert, baba au rhum and apple tart tartin. I did really like the apple tart tatin and was a little bit disappointed by the baba au rhum. The service was great. We actually got a french server named clementine who really took good care of us

Lb8cO1M0TirkWEsaUIG7NA.text: This place is very sexy, very French.    Dinner food was pretty good.  I only tried some smaller plates.  King crab crepe was delicious.  Onion soup was comme ci, comme ca.  Frisee salad was overdressed and the bacon (lardons) were hard.  Brunch food was meh - the beef bourguignon croissant benedict was terrible - ou est le boeuf?  Service was apathetic, Parisian even?  Prices were high.

5B4GanhKkgDw5j1EmqsY7w.text: Went here with my girlfriends recently.  It is a beautiful restaurant!  The highs?  Great ambiance, beautiful bar and clean bathroom.  Most of our food was goodish, decently prepared.  The lows ?  We were seated at an awful table near the place the waiters enter their orders to the kitchen and replenish silverware.  The waitstaff was constantly running back there and it was distracting and unpleasant.  Our server forgot to place our order to the kitchen for the charcuterie board we ordered.  One drink was not delivered.  When we finally received the charcuterie board it was disappointing and not as balanced as we would have hoped.  Also someone ordered something like a pate parfait and it was very odd tasting.  Overall, while a beautiful space, we would not recommend or return to Bardot Brasserie.  Giada's was pretty good though!

0jz_CG0L9eeXASmOFZi6fQ.text: So amazing. Best brunch ever. Has the lobster scramble, breakfast sandwich, and smoked salmon.

GPjn6joCdZj8UrhGNdjjQg.text: Great food!  Came here with a party of 12 and they immediately brought over the Sommelier to give us some wine recommendations.  The somme was very accommodating for our red/white wine choices.  I split the red-eye (medium) with the surf and turf and they brought it out pre-split.  The sides were really good.  Loved the bread and the Lobster bisque was pretty big.  The only thing I would ding them on is it took a long time for them to refill our drinks.  Aside from that, the steak tasted great and the crab was awesome.

QSchBEE706A0iNHcL7-Y0A.text: The best Mac and cheese I've had EVER!!! And the steak was good too. But the Mac and cheese is the reason I'll be going back for. The service can be quite slow. They really REALLY take their time with the food. Waited almost an hour just to get the appetizers and they forgot about our Mac and cheese! So we got the Mac and cheese when we were almost done with our meal but once I had a bite of that Mac, mmmmmm mmmmmm Mmmmm Mmmm mmmmm~ we forgot all about the wait. It was that good!!!!! Go try the Mac and cheese. Delicious!!  We also had the oysters, foie gras parfait, French onion soup, and my friends had the chicken, the gnocchi and filet mignon and they were all delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Mac and cheese ever!!!!

pnItHTd5pk_SQmkzID3B4w.text: Amazing night! Shannon was the best server a person could have. We had the chefs choice menu and it was unreal!  Thanks again Shannon!!

PtShSV7anNGOF-fQFahYPw.text: Bonjour Bardot.  Your food better be pretty darn good because I may need to finance this meal. And did you live up to expectation? Unfortunately for my wallet but fortunately for my belly, yes!    Sharing is caring so I got to sample several appetizers and entrees.  For starters, we tried the charcuterie platter ($27).  It was good; nothing too special.  The escargots bardot ($17 for six) were a bit disappointing because I thought the pastry shell and chartreuse butter overpowered the texture and flavor of the escargots.  The foie gras parfait was one of our favorites!  It was very smooth and delicate.  The port gelee's sweetness helped balance its earthy flavor.  For entrees, I shared the herb crusted Alaskan cod and pork chop with my sister. Both were perfectly cooked and delicious. You can tell they brine their chops.  I also tried my cousin's sea bass and immediately understood why it's one of the signature dishes. D#@$% was that fish delicious.  Too bad we didn't offer to split our entrees with her too! Lol.  Oh, if you're a wine enthusiast, you will be happy to know that they offer an impressive collection.  But, it's not uncommon to see bottles of wine being sold in the four to five digit range.  I wonder if they run your credit card before you're allowed to order a $30K bottle?  Even though we enjoyed one of their bottles with "value," there weren't many options under $200 to choose from! :)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras, pork chop, escargot, sea bass, and cod. Yummy!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out these prices! Wowzee!

_1eJTydf_JqC4sD_wPxsig.text: It was out first time to eat brunch at Bardot and it was definitely not the last time! We live in LA and came for a long weekend. And I wanted to eat something special. We got a table for 4 and had to change it to a table for 6 because two more friends had been on their way. The waiter was very kind and reseated us. When we arrived the server introduced himself (Oscar) and brought out fresh baguette with delicious butter. I had asked for gluten free bread but they didn't have any. It was totally fine. Oscar said he would get it for me if I knew of a place that served it in the Aria hotel but I didn't. What a super nice thing to do!!! Well, Oscar managed to actually get me some gluten free warm toast and came back a couple minutes later! WOW! Amazing and kind service! Thank you Oscar, you left an impression! Lovely to see when people love their job and service people so amazingly.  Delicious coffee and lobster scramble was amazing! Couldn't have been happier and fuller walking out of this place!

-2sxeYFv1e0MCU8ctwdtnQ.text: Croque madame. It was made with wonder bread or something that looked and tasted like it! They had such good bread here and this is the bread they used to make it! are you kidding me?!?!?!  The bread otherwise was great...steak was great.....but come on.

guuByFEQS_J4D_caBkdpNw.text: Yes, Yes and YES!! We tried all the starters there  Nothing but perfect. A bit pricy but worth any dime.  Do yourself a favor and don't go with a standard burger there and try some more brave plates...   5/5 !!!!!

B2WTCFckZdQZV-H6uk9WHQ.text: We went for dinner after a show and had a nice meal. We took a dozen oysters which were well presented and tasty. The rack of lamb was just ok with dried polenta. The mussels were well seasoned. Overall service was efficient and courteous. There are better French places in Vegas to enjoy.

c-ezfxklIO5Pf6zqFQFdYQ.text: We came in a group, and we were all looking forward to the Happy Hour Menu.  We were told that they scrapped the Happy Hour Menu except for some drinks.  However, they did honor the menu when we acted disappointed.  But the whole thing was disappointing, anyway.  They scrapped the Skate Wings entirely which I wanted to try. The wait staff did not have their act together.  A friend and I ordered 3 items (escargots, roasted bone marrow, and duck wings), and we got served only one until we told them two were missing.  They did serve them and we got to eat after everyone else had finished theirs. The bone marrow was okay but the other two looked like they were done in a hurry. The only saving grace was the Apple Tart Tantin which took a while because they make it from scratch.  Now that was excellent!  But dessert does not a French restaurant make! No, I will not recommend this restaurant nor will I come back. Note that the tip percentage is already included in the bill.

UN9kMMh8SWQVUf8dwAj5TA.text: I came here for brunch and had the hunter's waffle. It was excellent. The waffle was crispy and delicious. The service staff was friendly and attentive, and the price was reasonable (for aria).

iVCZyXpH2AN5bVuXVu9q0g.text: Growing up in the Restaurant Industry, I fault myself for setting ridiculous expectations only to have the majority of them never met.  My second trip to Bardot Brasserie left me full of humble pie.  We originally had a "not-so-great" experience our first time around, so we are usually very hesitant to dining with an establishment where the service and food were not hitting the usual marks.  However, I decided to give this venue another chance due to the outstanding reputation Michael Mina has as well as the fact that the GM, Roberto Liendo, personally reached out to me.   To have a restaurant succeed in Las Vegas, you need not only quality food, but a quality team upholding the standards that you strive to set and keeping such talent is often hard in a competitive market like Las Vegas.  Our meal started w/ a pleasant (and not ordered) surprise as we were sat.  The Sommelier quickly approached and poured a flute with Rose Champagne.  It wasn't overly sweet or dry champagne so it was perfect to wet our appetite for things to come.  Our Server Nicholas, came over right away with menus and seemed like he wrote them himself because of his innate ability to recall every preparation and ingredient in each dish.  Since Nicholas was so in tune with the menu, I went with my go-to methodology and let him decide what I was going to eat.  There are times where your server will push the "special of the day" if it's about to turn or priced a certain way to aid the bottom line/gouge the customer, however this was not the case.  He started us off with an order of the King Crab Crepe (buckwheat crepe, wild mushrooms and a Normandy beurre blanc) and a Tarte Flambee (flatbread w/ caramelized onions, gruyere, bacon lardons).  If there were only two dishes you can order at your next dining experience here, make these two the ones you choose.  The Crepe was stuffed w/ just the right amount of crab and the sauce was not too creamy or overpowering.  The pairing was spot on.  The Tarte Flambee can have its own review.  Bacon Lardons, nuff said.  We finished w/ an order of the Loup De Mer (European Seabass) and the Heritage Chicken Roti.  Normally, I don't order Chicken at restaurants since I can cook a mean bird, however I wasn't the one making the order.  So challenge accepted.  This chicken dish was out of this world.  It came with a side of mushroom & leek bread pudding that really needs to be added to the regular menu as a side as they would sell out each night because it's that irresistible.  I was informed by Nicholas that the secret of this dish is that the chicken is brined to keep it so moist prior to cooking.  The Loup de Mer was lightly grilled so the skin was a bit crispy but overall another winning dish.  If this meal taught me one thing, it was that you can't always trust first impressions.  I'm glad we gave this venue another look as the meal from start to finish, along w/ the hospitality shown by Roberto Liendo and his team was what most Restaurants should strive to achieve.  Can't wait to go back.

c6zhJNfaYxlDKcEQsyv2Ow.text: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful dinner last month at Bardot the day after Valentine's for our 5th Anniversary. Not only is the location beautiful, but the food is also not so bad, you can never go wrong at a French Brasserie! Our reservation was at 8pm, we arrived early and noticed they had Happy Hour from 5-7pm so we sat in the bar and lounge area and enjoyed some small bites and a drink. We enjoyed the Oysters, Tuna TarTare, Steak TarTare, Skate Wing, Bone Marrow, and my favorite small dish was the Duck Wings A' L'Orange, yum! The hostess was very sweet and took us to our table early and the table was absolutely gorgeous set up with rose pedals. This was such a perfect way to start an anniversary dinner. When this restaurant used to be American Fish we surprisingly had the same server as we did this time at Bardot. It was very nice to see that Michael Mina kept on some of the staff from the previous restaurant. Our server's name is Jamison, he was fantastic; this visit as well as the last visit. He was very kind and knowledgable he gave us a great list of suggestions for our meal:  French Onion Soup Gratinee--make sure to add the truffle, OXTAIL, and soft poached egg. Salad Course: Frisee salad with bacon and poached egg. Entrees: I had the Ora King Salmon with lentils and a smoked tomato vinaigrette. My boyfriend had the Pork Chop that came with a horseradish potato, very strong on the horseradish.. Sides: Green Beans and Macaroni Gratinee (normally I would not order any macaroni dish out at dinner, but I'm glad we got it, because the presentation is so creative, each noodle sits straight up and came as a square block, really impressive.  Dessert: There is ALWAYS room for dessert! My boyfriend's mother is french and one of his favorite past times is when his mom would prepare her famous Apple Tarte Tatin from scratch.....so of course we tried it. Very tasty and the individual serving size is a great way to present this dessert. Also, we ordered the Coupe Glacee {{fancy words}} which was ice cream and sorbets. Our night ended with a beautiful pink rose handed to me, they were a special take home for Valentine's weekend!  The only thing that really bothered us during our meal was that we were sitting at a booth closer to the kitchen and the chef kept tapping on his bell for the food runners to come back. It was fantastic that the kitchen staff was not loud and we couldn't hear any silverware or plates touching each other, but the bell was reallyyy annoying! How about tapping the bell once? Or perhaps just hiring one or two more runners so the guests do not have to hear the bell and see the chef laughing after hitting it 12 times in a row! Other than that, great spot, love the remodeling, and ask for Jamison, you will be in good hands!

tjN2q-N9vvTcXwQ9LjNeUQ.text: I have only been here for brunch.  They have amazing bread!  I could just eat their bread + bacon and be happy.  Also, ordered the hunter's waffle (good but not great) and the french toast (huge + sweet).  I will be back to try other items!

9rb8U-tjlAnswqgsluSi8Q.text: We had Happy Hour at the bar on Sunday 4/2/17.  The drinks were very good, and the French 75 was notable.  We had Oysters, which were good but not great. The reason we will come back is for the Tartines.  We had both the Bouef Bourguinon and the Avocado Tartines.  We had never tried Tartines before, but have found a new favorite appetizer.  The bartender was friendly, professional, attentive and very good at offering advice on what was good.

70XxkRVjRKQ1TRCkguVjTQ.text: Again fantastic service.  Great wines. The Anjou was brilliant. The marsanny amazing.   Lillian was top notch!!!   The beet and goat cheese.  Yummy!!!!    Again thank you!!!!!

R0EUQosdUELNm173k-C3uQ.text: French toast lived up to the hype which is not easy. All other dishes were as good and the coffee from lamill was a fantastic. Service spot on too. Well done.

lifxSOV20uZ-LrTpezIt4A.text: First of all the bartenders here are amazing! The service was great and my meal was perfect. Highly recommend dessert here as well.

H9jdpcWPYmRwY9aO6fsAYQ.text: Chick pea fries! Delicious. Beautiful dining room, excellent service. French onion soup, shellfish tower, steak frites, and the escargot in puff pastry were all very good, but the chick pea fries were the highlight. Also, the best bread basket in Vegas!

tn7EtBCe2DEdjkkqFe4cTQ.text: Service was very slow but the food was pretty good. One couple next to us walked out without being served.  My husband had to wait until after I got my soup to get his beer.The onion soup was hot and gratin was perfect. My husband was disappointed in his filet - both quality and execution. The chicken roti was nicely done although I would have put the lemon sauce on the bottom.  Serving it on top took away from the crispness of the skin. The savory mushroom bread pudding DID need a sauce badly. Overall the restaurant was okay but overpriced for the value and service.

9CJSFjg_K4_MojQw6UgZTw.text: Epic fail.   We had reservations for 745 and we weren't seated til about 820.  We had plenty of time to study the menu and ordered immediately.   Here it is, 910 and we still don't have our food.   We ended up leaving.   Incompetence everywhere.

Ndo6LCqoyGot3WPVyQX81A.text: I wanted to love his restaurant, but I didn't. The foie gras was excellent, and so was the bread, but nothing else was. The steak and frites were ridiculously salty--more so than a ballpark pretzel. The lamb was undercooked,  which was remediable, but less than I'd expect at the price. Don't waste your money. There are WAY better restaurants in Vegas.

gkFpWCE35CoTWxRXs2lWXw.text: From start to finish. Hostess to waitress, to somm and the work of the chefs....this experience is worth the money and the hype. Can't wait to celebrate more great meals.

VKiaxqs_eytLAMmLs6mPEA.text: Bardot simply impressed my friends and I with their excellent food, wine selection, and impeccable service. I started with the foie gras parfait, followed by rotisserie chicken. These two dishes were prepared to perfection. The foie gras was silky smooth and melts as soon as it touches your tongue. Served along with some toast and jam, the whole dish give hints of saltiness, sweet, and crunch to wet your appetite for your entree. When my rotisserie chicken arrived, it seem like a very simply roasted chicken but one bite into it and it was simply amazing. Accompanied with a sauce and some long bean, the chicken was tender and succulent. The skin crispy after hours of roasting pairs well with the tender chicken to give you such a sensation as you being to swallow it. Though we were stuffed for any desserts, i'm pretty sure that the desserts won't disappoint after such a wonderful appetizers and entree.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Parfait
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Rotisserie

A_kVDZuwYtxwxnueHelcNA.text: This is my favorite restaurant in LV right now. I have been 4 times over the last 2 months and they hit a home run every time! Sunday night myself and 3 friends had an amazing meal some of the highlights included the Duck a l'Orange which is a mush have. steak tar tar and the bone marrow appetizer are also excellent. as for main courses the lobster thermidor and the steak and frites our to die for. also if your a pork chop fan they have a chop that is the most tender I have ever had.

iu2YMt8bJsq7laGkuUQ6OQ.text: Went for brunch on a Saturday. Very different than most brunches I have been to because of the French influence. I got the sticky bun which they told me was a new item. It was very good but very sweet. I couldn't eat it all myself because it was so sweet so I had some of my friends hash browns. They were excellent. I also had champagne which was delicious. Service was good as was the decor.  I didn't do the unlimited rose wine but people seemed to be enjoying it. I've also been here for dinner and it was good too.

89yShXr_3H44WHjipqolFw.text: Sad, cold concept for conventioneers. Probably okay if you can expense it, but I'm not interested in paying markups like this for middle shelf grocery store wine.  Inexperienced service at the bar. Also, worst tarte flambe I've ever been served. I'm sure that there are better options deeper down the menu, but we didn't stick around to find out.

Ita1KxYWKnThPdbAtnmDtw.text: Service is not good, so that's problem 1. Additionally, if you're going to charge $54 for an 8 oz filet, it needs to be cooked properly as ordered. The flavor left something to be desired. I've had better steak at an outback. You can pass on this place.

BeKd1wDHstna2BBwQh-BQA.text: We were very pleased with this brasserie menu and execution made feel very authentic. It's a great lunch or heavy snack option. The escargot en croute was an especially nice surprise, great la beouf hache, and pate.

63vVz3KwVskWtMk5mUwL8w.text: Definitely one of the better brunches I've experienced in Vegas. So far I've done Caesars palace buffet and one at Wynn and if someone made me chose between those again I'd goose this one! The pictures don't do the French toast justice IT'S HUGE. enjoyed the French omelette. It is simple the Brie is in there somewhere but can def taste it. Comes with hash brown in a square form that has a herb in it that I can't pinpoint. All the food is delightfully different.

GTuKzkzdltNgV3l06oODew.text: Amazing! We had the foie gras patee, filet mignon with fries, and creme brulee. The bread with real butter was so good! For two of us not including drinks the bill was $200 plus $40 tip. Excellent service and food!!! Dressy atmosphere so wear your best.

Ptc6CS_WA-j3_5gVY3xd1g.text: Arrived early and was seated, thanks for making life easy.  I love good food and enjoy trying new places.  For my main course I had PARISIAN GNOCCHI AU PISTOU.  Delish.  Felt light and fresh and yet very filling.    The Fresh french bread served in a bag , with fresh butter with salt was good.  For dessert i had: PAVLOVA AUX FRUITS ROUGES vanilla meringue, lemon chantilly, strawberries, cassis coulis, lavender gelato  Was a amazing mix of flavors on the mouth, meringue was itself a bit big, but an dessert well worth the calories.  Good job on the gelato, lavender is hard to work with.  Friendly staff, great service(I enjoy my water and they never let my glass be empty).

ICHgj8RabjywcBLRoKYxyg.text: So far I am pretty disappointed with the service. First, our server seemed miffed that neither my husband or I drank alcohol. We should never feel judged from abstaining. Secondly, I'm not that hungry and was thinking of having an appetizer as my entree. My server repeatedly stated it was appetizer size. When I informed him I wasn't that hungry, he seemed annoyed! What is that?!? There are so many places we could go eat and I wanted to have a nice evening out. So far his attitude has really dampened my evening. Upon choosing the appetizer he pressed "and what after?!" I repeated that I wasn't that hungry and the plate sounded good and he seemed upset. Which makes me feel upset. We'll see how the food goes but what little appetite I had is now gone. :( No one should ever feel pressured to order. Whether a $50 meal or a $5000, service and care should be consistent across the board.

P2If0lcx0cwUwwgMawirJw.text: Great Happy Hour from 5-7pm in the bar/lounge! The bartender was very friendly. Awesome decor and ambience. $5 bartenders choice cocktail or red/white wine. A decent list of $5-$6 appetizers. I loved the tuna tartare, the pomme frites, and the escargot. You can skip the macaroni and cheese. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour - Shrimp Cocktail
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour - Bone Marrow
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour - Tuna Tartare

mZUIvABefp9vJpokKNX_bQ.text: Shady rolled in to Michael Mina's newest outpost in Aria for the first of 6 meals in his latest Vegas boondoggle. Shady and guest started with a nice bottle of Rose' and moved on to the meal.  First off, the space is beautiful. A stunning bar greets you as moved towards the dining area. After a long perusal, Shady's gracious companion lusted for the seared foie gras, while Shady himself opted for the Duck wings L'orange. The foie gras was delicious, and was consumed immediately. The Duck was indeed delicious, but far too much work finding meat among the bones. As good as they were, Shady would order something else in the future.  On to the mains-The Lupe De Mer-Seabass was outstanding. Its hard to say it was better than the perfectly cooked Duroc pork chop, but with both being 4 stars, the nod goes to the seabass. A side of sprouts, some rest, then off to dessert. Another outstanding dish-The frozen Paris brest. Basically the most delicious saucers u can imagine.  The French fare was the perfect start to the Vegas binge. The service was great, the scene upscale bistro, and the food outstanding. Shady will have to revisit for the much heralded brunch. Bill was 273$ with the bottle, and includes Shadys signature bountiful tip.

ZkNeBrcrmirmHbpUzHbH9g.text: Bardot was one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had. The cocktails before dinner were unique and tasty.  We got to our table and there was a hand written card from the staff.  It was thanking us for celebrating our anniversary with them.  It was signed by the entire wait staff and was a wonderful touch.  Our server, Steve, was amazing both in service and personality.  Truthfully this might be the best service I have ever had.  I will use this as a place marker to judge fine dinning from here on out.  The food was amazing.  We tried alot of new foods so, it was a bit of a culinary adventure.  I would certainly recommend.

-6h_dotynqWbhHVT4vNuSg.text: I never was a fan of French food and was dragged here by my spouse and in laws.  Had to start off with a Hors d'age draft beer.  Wow this beer had me buzzing before the appetizers arrived.  The CHARCUTERIE BOARD and Pate de Campagne were excellent.  I never liked escargot but I have to admit Bardots was good. I won't list everything we had but for a non fan of French cuisine I was mildly surprised by the food.  Waiter, Michael, was great.  Only issue I really had was the noise level.  It was pretty loud once the dining room filled up.  I enjoyed the decor and vibe of the restaurant.  I would recommend it if you are in the mood for French.

zZez-Yf2P74tJdKOYZgkag.text: This was a cute place. I was there for Valentine's Day when they had a special menu. The salmon was very good. If you like French food in a cute setting then I recommend this place.

5Nqzy4qIe4Ci61g-XAsIZg.text: Very good. Party of six. Classic French bistro food with a couple twists. Cheese, pastries are delicious. Escargots are very good. Entrees were good, but not amazing.

wmAuMOxsjHk7b6c4TDhcDQ.text: Had two great prior experiences then poor service, food, and seating last night.  Server rarely appeared and couldn't even pronounce the food (in English - not looking for French pretense).  The fish was chewy and raw.  It's understandable that any chef can have an off moment and lose focus so no big deal.  Wasn't looking for a freebie but they offered to take it off my bill - but see comment about terrible service so of course it wasn't.    Inconsistency of food, service, and seating comfort is the death of any restaurant.  Be careful especially if you're entertaining guests or colleagues. I know it must be hard to find good help in this town, but at $150/person that shouldn't be my problem.   Would love to have addressed this with them rather than on Yelp but no one was available and their web site has no contact method.

o1pT3uWfnR1xcCi8o5wfIw.text: Great, attentive service and probably the best burger I ever had. My new favorite place in Vegas for brunch.

KCXD6rMshpvHoDBbtl3KFw.text: I have visited Bardot for brunch and happy hour.  The charcuterie board and prime steak tartare are perfect for a happy hour snack, and Bardot features a fun cocktail menu.  I had the french toast for brunch with the bottomless rose and it was a great combo for the price.  I highly recommend Bardot for brunch and happy hour, and I plan to return soon to try a full dinner.

PdYuDFD5csAmmXvLuxvc1A.text: Outstanding service and ambiance. Food was well served, but didn't have the uff to be expected from a good restaurant. Onion soup was slightly too sweet for a pricey restaurant.

PsV6h3CsD9i5b3KEj0yTwg.text: Although nothing there reminded me of Brigitte Bardot, the decor was French like many Vegas brasseries. Unlike those other brasseries, the food was better here. We only came for the daily happy hour from 5-7P, but were very impressed by this recently opened Michael Mina restaurant.  The escargot en crout was so good, we ordered another plate of the tasty bites. The mild and soft snail was deliciously encased in a puff pastry shell rather than just topped with dough. The hazelnut "salt" and Chartreuse butter condiments and chives and mushroom garnishes were nice complements, but most were hard to eat WITH the escargot because they didn't attach to the pastry crust. To make it easier to eat, maybe a hazelnut and mushroom cream would be fun to dip into and adhere to the pastry.  They were out of skate wings, so we tried the salmon tartare instead. It was a smart combination of both fresh and smoked salmon that avoided the unpleasant tackiness when only fresh is used. I also liked the subtle use of capers and the thickly spreadable consistency of the chive mascarpone. Another smart choice was the sliced brioche which was friendlier to bite than a shattering crostini toast.  The "HNYB Sour" was a solid Cognac-based cocktail with a head of egg white and a float of Beaujolais.  Poorly positioned in the low foot traffic area of Aria's Promenade Level, it's located on the level above the casino next to the Zarkana theater.

q2apz9z07ZTSYSNBiaLYkw.text: No disappointments here! Begin with warm baguette, then a classic selection of cheeses to start. The menu is a classic French brasserie with outstanding onion soup gratinee, a frisee salad with lardons was perfect and not overly dressed. My Parisian gnocchi with pea pistou is lightly pan fried and the loup de mer of sea bass was light and perfectly cooked. The macaroni and cheese is awesome and not to be missed. We passed on dessert but the selections were appealing and looked good. Nice classic and new cocktail selections and a wines are well thought out with the sommelier asking if he can assist. A surprise was the photographer, Brittney, who is so nice and did a great job of the photos we purchased. Great job Michael Mina.

fV4FyH4ANV8gAEJ81l_ejA.text: Most authentic French restaurant west of Paris. Incredible foie gras and steak tartare. A must!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras in a jar with a port jelly. Amazing

2fLQC78iYPKMkptv04j3-Q.text: There are no words to express the amazing food here. We love the breakfasts- regardless of what hotel/casino we stay at, we always make a special breakfast reservation at Bardot. Yes, it's expressive but so are all fine restaurants in Las Vegas!

kexDmhv1cu-Espl0E4szXA.text: My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!   I live here in LV and sometimes my fiance isn't in town to go to dinner with me. I don't mind coming here and eating at their bar alone.   Everything I had on this menu is phenomenal. My favorite dish is the sea bass. By far, delicious! I don't eat meat but my friends have loved the pork chops and steak. Salmon dish isn't my favorite but it's still delicious.   Restaurant business has high turn over rate. I hope this place stays in Aria !!!!

QC_awkkODnuPOjlGezSTxg.text: The food was ok. But the service was really bad. The server yelled at us when we order French Toast:" I already told you when you came in, we are sold out!!"   I said I'm not ready, can I order later. I just needed few more minutes to take a look at the menu but he said:" no you can't. I need everyone to order now."  My friend ask him if she can get her rib eye sandwich cooked as medium rare. The server said:" you can order it, but I can't make it."

oMKjRz-x98Xc6G4KOlhDmA.text: Pros: Great service, great food, great drinks  Cons: Kind of expensive, but that should be expected  Details: We went here for a celebration with family from out of town. I had heard it was very good and was not disappointed. The highlight is the service because there are a lot of places to get great food in Las Vegas but the service here was next-level. The staff was extremely personable and worked with us almost like we were old friends. For alcohol, I only had one drink (rum based) and a sip of another (bourbon based) so I can't speak to all of the drink menu. But the drinks I had were great. The food was also great, from what I had and what my fiance had. I am not sure if the menu changes or not but it looks like it might rotate some items in. The atmosphere is also great, you lose the sense of being in the middle of a large casino. I did not get the reservation so I cannot speak to that but it was quite busy so I imagine you want to book ahead.

zC8SL4QqQFGWpCOEiTDTaw.text: The best French Restaurant on The Strip!  I had escargots Bardot, seared foie gras, octopus a la basquaise for appetizer.  Escargot is wrapped in pastry with amazing sauce. I LOVE the seared foie gras but I don't like the camargue rice. The octopus is very tasty & cooked perfectly but eating the beans with it seemed to ruined the taste. I had the scallops & king crab crepe for my entree and both are DELICIOUS!!!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rmg6LwWMtmiCDVo3ZuvR3g.text: A decadent experience and meal from start to finish. When my friend suggested this as our next food adventure I was excited. This has been my list to try for awhile.  Located inside of Aria the restaurant was easy to find. Follow the signs from the casino to the restaurant area. The walk from the parking garage wasn't too bad. Bardot is in the same area as Herringbone, The Buffet, and Carbone. The inside of the restaurant feels like a French bistro and has a nice ambiance.   Enjoying a leisurely meal we started with two appetizers and a soup. Everything sounded so great on the appetizer menu or hors d'oeuvres as it is labeled on the menu. The French bread brought out to begin was perfectly crunchy and tasty. This was a great way to enjoy the butter sauce with the crepe which we did shamelessly.   The French Onion soup was amazing with a nice amount of bread in the soup and a broth with amazing onion flavor. The layer of cheese on top was thick and the cheese just kept coming with each bite. A decadent soup for sure. The King Crab Crepe was a flavor explosion at first bite. I could not believe how much flavor was in something seemingly so simple. Everything was fresh and the crepe was perfectly prepared. We enjoyed this dish without the sauce served on the side by mistake and still found it incredible. The Steak Tartare was fresh and flavorful. The potatoes to enjoy the tartare on were prepared like a chip were incredibly delicate and delicious.  Sweets are a necessary guilty pleasure and we were getting full so we decided to skip to dessert. Narrowing to three choices wasn't easy, but we selected Cherry Clafouti, Mille Feuille, and an Apple Tart. All three were amazing, but Cherry Clafouti was my favorite. It was a unique dessert that was like a cross between bread pudding and custard. The delicious tart cherries adding plenty of flavor and the pistachio ice cream on top was so delicious.   The service was attentive and polite. Our waitress checked in on us frequently and accommodated our requests. Since the table was small the staff paid special attention to clearing plates frequently which I appreciated.   I'm already looking forward to returning to Bardot for another lovely evening. This is a great spot for a nice night with a friend or a date night. The food was outstanding and one of my more notable meals lately!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Split Order of 9 oz. Filet Mignon, Frites, &amp; Lobster Tail with Bearnaise.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Vol-Au-Vent
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry Clafoutis

pBzemzdu-B5X1mr7rXb0bg.text: The restaurant is located inside of the Aria hotel in Las Vegas, and it can be somewhat difficult to locate. It's a very casual, French restaurant, but their ambiance and bar-like atmosphere makes it quite the experience. We came at around 6pm with a reservation for four, and the table we were seated at was spacious and comfortable. The waiters were very kind, and brought us water and french baguettes to start with. The baguettes were very fresh, warm and soft on the inside while crunchy on the outside.   We decided to skip out on the appetizers, and order entrees. We ordered a double cut rib eye, the lamb chops, and a pork chop. My brother and dad both ordered the double cut rib eye, but my dad's steak cooked medium had more flavor than my brother's steak cooked medium rare. The steak was very well cooked, and there was a great, smokey flavor. My mom's pork chop was also amazing--it had a deep, smokey bacon flavor from the bacon condiments on top. My lamb chop, unfortunately, was the most disappointing. It lacked flavor and it somewhat tasted like raw sashimi (which was, in my part, my own fault since I had ordered it medium rare). The quality of meat was great, but I wish there was more seasoning and a bit more time on the grill.   We ended up each ordering a dessert, since everything on the menu looked amazing, and we got two baked Alaska, a macaroon, and a napoleon looking french pastry. My favorite was the macaroon, which had a lot of chocolate, but wasn't sweet at all. They also pour warm chocolate on the macaroon table side. The baked Alaska was a show in it of itself--the waiter poured flaming bourbon onto the cake to toast the marshmallow. The baked Alaska was light, but I wasn't a fan of the strong alcohol taste.   I would give this place a 4.5/5, but I am rounding up because of the service and the amazing steak, pork chop, and macaroon dessert. I would recommend this place if you're staying in Vegas, and if you're looking for a more casual dining experience.

FZ3xMvhfDVA6_oqMuUFk-g.text: Pretty resturant. Friendly service. So so food.  Of course on a 100+ degree day I was craving soup. I tried the french onion soup and it was mediocre. Not much flavor, the cheese was slightly hard and didn't have flavor, and it was not something I would want to try again. The bread was good and the pavlova was very good - tooth hurting sweet chewy and light and refreshing at the same time.   The service and ambiance was nice at least.

aoAQtzLjuqnAQY-RTf17_w.text: Matthew was incredible! He made thoughtful recommendations and was very attentive. Our dining experience was flawless from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BRAni2V9_poIjIvRBN4H-w.text: Great and affordable French food in Aria  My recent trip to Vegas caused me to eat at 3 different French restaruants: Bardot Brassiere, Mon Ami Gabi, and Bouchon. Bardot Brassiere was by far my favorite one.  We went there for brunch at 11AM, had reservations but the restaurant was about 1/4 empty so not sure if it's necessary. The restaurant is located inside the Aria, and is very tastefully decorated with a nice excerpt from Heminingway on the wall. The hostess quickly sat us down, and the waiter quickly came by, got us water and menus. While waiting to place our order, they brought over French bread and butter. Some of the best French bread I had, although I've had better butter (was still tasty).  I got the goat cheese and mushroom quiche, while my friends got the French Toast. The quiche is literally the best quiche I've ever had (Admittedly, I haven't had many quiches). It was rich, flavorful, and the mushrooms were absolutely scrumptious. The small salad (e.g. pieces of lettuce) that came with it were seasoned simply, but also yummy. The French toast was the largest piece of toast you'll ever see (literally it's the size of your face). It comes with some sort of caramelized nut triangle on top, some whipped butter, and an amazing syrup (I don't even know how to describe it). Every bite was delicious and rich, and given that the French toast was probably at least 1 to 2 lbs, we were unable to finish it.   I would definitely come back here in the future if I have another chance. The Nutella sticky bun looks amazing, and I'm also a sucker for the Prime Rib French Dip.

dZ8NNcjutH3sjDgpWU1z-Q.text: I like Bardot more than Bouchon for brunch. It's a little more polished, a finer food flavor, and much friendlier staff. Especially Oscar. Thanks, Oscar, for your suggestions and the strawberry Bellini!

Uc3LyXxj7zhHZihbpg_eng.text: Slave girl and I were looking for a place to get brunch and we found out Bardot Brasserie had brunch until 1:30pm with bottomless mimosa. Yes please.   Bardot was beautifully decorated and very well lighted inside. The bar was very busy especially with bottomless mimosa.  We ordered steak tartare, truffle fries, French toast, and croque madame.  We started with complimentary baguette with salted butter. I know nothing about how to make butter magical, but the butter that came with was really good especially the part had salt on. I tried to use regular table salt and they just didn't taste the same.   Steak tartare was excellent. The steak was grounded to order mixing with sauce verte and egg yolk. Severed with gaufrette potato chips. It had creamy texture and good flavor.   Croque madame came with pain de mie, Paris ham, gruyere fondue, and a organic egg on top. It was good but it didn't wow me like the one I had in San Francisco.   Slave girl told me the French toast was one of the best she ever had. Since I only had a bite, I would say sure, why not. It came with brioche French toast top with vanilla mascarpone, almond brittle, and organic syrup.   Truffle fries was a bit fail in my book. Sure it was done well, but I didn't get too much of truffle flavors which defeated the purpose of "truffle" fries.   The service here was fantastic. It was a full house but my mimosa was never empty. Matter of fact, it was filled before I even finished the glass. On top of that, our server was also training a new server too. Great job for sure. We will go back to try the dinner menu.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries with garlic aioli

nLd5e0Kix3uWysb_xlReFQ.text: Best restaurant in Las Vegas!! We stayed at the Aria Hotel, so the restaurant was at a very convenient location, but even if not staying on site, I would be definitely there every single day! Feels like I was in a small restaurant/cafe in Paris, wonderful and friendly staff!!! AMAZING wine selection, and the BEST burger in town! Must try the escargot appetizer!

PaALrx5X2mBFhI1AJqFraQ.text: Wow!! Where do I begin, this breakfast is AMAZING! Our service with Oscar was so wonderful. As soon as we sat down Oscar served us with such a delicious cup of coffee. We ordered the short rib croissant, the waffle duck confit, the French toast with seared foie gras, the French omelet add truffle as well as the lobster scramble. There's not one part of this breakfast I would change. Oscar thank you for your amazing hospitality, we appreciate you so much!

oKhqoXQcqYARbV2wBdpf2w.text: The atmosphere at Bardot Brasserie was great. The wait staff was wonderful. It really stood out to me when my boyfriend reached for the bottle of water to refill his cup, our waitress noticed as he was passing by and rushed to refill it himself. Now that's customer service. We were seated without a wait (I had made reservations, but still...) Overall, really loved having breakfast here and would love to return.

RjZkzLFkXKn-f4Bu-JhHQQ.text: Had a great brunch here on Saturday after mistakenly coming here on Friday the day before. The gentleman at the check in was nice enough to cancel my Friday reservation for us. While we were sitting on the lovely outdoor seating area trying to figure out a plan for lunch he was kind enough to bring us 2 cups of lovey cold water in plastic cups and advised us to keep hydrated with all the hot dry air. That was such great customer service to people who weren't even customers at the time. I really appreciated the kind gesture. When we came the next day for brunch I asked what the gentleman's name was who had been in the front yesterday and described his features and as I was doing so we spotted each other and I expressed our excitement to be back for actual brunch. I came to find out that his name is Matej and he is the manager, a great manager at that. We had an excellent server, Oscar who was funny and helpful. In the middle of the meal Matej came by to check in on us and we let him know how delicious everything was. Loved everything from the yummy softened salted butter and baguette to the savory sweet Foie Gras and the French toast was the best my husband has ever had, everything we had was delicious. At the end of our meal Oscar let us know that Matej had filled him in on our little mishap from the day before and had sent out delicious complimentary desserts for the birthday boy and my husband for Father's Day. Both of the reasons why we were celebrating. Definitely recommend Bardot for the amazing food and service. I really appreciate it when a restaurant knows there are literally hundreds of good restaurants in Vegas to dine and value you as a customer.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hp5ACrmXf-eT9LZnw5JA0w.text: Best spot I've eaten so far in 2019. Came for the French toast which was amazing but there are other items on the menu that really stand out and make this place a Gem. The bacon. No like the bacon is the best piece of bacon I have ever had in my entire life. I usually don't order double cut bacon because it's always so chewy but it really was like a slice pork that just melted in your mouth. Other items that were amazing which a must order is the pastry basket and the French fries. All three of these items mixed with the service which was awesome. I will never not come to Vegas and not eat here.

UYDmDRyCVbG3lqSFCYdqYw.text: Great location for a very special occasion for what ever it is. My girlfriend made reservations here for my birthday l. I had a great time and the setting was on point. Our server was very helpful and friendly on serving us, making it a great experience for my birthday.   The salmon entree we ordered was the best salmon i ever had in my life. It was so moist and so much flavor. The oysters are super fresh. The escargots was out of this world which i never had before. I would love to come back again to this place.

0_pYFW9plttpz2zLXldtiw.text: Delicious food!!! Would definitely come back for JUST the French Toast. Ask for Oscar...incredibly helpful, delightful, and kept my rose full!

i15-SVN62-DzwhA3CUayMA.text: So I got my friends excited about this place based on the reviews! We came for the brunch.  I placed reservations for 1:30 PM. Unfortunately there was traffic and we were running late.  When we finally parked I literally had my group make an effort to run all the way to the restaurant.  We arrived at 1:46 PM. And the hostess told us that their maximum late time frame was 15 minutes. And kitchen was closed for brunch.  I understand we were in the wrong being late.   BUT 1 MINUTE?!  They brought the manager out and you clearly treated me like I was just another random number. I explained to him I worked in the service industry before and we would gladly not be a hassle and order a simple dish that's quicker to make.  He then walked off into apparently speak with the shop and request permission but I think he just went for a nice walk in circles.  Moral of the story. Treat people with empathy. It was 1 minute. You could make a persons day with that simple okay I'll let you slide.

k0Ib-Xy5rfX8uxn-WUBEng.text: We went her for brunch on a Saturday.  It is a beautiful restaurant that really make you feel like you are in France.  Service was very good.    We started with some mimosas which were top notch--just the right blend.  They brought out a little baguette with butter that was really good.  I was thinking about getting the eggs benedict--but was not sure about putting it on croissant--so instead I ordered the cheese omelet.  It was cooked well, but really light on the cheese and not that flavorful.  It came with a side of salad, which was kind of odd, but tasted good.    I really did not like the hash browns.  It was kind of a fried block of potato--a little like a giant french fry.  I think some might like it that way, but not me or my friend.  My friend ordered something called the American plate with two eggs.  She ordered them over easy--but they were really likely cooked.  Fortunately, I ordered a side of bacon that was excellent--I would definitely order that again.

xhoZu5Zy8_4Xb4i7XnOKjg.text: Went here with the guys for a nice dinner in Vegas and was very happy with the friendly (and not stuck up) service. Staff kept engaged, recommended sides, and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our dinner. The food was delicious, the Prime Rib was cooked perfectly and was very filling.  The ambiance was nice, perfect place for a boys night out.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bPtM7DWNvsg049RMB3RUmw.text: Took my wife and mother/father in-law last weekend for my mother in-laws birthday. I can't say that I'm often caught by surprise when it comes to restaurants but I definitely was on that night. I had a very lackluster experience at Hell's Kitchen the night before which I had very high hopes for (Gordon Ramsey you are 0-2) so I tried to keep my expectations in check. I had the 5 course prix fixe for $175 plus a few drinks and tip, not the best $280 I've ever spent. Main course was the beef wellington which was very bland and not prepared correctly, but this isn't about Hell's Kitchen and what they did wrong this is about Bardot and how they amazed!!!   We started with drinks, I had a house cocktail (midnight in Paris) that was excellent. For apps we ordered the escargot with garlic butter sauce and oysters. Both we exceptional but the escargot was the better of the two easily. For entrees my wife and I had the beef wellington for two. My mother in-law had the duck L orange and my father in-law had the filet. All three dishes were amazing but the beef wellington might be one of the best things I've ever tasted in my life, it was that good. I won't really get into sides other then to say that they more than held their own in the plate and the truffle mash could have been it's own meal it was so good. I'm not sure why this place isn't a 5 stars across the but it's definitely my new favorite spot in Vegas and I will be here again. My only real regret was that we had to make a show and couldn't stay longer to try more dishes.    Thank you to chef Smith and everyone else that made this such a great experience, see you guys seen.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With Executive Chef Josh Smith
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xXDNBDgAwlXzjy9J6t7Hmg.text: Bardot is a Vegas must! I wish there was one in my hometown. I can't remember the last time I've had such a great meal. The French restaurant is located in the Aria, and it has a formal dining area and bar area. I made a reservation for a Thursday night.   My table started with a bread and cheese plate that also came with spreads and jam. We asked for additional toasted bread. The plate was delicious. My favorite was probably the jam and toasted bread but all of it is good. I ordered the duck breast prepared medium. It was cooked and seasoned perfectly. It's certainly meant for more than one person as there was no way I could finish it alone. Hands down the best thing we ate was the gnocchi. It literally tastes like garlic, potatoes, and butter melting in your mouth. I've never had anything like it. Please do yourself a favor and order it. Also great wine, enjoyed a Malbec.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

UfFLtYSrLWiWUtT2fD_keA.text: This is now one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. The restaurant is gorgeous and intimate. The bar is amazing to look at. The interior of the restaurant is beautiful with glass that allows you to see into the kitchen.  Immediately you are greeted by helpful and friendly staff. Our server was Oscar who was attentive and friendly. My boyfriend took me here for my birthday from a recommendation from a friend. We ordered our own tasting menu. I reccomend every dish we have ordered. The dishes were bright, vibrant, succulent, rich, and delectable.  - Seared Foie Gras (not pictured) - Lobster Thermidor (not pictured) - Pop Tart Flambee - Crab Endive Salad (not pictured) - Charcuterie Board - Bechamel Mac n Cheese - Table side Beef Wellington served with asparagus and black truffle pommes puree  - Table side Baked Alaska with strawberry and rhubarb -Assorted desserts ( chocolate macaroon, espresso creme brulee, beignets, and mille-feuille)  The items that aren't pictured were because we were inpatient and couldn't wait to dig in.   We will definitely be back and ready to try more of the menu with friends and family in tow. Thank you to Chef Josh and the amazing staff at Bardot Brasserie. Oscar is a top notch server and we will be happy to be in his section again.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie Board

8FV6BoAwJ6A1hs8Dov1iWg.text: Outstanding food. We had wonderful baguettes with amazingly soft butter that you add sea salt to (did not previously know you could improve on soft butter), a cheese board with lots of things I can't pronounce that tasted great, French onion gratinee - unbelievably easy to eat for French onion soup, a flavorful pork chop, and an espresso creme brulee accented with two miniature bignets. Superb on all fronts.   There was just one small miscue in that something we ordered was not delivered, but the mistake was made right and then some.   Call it 4.75 stars. Would go back in a heartbeat.

mPKZiEEPY4rArK-rUnmM5Q.text: I love French food, so when I came across Bardot, I was excited! I ordered the prime rib sandwich and upgraded to the truffle fries. I also ended up ordering the steak tartare.   The tartare was good, but a little bland. The potato chips made all the difference. The prime rib sandwich.. delicious! The meat was super tender and the au jus was savory with the perfect amount of saltiness! The truffle fries were also amazing. I would recommend you pay the extra 4 bucks for them, you could definitely taste the truffles!

sqkIv2KwfG_3r7QoAJTZBw.text: I wanted to come here for a long time and as I had nobody to join me, I decided to come try the happy hour by myself. Bardot is easy to find, on level 2 of Aria, across Carbone. The place is gorgeous inside and outside, I love it! The signs are in French and the theme is very well done. It gives all the French feels. I ordered 2 tartines: the avocado tomato tartine and the shrimp tartine. They were both really good. Healthy fresh and decent portion. The toast comes very crispy. My favorite was the shrimp, be aware there's some spicy peppers but if you are like me, you can remove them easily. I would order this dish again! Friendly staff, pleasant dining. I hope to come back for a seated dinner. I recommend this for a date as it's a fairly romantic setting.

uD-y0nhHKGosQIaiFwh4PA.text: Loved the decor at Bardot so so much! Having a background in design, I can definitely appreciate all the craftsmanship and attention to detail. Our waitress was the sweet French girl. She suggested her faves and I'm glad I went with it. I'm def not a lobster for breakfast type of gal, but omg! The lobster scramble was yummy. And while you're there, you got to order the French press coffee to go with your breakfast!

EBfjiZlDiFFy6I_8GljDUQ.text: Update 7/6/19  We still love this place. It's in our top 5 for Date Night spots. We had an 8:15pm reservation this evening. Jesus was our server and was a joy to have. Just a real nice guy with a smile for everyone. Shout out to all the employees here who clear plates and are on top of refilling water. The two hostesses were also very sweet helping us with directions to main valet when we asked on our way out.  A few things we noticed and were personally disappointed in: No more bleu cheese sauce offered as a choice for filet, didn't get the volcanic rock salt with worlds best butter (it was just regular table salt) and they cut my husbands filet in half (maybe to check if it was medium rare?) to serve. Not sure if these are budget cuts or these are just new choices management has made?

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So pretty 7/6/19

a31ouGgY6yR3WsmFRKO9QQ.text: This French restaurant is know for their French toast and I had to find out for myself why. Came here during brunch and ordered a ton of food! We started with the la fromage board: mimolette, rockaport (bleu Cheese) and raclette. When I saw raclette, I was hoping for that melted cheesy stuff, but it wasn't.  It was still in its original form and was very mild compared to the other choices.   The French toast lacks color, but the sweetness from the syrup definitely made up for it! The toast was crunchy on the outside and very soft inside. I drowned the bread in that sweet syrup which made it a little soggy. The peanut brittle wasn't my favorite part of the dish, but my friends loved it.   The steak tartare was a little too greasy and oily for my palette. And I wish the"chips" provided were a bit stronger so I can eat it with the tartare on top. It broke into pieces by the time it reached my mouth.  The prime rib sandwich was delicious! I ate it without the bread and dipped it in their au jou and it tasted like heaven. Definitely recommend this dish!  Ambiance is intimate with their dim lights and excellent customer service. I'll be back soon for their dinner service and check out their menu then.

mPisIr2MSM4FyQLAAvTt8Q.text: We decided to come checkout BARDOT which was located in our hotel (Aria) and it was really good. I've never been to a French Cuisine resturant and I become impressed. I had the Filet which was really good and the wife had the ribeye which she liked also. I tried some of the beet salad and that was amazing. The encrusted goat cheese was the best I've ever had. The Mac n Cheese is MUST here. Noodles all standing in the pan with a nice cheese crust. Decor is beautiful. Service could have been a little better. Waiter wasn't always on top of things. I would definitely come back and explore the menu more

bB7FKB9AcI-EQDBe_D9BGg.text: We always go to other France place in town. This is a more comfort fully loaded version.    The service is great and they do have all you can drink options.   But it's very pricey.  For 3 of us it's more than $200 and I only ordered French onion soup.    We are locals so we almost never appreciate casino pricing anymore.    I do think the food is tasty, and it's creative.  But it's definitely on a heavy side and wasn't imprssive with the butter or baguette at all. Baguette was crispy yet dry on the inside.  Butter was wipped.    I would guess every dish is more than 1000 calories.

Kdna7BJO_JGTTP1GOWw1Pg.text: Another Michael Mina restaurant located inside the ARIA and requires reservations as the place gets totally packed.  The best thing served for breakfast as what others have said was the French toast, it was incredible! Quite different from the traditional method that is served everywhere.   The French onion soup was way too salty and my dad couldn't finish it. The salmon benedict, French omelet, and the beets salad were super delectable as well.  One out of 8 items weren't that great as mentioned above. Great friendly attentive service with a smile.  For sure will return when in Vegas.

179UoLdb65HFUeHzyzQMfA.text: Had an amazing dinner here with some colleagues. Our table of 9 split several types of apps, including the steak tartare, foie gras parfait, seared foie gras, escargot, world's best butter, and charcuterie board. For dinner, I went with the parisian gnocchi which was super fluffy with a nice layer of cheese shavings on top. While the pasta was good, the apps were out of this world and I could have made that my entire meal. Of course, you have to flush everything down with some bottles of wine, which they have no shortage of here.   Overall, had a very enjoyable dinner at Bardot and would highly recommend for a special occasion or intimate meal.

TBNTY0r1oJxfkoNKqDhDbA.text: Came here for weekend brunch and tried the breakfast sandwich, the lobster scramble, worlds best butter, and shrimp cocktail. This was our second time visiting the restaurant. The baguette and butter was still delicious but I think the bread was better on our first visit. The breakfast sandwich looks like a giant McDonald's egg McMuffin, but the taste is quite nice. A perfectly cooked egg and a flavorful patty. The lobster scramble was beautiful but a bit light on the lobster. The shrimp cocktail was good, but nothing amazing. Fairly good service considering how busy the restaurant was.

61w0T6WBZNcO5CrmBzN0Vw.text: I felt like I was in a secret French cafe.  My bestie and I wanted to brunch before coming home so we called the night before to get reservations and luckily they had one spot available. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. We had our luggage with us and without asking,  the hostess offered to hold our bags.   Our waiter was attentive but not personable,  which was fine with us because we didn't feel like having a lot of chatter this morning after a long night out the day before.  We ordered the lobster scramble, French toast with a side of bacon. The scramble was delicious and exquisite. The French toast however lacked flavor and came with this really strong almond syrup. It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't traditional French toast. I wouldn't order it again. The bacon is thick and tasted like honey baked ham. Beautiful restaurant in the Aria casino. I would love to come back.

joSH3P6BLeHg_rFlg1ucpQ.text: For starters I'd like to say that this most recent visit was so night and day from my previous which really does show that all places (well given the reasoning involved) deserve a second chance.   On day one of a now very distant trip to Vegas I reluctantly gave brunch here a shot based on my past experience, but I'm so glad I did. Go figure seeing it on a travel channel best of food show planted that seed, but now I don't think I'd ever go anywhere else should I have the brunch itch yet again.  The wife went for the Hass Avocado Croissant Benedict and although it was our first time devouring one boy can we say the bar has been set high here. They pretty much use a whole avocado for this and no doubt the freshness was there. What stood out to me though was the bearnaise sauce. I've tasted a few here and there, but this was very creamy and the herb mix even on its own tasted superb!  I took a different spin as I'm more of the gluten of the ground. As a side (which was really a costar of the show) the double-cut bacon is outstanding. It certainly is a portion which could be shared, but it's everything bacon should be. Prepared to spit out tender love and sticky coating to send your taste buds sizzling on a hot plate.  What I can not even begin to describe up even till now was the French Toast. It's their claim to fame and with good reason. The brioche is devilishly soft and not as heavy as I expected. The vanilla mascarpone though is an explosion of sweet all over your body. Your stomach definitely feels like it rolled a 7 with each bite! The almond brittle sadly I didn't care much for, but for me it was forgettable and I just set it to the side.  There is so much left to be desired here and I should warn the staff now you'll be sick of my face shall I happen to make it out on a Saturday and/or Sunday. Haha
