Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup...divine!

d7ZJNO-wkh6JJcqWqwsrmA.text: Ordered the steakburger. They gave it two tries. First, it was so over cooked that it was a hockey puck. Second try was so raw that it wasn't even staying in a patty. Neither was the medium rare that I ordered.   Our server never checked to see if the second burger was correct and didn't seem to care when the burger remained on the plate at the end of the meal.   Avoid this place. Not worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw burger. Second try.

2fXiF_zCzr_-w06eNAeZsQ.text: This place was AMAZING!!! Came here with the sister-in-law, brother-in-law, and the hubby while we were in Vegas for a little vaca. We had 11:45am reservations on Sunday for brunch! We were seated right away.  We ordered the Paris ham croissant benedict ($16), the french toast ($16), the hunter's waffle ($19) and a nutella sticky bun for the table ($16). While we waited, they brought a couple of small baguettes for the table and some yummy salted whipped butter.   The food was all amazing. The french toast was HUGE!!! Waaaaay too much for one person and a little too rich. I felt like I would have had a sugar coma after consuming it. The hunter's waffle looked good. My brother-in-law seemed to be enjoying it. The croissant benedict was as delicious as it sounded. What better to have as the base for an eggs benedict than a flakey buttery croissant? It was soooooo good!   The clear winner for the brunch was the nutella sticky bun. It was melt in your mouth, sticky, gooey, goodness. I'm glad we got one to split for the table though, because just having that for breakfast is pretty dangerous.   This place was so good we wanted an encore performance the next day, but sadly, they do not serve brunch on weekdays =(  It's a little pricey, but well worth the splurge!

4YjPWkQ0alCzk68Ux0zvhA.text: We got a burnt onion soup, it happens, don't expect to get it at a place that charges 20 something dollar for it but sometimes it's the bottom of the pot, it happens. What doesn't need to happen is a CHAUVINIST SUPERVISOR WORKING IN VEGAS at the 21st century. RAYMOND came to apologize on behalf of the BARDOT Brasserie, my friend and I were sitting at the bar, I had the soup and I'm also a female, Raymond came to us introduce himself to my friend (the male) shook his hand and then waved at me, I guess to acknowledge my existence and then apologized to my friend (the male) for the soup he never ate, didn't give me a second look and left.  I was and still am furious, by the way I'm not insecure, I am not a weak woman and I don't consider myself an active feminist but to be treated like I'm a piece of something sitting next to a male by a restaurant's CHAUVINIST SUPERVISOR after I choose to spend my money there (yes, believe it or not I pay for my share) is unacceptable.  As for the rest, most food was ok, Steak Tartare and Foie Gras Parfait were really good and Jason's service at the bar that was impeccable, if not for that encounter with that idiot (accuse my language) I would probably agree with the 4 stars review but I did meet that supervisor and I'm still furious, they don't deserve our money especially when there are so many other options, maybe even owned by women, here's an idea for you.

glrP9611skEkMydXmJIwjg.text: Went for brunch here and it was great. Outstanding service and tried a new dish I usually do not have. Excellent iced tea and great setting that is cool and upbeat. Highly recommend!

q5DgfRtFbv_g66ENO5o1-g.text: I really wanted to like this place since it is a Michael Mina restaurant. However I was pretty disappointed. The only thing good about this place was the Foie Gras Parfait. The Cod and the Gnocchi were disappointing. Foie Gras was so good I would go back just to eat that. I had $100 Aria resort credit that I needed to use and got to use it for this place. I would check your bill if you are charging to your room. My credit didn't apply to this restaurant for some reason. I had to call Aria to get it adjusted.  I think next time I would try the steak and fries. Those looked amazing as it was being brought to other tables. The service was also extremely slow at the bar area. Waited 50 minutes for our main entrees to arrive. That's ridiculous. The other tables that got there later got their food ahead so they probably forgot about us. No apologies either from the waitress.

s8tMkV3vInJRBEDuVgpwZw.text: I put a lot of time into looking for a place to have a good meal on my most recent trip to Las Vegas, and Bardot did not disappoint. So many other places I looked into were overpriced and didn't seem worth it. This is not the case at Bardot. Although it is pricey, you get what you pay for. The food was fantastic (I had the Parisian gnocchi au pistou, blistered green beans, macaroni gratinee, and pavlova) and the service was excellent. The restaurant itself is beautiful. I also appreciated that there was good lighting. Restaurants are often too dark and I want to be able to see the beautiful food in front of me! Bardot is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a good meal in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pavlova aux fruits rouges
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parisian gnocchi au pistou, blistered green beans, and macaroni gratinee

hoojujklZHoSGVPVV0wWyw.text: We came here for dinner over the Fourth of July. It's a beautiful bistro, very elegant, with marble top tables, black furniture with gold highlights. Unfortunately when my boyfriend tried to order a salad with bacon added, they charged him an extra five dollars just to scatter bacon over it.   It took a long time to just get bread and butter. How long should it take to get bread and butter?? I'm mystified that a sophisticated hotel like the Aria has such spotty service.   The rest of the food was great but the first experiences with the restaurant simply marred the rest of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r11gIqrFvkgi7c-9MQLh5w.text: Tres bien.  I ordered the foie gras with a glass of the Bartender's Choice as my happy hour cocktail, which happened to be on this day a smooth and simple concoction of tequila with a splash of lime. Eric, the bartender who served me, was very professional and pleasant. The foie gras was delicious. It was served with thick, fresh from the oven bread. It was a perfectly smooth texture. This particular foie gras is served with ruby port gelee, so if you like it without the sweetness of the "jam" you may want to let the server/bar staff know so they can accommodate you. I finished my happy hour with a slice of lemon meringue tarte. I don't like my desserts too sweet and this one was a smidgen on the sweet side, but the right amount of lemon flavor was the redeeming quality.  It was a nice happy hour for a last night in Vegas. I'll go back for a proper lunch or dinner since my experience was a positive one.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Merengue Tart
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras

qWl8C4lkcMStYuDGL1kUYQ.text: This hidden restaurant is a great place for breakfast. Great service here; they were very kind and accommodating. The food was good; I had the Eggs Benedict with short ribs. The egg was cooked perfectly. Will visit at another time for lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aXFbdx1ui__1wMQuPJnrsA.text: frikkin amazing. Chef Michael Mina- yes.   if you want to feel like a baller and have some romantical time with your girlfriends (ha! because we single!)... this is a beautiful resto inside the Aria hotel. i loved my experience here. the beautiful bar with brass and marble bar counters really caught my attention.   Rose' all day'er. they had a great lunch menu with a happy hour of unlimited rose' for $15. we got our Drake on. the server bringing us the cheese plates and our platters really made the whole meal memorable. dramatic in the presentation of every entree... we giggled and oo'd/ahh'd- along with major photo ops in between.   the Mussels Marinieres with garlic butter was fantastic. soft and chewy- the luxurious dripping of butter down my lips and dipping the crusty baguette to sop up the goods... mmm mm! the a Boulangerie plate was superb and Cheese Plate... when the server lifted the glass dome, i knew i was in for a good ol' time.   they have specialty cocktails on rotation and seasonal ones as well. i tried the French Mule and it was delicious!

S_b85tBFeTUVgrep8iN1eQ.text: Had the most enjoyable brunch with my sisters and grandparents here!  Thank you Thierry for your outstanding service and honesty! He made our first experience here so amazing and we are so thankful! Food was perfect and met all my dietary needs!  I recommend this restaurant highly! Can't wait to come back :)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab Buckwheat Crepe with Hashbrowns (gluten free and soy free)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Tartare, Fruit and Pistachio Yoghurt and Charcuterie

4upNCX8r0tYIDBtF2uu8Eg.text: Fantastic food and service. It was a bit loud, to be frank...but I mean, it's Vegas. We were walk-ins, but got a table. They had a stupendously awesome drink list; everything from the brown stuff to the beer list was world-class.   Have to say I found my new favorite steak tartare dish here; it was so stupid good....can't really describe how much better it is than other places that offer the same dish. The French onion soup was rather good as well, and I really, absolutely loved the Rack of Lamb. All of the food was really good.   Our wait staff was definitely good to go. The only real complaint I could say is that the wait time on dishes was rather slow...but it's a French restaurant, so am I really complaining?

3vqVhdkJMfOheQEKpRaU2Q.text: A really good place for brunch! First off the place was very nice, modernly decorated, the place was packed but I did not feel crowded. Our server was so nice and efficient! He made recommendations, explained the menu to us, cleared out our dirty plates, and the rest of the staff were also very helpful, our drinks were always re-filled and never had to ask for anything.   Food is pricier than other places but I think it is worth it for the quality of the food, the presentation, the service and the experience. My friend and I stuffed our face with appetizers and entrees and left satisfied. The short rib benedict was so good, definitely must try! The base is a croissant instead of an english muffin, it was fluffy and buttery, so good! The rib melted in my mouth, the spinach was good, everything was good! The escargot bardot was on point! Strong flavor with puffy pastry on the outside, very good appetizer!

XHUPDqsXjiKhBEQ9-M4dgg.text: I was underwhelmed.   The overall ambiance was nice. Clean and classic without being overly fancy. That being said, I felt that the food was priced higher than it should have been. I understand it cost more to eat better quality, but this just didn't meet the standard I was expecting for the price point. The service was ok, but it took a really long time for our order to come out. 30 - 45 min. Bubs ordered the crab crepe ($22). He liked it but I was not a fan at all. I ordered the beet salad. Flavors were on point with what I expected, but there really wasn't much food. When I order a salad I imagine a plate with lettuce and fixings. This was a cut up beet with a goat cheese wheel and some arrugala laid on top. Not really worth $19. The best part were the truffle fries. Cooked and seasoned to perfection, they were the saving grace of the meal. My friends ordered the pork chop and the lobster bisque. Both said their food was ok. For the damage it put on my credit card, I was expecting more.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted beet salad
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster half plate

5f6DtcEHfv5hRx4isYaLlg.text: THE BEST FRENCH FOOD . And I'm not even a big fan of French cuisine.. but this place was exceptional! Everything is 5 stars from service, atmosphere and quality of food. I would definitely come back for the French Toast..It was HEAVENLY. So moist, soft, fluffy, but crispy on the outside. Not sweet at all. Syrup is served on the side.   Make sure to order the French bread that comes with "the worlds best butter" ... it really is the worlds best butter... sooo rich in flavour but not too heavy or thick. So soft and silky with a creamy buttery salt flavour. The French bread is also very fresh and served warm

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Americano
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet Salad with Goat Cheese
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brioche French Toast. AMAZING

NN6qV4nXcSb5ygzE6z09gA.text: From the atmosphere to the service to the food-- five stars. Impeccable. Our waiter was attentive but not intrusive. Perfect for the situation! We had a delightful brunch on a Saturday morning. Try the bellinis to start things off right!  Raspberry, peach and assorted others to choose from. A nice break from a mimosa or a Bloody Mary. The pastrami cured salmon was fabulous. It looked incredible, with so much attention to detail.  The taste did not disappoint. The French onion soup was very good as were the short rib bourguignon eggs Benedict. Make a reservation to assure a nice table.

S4yGtJ7181plRMovlw9bVw.text: Came here for a Bachlorette party and waited at least 20 minutes for our table even tho we had a reservation at 9pm. The hostess and the waiter both apologised and we hung out at the bar so it wasn't too bad.   In terms of food, it was decent but again nothing memorable. We picked this place cuz we stayed at the Aria and they can accommodate a big group.  The complimentary French bread that came with the meal was great and we ordered their "world best butter" for $8 a pop. The butter was very silly and creamy but we didn't think it lived up to its name. We thought the complimentary butter was just as good.   Overall, food was decent but again, Vegas has a lot Of great restaurants to offer so I probably won't come back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0SR2juQ-M_lkA61oAarOSQ.text: February is a big month for us. We came here to celebrate my husband's birthday, our anniversary plus wedding, and valentine's day. On our very first date, my husband took me to a French restaurant. We re-created that first date by coming here. We had reservations for 630 and was seated promptly in a nice booth that was actually for a party of four. I really liked this extra touch. Our waitress Kim was really good and personable. She checked in with us multiple times but not excessively.   Came with a complimentary bread and butter.   10 OZ FLAT IRON, STRAUSS GRASS-FED - you get to pick your sauce. The steak was cooked to perfection and the fries that came with it was amazing!   PARISIAN GNOCCHI - I got this and was very pleased. I got a gnocchi dish on our first date too. This is way better. It was very pleasing to the eyes and the gnocchi was the best we've had. Doesn't look like a lot of food but you will be full.   BRUSSELS SPROUTS - sides. A good amount that can be shared up to three people.   We also got a wine and a cocktail (STRAWBERRY BLANC). The strawberry blanc was really good and refreshing.   Overall, it was a great experience EXCEPT how there is some lady who takes photos of you and tries to get you to spend $70 bucks on three printed photos. I understand we are in Vegas and in the Aria but this is a nice place. I don't want to be coerced into buying photos like I am in an amusement park. Hence 4 stars instead of 5.

X19BsG9ABnpDLmO6I0T2ZQ.text: AMAZING!!!! We had reservations for Sunday brunch around 12:30. Seated right away.   We opted for bottomless sparkling rose. Worth every penny. I'm sort of a rose snob and it was perfect.   Food was amazing! Seriously everything we ordered was delicious   Oscar, our server, was phenomenal. I'm big on service. Everyone was excellent. Next time we are in Vegas we will be back!

TWDo26DtCmZUqtuyZal92g.text: Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. I took a group of 10 business colleagues here for dinner and we had an absolutely fantastic time.

oTTzqeaLPcYoT70mxto9GA.text: A French-inspired bistro run in collaboration with prolific chef Michael Mina, Bardot is a solid choice for accessible upscale dining inside a Strip resort.  Brunching here is a great way to ease into a weekend day, starting with the bottomless rose. More, please! And the food options are all quite solid. I didn't partake in the much-enjoyed Nutella sticky bun for fear of an instant heart attack, but I still pushed the envelope with the foie gras tartare and a side of bacon to start. It was quite delightful, with none of the "ducky" taste in the way that, say, seafood can taste "fishy." The short rib bourgignon benedict added more savory tastiness to the whole brunch.   Service is friendly and professional, and also just the right level of attentive without being overbearing. The venue, which is up a flight of escalators from the ground floor of the Aria, indeed feels like an authentic Parisian bistro with its rustic decor.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. breakfast bacon

Hs7a7s5U8-ChHP0wUAMpsw.text: I loved the atmosphere of this restaurant. The escargot was on point. The charcuterie board was okay but the other apps were amazing. I had the steak which was good not great, however the duck was ginormous and the best I have ever eaten. If you go here skip everything else and order the escargot and duck! Waitstaff was a bit slow, but I enjoyed it because they didn't rush me!

1A4cxGjYFBGZA5yrR2tXYg.text: Bardot Brasserie is at its best!    Lauren C or Lucky Charm ~ either way L.C. and I have good luck at our dining adventures.  Located on the second floor of Aria, it's a treasure!  When you receive impeccable service with incredible food, I'll be back for more.  Our dining excursion led us to sample several hors d'oeuvres as well as desserts.  Let's start with the hors d'oeuvres.  The Prime Steak Tartare is ground to order and served with a sauce verte, egg yolk on top with gaufrette potatoes.  The steak tartare is presented beautifully.  When you break the yolk to ooze into the tartare, it's perfect.  The Onion Soup Gratinee couldn't be better with the cave-aged gruyere covering the dish.  The winner of our starters for me is the King Crab Crepe.  Perfectly delicate with black trumpet mushrooms, sunny side egg. The normandy cider beurre blanc on the side could've been smothered on everything I ate.  I fell in love with this sauce.    Onto the fun stuff, Dessert.  We probably went overboard but we that's our thing.  We split 3... yes 3.  The Mille Feuille, Apple tart and Cherry Clafouti.  All had an intense and rich flavor.  Each had their own unique characteristic.  What stood out was the Cherry Clafouti.  It's warm cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream on top.  The cherry pudding was more like a cherry bread pudding.  Very sweet and savory.  The pistachio ice cream complimented the dessert so perfectly.    I wish I had our waitresses name since she was so attentive.  She was great with recommendations and accommodating to our needs.  Her service was the cherry on top to a 5 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry Clafoutis- warm cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream. Love!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Tarte Tatin
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Profiteroles

tRbuHQi9MHpPb33a9MbrbA.text: Thank you BARDOT for such an amazing dining experience. You definitely helped make my birthday a memorable one!  I had been wanting to come here for a while, and my bf actually made reservations for us to eat here on my birthday. Everyone was extremely friendly and even wished me a happy birthday. We both had And God Created Woman, which I believe is named after the 50's French film. It was delicious. Just slightly sweet with citrus flavors that went well with the gin. Our server described it perfectly especially with the foam on top. We decided to start off our dinner with a cheese plate and oysters. The oysters were delicious and refreshing and the cheese plate, absolute perfection. We got the Blue cheese, goat cheese and the monks cheese. All of which were delicious!  We then ordered the caramelized goat cheese and beet salad, as well as the French onion soup. My bf wasn't too fond of the beet salad for the specific reason that he isn't too fond of beets (he ordered the salad), I thought it was delicious. I on the other hand bought the onion soup was good, but I felt like the cheese didn't melt properly.   For our main entrees, my bf got the pork chop, and I the gnocchi. The pork chop was supposedly fantastic, as he described it as really smoky bacon and enjoyed every bite. The gnocchi is not going to be what you expect. It is a very creamy dish with the triple creme wedges, butter soft, and very large gnocchi's. I personally thought it was a little too hearty for me, but it was still delicious  Dessert was finished nicely as my bf surprised me with a macaron with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate. The portions here are quite large for a French restaurant, and you definitely feel like you got the most of your meal. The staff is very friendly, I would recommend coming here at least once if you are able to

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lovely close to a wonderful birthday (usually, this is to share)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Gnocchi
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oysters, cheese plate, and Worlds Greatest Butter, were so fantastic, I actually forgot to take a photo

CJjraHpETn_hVS8Kt9D8EA.text: This place is definitely fancy and romantic, but I give 3 stars to the food, it was just not worth it at all and tasted it just like any other normal restaurants in town, we even asked the server for his recommendation on the menu and he said everything is great which was not True at all!!! Definitely not worth the price and didn't even taste delicious! We were so disappointed since we always enjoy trying new places. Great customer service though

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Aux Lentils
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread and butter
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tartare

dt5kq0efjbBMaxIswjOsSw.text: We made dinner reservations for four at Bardot after reading the positive reviews and having preciously visited Stripsteak which is another Michael Mina restaurant. The classy decor, style and overall vibe of the place is definitely one with a throwback feel. Upon entering we were immediately greeted and seated right away.  The waiter quickly took and brought our drinks and informed us of the night's specials. I tried to convince the table to order the Duck wings a L'Oreal but we ended up ordering the bone marrow and charcuterie board. The board was good but nothing too exciting but the bone marrow was simply devine and easily the best I've ever ordered at any steak house.  We ended up ordering the code which was on special and the double pork chop. Our friends both got steaks. They have a good selection of beers on tap and the service and ambience is second to none. We hope to be back soon. This is a great place to treat yourself when in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double pork chop
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That night&#39;s special, cod
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow. Simply awesome!

lP5V9hMWiWMAxL41B2iuvg.text: David at the BARDOT Brasserie is literally amazing. He went above and beyond to accommodate my table. We came in hungry and ready to have fun and he made the entire experience so amazing. If you come here ask to sit at his table. He's everything.

uRC30oJ1FiT-oeMF4mLK3A.text: Take. Me. Back.  I have little to no faith in Mina restaurants but this place blew me away. I come to Vegas enough to constantly struggling to try a new place vs visiting an old spot. Finally stayed away from grabbing brunch at Bouchon and ended up here. Located on the second floor, escalator near the taxi drop off. If you're coming from the casino floor, head over to the chocolate decor wall and you'll see the escalator.  The decor of this place is great. I feel like I'm in some 1950 building. Service was great, I forgot his name, but the server we had was very patient with us. He gave a good amount of suggestions, just that we didn't have the stomach to try everything. Ended up ordering the escargots bardot, short rib croissant benedict, and a bellini. Bellini was good, but I just felt like one that day, it's not a MUST HAVE. But the other two.... if you're able to take the disgusting thought of having to engulf a snail down your throat, order it. If you're not afraid of a heavy brunch dish, order that short rib croissant benedict. What this place has done right is the pastry. Both the bardot and the benedict had a good flakey crisp. If I didn't have to share the bardot, that would have been better. Unfortunately I came with 2 others and it was our first time, so sharing is caring. Blah blah blah. I was deciding between the short rib croissant benedict and the hunter's waffle (duck confit waffle, basically a more bougie version of chicken and waffles, I'm bougie so I considered it). I'm too much of a croissant fan so the benedict won me over. Not that it was a bad dish, it was just too heavy for my preference. I loved it, but I didn't want to be THAT full. Hunter's waffle would have left me in the same state. Flavors had been very rich, lots of juice coming from the short rib. Paired with the yolk, there goes the crispy and flakey croissant...   But yes. Make me go back there, because I can't say no.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croque madame..close up
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croque madame with fries
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar

6G1OsKDp9tahd_DHbcs66A.text: Wildly expensive for below mediocre food. Service is well intentioned but a mess. You couldn't pay me to ever go here again

b4ZXapI4JG7o-iazn16fkA.text: My obsession with this place is real. I've never seen such a beautiful bar. The food is amazing and it's a real dining experience. If I could get married here I would. Love Bardot!

HpzJ-ltgsTTaI4KxG212lw.text: Went in for dinner with some out of town friends and they were blown away , cocktails were amazing and the food was incredible as usual , the Escargot and foie gras parfait were the best I ever had , for dinner we had the double cut ribeye which was a perfect medium rare with so much flavor ( upgrade to the truffle fries worth every penny ) , the scallops were out of this world I didn't know scallops could taste so good and have a perfect texture and finally the duck breast ( I'm usually a beef kinda guy but with a 16 oz duck breast I thought I died and went to heaven ) our server Oscar was very personable and had that bubbly personality that makes you Fee like you've known him for years , and once he flambeed the baked Alaska dessert table side we knew we had a new favorite restaurant , thank you Oscar and Bardot Brasserie for an unforgettable meal !

dVJWHNPoYJaSVE4USbB-XQ.text: First thing first, you pay a premium for food & drinks on the strip, so the price here is inline with that.  We made a reservation at 6:30 on a Tuesday and we got seated right away when we arrived. It was half empty at that time, the waiter was friendly and explained the menu to us very well. The decor was great, looks just like a restaurant in French, unfortunately the noise level was unmistakably Vegas, it was definitely one of the nosiest restaurants we've visited including buffets and fast food.  We almost had to shout in order to hear one another.  I wonder if it was because there's a conversation crowd dining there. We ordered the octopus as appetizer and the beet salad, I had the scallops and my husband had the prime rib, we also had the Baked Alaska as dessert.  The dessert was the best value considered you got a show out of it, although the taste was just OK.  We like the rest of the food, it's good but not exceptional. The service was good overall, our waiter was attentive at first, but when the restaurant fills up, he was busy serving others, we had to wait for about 10 minutes after we finished our entrees for someone (whom looked like a hostess) to clear our plates and gave us the dessert menu.   Since there's tons of restaurants to choose from in Vegas, I don't think I'll come back just because of the noise level.

dlkUWev-VfJwoSA1IdCVeQ.text: We are already big Michael Mina fans, so needless to say, we really enjoyed Bardot. Started with escargot Bardot (escargot in puff pastry), foie gras parfait, and the steak tartar. The fois gras parfait was amazing - whipped with a thin layer of port gelee on top. Our server described it as "adult PB&J." The steak tartar has a very delicate flavor, so start with that first if you're going to have it because it didn't quite stand up to the other appetizers.   For mains, my friend ordered the Parisian gnocchi and it was excellent. I had the pork chop (it was huge and saltier with the bacon). Came with delicious horseradish mashed potatoes. My husband had a steak, which he enjoyed. The wine service was very nice - the server came with 3 recommended wines (one for each of us) and he poured us samples. The only downside was that we were completely unaware of the price (he quoted one glass at $18 and it was actually $25).   For dessert, don't miss the chocolate macaroon. It's big enough to share.  It was a bit pricey, but I'm told their brunch is a steal with bottomless rose. We will certainly be back!

H3UdZlsmRsB2gJobfZho4w.text: You need a reservation  Delicious food! Went for brunch. Loved the bread and the steak and eggs. Don't fall for the french toast! Its MASSIVE and a bit under coked in areas.  I would share it if you're still determined to order it!  Very pricey though, but what in Vegas isn't lol

hDju5WlsS1eCjXUEu9eiBQ.text: Food was good but the cocktails were the True highlight. MIXOLOGIST LILLIAN is ridiculous. We got to watch her work and she is meticulous. We asked her to make a few custom drinks and they were all phenomenal. I asked for a twist to an Old Fashioned, not too sweet and it came out perfect. My wife's drink (I can't remember all the great things she added but egg whites was one!) was exactly what she wanted. Lillian's first attempt was not satisfactory to her so she just threw it out. Sit in bar area and watch her work. Talk to her and you will get a perfect drink.

Tkz11irZRPP7W-T-eaI2dQ.text: Wow. Amazing. The foie gras parfait was spectacular and the fresh bread and butter is just like what you'd find in Paris. Excellent restaurant and service. I'll be back.

o5yN5MuFsSDS_JV0iQl-NQ.text: We had such a great experience here. I got the sea bass, BF got the chicken. We split a bottle of wine, the frisee salad and the macaroni. Everything was cooked perfectly and full of flavor. Great service, beautiful atmosphere. We were so relaxed and happy the whole meal. Highly recommend. I think the dish I'll crave the most is the macaroni. Uniquely prepared and so tasty.

r_QyGURuttVJrxdUYMVr0A.text: The decorum is beautiful but not so much that you feel uncomfortable inside. Comfortable elegance with class--nothing like feeling like you're in a stuffy library that you can't talk.The staff are so inviting and helpful with your selections. We loved the Foie Gras parfait with grilled country bread! They even brought more bread. It's the type of appetizer that would make you act naughty, like licking your fingers. The escargot bardot took awhile to come out but, I did wish that I could taste the escargot more than the pastry. However, it was warm and delicate. The Skate wing was good. But, the main star was the Oak fired pork chop! The smoke on the pork chip was amazing. We can't wait to go back and try their other selections.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AC7nhqchqMa6CBYUQhjvQw.text: Such a beautiful restaurant and always the best service!! I am not a fan of fish, but was talked into trying the Sea Bass and it was amazing!! The charcuterie and cheese displays are to die for. One of Michael Mina's finest!!

KZ1ERV7oJwfx527cqEVr9w.text: I had reservations on a Saturday evening and was seated quickly and in a very nice location. I had a view of a large part of the restaurant and the bar.  The restaurant design and decor is classy and so a view of the restaurant which I had was very pleasant and added to the overall ambiance in a good way. The food is fantastic.  Delicate and tasty.  I enjoyed my entire meal.  My entree was the pork chop, which is delicious. The service is top class.  Absolutely. The drinks I tried were delicious. Overall, I had a wonderful dinner and time well spent at the restaurant and plan to dine there again. I look forward to it.

mmZzSuiDccp25SudWQRwmw.text: We had reservations and high hopes! We got in so fast even with a line! Though, once inside...the wait started. Just to get our waitress and a glass of water it took 15 minutes. Our waitress was a nice pregnant girl, and have only little complaints about her.  She was quiet, so quiet I could barely hear her over the incredible noise. We did tapas, ordering 8 appetizers. Shrimp cocktail was perfectly cooked and tender. The cheese plate was delicious. The meat plate, half yummy half flavorless.  The duck lorange was not to my taste, though others said it was just ok. The pigs ear turned my stomach, but I had a small price that was totally fat, the men ate the rest. My sister spit her piece out. The seared foie gras was yummy, the parfait foie gras was delicious! King crab crepe was yummy!  The worst part the bread was burnt, ard and inedible. Which made it hard to eat most of the appetizers, as most required some sort of delivery device.  All the desserts were amazing The manager came over and spoke to us, and apologized, though didn't offer any discount or compensation. So don't expect any thing more than " I'm sorry, you didn't enjoy the meal." Which is fine, we didn't need a discount or freebies. But with the amount of food sent back it would have been nice. And it would have been nice of the waitress was a little more attentive.

bztN7cgx1pdjZP3eafTHbA.text: Excellent restaurant and service.  I was taken care of in the bar area, but the server (Rosie) was fantastic.  She was considerate, knowledgeable and complimentary of my menu choices. The Sommelier, Andrew, came over when I was reviewing the wine list and was incredibly knowledgeable.  He offered a perfect pairing and was very personable.  Kudos to the team in the restaurant, everyone from beginning to end was first class and perfect.

eWF-4a_VihXa3gOreELN6g.text: The baguette was delicious with the salted butter.   I got the King Crab Crepe.  It was meh.   Did not seem like they used king crab.   Looked a lot like the artificial stuff.   The overall taste was off too.   My friend ordered the mussels with fries.   Those were AMAZING!  The cream sauce was perfect and the fries were so divine.   We also tried the onion soup with the beef & egg.   I would recommend just the soup.  The extra fixings weren't that great.    The property is beautiful.   The bar is visually stunning.

D1MIsctc09fw5hhEv1R-JA.text: Excellent  from  first  bite  to last. The  bread  tastes  like it just  came  out  of  the  oven  at a Paris boulangerie. The   cocktails  are  exquisite. Appetizers, entrees, desserts  - don't  have  the  words  to  convey how  good everything  was. Service  is attentive, but personable - no attitude. I love Michael  Mina's restaurants.

IRUSTkeKRF7rVWCVXoQ5lQ.text: Glad we came here for happy hour before our show.  I can see this restaurant becoming popular very soon.  Especially love the escargot (great flavor with a buttery crust).  You get three pieces for $6 (HH menu).  We also ordered from the regular menu... I'd prefer the gnocchi to be chewier but still yummy & the onion soup was not salty (move away Bouchon!).  I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m a sucker for escargot.  Ended up with 3 orders (HH menu).
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $2 per oysters on the HH menu. Two fatty ones, love!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good but gnocchi on the softer side.

4zcQaIEYbq-48g1r3ogkdA.text: This place is amazing! Came here for dinner and everything was out of this world tasty! Duck al'orange, King crab crepe, and chocolate macaroon dessert were all the best. Definitely try this French brasserie. Staff was incredibly friendly and not pretentious.

84ienl5mLp8QxOAgSu-Tug.text: I had an absolutely delicious meal here. We arrived a little early so we grabbed a drink at the bar. Attentive bartenders and a great selection of liquor. The hostess came by to grab us when our table was ready and almost immediately our server arrived with a bottle of water. We opted for the Summer in Provence tasting menu and the wine pairings. We both selected the tuna tartare, the scallops, sea bass, and strawberry pavlova. The alcohol pairings allowed for either a wine with each course of cocktail/beer. Our server was incredibly accommodating and said it would be no problem if I wanted to try the cocktail with my first course since I really wanted to try "And God Made Woman."   First, the food was amazing. The portions were good and the wine with each course was delicious. And damn if that "And God Made Woman" cocktail wasn't worth asking the server for a sub. Seriously, get a glass, it's awesome.   Having never had strawberry pavlova, I was super surprised by the presentation and now I'm going to research how to make it at home because it was just that good.  Hands down one of the most expensive meals we've ever had, but we both agreed we'd come back. I mean, I don't know what else to say, it's just really good. Also, say yes to the bread when they ask.

zduFokzD4_A6k_BrZ17Q8g.text: This place is definitely as good as it gets in Vegas!  A group of friends enjoyed a fantastic dinner here last night.  We started with the steak tartare, chickpea fries and the charcuterie plate...wow, what a way to start a meal!  We also enjoyed an amazing French rose to pair beautifully with our menu selections.  For our next course I enjoyed the onion soup...ooh la la - so amazing!  The server highly recommended the herb crusted cod and he didn't lead my wrong as it was fresh, flaky and so flavorful.  We were stuffed, but felt like we had to try some dessert since the rest of the meal was so amazing...well, so glad we did - the chocolate macaron was to die for and the frozen paris brest was so refreshing and downright amazing!  Wow - this is a must visit restaurant in Vegas...I promise you will not be disappointed!

-mbbftdNyRTcuR8yzScwjA.text: Above and beyond service! This review is for service...not the food at Bardot. We were excited to try their king crab crepe and $25 bottomless rose deal, but we arrived at the restaurant to be told the exhaust hood over their stoves wasn't working, and they were cancelling all remaining reservations. The manager walked us over to Herringbone (also in Aria), explained the sitch to their manager, who said they would seat us and honor the rose special...nice touch! We enjoyed a fresh squeezed greyhound at the bar, before being seated in their outside patio, where we had a fabulous lunch. When the check came, our server told us that Bardot had covered our rose tab....WOW! Having to shut down dining on a Saturday afternoon is a restaurant's worst nightmare, but they still went the extra mile to make it up to their inconvenienced customers...definitely will go back next time I'm in Vegas! And Herringbone was awesome too!

GrLvk0JWL4A-d1uM1ervtA.text: Best Authentic French Cuisine. Our  waitress Cassie was very professional. You want real French  food, this is the place.  Our menu were : Salmon Lentils, Crab Crepes and Boulanger Basket.  Bardot Brasserie ROCK!!!!!!!

-dr3GveFriZqgw38T1lpMA.text: Great ambiance, excellent cocktails, good service and tasty food. I recommend this place if you are looking for a great dinning experience.

iwc4DH5IhyT5VfCRruT20g.text: beautiful place, with just right portions (albeit a little pricey). Have been 3x: twice during dinner and once during rose brunch - where the servers NEVER let my glass become under half full with rose!!! Same applies to my water glass! The service was supreme. The side of hash browns is delicious and so was the french toast that we all shared (several portions). There is a slight dress code for gentlemen so check on that - we came to booze it up right before Life is Beautiful festival so had to tell the guys no festival wear until after rose brunch ;)

YioDR9YkMT0x691CVywumQ.text: "Great food but poor service" 3 of 5 stars Pending review  Made a reservation for a table for 3 for dinner and were seated by the bar area, which was very disappointing. We asked if we could be seated in the main restaurant and were told there were no tables available. Perhaps we should have been told this when the reservation was made? We ordered cocktails and it took 45 minutes just to get our drinks. The waitress kept apologizing that the bar was backed up. Honestly-45 minutes to get drinks?? By the time our drinks came, we finished our appetizers and were ready for our main meal. The manager did comp our drinks but it did not make up for the long wait time. The food was well prepared and very tasty but overall this was not a great experience. There are too many excellent restaurants in Vegas where they appreciate your patronage. I would not recommend spending your money here.

ESsp5M5YlcuH1UdGfGQOwQ.text: Brunch was incredible! I ordered the Hunter's Waffle with glazed duck confit. We had a party of 10 and each of us sampled each other's plates ( I enjoyed them all). A few of us ordered the Everylasting Rose for $25 which was well worth it! I am partial to French cuisine but the quality of the ingredients and preparation were excellent. I will be back next time I am in town.

nmTIeSElrJkOV2LD_G4Lvg.text: Amazing food!  Amazing service.  Staff was very knowledgable.  I tried so much food.  It was by far one one of the best restaurants in town.  This was a great addition to Aria.    For only being open a couple days it seemed as the staff had been there for years.  Great job!

xImVh8gcmqHqrhkPCDcOvg.text: This place won't disappoint. Great food and service. Ordered the bone marrow and lamb. Food was a tad on the salty side and environment was a bit noisy because of the music but other than that, fantastic food and nearly impeccable service.

gK31z26I3e3TeDdiM6izlQ.text: Ok you should never eat anywhere for bread and dessert, but the baguettes and chocolate macaron were so carb worthy.  The bartenders are very knowledgable so just ask them to make you something!

6i_ae3QioQmfjuUHHe2Mjw.text: The service is always impeccable. The food is delicious. It feels so good going to a place where you know you will never be disappointed.

jYG5akXynwSrLJB71En8DQ.text: Very upscale. The food was amazing and cooked perfectly. The mixed drinks were unique and delicious. Try to make a reservation ahead of time if you plan to go on a weekend as this place will be packed.

kxa-PxLyqIHO0io9ny69aw.text: Great classic French Bistro. Food was simple yet delicious and the atmosphere was vibrant and young. Had a frisee salad and the steak frites au poivres; two of my favorite classic bistro dishes. They did not disappoint.

xRT2LoBNyARmf0Qo3CAM4A.text: A beautifully decorated room. Warm colors & festive, instantly transporting you to  Paris, France.  My friends & I were escorted to a nice comfortable room with a big 4 top table. Thank goodness it wasn't a little table!  That part of a Paris Brasserie was left out of our experience.  Our first course was the Pate de Champagne, Foie Gras Parfait, & Fruits de Mer. LOVED the Pate de Champagne with the port wine gelee. The perfect combo of sweet & salty. I couldn't get enough of the melt in your mouth love. The Foie Gras Parfait had a textbook European Foie Gras  texture I liked it but I do prefer the Pate creaminess. My friends who are from Europe absolutely loved it. The cornichons that acompanied the Foie Gras balanced the dish with it's salty sour flavor. And of course the Fruits de Mer was lovely in presentation as well as taste. My taste buds were soooo happy! Our mains were Lobster Thermador & Rack of Lamb. The presentation of the Lobster Thermador was beautiful. 2 huge pieces of Lobster (shared by 2) topped with Brandy cream Bernaise. The Bernaise sauce was whipped to look like a cloud of French heaven. It was lovingly baked on the  Lobster. I was sad that I didn't order that till my Lamb Crown Roast was put before me.  Lamb was done perfectly. It was juicy & spiced just right. It was supposed to be for 2 people but the portion was so huge 3 could've been very satisfied with this delectable entree. I was suprised at the vegetable that  accompanied my Lamb. I thought that I hated Eggplant. The Chef & his staff proved me wrong. It was a puree of Eggplant topped with pesto sauce. It was such an amazing balance of flavors, salty & sweet. We also had mushrooms a la grecque & green beans almondine. The mushrooms were soooo delicious I really wished I didn't have to share that dish. It was heavenly & melted in my mouth. Not that they were mushy, but so perfectly cooked. Sadly the green beans were overly salted. So mush that no one ate much of it.  The last course was our 2 desserts. Coupe de Glacee which was the sorbet of the day, Strawberry topped with merengue. You would think eh, sorbet, so pedestrian. But this presentation was amazing! It was so unusual I actually took a picture of it. I'm not one of those camera foodies, but this desert looked so good. The merengue topping looked like little clouds of heaven. Not overly sweet, perfectly crunchy & yummy. The sorbet under the merengue had little bits of strawberry whipped into it. Aria has perfected the sorbet, what else can I say. We also had the classic Creme Caramel topped with a spun sugar cookie. It was also quite delicate & great with our after dinner espressos.   The service was exceptional. The Bardot staff was so attentive, patiently explaining our questions. I really appreciate good service which in my town is sadly lacking at most strip venues. These professionals were at the top of their craft. Cudos to them!  I was so happy that I took my friends to this restaurant. It's a gamble to go to a restaurant in the first weeks of a grand opening. A lot can go wrong as the staff is still working out the kinks. Evidently these people are the creme de la creme of fine dining. The food & service was superb! Bravo & Bon Apetit!!

zJ_VIH-XsvTyDVD-nJf_fA.text: One of my faves if I'm feeling gluttonous but not wanting the buffet type setting.  Setup on the second level inside Aria. Some delicious traditional French dishes alongside some fun interesting take on the classics. Start by sharing the prime steak tartare and frisee aux lardons. I'm a big fan of simple dishes that are seasoned and executed well. Both of these dishes are just that. Their variations on Benedicts are deliciously fun but my favorite dish is the hunter's waffle -- a sort of duck a l'orange for breakfast. Sitting atop a waffle is glazed duck confit and perfectly poached eggs that are smothered with sauce maltaise. It's sweet and savory and makes me smile. And don't forget the everlasting rose. Service is absolutely always on point whether it's at the bar or at a table. Support staff is always helpful. Managers actively on the floor visiting with guests. It is pricey but absolutely worth every penny. Awesome awesome food, service and environment.

O6O5IdN3W6np4Bj0Mpibmw.text: Food was pretty good, not great.   Service was lousy.   Servers were generally inattentive and sometimes rude.   One of the members of our party asked a server where his diet coke was (it had been ordered 15 minutes earlier) and the server replied "I'm not the coke person".   No offer to go get it or find the right person.

HP1m6UuC8UVkSGjkHiNkEw.text: We did the Valentine's Day brunch and had an amazing culinary experience. The food is excellent, I can't even name one, everything we tried from appetizer to main to desert was delicious! Our server JP was really sweet and he brought the girls roses at the end of brunch. We'll be back for sure

7HM1Wz42jJZfxiWzqCnoGA.text: Beautiful restaurant! The food is very good as well and the service is great. We had so many lovely dishes but I would say that my favorite would be the escargot with chartreuse butter. So good! Can't wait to come back.

b2Wv5aBJTpEqnZZJ2j5h-Q.text: We've been to Vegas a few times.  We've tried different brunch places and this was by far the best.  Wife had the French Onion soup and the 4" tall French Toast.  French Onion was perfect, not salty like most spots.  french Toast was great and not overly sweet.  Will definitely be back.

fxKSNtJmP89C86DIwCy13g.text: This place is amazing! Great service, atmosphere, and the food and drinks are seriously incredible. I sat at the bar with a friend around dinner time and we ordered a few cocktails and mostly a bunch of different appetizers. Everything was delicious. It's a great vibe and you can go casual or fancy. I went twice while in Vegas and that's saying a lot!

uLF0_0MV8Vvs9LHnOqPu5g.text: Fantastic resturant!  Amazing atmosphere.  Great drinks but even better food .  I highly recommend for a great date night.

wu5SbnQ0p1PIQfp1Q3MpMw.text: The pate was amazing.  I also had the pork chop which was a hit.  Service was fantastic.  I'll be back here soon.

H1eIpBlmfUTq353SN6haqw.text: Food was pretty good. We got the oyster sampler. The west coast oysters were better than the east coast oysters. The main courses were good but portions do run a little small. Average price for a main course was about $35.

qskffIulpM_aVVLU-1Y_1Q.text: Best French toast ever! It's worth going to Vegas just for that. My Bellini was a little disappointing, but otherwise perfect.

jgPD6Og87RQBO1b7356dHg.text: The chickpea fries were awesome! The rest of the food was good...but definitely not worth the price.

fLXFfdwRwmkR6f6pJBanhg.text: My first time at a Michael Mina establishment and it was memorable.  I loved Bardot upon entry, we had a minor reservation snafu but the host quickly was able to take care of us. Bardot is sexy, chic with an easy sophistication. My senses were quickly stimulated and I quickly was enraptured in a laissez-faire attitude while thinking of what cocktail to have.  In my group, I had (forgive me for not having the exact names) Salmon with Beluga Lentils, started with an Endive Salad, and Lemon Meringue Tart for dessert. Salmon was robust and rich, and the Endive Salad balanced the strong flavors of the bleu cheese and endive perfectly in it's vinaigrette.  But that Lemon Meringue Tart? I'm still dreaming of it. It was THAT good.  If they offer you bread and butter here, definitely get it. That baguette is served perfectly warm and that butter is creamy.  Michael Mina isn't that everyday occasion, but I'll definitely find a reason to come back here!  The only disappointment was having a few glasses of rose and not finding a photo of Brigitte anywhere! Dommage.

k_XZ8dMhkZZgWjdVn4-cgQ.text: I would recommend either Bardot Mon Ami gabi for brunch in Vegas. Bardots portions are big so we shared the following amongst 4 girls:  - escargot bardot: comes in 4 small servings. Not as tasty as expected but still good - endive and blue cheese salad: simple and delicious, blue cheese wasnt too overpowering - petit french onion soup: perfect in every way - french toast: basically half a loaf of high quality bread. Sooo full!  I will be back!! Next time I would try the nutella sticky buns...

JYCont4G_-kXP8B5fygoyA.text: Everything was so good here. The 14oz Double Cut Ribeye was to die for. It was so tender and juicy that it melted in your mouth. The food portions were big. Everyone enjoyed their dishes: Bone Marrow Au Poivre, Seared Foie Gras Lyonnaise and Lamb Rack "Frites". The service was okay because it was a tad slow, but it wasn't a full-house night.

m0mAFaiYRQvoBrd7vyWsZQ.text: One of the best looking restaurants around - all black lacquer, brass, tile, and marble.  It was "fancy brasserie" done right.  We ordered the pastry basket - yum, hunter's waffle, crab crepe, and eggs with bacon.  The duck and bacon were a little on the salty side, but the food overall was great.  We paid a little extra to separate the waffle from the duck and eggs and get whipped cream and strawberries instead.  The strawberries were the sweetest I've ever tasted.  How they got them to the desert, I don't know.   The bread and butter also deserve their own shout-out.  I basically filled up half my stomach space on those alone.

KxJ0RFXVYA8tD_5WKOB0aw.text: One of my favorite places to go for Sunday brunch :) salmon eggs Benedict never seems to disappoint and their restaurant has a nice and pretty ambience !

_Vzzp-GPQJAb3AYawMvOFw.text: Amazing atmosphere at bar and in the dining room! Great menu selection and the cocktails were extraordinary. Definitely recommend this restaurant for Aria!

rRC_rf4VW3wvnT4RSwgbSw.text: I went here for brunch with 15 people and we all felt disrespected and mistreated by the waiter. He told three of us to "relax" three separate times. He personally told me to relax when I asked if he could bring me ketchup when he had a chance. The food was average, but after this experience you couldn't pay me to go back. This is my first time writing a negative review on yelp. I am not one to complain but I felt this was necessary. My friend spoke to the manager about the poor and undeserved service we had, yet we had nothing taken off our bill. In all, terrible horrible, experience.

m4tKQTX6BT6hGN2GLY10JQ.text: Las Vegas, Nevada - Aria  I usually don't 5-star Vegas restaurants but this place was really excellent.  Foie gras, salmon, yellowfin tuna nicoise excellent.  Others at our table had mussels, filet, cheese plate et cetera.  Everything was great.  The gnocchi was the best I've ever had.     Also, pricing was very reasonable for LV.  Our tab was $120, including tax & tip, for 2 glasses of wine, 2 entrees, and the Foie gras. Also great baguettes.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow fin salad

iLVOPgApON-ZiBf2r7gHNQ.text: 5 stars all the way for Bardot! It's one of the best French places I've been to!  + Escargot. 6 individual puff pastures ($18). Each one is packed with butter/garlic flavor! I'm not sure how they did this and still in awe about it because escargot is typically doused in butter and garlic but instead, the butter and garlic flavors are all embedded into the puff pastry. When you take a bite into the puff pastry he the escargot itself is actually pretty hot but the outside (the puff pastry) is warm.  + Smoked Salmon Croissant Benedict (FTW!). I am SO GLAD I went with this because I was debating between this and the lobster option. I love salmon but was told both were equally as good, just depends on what you're craving. The smoked salmon, hollandaise and croissant are all buttery goodness! They all pair so well together and the quality of the smoked salmon is like nothing I've ever had! The croissant isn't your typical croissant, but made to compliment the fillings (i.e. Egg, kale and of course salmon in this case).  The coffee is good too! I tried a few other things but can't remember since it's been some time since my visit - BUT - the quality of food here is amazing for the price! Service was attentive and on point. They have officially become my new favorite French restaurant!

kQAy5DiqeoqMoHj-7JxqZw.text: Excellent wine list, classy atmosphere and decor.  While the acoustics are a little loud the food in top notch and the service is excellent! Added props to. Rozita the server. She was great, memorized our orders and got it all right, she was attentive without being overbearing and extremely friendly. Great job guys!

PMrs-QxbDFKSE4SLp8E9mA.text: Classic classy restaurant.  The service was nice and professional.  The Hunters Waffles were the best food I had in Vegas.  Highly recommended breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunters Waffle, fantastic

kR8R3g5Nf6WQNYMKt_3XdQ.text: YES! what a nice change of pace is Las Vegas~   LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the feeling, the decor & our service was all excellent. So why only 4 stars? actually I would give 4.5 if YELP! gave half stars....the noise level is EXTREMELY high. Now that means people have having a good time, which is OK with me, however just be prepared. I was there with a old friend just catching up and were @ a 2 top and a couple times we did say to each other, "What?"   The menu is diverse enough that everyone should be able to find a delish choice for appetizers, dinner & dessert. All our selections were very inviting to look at and MOST OF ALL tasted as good as they looked~ We both thought the price point was fare (again your on the Strip!)     The Bar area was hopping too, something was going on as many, many people were in costume through out the hotel.   Bardot Brasserie is inside the Aria, have to walk a ways one inside the Aria, but this is Las Vegas so that's nothing new.

uhCwmeK2GE982KBEb4u-eA.text: Went here for a bachelorette brunch. Food was okay, did not care for the chicken French dip or croque madame. Both were very average choices. Service was shocking. Rude waitstaff, never saw the server, asked for our bill three times, did not refill water the entire time. Disappointing.

F-ddxYeY1tx29k9ePqHECw.text: This is one of my top favorite restaurants in LV. The menu is amazing and so if the atmosphere (and I live the decor). I recommend the French onion soup (I asked to add truffle, it's a $6 Addition but worth every penny- it's not the same without it. For the same price they will also add an egg and beef but I didn't want that). The crab was amazing!

3VC9B2x6muHlFkAyu1QYDA.text: second time coming here still never fails i always get a croissant benedict this time the smoked salmon perfectly flakey with the strength to hold the eggs and smoked salmon. the little cheese and fruit platter is great alongside with the fresh baguette and greatest butter from Paris . if u need a pick me up i advise to get the cappuccino perfect foam to espresso ratio. great service and great food always gotta come back here

KTI4KwajAp61Mupm1wFHvA.text: This place never disappoints. Always have great service, food is delicious, and the drinks are on point. This is a restaurant that I like to take friends when they're visiting from out of town because I know they'll be impressed. This is a must try!

p-B-zuzRBIATFzdHZ-1L0g.text: I loved Bardot when I went on Valentine's Day. I don't know if I can give an honest review though without mentioning that I may have gotten really terrible food poisoning from here that night. It started a few hours after I ate here, and my husband met someone in the casino whose wife got food poisoning from BarMasa the same night. There might've been something just going around Aria. That's why I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 4.  Aside from possible food poisoning, the food was fantastic. We shared onion soup, escargots, steak tartare, and the charcuterie board. The steak tartare entree was so good, we actually ordered an extra appetizer sized one. We also shared the chocolate macaron dessert, which was great but a little too rich. The only thing I ate that my husband didn't was complimentary macarons at the end of the meal. The other negative was service. We went on Valentine's Day, so we expected rushed service, but we were there early with few other diners and still felt like we barely saw or heard from our waiter.

E69uMuCJJSDhqsuUwM8D2A.text: One of my friends made reservations at 6 pm for 11 persons to celebrate 2 of our friends' birthday on Saturday: 3/6/2016. Located in Aria hotel and near the buffet, this place, foods, and customer service were great. The food was cooked to perfection and everyone enjoyed their food. I had the pork chops and it melts in your mouth. I had sampled a little bit of my friends food. It was great. It was too hard to choice which one is the best. I was too full to finish my pork chops but had to because some of my friends and I had to go to a show right after. I didn't want to carry any left over food around and leave it in the car to spoil. I would recommend.
