Fpeyd7E-jL6k8nXXLoIDLQ.text: The best brunch in Las Vegas.    That sounds like hyperbole, since Vegas is a city overrun with brunch spots at all price points and levels of quality.  But Michael Mina's Bardot Brasserie is the real deal.  It forgoes behemoth pancakes and bottom-shelf mimosas for top-quality French gastronomy, and the payoff is amazing.  Another plus: Bardot Brasserie is one of the few brunch spots that accepts reservations, which we were lucky to have when I joined 2 friends here for a 10am Sunday brunch.  The place was totally packed.  The hostess then whisked us past gorgeous displays of breads and pastries to a beautiful table near the back, which was an excellent vantagepoint to soak in the classy decor.  We started off with a round of cappuccinos, followed by "la boulangerie" -- an assortment of breads and pastries, along with baguettes and butter.  Absolutely everything was fresh, warm, and packed with flavor.  I would've been happy camper calling it a day after that, but we were hungry, so we kept ordering.  For the mains, we shared a plate of "pate de campagne" of pork, veal and pistachio, served with pickled vegetables, more crusty baguette, and spicy mustard.  The next course was the hunter's waffle with duck confit, poached eggs, and maltaise sauce.  Both of these were outstanding, but the hunter's waffle was truly exceptional -- an elevated and elegant twist on eggs benedict.  Somewhere in the middle of the mains, we had a bottle of "Patrick Bottex Bugey Cerdon" rose, which was a delicate and smooth bubbly that paired excellently with the duck.  (Speaking of which -- service was outstanding.  Our server knew the menu inside and out, and exactly what bottle to pair with what dish.)  To round out the meal, we tasted three different desserts -- chocolate macaron, apple tarte tatin, and orange jelly candy.  All of these were pure heaven, but special props go to that chocolate macaron.   Now I know why it's one of the signature dishes of the house.  The chocolate cookie combined with the dark chocolate mousse is just pure decadence.  I can't say enough good things about Bardot Brasserie.  I hope this place keeps Vegas classy -- and my belly full -- for a long time to come.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. orange jelly candy
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. apple tarte tatin
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate macaron

yvd1BKf2IMGzTs34tfnVIA.text: 5 stars for brunch service.  Came on a slower weekend, with an OpenTable reservation at 10 am. Every staff member we met was friendly, helpful, and professional; I was pleasantly surprised. Our waiters knew their menu very well and gave us great suggestions for our orders. Water and coffee was always refilled with the attentive staff.  Fois Gra Parfait: bold in flavor, no fillers, just fois gras and ruby port gelee. Grilled country bread and mini pickles on the side. It seemed small at first, but then we realized how rich, dense, and flavorful it was and we ended up having leftover. Definitely worth a try.   Short-rib Croissant Benedict: RICH, delicious, savory. I don't know if I'd order this again, but I only regret my stomach wasn't big enough for this to fit comfortably.  French toast with mascapone, almond brittle, and almond syrup: huge, perfectly balanced in sweetness and textures. This is definitely large enough for 2 people to share.  Food was generously portioned, ambiance was Parisian-elegant/chic, and the staff was fantastic. I will definitely be visiting Bardot again for brunch next time I'm in town.

be0GdupXfVaQ7UGmnzIdyQ.text: Michael Mina's restaurants blow me away every single time but Bardot is THE #1 most exceptional restaurant I have ever been to in my life (Michael Mina at bellagio is a close 2nd). The experience from the moment you walk up is absolutely phenomenal in every aspect. The look, the feel, the service, THE FOOD- it is worth every single penny. Is it noisy? Yes. Is it pricey? Yes. But if you're coming to Vegas for a quiet romantic getaway and expect a 5 star meal for under $50 you're vacationing at the wrong destination. The escargot is wrapped in a puff pasty and I could have ordered that alone and left and still be 100% satisfied with my visit. That is a MUST even if you don't normally enjoy escargot. However, we did order plenty more and every single course got better and better. We paired each course with a drink the server (Carlos?) and bartender (Dino) recommended (and a few more) and WOW, the presentation with the drinks themselves were astounding. After the escargot, Brussel sprouts, mussels, flat iron grass fed steak, and scallops it was time for the table side flambe baked alaska! Every single item was impeccable. I can not recommend Bardot enough! Thank you to everyone that assisted us with our experience!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat iron steak with truffle fries

AokGHqZqt6kcdGKykhikyQ.text: We came here for our anniversary dinner and loved it! We were greeted for our reservation with a cute signed card from the staff congratulating us.   We had made the *mistake* of eating at Wicked Spoon for brunch earlier in the day, so we didn't get to try as many menu items at Bardot as we wanted to (glutton problems). We ordered cocktails to start, the Crowd Pleaser for him and Death in the Florida Straights for me. Both were excellent, I wanted to order 5 more of mine, because the spiciness was divine, but we had a show later I needed to be awake for.   We skipped appetizers, and he got the Heritage Chicken Roti and I had the filet mignon with steak frites. Ooooh man. My steak was a perfect rare, and so juicy tender perfect. The fries are cooked in beef fat and are pure decadence with mayonnaise. My husband was in love with his chicken, and we heard our waiter tell another table they were out of it as we were eating, so try not to miss it!   The restaurant itself is gorgeously decorated, and while we were sitting at a center table, it still felt quite intimate and romantic. Our waiter was great, and struck the perfect balance of attentive and unobtrusive.   By this point we were stuffed, which was a heartbreak, because I wanted to try their entire dessert menu. Truly, though, it gives us an excuse to come back on our next visit-- not that we really needed one.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Crowd Pleaser and Death in the Florida Straights, which was one of the best cocktails I&#39;ve ever had.

MSR3Q3UgiXAvIMkL2MsAFw.text: Wish I could give more than 5 stars. The filet and fries were the best I've ever had. The service was excellent and the wine menu was amazing. The atmosphere was nice, very warm environment. I will definitely be returning.

Dlhzyqkb0S9VdExULAlHXg.text: I ate here for my birthday and was not disappointed. The ambience was purely fantastic. The cocktails were delicious, and he food was amazing. I had the lamb, which was moist and delicious, and my partner had the gnocchi which was a fantastic French twist- small mouthfuls of delight. Very romantic, ambient atmosphere.

Y3OwaOdOvBBaihrbfTJkAQ.text: I was very excited to try this restaurant for the first time due to the wonderful reviews and the love for French food. However I would never recommend or step a foot back into this place. When we got seated nobody came up to our table or bring us menus until my husband asked for menus. When we finally ordered the food and drinks it took a while for everything to come out. I ordered the duck waffles, half way through one, on my last bite I felt something sharp in my mouth I took it out to only notice it was a thick piece of plastic that could of cut my throat had I swallowed it by accident and possible damage my organs. I asked for a manager right away and he did apologize and comp our meal, however this is still a huge liability and reputation risk for such a high end and not cheap restaurant. People's safety should always come first and this fell very short of it. They need to be held to higher standards of performing quality assurance in the kitchen if a piece of plastic from some packaging is getting into the food.

Mb-prO6D-TEpVVcus5de2g.text: This is one of the best Las Vegas casino restaurants, hands down. There are so many places where it all just gets mailed in, this is not one of them. It starts with the kitchen team and extends to the front of the house. If you're price cautious you can absolutely navigate the menu to keep it reasonable and if not, then you can live decadently with the handful of more extravagant dishes.   Stand outs included the escargot (best I ever had), foie gras parfait, the seasonal specials (a salad and a ravioli-type of thing topped with truffle), mac and cheese, the scallops and the wellington. And of course the fresh bread, delicious!  You can't go wrong picking Bardot as one of your vacation restaurant choices or as a place for locals to celebrate on The Strip.

JaExymYGHRXElGnCHOnQMA.text: Excellent brunch! We aren't one for fighting the buffet lines or stuffing our faces first thing in the morning so this place was perfect. This restaurant has a great modern French vibe and very flavorful food.   We started out with the "best butter in the world" for an extra $5 and it was worth it. The butter was that classic French butter with a side of rock salt. It wasn't hard and easy to spread on the cut bread that was served with the butter. The tables that did not upgrade the butter had small French baguettes that also looked good but our bread was amazing. Perfect spongy texture on the inside with a crunchy crust on the outside. Definitely worth the upgrade if you like bread and butter.   I wanted to be a little healthy before overindulging the rest of the day so I tried a side salad to start. Amazing. It had a light citrus vinegarette and very fresh lettuce. The lettuce tasted like butter lettuce but had more color to it. Simple salad but packed with flavor.   I ordered the steak and eggs for my main. Not the most flavorful but cooked exactly medium rare like I asked for. I didn't see my steak knife and ended up using a butter knife the whole time and had no issues cutting it. Eggs were pretty standard but did look like European eggs because the yolk was more orange.   As sides we got the thick cut bacon. Super thick cut and it was delicious. No burnt taste to it and so flavorful. We would definitely order this side again.   Overall, great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Lots of flavor in all the food. Typical French menu with a few twists and extras to cater to Americans. Great decor. We will definitely be going back for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Worlds best butter&#34; and bread
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad and fries

Dn0TzIyPtYDfG6hR9-8k1w.text: We had brunch here last Sunday. The ambiance is lovely and the servers are very nice. Unfortunately, the food was disappointing in a few instances. I ordered an Irish coffee which arrived cold. They took it back and heated it and it took way too long, and arrived barely luke warm. Hubby ordered the Huntsman Waffle with the duck confit and poached eggs, asked for the eggs poached hard, they came extremely soft so he sent them back. The rest of our group went ahead and ate, and it took a long time for my husband's meal to come out. No apology, no concession on the bill. Service was pretty slow also. However, the Nutella sticky bun is awesome, as was the smoked salmon starter.

eu9kG2eLZuMD28K0ijlctw.text: Good for large groups. Service went smoothly and timely. The king crab crepe was delicious. A great way to start the meal. The mussels were nice and plump in a light broth. Wasn't too fond of the gnocchi but they weren't horrible. Something about the goat cheese didn't mix well with the dish. The echire butter was worth the try.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Echire butter, king crab crepe, gnocchi, and mussels

wCzg4rPxTrqR9Lqrh9Ovaw.text: A nice weekend brunch in a beautiful space. It is designed to mimic an actual French brasserie. The juices were delicious. The omelet was nice, but not as delicate as I expected. Potato square was good and the little mixed green salad was delicious. I had the croque madame. It was gorgeous to look at and the egg was perfectly cooked. However - it was three slices of thick white bread (not grilled or toasted), layered with rolled-up thinly sliced deli ham, brie and bechamel. White bread? American ham? Triple decker? What is this, a play on a club? Our server, the adorable and efficient Colin, had a French accent so when he asked me about my dish, I was honest. I pushed him to admit it was not an authentic execution at all. Crusty, grilled bread and French ham is expected. I'd go back though, because they really are doing good, delicious things there.

muSn6NrQa0KdbcGEl5tbww.text: This was such a disappointment. I waited forever for a waiter to even come to my table. The food was overall  bad and the crab bisque wasn't a bisque at all. More like tomato sauce with barely thawed frozen crab thrown in. It's extremely pricey and for these prices I would expect a million times better service and food. Just terrible!

C80YfAoU_8uXKF-nPAmfBQ.text: Chef Michael Mina says "Every detail of Bardot Brasserie was designed to transport guests to a cafe along the Champs-Elysees in the 1920's" and it does just that. If you are looking for a superb dining experience in Vegas, definitely stop by Bardot!  This is the kind of place when they talk about the best Chefs in the world having the best restaurants in Las Vegas this is one of those restaurants! The atmosphere is very elegant French style, with high ceilings and a stunning European Cafe. When you walk in, the look of the bar and restaurant itself is truly something to behold.  Came here for Brunch and the service was top notch- our server was extremely informative, sweet and on top of everything. We started our meal with the complementary Baguette in a paper bag (how French!) and sea salted butter- I am a big fan of bread and this is among some of the best I've ever had. By recommendation we ordered the Brioche French Toast with vanilla mascarpone, almond brittle, and orgeat syrup. I am not kidding when I say this is one of the best breakfasts I've ever had! I don't even like French Toast all that much but this dish is a LIFE-CHANGER! We shared it between two people and couldn't finish so I'd say order one for the table or share between 3-4 unless you want some leftovers for when you come home at 4AM from the Club!   Favorites: Brioche French Toast

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brioche French Toast- life changing!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Baguette- delicious!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous Interior

8_KOPfnwBVw169WlvA3ZSw.text: Excellent service. I've been here for dinner and also Sunday brunch (which comes with bottomless rose).   Salmon tartine (4/5): I didn't like the cream cheese at the bottom. too heavy  Chocolate macaron (3.5/5): The chocolate sauce is over the top. This dessert can feed 2-3 people.   French onion soup (4/5): Very flavorful.  Croque Madame (4.5/5): The croque madame comes with a creamy white sauce on the top which I didn't care for. Otherwise, it was delicious!

UB-gT3ySNtNoRfKp8InUiQ.text: Had lunch here yesterday- I was with a group of about 8 colleagues. The place was extremely busy and incredibly noisy. The hostess was very inefficient in getting people seated- there was a line out the door. I found the servers to be very stressed out in dealing with what appeared to be 100% occupancy. The food was a bit slow in coming- though everyone seemed to enjoy what they ordered. The french onion soup was delicious. We ran out of time and could not wait any longer for desert. I'm afraid I was tuned-off from the moment I arrived due to the in-ineffeciency of the hostess and the dour looks on the waiter's faces.... The atmosphere was more like a TGIF than a True French Bistro

mNEFxktQkIQmz0_6Sfrajw.text: Came here for Sunday brunch and this place is overrated. We wanted to impress my friend who traveled in from Singapore but our server was just rude and very aloof. Maybe because we didn't order any drinks or appetizers. Honestly, I was all for ordering apps but upon finding out that in all of Aria Resort , BARDOT cannot manage to find any gluten free bread or crackers for the growing population of gluten intolerant guests. I was stuck ordering a $30 salad that was just a bunch of lettuce leaves and a boiled chicken. My friends had the duck confit, the French toast and American breakfast and they were not impressed for the price that we paid! I don't know how this place got mentioned on the 2018 Eater list of must do brunches in Vegas! Don't waste your time or your money!

MOmhB6XoE1itnIphFxAHUQ.text: Meh.  I've experienced much better is a good way to describe the meal we had here.  We came here for brunch and with no reservation, we sat at the bar, which is fine.  That's what we do a lot of times anyway, but the only seats open were on a corner.  We grabbed them to make sure we had seats and then waited for about 10 minutes before anyone greeted us.  The bartenders took care of the parties to our right and to our left, but did not acknowledge us until after they had taken care of both of those parties.  Finally we got a couple of waters.  We weren't sure what we wanted yet so we took a few minutes to look at the menu - and moved down a few seats when a couple left.  Much more room which was nice!  A couple of bartenders asked us several different times if we wanted bar drinks, and when we kept saying no, they seemed to be irritated. We like a good cocktail but weren't in the mood.  I ended up ordering the French Omelette and my husband ordered the Bardot Breakfast Sandwich.  The dishes came out about 15 or so minutes later which wasn't bad.  They were not like any other French omelette or egg dishes either of us have ever had, though - the eggs were...well done.  My omelette was so firm it held it's shape like a Japanese egg omelette would, and it also did not have any fine herbs or Gruyere in it that I could see, and had no seasoning at all.  I added salt & pepper which helped, but it still just tasted like plain egg.  My husband's egg sandwich had these little rectangles of the same, firmly cooked eggs, and they were almost like a styrofoam consistency.  We really should have sent it all back, but since the bartenders already seemed irritated by us not ordering drinks we didn't want to rock the boat.  We just ate what we could, paid and left.  It wasn't inedible but it definitely wasn't worth the price and wasn't a good experience. It's a shame because I love French food, and the place had a great atmosphere.

iRhWr0nhdpP9Xx-DV_tVuw.text: Our entire group had been looking forward to eating here leading up to our trip, and were slightly disappointed.  We ordered the charcuterie board to begin with which wasn't amazing. We wished we had ordered a different appetizer. Then the four of us ordered moules frites, gnocchi, scallops, and a filet mignon w/ frites.   I wish I had ordered something other than the gnocchi. The filet was okay but I've definitely tasted better. The fries that came with the mussels and filet were just not good. They were really crispy but had basically nothing inside. I can't speak for the scallops or mussels, but my friends weren't ecstatic about their choice either.  The inside of the restaurant is nice and dark, but once again nothing amazing. It's mainly disappointing because we had been looking forward to coming here for weeks leading up to our trip. It might be a better choice to come here for brunch in the future!

waUcNjmxlMLH5KCKmNOLSQ.text: Very authentic and stylelish surroundings meets the eye, adding that extra to the total experience.  The food is of very High quality and so is the service. Our waiter had the knowledge needed to recommend Wine and food that fitted our desires.  The Prices are in the higher end, but fair. Only thing I could ask for more, was a bigger appetite

Rh9VX9G_cqK2QmAWRDxJPA.text: Went for breakfast while staying at the Aria.  Great food! Generous portions and it was delicious!  However the service was just awful.  It took 10 minutes to get coffee, water wasn't refilled.  When it was time to leave we asked for the check.  It took another full 10 minutes to bring the check!  I had to track down the server just to get the check.    I've never walked out on a bill in my life, but was tempted to here as the delay nearly made me late for an appointment.

3oAYyyh68ikbL1S3H6M8LA.text: we had a nice dinner, but we expected better. The waiter was nice and explain to us what are our options and the place is chic but the food was just ok... Domage.

8zDzsjx9JumdOeMiII9FbA.text: I'd say it was an okay experience. Average at most. The hostess and wait staff were friendly and attentive. The food was okay but not knock your socks off great. We love the pork chop because it was juicy and was cooked to perfection. However, the macaroni and cheese is sub par. It was missing the cheese part! For me, the best part was the dessert - a big chocolate macaron.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kinda dry and lacking the cheese part

75R0_zkt5TH8KuIDx4MFgw.text: Wonderful restaurant with fabulous food!  Everything was delicious!  Great service.

pBbu5kYx-OIhqG_JjpHZbg.text: Great experience ! Decor was similar to buchon at the Venetian. Great service by John-Paul. Excellent suggestions.   We got the hunters waffles. Poached egg w duck I believe. Delicate and delicious.  18-19 dollars. Good to share for two.   We also got the duck confit sandwich. Bread was so soft and the sauce it comes with makes the sandwich even better. 18-19 dollars.   The crab crepe was extremely good. Complex in tastes and texture. Egg, mushroom , slices of apples , crab, etc. 19 dollars   I would definitely recommend this place for a nice brunch!

IjX3rLFbnG7nTckKO2vxRw.text: Amazing food. Me and my wife went last night and we're very impressed. Service was great

R56u0R87BVMbYGbe62_8bw.text: I have to say this has been my favorite Brunch in Vegas. I hate to say it, but even better than Bouchon Bistro. Michael Mina's French Brasserie located in the Aria Hotel is beautifully decorated Parisian style which transports you to a cafe in Paris. The first Brunch item was the Paris Eggs Benedict which was a variation of the traditional Eggs Benedict which is usually served on an English Muffin. Instead the eggs were nestled on top of a buttery flaky croissant. Must I say this was perfection and was Simply divine. We also ordered the French Toast which was made of Brioche and had a caramelized top. It was served with Vanilla Marscapone, candied almonds and instead of maple syrup it was served with orgeat syrup which is a sweet syrup made of almonds. Simply divine. For the side dish I had to try the macaroni gratinee.  This dish was a take on Macaroni and cheese but elevated to new heights. All of the Macaroni are perfectly aligned standing upright. How, you ask, I have no idea, but who cares the taste was amazing. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Vegas.  I might even stay at The Aria just to have easier access to Bardot Brasserie.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroni gratin
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict on croissant
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZGYTzYRSLpNKbQLa6paV1A.text: 2 wks ago I went to Bardot Brasserie on a date. I want to commend the waiters for exceptional service. Our waiter recognized we were on a date and gave us the space and time to get to know each other. My date had the french onion soup which was marvelous, and I had the king crab crepe. It was gorgeous and had great flavor, but it was served warm, not hot. By the 3rd bite, it was cold. I thought maybe that was what this dish's temp was supposed to be. then we had entrees, I had the pork chop with their wild macaroni side. The chop was also warm, not hot, and so was the macaroni. let me be clear: none of the food we were served was above room temp. I would have returned all of it but for date appearances. the chop was brined and very well seasoned. but it was cold! the dessert, apple tart tartin, was one of the best I ever had. Sadly, most of the meal was the same temp as the ice cream on top of the tartin.

mLj6He47LuJvtAEbi6-CRQ.text: For a broke college student this place was not ideal for my crew and I. However our server Tish made it so worth it! She was great. So sweet and honest, and energetic! I wish she would've came out with us that night. Kept our bottomless Rose filled. Homegirl was a real one. The food was good but obviously expensive. I'd only go back for Tish.

XlKGVH9SqJWfiEr5A8rSMQ.text: Great brunch, lobster Benedict was super tasty, not on the menu but they can make it when you ask! Unlimited rose for $25 was amazing! Will definitely return next time I am in Vegas.

lVWgU2sewDK4UkY4A_Pqzw.text: Best brunch! I was lucky enough to go here with my best girlfriends during my bachelorette party. It was recommended by a friend, who did not steer me wrong. The bellini's were delicious, and the rose all day was a killer deal. I loved my food, I got the eggs Benedict that was placed on top of a perfectly flaky croissant, the hollandaise was creamy and perfectly rich. And to top off an already amazing brunch we shared a sticky bun, made with NUTELLA!!! To. Die. For.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

avpMbv21xlw7LT5ZOMdeEQ.text: Visited this lovely restaurant over the weekend for brunch and it was seriously perfection. Loved the complimentary assorted bread basket and baguette...my group of 4 ended up sharing the entire bread basket and we are not sorry we did. The quality of the Onion Soup broth was incredible and just the right amount of cheese on top. I had the Chicken French Dip as my main dish and that too did not disappoint. I can't wait to visit Vegas again just so I can dine here for lunch/dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to the restaurant
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French 75 was delicious
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous bar

Wa9z8Am4ZJ2NVJrPqvB-cw.text: Where do I start?! Came here for Brunch, best decision of my trip to Vegas. So, not only can you get bottomless rose or sparkling rose, the food was off the charts good.  I chose the still offering, what a great deal...definitely got my money's worth!  Reminded me of a quaint brasserie in Paris. This place is legit. The only issue we had was deciding what to order!  We ended up sharing the beef Bourgogne croissant Benedict and the French toast. I can say that hands down the best French toast I've ever had. It was unbelievable. The Benedict was awesome too. Service was perfect, and attentive. Please go here. Michael Mina is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best French toast ever created. Really.
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect.

f1-dJ-wRX44N2rEBmQxWIw.text: We got their signature French toast and Maine lobster Eggs Benedict and they were both amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Egg Benedict :)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast

XDuyuxADTmYRZ5NaRLL3lg.text: Visited this restaurant while staying at the Aria. Everything was pretty expensive but taste pretty good. Decent atmosphere and excellent service. If price is not an issue, I would definitely come visit more often.

9na-llJ0A8u87aGyA-W59Q.text: Was here in Mid July with my cousin on vacation, late night and we decided to stop for a bite.  After wandering down the menu, we decided on the steak and frites.  I wanted the au poivre sauce.  They were nice enough to spit the entree between us.  She also ordered the French onion soup.  Oh my WORD is all I can say about the food - Sacre Bleu!!!!  When I say delicieux- I mean DEE-LISH-SHUS!  wow, oh, WOW!!!!  The soup was spot on.  Absolutely mouth watering and exactly what you'd want from French onion soup.  Not too salty, the croutons were perfect and the cheese was just the right texture.  The steak - oh, heavens..... cooked to make you want it as a blanket so you can tuck yourself into it with the frites as little pillows you can munch on in your happy dreams.  (too much? maybe but it was just that good).  The atmosphere was very nice as well, medium lighting so you could be there with platonic friends or on a romantic date and they have great staff who are very helpful.  We had a great time, I would absolutely go back when I am in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of a steak with fries and au poivre sauce

w8cqueQSc1v3U2N6cLAcsQ.text: I couldn't be happier with my experience at Bardot.  I was here with a group of 10 people for my bachelor party dinner last Friday.  The food was excellent, the prices were reasonable (for Vegas), and the service was top notch.    Between the everyone in the group, I think we ordered just about all of the appetizers and about half the entrees. I loved everything I tried and I didn't hear a single complaint from anyone.  The onion soup is the top 2 or 3 I've ever had, as was the beef tartare. My ribeye steak was cooked perfectly and incredibly flavorful. I was able to sample their mac and cheese, which had a look that I've never seen before, and it was excellent.   I was pleased with how great the service for our group was considering how many people we had.  I think a place deserves to be recognized when they can effortlessly handle a large group.  My only complaint is minor -- I wish they'd add a hard cider or two to their beer menu. I don't like most beers and I don't like wine, so I ended up having to stick to Diet Coke because they didn't have any ciders.  That being said, it won't keep me from coming back!

HHZVN099eIqYIGEtluEHng.text: My bf is French and ever since I started dating him, we've been eating at a lot of authentic French restaurants haha.  We both really enjoyed Bardot. The atmosphere was nice and we had impeccable service from our French waitress Clementine.  I ordered the King crab crepe as an appetizer after reading all the yelp reviews, but for me, it was just ok.   I much preferred the rack of lamb and macaroni.  The meat was so lamb meat was so tender and flavorful.  The macaroni and cheese was the best I've ever had!  For dessert, we ordered the apple tart tartin which was really good as well.

FqxDRJJw-rG8-dyfLg8s6A.text: Bloody Mary is a total pass.  Order oysters and escargot. Stick to omelettes and eggs. I order croque madame only to be completely disappointed by a heavy bechamel sauce soaked untoasted or very lightly toasted piece of white bread with not melted cheese and a runny egg.  The mgr Roberto took these items off the bill and it's the only reason I give 3 stars and would go back.   This place is a choice of connivence being that you want shellfish and don't want to leave aria. And yes and it has its stars and busts on the menu. Gotta just eat your way around the land mines.

13h4ckZeGz6shCxsYRZ94w.text: To start, this reviewer is not a fan of French restaurants, but this is not your average stuffy French restaurant.  I must say that the experience from walking through the doors to dessert was off the charts great.  The location within Aria is odd, given it is situated with two other restaurants at the end of a corridor on the second floor of a poorly trafficked area.  Upon entering Bardot, you feel like you found the coolest French inspired speak easy around.  The restaurant is alive with energy, the drinks potent, the menu selection is celestial, and the service PERFECT.  I was in with a large party, and our server delivered a mix of seasoned professional with comic relief.  Being a picky pescatarian, I was offered a special plate from Chef, although I declined.  I was so touched that the Chef would make something special for me, and delivered such an amazing epicurean experience, I couldn't stop raving about the food while there that our server arranged to bring out Chef Jeannie.  She was such a great sport and chatted with us for a while.    We started with assorted appetizers, and all were exceptional.  I had the Salad Bardot, and the Salmon Aux Lentils.  Both were 10's.  I topped it off with the chocolate macarone, this was rich and could be split with two others.  I dine in Vegas regularly, and have been let down more times than I was inspired, and this place hit the spot.  Please make the effort to try Bardot.

pRHJajviz-TY7CX8Xi05hA.text: Menu has changed sooooooo much from when they first opened. If you were here when they first opened, then you will for sure be disappointed. Three stars because the  Escargot is still on point and for the fact that it is the only thing that has remained the same.

fvlHWD5cZLE256TBfutF5w.text: A beautiful meal and experience from start to end. Food is fantastic and done so well. Familiar flavors but elevated and done so delicately you can taste and see the work put into it.  Chef Josh Smith raises the bar.  I look forward to the new additions to the menu every few months. Every time I return it gets better, is that possible?! Favorites: beef Wellington, duck l'orange, foie spread, "best" butter, seasonal deconstructed lobster tail, melon salad, Mille feuille, baked Alaska. Looking forward to returning!

lnbikyMGefTtV5lk6Y59gA.text: We have been to many of the French restaurants in Las Vegas and being from the Bay Area, we are familiar with MIchael Minna and his high expectations when it comes to the dining experience. We came here last evening to enjoy a great dinner and were deeply disappointed and left dissatisfied. The service was awful plain and simple. Our party of four waited over an hour and 15 minutes from the time our appetizer and bread came until our entrees showed up Luke warm. Guess what... I understand that it's a busy Saturday night, but this terrible waiter..... never checked in on us, offered us another drink, more bread, ANYTHING! When he finally remembered us........he brought  luke warm dishes out that were meh. HE WAS SO RUDE. A little charm could has saved the night.  Do not come here for a fine dining experience, you'll be sorry.

0rFLWPnFqQjdyhYKI1frkA.text: It is not often I dish out five star reviews, but in this case it was so easy! My mind was blown with every little detail of this restaurant. My fiance's mother made a reservation on OpenTable the night before so we could get in for brunch as soon they opened. It was the Saturday morning before Mother's Day so even before the doors opened it got busy & crowded so we were very grateful we had a reservation. They took us right away because they saw us waiting there the longest. Respectful! We were led through the beautiful restaurant to a back table right near the kitchen. The place was absolutely beautiful decorated with fresh, blooming flowers and Parisian inspired decor. It brings you right to France . Las Vegas dining has always been my favorite because of how in depth the theming and decorating always creates such an atmosphere that is transcending and gives you not just a meal, but an experience. We haven't even talked Food yet! The brunch menu was to die for. I could've ordered anything and I would've been delicious. We decided to order a large French press for the table. It took a little while but it was so delicious. They also gave you two baguettes per table with delicious hand made, whipped butter to accompany.  My fiance & I split the "American in Paris" breakfast, how appropriate! My fiance's mother got the egg white & kale quiche which was delicious. We also ordered the assorted pastry basket as an appetizer with our coffee to nibble on. Everything was fresh, delicious, and served with such presentation. The service was wonderful, the manager occasionally checked in on us to make sure we were doing well. There was an accordion player making his way through the tables telling jokes and playing Parisian music. Overall, this experience is not one to be missed!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Accordion player
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American in Paris
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry basket!

_InTHmK-XIeWBIcD7dtbgg.text: Great spot for brunch! We rolled in 16 people deep.Great food, great service!  Talk about indulgence:  SEASONAL FRUIT - frozen yogurt-pistachio parfait, buckwheat beignets. When in Vegas, you can't go wrong with fruit and beignets. PRIME STEAK TARTARE -ground to order, sauce verte, egg yolk, toasted baguette. Couldn't get enough. Maine Lobster Croissant Benedict - Love the croissant twist - eggs were perfectly poached, and filled with ample amounts of lobster!   For Dessert! MILLE FEUILLE - caramelized puff pastry, vanilla creme patissiere CREME BRULEE - vanilla bean custard, turbinado croquant  And bottomless sparkling rose for $25 or rose for $20?! Must keep the good feeling going..

h5o9zpCTraIKC7IDgPzCKw.text: Very cool place, decor was spot on, food was out of this world,  Wine list OMG..  Trust me, might as well drop some cash here than casino, well worth it, i'll come back again.

xTikYBc4qGyUPcsUciwKaA.text: My wife and I went to Bardot for Christmas in 2017, and had their escargot, lamb, and pork. Everything was really good back then. The restaurant wasn't too crowded, and food was awesome. The escargot was cooked inside a very fluffy pastry, lamb and pork were well seasoned and perfectly cooked.   We went back to Bardot in Oct of 2018, and ordered the escargot, prime rib, and octopus. This time, everything was terrible. The prime rib was cooked medium well (i ordered med rare), the crust seasoning was non-existent, and for some reason, the prime rib did not have an brow section. Was the worst prime rib I've had ever. The octopus was dry, overcooked, and over-seasoned. The escargot pastry was not fluffy at all, but soggy.   not sure what happened, but maybe their head chef is not there on Monday (or no longer there). For its very pricey menu, we did not get a good meal. It's sad, because we really liked their food the first time, and felt the restaurant was unique   I told the server about the poor quality of the meal, and while he did offer to take it back to the chef (I really didn't want to stay and wait any longer) he didn't offer any discounts or coupons. Would've been nice

V34a8jBInPumW__ja3cu8A.text: Overall, good food. They served us warm bread, which is always a good sign of a restaurant that knows food. The escargot bites were my favorite and the octopus was supple and tender. The lobster bisque on the other hand, was bitter and tangy. Don't order this. My husband's fish was handled perfectly though...

E1QrmXW93pK-JAGJFQcM5w.text: We showed up a couple minutes early for our 7:00pm reservation and were promptly escorted to our table. The service- Our waitress from beginning to end was attentive without being annoying. (I'm kicking myself for not remembering her name). She checked in frequently, helped correct a minor thing with one of our dishes, and had a great personality. The food- wonderful! We had the bone marrow (heaven!), beet salad, frisee salad, mussels, and half chicken. Everything was done perfectly and was flavorful and holy crap good! We had to roll on out of the restaurant and didn't get a chance to try dessert (I guess we'll have to go back). The wine by the glass selection was broad enough to easily pair with each dish. Yes, it was a pricey meal, but worth every penny!  Well done Bardot team!

iqW5iSrqE_HnW3s5Ux4HUA.text: Gorgeous bar and the interior is so French, I just adore it.   Excellent service. I had the la varenne cocktail (cognac, liqueur, lemon juice), bone marrow au poivre appetizer, poulet roti entree with mushroom bread pudding and haricots verts, and frozen paris brest for dessert. My fiance had the pork chop.   La varenne was a little too sweet and not strong enough. The caramelized onions that came with the bone marrow was a little too salty, but the country bread was perfect. The paris brest should probably be more of the traditional variety, as opposed to with hazelnut ice cream, as the ice cream hardened the choux pastry and made it less enjoyable altogether.   A little bit of a limited menu.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poulet roti with mushroom bread pudding &amp; haricots verts
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gorgeous bar

-98mvYAOsHLReSk0gg4y7A.text: Upon coming here prior for a Yelp elite event, and loving the oysters, I came back here JUST to stuff my face with more. But, while at it, tried a few other items.   Truffle fries- 1 star.  The fries were undercooked, meaning touch and hard on the inside, and not crisp on the outside. The flavoring was off with too much salt.   Oysters- 2 stars. Got 1 dozen oysters, thinking I'd be blown away like last time, but no, I unfortunately wasn't.   Steak tar tar- 2 stars. This dish was OK as well. It was almost too cold in temperature, as though it had been thawed only a couple hours ago and chopped up.   Service- 5 stars. They checked on the table multiple times and water was filled constantly.   Based on my recent experience, I won't be back.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tartar- 2 stars
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters- half Kumamoto and east coast.

KKfTdX3u268zfG3J8GP6kg.text: If you are staying at the Aria, Bardot has a great happy hour daily 5-7pm.  Wine, cocktail, beer specials and some great snacks.  Get the POUTINE, salmon tartar and any of the tartines.  It's rare to find any deals in the Aria, so this happy hour was a reasonable priced surprise.   Sit at the bar for a more casual experience and the bartender takes care of you.  More of a mature crowd.

oHJ55W5fQxaEfX8csKSL0g.text: After visiting Vegas several times, I finally decided to forego spending $$$ on an overpriced buffet and spend it on something worth, in my opinion, far greater value: a beautifully-prepared French meal. I started with a glass (or two?) of Brut Rose. The group I was with ordered the Macaroni & Mimolette Gratinee to try out. Loved the presentation of it! I went with the Rack of Lamb and Frites for my entree. The lamb was absolutely tender and just so delicious!  It was cooked to perfection (i.e. medium rare), and the basil and garlic sauce was a nice compliment to the lamb without being overpowering. The chickpea fries were a pleasant surprise and something I would love to have again! If you're looking for a meal worth spending money on, I highly recommend visiting Bardot!

fx-PO-d9kjU8lSsu8yOrdQ.text: When you're in Vegas, BARDOT is where you have to go for brunch. On this visit I started off with fresh squeezed orange juice and the pastry basket which includes a variety of 4 very fresh and very flavorful pastry. There are a number of starters and if you like escargot, theirs is carefully wrapped in puff pastry and cannot be beat. Others in my party started with a Bloody Mary and they claim it's their favorite anywhere - it's made with fresh squeezed tomato juice. There were a number of entrees ordered at our table but I went with the Prosciutto Benedict (one of 4 varieties.) BARDOT serves their Benedict's on croissants which is a pleasant deviation from tradition. The eggs were perfectly poached and the bearnaise was well balanced.   You should also know that the portions are generous which provides a hearty start to a full day on the town!

JMN187Xz90FsYFg4czlJZA.text: Great place. The food is amazing. Been here several times and have never been disappointed.  Beautiful interior and authentic Belgian and French foods on the menu. Cooked to perfection.  Will most definitely visit again! Would recommend to anyone!

vbdE1oeD3uLoPwqGdEVPbQ.text: I had my birthday dinner here this past Friday! The service first off was great, our server was friendly and helpful with explaining. We ordered the beef tartare, duck wings, onion soup and oysters as starters. They gave us fresh bread and butter, that was even delicious! The onion soup is AMAZING! We added short ribs and a poached egg in the soup and it is seriously a game changer. I've never enjoyed a soup so much, its definitely something you can share as well.  My gf and I ordered the rack of lambs and shared it, when they brought it out the actually split the dish into two plates and it was more than enough! That mac and cheese is sooooooo good, definitely split it with some folks at the table because its rich. I am so glad we came here and we left super full. Warning since the food is french it is a bit on the heavier side, but super tasty! I would definitely come back just for that onion soup. YUM!

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Kumamoto oysters!

zxsaALT-Li60dkDHV_5V-Q.text: We loved this place. Everything was delicious and tasted perfect. We will be visiting on our next trip to Vegas.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Every bite was on of this world.

K_2ZAFVjPXf8_yiejEHKnA.text: A bit disappointed.. The looks, the atmosphere, all the bells and whistles - it's all there (they puree fresh raspberries in front of you to dip your steak into...); however, the dishes I had here were okay - a mere 3 out of 5.  Oysters - my favorite part of dinner, which came uncooked and unseasoned. They were excellent. Escargot - a fun concept; however, not much flavor at all and the dough they are wrapped in takes over.  Foie Gras - my favorite thing on the planet when done right. This was the biggest disappointment: it came overcooked (one side burnt) and extremely salty. The polenta it sat on top of, on the other hand, seemed completely unseasoned.   I really hope I got unlucky, as this place has huge potential; however, my food simply did not taste good.

HNNKL0YQAEyuiGust0zNzQ.text: Amazing staff! Erik in the kitchen helped me get my boyfriends bday dinner in order and made sure our night was perfect! The food was great as well!

81_Y4nt0gMXLUYDfoivhdw.text: Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU!!! We chose this restaurant because of the Michael Mina brand. Unfortunately, when we dined here last week, my husband had a meltdown.  The food took a little longer getting to us and the waiter (I'm so sorry I don't remember his name) didn't hear one of his requests. These are truly minor problems but that night it was a perfect storm of stress.  The staff and especially Natalie was so gracious and so accommodating. You did not deserve the treatment you received and I humbly apologize. Frankly the food was delicious....REALLY delicious. But even better than the food, if it's even possible, the service surpassed all expectation. You all deserve gold stars. Thank you again to Natalie and her team!!

FzHk2gFNf5tqRdemYmqh7A.text: We can't get enough of this place. Everett time we are staying at the Aria we come here several times!  Brings back memories of trips to Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet and goat cheese salad- best  of this type I have enjoyed so far. Seasoned perfectly

-TDKJejtwZJ6yLwzrl9tqw.text: We had a great experience the first time around, but the second time here was even better. The NY strip steak is very good and was perfectly cooked. The strip is so tender you would think you were cutting into a filet, plus the sauces are delicious.  Last time we skipped dessert, so this time we had the chocolate macaroon and the Paris Brest. Both amazing desserts and quite @ generous serving. Once again, Michael Mina never has disappointed with his offerings. :)

0XvS7KxxCUOTyNks9pR60A.text: Bardot is a modern French brasserie located on the 2nd floor of Aria near the convention center, in the restaurant circle. I've been here a few times and really appreciated the friendly, prompt and humble service we had here.   The food was decent above average style Strip food, a slight edge over Mon ami Gabi (love their steak) only because of the foie gras here.   ---- Recommend ---- * Foie gras parfait - 5 stars: Smooth, decadent, and absolutely perfect with their fresh bread.  * Hangar steak - 4 stars: Surprisingly good from what it appears but the fries were overly oily.   ---- Pass ---- * Chocolate Macaron - 3 stars: IG-worthy enormous macaron the size of your head, nothing special.  * Mac n cheese - 2 stars: This looked so cool because it is a baked square of mac n cheese with each noodle facing up! It tasted very mediocre don't waste your stomach room on this one.  * Steak tartare - 3 stars: Fine, standard. Liked the potato chips. Wouldn't order again * Salad - 2 stars: Pretty terrible bland sparse salad.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras parfait
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tartare
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatiron steak

WEfSf8ScTaf-vnqT6ZxHKg.text: I would like to name this meal "The Tour of Bardot" by Erik and Nelson. I had one of the most memorable experience dinning at this facility because of how knowledgeable they are. It wasn't a dull dinner but I had entered into the passionate dinning food experience, I get to learn a little about the restaurant history and other sister restaurant they have.  As a business owner myself, I recognized when someone is very prideful about what they do and their food. They didn't just being a monotonous workers who are trying to up sale but they get to know what are your taste styles and go from there! Thank you you guys tremendously for such a marvelous tour of Bardot.  Okay, let's get back to the actual food tour after the gratitude messages.  I actually found my favorite cocktail here at BARDOT; Strawberry Blanc. It tastes like strawberry juice. My personal favorite starters and sides are Macaroni & Mimolette gratinee with sauce bechamel, Escargot Bardot, Lobster Thermidor and last but not least Lobster bisque.  We got  Heritage Chicken Roti (which takes 3 days to prepared) and grilled over oak woods Prime Ribs. Very tenders and just melt in your mouth.   Next up! Dessert! The best part of the meal.  CHOCOLATE MACARON & ESPRESSO CREME BRULEE are absolutely delicious! I can eat them everyday. The perfect amount of sweetness  I also fell in love with this Black Lavender Tea, OMG!!!!!! It's a must try.

51fchxqvRsMSu8qlNQFBOg.text: Charming place for brunch. We had a lazy Sunday complete with meats and cheeses and bottomless rose mimosas. It's a little pricey but the 'house rose' was lovely and well worth the 28 dollars.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A cheese and meat brunch

x3cjqGlICK79sqfh0-O1zQ.text: Let me start by saying....Oh my jesus! The food here was amazing and the modern french ambience and decor was exquisite as well.   We came for dinner and We had the beef tartare which I devoured before taking any pictures because I was starving but let me tell you it was delish! I highly recommend it!   The complimentary bread and butter were equally impressive. I mean THATZ BUTTER DOE!!!! Its supposed to be the best butter ever and it really was! I was just spooning butter in my mouth like it was another dish all on it's own!  The seafood platter we recieved was so delish! The oysters were small but super sweet and fresh! It came with this mini Tabasco sauce bottle and it was just so adorbs! I kinda had to take it home with me lololz  The shrimp and crab and lobster were opened for easy access and easy dining. It was just so amazingly good! Definitely recommend it if you want the overall seafood experience! Definitely worth it and it was definitely fresh! I also loved the variety of sauces they give with it instead of the typical cocktail sauce and calling it a day.  We also had the lobster bisque which was also really good and they give you this puff pastry with it which was so flaky and soft. It was a bit on the sweet side but still really good!   The lamb doe... omg let me tell you! It was the best lamb that I have ever tasted! It had no gamey taste what so ever and it was so soft and cooked to the Medium rare perfection that I had asked for.   All in all, an excellent experience! Would recommend this place if you're ever in the Vegas area!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-0yGosXTYPYwN6eOqyIEYA.text: Date Night!!  I went here with my boyfriend for a date night on a Wednesday. It was our first time here & the restaurant itself is beautiful.   The lighting & ambiance is nice, it was just very loud. We were sitting very close in between two other tables & we could hear every word they were saying, & I felt like we were shouting over them to have a conversation.   The food was amazing! We're both lovers of French food & Bardot did not disappoint. Make sure you eat the bread with the delicious butter- I hardly ever eat bread & it's totally worth it here!   We had the Foie Gras Parfait for a starter, He had the Heritage Chicken & I had the Scallops Meuniere & every bite was absolutely wonderful! The portions I feel are very generous for French cuisine.   The service was the only thing that was lacking. Thus only four stars (I would give 3 1/2 if I could). Our server was very inattentive. It took forever to just order our drinks. He didn't even come by after we received our entrees to see if we needed anything. Never offered/asked if we wanted another drink when our first ones were gone. Although we were full from our meal I kind of wanted to try dessert but didn't want to wait for the waiter since he was taking so long. Our bus boy was amazing though! It was super busy & he seemed like he may have been new.   All in all I would definitely go back. I'm wanting to try their brunch ;)

_iiVA3rYPzJjjZpXWZEBHw.text: I like Bardot!  What's up with all these nasty reviews?  Super cute.  Good drinks.  Always a fun time at Bardot. Put on a sexy dress and go already.

y46XuZvfsgLHORGEr7bHiw.text: Had an amazing experience here, from start to finish. Service was attentive and quick and the food was out of this world. The French toast is compared to none! And everything else was above par also, will definitely be back when I return to Vegas for Uncork'd Weekend.

8X8M0kDZyC6UIbTCyZh4sQ.text: A solid 3 star rating from me. I came here two years ago and had such a wonderful experience, I had to come back here. Today's dinner was good but I wasn't  wow'd like last time. Maybe it was the service and their lobster.   First time I was at the bar and second time (this review) was at main dining room.  Highlight of the food I've ate and highly recommend: stick with their burger and you can't go wrong.   Lobster thermidor at $76 was over cooked. Also. why such a small lobster tail for that price? This is the reason I knocked down a star too. I think my local grocery has larger lobster tails than this!   The foie gras appetizer was great, but why on earth did they add the lentils. Not necessary and kind of ruined the delicate piece of foie gras.   Sea bass was a quite large dish and tasted great. A really good size portion too.   Service at the bar was way more friendlier than the waiter we got. He was just an order taker and really didn't have any charm or personality.  Thus the other star drop, bringing this to a 3 star review.   Maybe I had such high expectations from my first visit, but kind of left here unsatisfied.

tOoMrWhISvUHiCsYjCdYtQ.text: Best breakfast (especially the eggs!) in Vegas. Apparently they use supper fatty butter to cook everything and that gives it such a rich flavor, it's really delicious. I had something like an omelette and added truffles (best $3 addition) and really enjoyed it. I also tried the bacon, which was very salty, but overall was pleased with the food. The place is also very cute with very friendly and attentive staff.

oHpy_rs3OXXVpoJKDKyw7A.text: Just received a snarky message from their manager assuring me that their digusting, cold bechamel,stale bread, old ham, shitty Croque Madame was good, and that maybe I don't know the difference between a horrible restaurant experience and a good one.

Michael Mina.  4 - ESCARGOTS BARDOT (burgundy snails, puff pastry, toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter) 4 - MAINE LOBSTER BISQUE (classically prepared with brandy, roasted tomato, tarragon & puff pastry) 3 - HUNTER'S WAFFLE (glazed duck confit, poached eggs, sauce maltaise) 5 - SHORT RIB BOURGIGNON (Croissant Benedicts, two poached eggs, sauteed spinach, bearnaise)  Overall, "I'm a fan."

qIcETr8kIRvM5KvchI2HQw.text: Amazing....  That's it. In one word. Our experience was amazing.  This was my first time trying it, so I decided to do it a little different, instead of ordering an entree I order the beet and goat cheese salad, half dozen oysters, and truffle fries.  The beet salad was soooo good! I love every ingredient in there. Beets, goat cheese, arugula, etc. The oysters were fantastic with all the fixings mixed in, and the truffle fries were great also.  I got to sample my friends dishes as well, and everyone was extremely happy with their choices.  Fantastic service and wine pairing was perfect. Maybe the only knock was that it was kind of loud. But next time maybe we'll request a quieter table area.   But that's it, can't wait to go back!

K3FxnU7tq-w2lShJBsgh1Q.text: Definitely a must try , absolutely loved the charcuterie board the meat selection was very high quality and we literally left nothing behind so that shows how good it was

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VYnlOrATM5ZIgRFRJu1OOA.text: What a hidden gem in the Aria set just next to Jean George's Steak House! The service was amazing (we had a group of 11 tucked into a table near the front), the food was fantastic, and decor transportive. I feel like not enough people have mentioned the great deal of the $25 bottomless rose (still or sparkling) special that a bunch of people ordered with brunch. Our server, Latisha, was very accommodating and kind to our group. She even kindly split the checks into about 5 groups!  The french bread served prior to the meal was to die for: super crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. As a novice bread baker, it really got my creative juices going. I certainly feel the need to go and try out a variety of french baguettes until I find something that resembles that bread!   For the two of us: french onion soup $18 was just amazing. You can tell the cheese wasn't crazy heated under a salamander for tons of time prior to serving. The broth was deep and flavorful with the perfect amount of bread inside. I wish I could make something that came even somewhat close to the caliber of that soup! We also split a frisee lardon salad ($19) and prosciutto benedict ($21). While you can skip the frisee (mostly eaten so that we could say we had something green), the benedict on a croissant was delicious. After going to Parma, we are suckers for proscuitto de Parma... Yum. Lastly, a large french press coffee was $9.50. This lasted around half of the table and was worth the cost as well. Overall, totally worth the price and probably the best hang-over-curing-brunch I'll ever eat.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GZIoQlD6NCpJxySaM1Q9Qg.text: I'm in Vegas every couple months for work and always on a mission to find a new favorite, and this one definitely made it on the list! Came in for lunch and decided to try escargot for my first time. All I have to say is I typically don't like this texture, but BARDOT certainly knows what they're doing as this was the most approachable escargot ever! So great and definitely worth a try. Also loved the Mac n cheese and Caesar salad. Martinis were on point and we totally appreciated the amazing service from Raymond and his staff!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can never go wrong with mussels
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loving this style of Caesar salad
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot is on point. If you&#39;ve never had it, there&#39;s no better way to try it than this way.

zezi1jMEjaa9xBU-RGcHog.text: escargots are snuggled in this happy basil-y puff pastry the size of a grape that you can just pop in your mouth - it's creamy, tasty, and delicate. Delicate! not overly parmy-garlicky-oily. I would get it again. Foie gras in a cup is silky smoooooth and not overpowering. The flavour is also delicate. The top jelly adds a good punch to the smoothness of the foie pate. The Charcuterie board is a must. It has a slew of terrines, rillettes, sliced meats, bread, yum yum yum and more yum yum yum.  At this point you stop. because you are full. Really it's filling. Oh and the $5 best butter in the world... comes w a baguette and another home made butter. The verdict was that the home made butter wins over the best butter in the world... haha... But you can decide that for yourself. Their bread game is strong (makes sense, they are french) But all apps came w. different breads. They are all crispy, chewy, bouncy inside... so good.  Like a casper matress. As to entres, I don't know why I opted for the duck a l'orange. Eeverytime I see duck or goose i opt for it... i wish the sauce came on the side (i know, sounds like a faux pas) But i wonder if the sauce made the duck skin soggy.  I like my crispy skin! the sauce was okay- served w white asparagus and ramps.  The duck itself was sliced and it could have been shared it was 7" long x 4" ... I will say it was overcooked on the 4 slices of each end and the 4 slices in the center were perfect.   NOW - I don't know why i didn't opt for the prime rib. But lucky me two people in my party did... and PERSONALLY.... get the prime rib ONLY IF: YOU ADORE THE FATTIES. MY GOODNESS. it was a celebration to me. Fatties have so much delicious flavor... swoop a little of the beef jus and tear a piece of that crispy baguette (add a little homemade butter - why not) and it's a bite of heavy... the fatties are like another type of bone marrow... uuuugh.... so SO SO SO SO good...  People can be turned off by the fatties, but bring me and i will demolish it. Get the prime rib.  ah! ok fyi: when i go to a steakhouse i ask if the prime rib will have fatties. Bardot has a SERIOUS prime rib - like Parisian style steak prime rib not americanized. it's got a good 1" x 4" swirl of happy fatty in the center and a bit on the perimeter too... it's (personally) excellent.  our waiter was LOVELY.

zr170Zy3iFaEHuKQ78Fijw.text: We had brunch at Bardot Brasserie on 3/24.  When we travel to Las Vegas we always like to have a really nice brunch on Sunday.  We've gotten quite tired of the same old buffets.  They all seem the same. After much research, we decided to have brunch at Bardot Brasserie. We typically stay at Aria but have never tried this restaurant.  We had a wonderful brunch there with Shannon as our server. I had the wonderful (and crazy big) french toast and my husband had the breakfast sandwich. We shared an order of bacon and enjoyed the bottomless sparkling rose.  Everything was wonderful and Shannon (and others) kept the rose coming.. Thank you Shannon!  We have another trip planned for September and can't wait to return to Bardot for Sunday brunch. We also plan to try it for dinner. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N8M9HTEoYfdBI2lqinR8QQ.text: I loved this place! Came here last minute to have dinner and they had reservations available and seated us pretty quickly. Very friendly staff in the front. I liked her vibe. She was very nice. We got seated in a nice place. It's a bit dim. Very beautiful inside. I ordered the scallops and omg. Best scallops I've probably ever had in my life. Also ordered Brussels Sprouts as a side, mashed potatoes and something else I forgot. But everything was delicious. If you're not sure of which wine to get, they allow you to taste some before you order. I will definitely be back here when I'm in Vegas and staying at the Aria. Thank you!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o4raUbKATObSKNUbMHo9Xw.text: My boyfriend and I visited Bardot to celebrate our 4 year anniversary. This restaurant is BEAUTIFUL and has a great atmosphere. The cocktails were great and we started off with the delicious French onion soup and then enjoyed the gnocchi and ribeye. The steak was cooked perfectly, and we enjoyed every bite. One of the best gnocchi dishes I've ever had. Service was great, overall a very enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ao4dnaqLQ83eae4Y3Aqd3A.text: AMAZING!!!! We came here for my girlfriends birthday brunch. We did have reservations and were seated promptly. Our dishes were really delicious. Our top favorite in order are 1:Hunters Waffle (seriously a Must) the duck was cooked to perfection, moist, Flavorful and not gamy at all.  2:King crab & Endive salad. It came in little lettuce cups with delicious crab and a citrus dressing. Very refreshing and just melts in your mouth. A good balance to have between all the carbs! Next was the Charcuterie board and even though I'm not an Escargot fan, the dish here was great! We also had the Maine lobster scramble, it was ok Nothing special about it. Not worth the $29. The Truffle fries are a MUST, so is the Nutella sticky bun, and the chocolate macaroon. The French toast is super popular, not too sweet and a hearty portion. Wish it was served with ice cream, that would have been a better compliment in my opinion.! And for those lushes out there, don't forget to add the Everlasting Rose.! Everything tastes better with a little bubbly! Overall excellent service, ambiance and food quality. Thanks BARDOT for a beautiful dinning experience.!!!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate macaroon
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella sticky bun &amp; I&#39;m not sure what the other one is.? I was too full to try it.. LoL

G5NW984MCddLLT5Y-CWQKg.text: Tucked away on the promenade of the Aria, Bardot is a great restaurant from Michael Mina that gives you a semi-formal dining experience with a space that gives that vintage vibe.  Square bar up front has both bar seating and some tables for those looking for a drink and something quick.  We had amazing service from Matthew and really enjoyed the recommendations.  We started with a loaf of bread with amazing butter from Normandy (beurre d'echire A.O.C.) and the shrimp cocktail (U10s) that were nicely seasoned.  This was followed up with the Parisian Gnocchi (tete de moine cheese, morel mushrooms, black truffle shavings and roasted garlic veloute) and the King Crab Crepe (buckwheat flour crepe, open faced with trumpet mushrooms, sunny-side egg and a brittany cider beurre blanc).    We did get a couple of toasted marshmallows to finish off the meal.  Perfect way to end this trip to Vegas and head back home.

4vfHLx6pRWY1ru2nP-eZTw.text: 2018 Yelp 100 Challenge! 22/100  Had the pleasure to dine here with my love! Awesome experience and one I will NEVER forget!  Upon arrival the host was sweet to assist and let us know that we still had a little time to kill :) We made our way to the beautiful bar and got us the best tasting champagne "Renardat-Fache" - or they call it "Bugey/boogie Fache" - delicious fruity sparkling champagne!  As we were checking out the menu we knew right away what we wanted and go into work! Our server was great! He knew my love for food will need more space on our table!   We ordered the following: - King Crab Crepe $22 - Literally the most interesting dish I've ever had so far! King crab w/ fried eggs? Who knew?!?!!? DELICIOUS! - Bone Marrow en Persillade $19 - served with 2 different flavor bread I say this is one AMAZING dish.. the only thing I didn't like was the thickness of the bread...maybe a little thin slice wouldn't hurt (Do not plan on getting full with just bread) - Scallops Meuniere $46 - HUGE I mean HUGE scallops I've ever seen in my life! Perfectly cooked and full of flavor I LOVE! - Loup de Mer au Fenouil $56 - MY FAV DISH! I enjoyed this plate very much! the buttery sauce with enough lemon...PERFECT. Boneless: easy to eat & the skin peels right off~~ DAMNNN drooool - Bone in New York Strip , Creekstone $61 - Cooked to perfection and truffle fries.. Perfect match! My love enjoyed this VERY MUCH! - Roasted Brussel Sprout $14 - GET IT!!!!!!  Overall this place is AMAZING and I give my man 2 thumbs up on choosing this place for our romantic dinner + being wise on making reservation beforehand :) (thats a MUST)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3/3/2018 - King Crab Crepes $22
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3/3/2018 - King Crab Crepes $22
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3/3/2018 Bone Marrow en Persillade $19 ** 1 order, comes with 2 piece **

iy_Z74a2DBOW-FQv3G1zJg.text: After Michael Mina closed out American Fish which I was fan of, I was happy to see that he opened another place in Aria. I've been here a few times for brunches and dinners since it opened. I was satisfied each time I left the restaurant.   Service: I've received 5 star attentive services each time I was there. My bottomless rose was always filled up before I noticed. Huge plus for me. On my recent visit, our waitress did a great job on assisting my friend picking out the menu.   Environment: it is a casual French place. Sometimes the noise level can be quite high which I don't mind. The decor and atmosphere makes me feel like I'm actually dining in Paris.   Food: I had more brunch experiences here than dinner. I've enjoyed my brunch items each time. Although I was disappointed that lobster Benedict is no longer on the menu. Since it's been a few years when I had the dinner here, this review is purely based on brunch. Get BOTTOMLESS rose! For $25, it's so worth it. I also really enjoy the foie gras parfait here. It's not too salty nor it has the gaminess. The steak tartare and Escargot are also good appetizer choices to share among the table. The bread here is so yummy. My croissant Benedicts were delicious. Although I preferred the lobster one they used to have on the menu rather than short rib. I just tried their French toast yesterday. The portion was huge. The almond brittle was so yummy with the toast. I recommend to share another savory entrees or have the French toast as dessert.   This place is definitely one of my favorite brunch spot and I highly recommend you to come check it out if you haven't already!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast (5/5)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib croissant Benedict (4/5)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye (5/5)

K29iqn8VGEMjH06JaOlVEA.text: There are lots of fancy places to eat at Vegas, so we tried our luck at Bardot.  I was not disappointed.  I had two cocktails (Manhattan and Vesper).  Both were great.  I'm not even a gin person, but the Vesper was good.  We also had the escargot.  Also very good.  The duck was tender and tasty.  Would go here again.

-JFK2ur3Bt4e4WXL9ApYhw.text: Amazing service. No wait on a Thursday night. Was immediately seated. I had the scallops which were phenomenal and my husband had the pork chop. Also delicious. He wasn't a fan of the wasabi flavor in the potatoes. A little too potent for him but that may just be personal preference because I thought it tasted great. Quiet and dim atmosphere. Very romantic. Dessert was also delicious! Great all the way around. Recommend!

K1LYOuN9ZvdwLSSfoNjQOw.text: Food deserves 4 star, but the service is really slow there. Maybe it will be better if you have a reservation?

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r0gp17RmxT37nNrF9zQs8Q.text: We got a chance to return to the beautiful Bardot Brasserie during our 2019 vacation--this time for a full dinner. We came in at the end of the evening on Tuesday without a reservation and got sat right away. I was most impressed with our server, Jesus, who took such wonderful care of us when we were the very last table sat that evening and stayed past closing.   Our server was gracious and ever so patient with us as we were such indecisive guests. Jesus provided spot-on recommendations for wines by the glass as well as our appetizers and entrees. We are so appreciative that he went over in detail (more than once!) the soft shell blue crap appetizer that was being served as a special as neither of us had ever had the opportunity to try one.  Our dinner, of course, was excellent. My boyfriend got the soft shell crab special and I ordered the steak tartare because I had such fond memories of how incredible it was when I enjoyed it three years ago. Both dishes were incredible and might have outshone the entrees. And now that we've finally had soft shell crab, we may be ruined forever because I can't imagine it will taste nearly as good anywhere else.   For our main entrees, I ordered the beautiful sea bass, my boyfriend ordered the filet, and we ordered a side of Brussels sprouts. My sea bass was perfectly prepared but wasn't a standout item--I'll be getting something different next time, like the filet! My boyfriend's steak was incredible and was one of the best filets I've ever had. it was perfect, and I will be dreaming about it until I return to Vegas. Sadly, the side of Brussels sprouts was lackluster and will not be ordered again. But that's small complaint for what was such a special meal. Kudos to the team at Bardot Brasserie!

gadwxMcGcKCk5tze6GFOGg.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Aria for a little end of the summer get away and decided to eat at Bardot before we went to the George Strait concert at T Mobile Arena on Friday August 23rd.  I have to say it may have been the best dining experience I have ever had. With the recommendation of our waiter, who was super nice and attentive the whole evening, we started with the escargot.  It was amazing, I wanted to order another round but knew I needed to hold off for the main course. We ordered the deluxe shellfish tower and oak smoked pork. The shellfish tower had to be the best seafood I have had.  It came with crab, lobster, oysters, and jumbo shrimp.  I like seafood, but do not love seafood, and this platter made me love seafood.  Everything was so fresh tasting as if they had just pulled it out of the ocean.  The pork chop was amazing as well, grill over an oak fire gave the meat this delicious natural smoke flavor unlike the acidic smokey flavor from processed marinades.  For dessert we ordered the espresso creme brulee which was served with fresh biegnets and it was delicious.  Overall, the best part about this restaurant is how they do not cut corners any where on the menu.  Everything is fresh and cooked to perfection.  We will be back next time we are in Vegas!

XCT40ZsXHS3QWap1Sqq_eQ.text: By far my fav place in Vegas for brunch. Last time I was in Vegas stopped by here for dinner with a group of friends. As always, service is top notch, food is good and drinks are solid.

L52ht0NpyNYwjBSZYqj_fg.text: The escargot is AMAZING just AMAZING... the vibe the decor the ambiance is on point. The prices are high but your in Vegas so we have to deal with it. The food is just amazing and the staff is super helpful. Also ask for the garlic dipping sauce. Soo good I can drink it. I don't know what it really is but my fries and that sauce were a match made in heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z6JUhX0FGLVds5MgSD7Rig.text: This place was fantastic! Very elegant restaurant and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the French toast. It was huge and can easily be split either three people, but is a must have plate. I had the steak with fried eggs and my wife had the avocado eggs Benedict and she said it was good.   The only thing that we believe was the service. It was very good but our particular server was always in a rush and I had to flag him down many times to just ask for water, coffee and bread. I didn't understand why he didn't spend more time at our table.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
