Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AbCwVSjoQZnkPtJ4pGPNqg.text: My experience here was amazing! Started with the bread basket I can say that is probably the best I ever had and definitely recommend starting with this. Main course was the epic French toast it was so delicious everything complimented each other so well. Thank you to your culinary team and definitely will be back soon!

IPmRQWTBn23WMgq0Dw4CLQ.text: Given the option of a buffet or Bardot, always go with Bardot!  Always!  This was absolutely one of the better choices made on a recent trip to Vegas, unlike the one where I kept forgetting to collect my winnings and walk away from the table.  Hate when that happens.    The service for brunch was so comforting, especially when you are recovering from a late night.  We were so hungry and started to order more than we should, so our oh so polite and professional server made a recommendation on how to serve our meal that worked out perfectly.  We started with the king crab crepe.  The crepe was so light and tasty.  I secretly wished I didn't have to share that one because I could have finished it in a minute.  My hunny ordered the filet mignon and eggs and I had the smoked salmon croissant benedict, which I absolutely loved being served on a croissant rather than a english muffin.  The texture and taste was good, though it was a bit salty which I just figure is due to the smoked salmon.  The filet mignon was cooked perfectly medium.  I have to say, even the salted butter and bread was spot on for our meal.    For our finale, we had the nutella sticky bun for dessert, because why not.  Our server recommended this as a dessert rather than a starter and I'm so glad she did.  At first I thought there was no way we could eat it after all we just ate.  But the sticky bun was much lighter than I expected and even with the heavy nutella, it wasn't as sweet as it looked.  It was the perfect amount of sugar to end our lovely meal.  I will absolutely add this as one of my go to places next time I'm in Vegas baby!  Can't wait to try it again!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah they do!
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella sticky bun
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon croissant Benedict

q20FsFIpUqoCnAQRs8EYWg.text: Finally crossed off Bardot and I wish I visited sooner..  Service: Exceeded expectations for $$$ restaurant.  Our server was friendly, knowledgeable and worked with a professional sense of urgency.  The kitchen kept the high end dishes coming on time throughout the evening.  Brasserie cuisine: The "World's best butter" with the sea salt was tasty and I kept carb loading because of it.  The Maine Lobster Bisque was a little off for me (little too much brandy or dry sherry?) but had this amazing type of cracker paired with it that I've never seen before. (see pic).  The cheese plate was solid and the charcuterie/meat board was awesome, that prosciutto!  I tried some of my friend's moules frites/mussels and it was tasty, perfect amount of garlic butter.  I went with the Rack of Lamb and it was delicious.  Prepped and cooked perfectly, and something I'd order again.  Every time I see truffle fries, it's an auto order and Bardot's was great.  Ambiance:  Beautiful inside and out, the brasserie lighting and decor makes for a wonderful dining experience.  The Dark wood tables and burgundy leather chairs are comfortable. The rectangular bar by the entrance is designed beautifully, almost chandelier like.  Bardot Brasserie just made my list of great restaurants for a first date.  The delicious cuisine is as pretty as the lovely restaurant which enhances your dining experience.  Everything looks good, tastes good and I'm looking forward to the next visit to try more dishes. That's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy..! =)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5a6Csz4_ClFSgKFurOI_bA.text: I really enjoyed this place. My friend took me here for my birthday and it was so nice. We went during happy hour and I'm glad we did. We only have a few items off the menu and it ended up being around $100. Which was expected but just wanted to give you guys a heads up that was looking for a good happy hour. This is not, it's pretty fancy. But the service was great and I would come here for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French dip, salmon bites and two cocktails. The fries that came with the French dip was so delicious!!

3xJ58Y1tGNznf6kRh0w8nA.text: Bardot - a beautifully appointed French inspired restaurant, sharing an inspired quote from Earnest Hemingway emblazoned on the wall in a quiet alcove by the bar.  Bardot - with an interesting intersection of French and California wines.  Bardot - with a menu and a wait-staff that each looked the part but that each fell regrettably short.  Bardot - with so much promise, but the promise it keeps will be a pedestrian stroll along the wrong side of the Seine, with the "best butter in the world" (please....) served with charred slices of grocery store Vienna white bread.    The salmon aux lentilles would have, perhaps, fared better without the uninspired, unseasoned and under-cooked salmon (medium means medium, not rare).    The semolina gnocchi featured dry, tater-tot sized pistons of compressed mashed potatoes, with a few truffles.  I like mashed potatoes, I would have enjoyed a nice truffled mashed potato dish, but we ordered gnocchi.  So there's that.  Go for the atmosphere my friends, have a nice bowl of baked French onion soup with your glass of wine and then call it a night!

3JNX2T7JJGzRlTKHHV-Ohw.text: This place has some of the World's Best Butter...ask them they will tell you. They will also explain why it is the best, and after the explanation from our waiter I totally believe it.   This place is absolutely lovely, I don't use the word lovely too often and there's reason for that (a lot of spots don't warrant it). The little touches from the interior, lighting, old-school feel and fresh roses all over the place really add to your overall experience.   We ordered a ton of different things and I also convinced all of my friends to try their Escargot they had on the menu. They were baked into these perfect little pastries and topped with an amazing sauce, tres magnifique! Hopefully I used that properly, either way I would definitely recommend this spot if you are in Las Vegas and it is definitely worth the reservation and price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot!

DTVfSyXVmcbMJLEs6EkaDg.text: Found this spot by wondering around Aria.  I ended up sitting at the bar for dinner.  Let's start with the atmosphere.  This place was popping and busy and loud.  Great music and great vibe. And This was on a Tuesday night. I cannot imagine being here on a Friday night.  This place is huge with plenty of sitting.  4/5   Food: i kept my meal light.  I ended up ordering escargots,  king crab salad, and the steak tartare. The steak tartare was on point with seasoning. I wish they gave me more chips.  The escargot was on the drier side and I thought it was missing that heavy garlic taste.  It wasn't bad but it didn't impress me at all.  The king crab salad was interesting.  I thought it would be chunky meat in it. But they kind shredded it.  The salad was very light but it looked like it was a lot.  My personal thought that this place is overpriced for that type of food that they served.  But the food was good, not wow great to justify their prices.  4/5  Service:  the bartender was on point and attentive.  4.5/5   Overall I would come back to try a few other dishes for out of curiosity.

vs7UZZD1n_wIv99JPYMHIg.text: Fantastic time and cuisine! Our server Esteve and somm Frank Kovalcheck helped make it a memorable experience!

uIxR-Ie7RKd1ff9sUiQBrA.text: Went to Bardot's for an anniversary dinner and it did not disappoint. We splurged on the Fete Royale. Put yourself in the hands of the Chef!  Two courses of appetizers, entrees, and dessert.  The appetizers were delicious. Entrees of prime rib and sea bass with a side of the most delicious macaroni and cheese.  (I could make a meal of the Mac and cheese with a toasty cheese top and perfectly stacked macaronis!) The prime rib was very tasty and the sea bass perfectly prepared whole. The desserts were a trio of espresso pudding, chocolate cookie and cream stack and a Napoleon like pastry. Each was excellent.   The service was attentive but not intrusive with excellent suggestions for cocktails and wine pairings. Pacing was excellent.   The restaurant itself is French bistro like, very nice. Noise was a little loud, but reasonable for a busy place.

fqjy28JuFU6WfJGGWAhRzQ.text: It's been a week and a half since I was at Bardot for my best friend's bachelorette (formal) dinner, and I'm still thinking about the amazing food and great service!   We started off with a bottle of Perrier-Jouet, and ordered a beet salad and cheese plate for the table... a-mazing. The beets were super fresh, well dressed with great oil, and served along an amazing cheese. The cheese plate was to die for--our waiter made some expert selections, and I find myself googling where I can get them locally!   Dinner was excellent. From the chicken my best friend had (not too moist, but not dry at all..almost sous vide perfection) to the beautiful and generous cut of prime rib I had. Each paired well with the selections from the Somm from the great wine list. Sides were hearty and delicious.   I wish we would have had time (or stomach space) for dessert, as I'm sure it would have been amazing.   Truly appreciated the excellent service we received at Bardot as well. I was in the service industry for a while, so I pay attention to the little things--the Sommelier's presentation was perfect, the waiter was an expert with the menu, and the pace of the meal was great. The waiter didn't even flinch when I asked (before the meal, away from the table) about splitting the check 4 ways--extremely accommodating and professional.  I can't say enough great things about this experience. I felt like I was truly in a starred restaurant. Excellent.

1UVPhWSznkcHGY8y-n3aRg.text: Easy to make reservations. Not too crowded. Lamb and brussel sprouts were delicious. Other dishes were good also. I was expecting more for the desserts but they were ok. Came for dinner so maybe breakfast is better. Decor is lovely and ambiance is good. Service is excellent.

uvTUYB_1yu0LD5SbiyWD8Q.text: My new favorite brunch place in Vegas. It's Michael Mina's French brasserie at the Aria. They have wonderful French breakfast like croque madame, French omelets, duck confit waffles, and steak and eggs.  Their baguettes and butter are to die for!  They also have extravagant seafood platters, great breakfast cocktails, and endless champagne pours.  It doesn't get better than this!

3uH_Z7FTUXAmFFPFwEV1cg.text: Came here for Sunday brunch and it was the best meal I had in Vegas.  We had the eggs benedict and the beet salad.  Both were delicious and the best we have had.  our server Oscar was very nice.  The chef delivered a beautiful appetizer and we were given a glass of rose with our meal.  The restaurant itself is beautiful with the flowers and mirrors.  I would definitely recommend and will return next time I am in Las Vegas.

swD3b_NC0SrSSMQNe7ELLg.text: The food was delightful... but omg the dessert!!!! Try the Baked Alaskan - it was magical and they set it on fire which was delightful.

GKQ5oppUGJg98IA0Xym1bA.text: Oh Bardot how I love thee. Honestly the best food I have enjoyed in Vegas. Excellent and friendly service and am absolutely FAB happy hour until 7pm. The apps were so incredible we never made it to an entree and repeated the same meal a few days later.  Our favorite dishes... Prime Tartar  Foie Gras with lentils (so good order your own so you don't have to share, trust me) Bone marrow Duck wings  Also the French 75 with gin was excellent and so refreshing.  The vibe is polished and classy but also warm and welcoming. Not a spot to bring your kids. Find it on the 2nd promenade level in Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime tartare and salmon
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poutine with caramelized onions
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow

2tWhwceAqZJW9o2wy7uC2A.text: Let's be clear, there are a LOT of good/excellent restaurants in Las Vegas.  I travel here more than enough to know this. I would say that the food at Bardot is no exception to that rule.  Unfortunately the service is so bad that you can't rank it any higher than a 1.  I mean I have spent time in France, I am French for crying out loud and I can't recall a time where you were supposed to be whisked away to France only to find out that the Tour Guide or in this case the hostess would be better fit working on a corner somewhere rather than guiding you on your journey. I mean I get it, I made a reservation I show you the confirmation of the reservation and somehow in your mind because it shows something different in YOUR system I am a liar.  Also when there are open tables everywhere and you still feel the need to place my party of 4 in a high traffic area, you FAIL.    Beyond her incompetence we have the idea of the "appetizer".  In my book the appetizer is supposed to come out first. Hmm..apparently it is different in France (Hint: It isn't different).  They decided here at Bardot to just bring EVERYTHING at once. So that of course while you are eating one thing the other items get cold. FAIL.  If it is there policy to bring everything at once they should at least explain that?!  Oh and of course they forgot a side of frites which was to be included (not ordered separately) for a friend but it only took a half hour to get it to him.  Another glorious fail. All in all this Terrible service give this restaurant a 1 in my book and if I were you I would search for other options in this city. There are plenty of them....f

mGMUufW_PiEQ1lM-lpxQoQ.text: Simply fantastic! Service was wonderful from the moment we walked in. The atmosphere and decor was elegant and you forget that you're inside a huge resort. Then there is the FOOD! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and the menu cocktails were amazing. It's places like this inside Aria that make it the best resort in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7eoxrLby3HsMrrY5HV73_Q.text: Absolutely stunning and breathtaking view the moment you walk in ...the view is of an eclectic bar with bottles all neatly placed and organized. One of the best brunch spots we have had the pleasure of visiting. You must try the sticky bun!! But be sure to share it with your lucky other half since it's that delicious but sweet and good all around. The food display is spot on, the food is ordered and cooked table by table so you can dine at your leisure.  Service was absolutely wonderful and the coffee is just delicious! Loved the color of the eggs! How'd they do it? I guess you'll have to go and see :)

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NkqbewMCrZn8gz3QJJGhVA.text: I just had lunch there today and it was a disappointment - not a total disaster, but definitely will not go back. Our bread was very delicious with a nice crust, but my Caesar salad made with endives was not what I expected. The chef filled each slice of the endive leaf with like a teaspoon of rich Caesar dressing, so by the time you eat 10, you feel like you've eaten half a cup of dressing. It was too rich and made my stomach sick. I told the waitress and she felt bad, but did not attempt to remedy the situation. She was probably scared to death of her boss. In any event, there were other things on the menu that looked promising. Just try to avoid the Caesar.

Q5-_FwMwu0WuTag_JlbyJw.text: Really bad place, hostess are disrespectful, incompetent. Manager at first didn't want to come and put his face. He finally decide to come after 30 minuts and not even we are sorry. This place is not a good place, rude employees, food is just ok, nothing spectacular! 7mhuv-1hF7bcJBokSu7pYQ.text: I am in love with this place ! The staff is so nice and the food was incredible ! We got the escargot and foie grad first and WOW. Nothing like I have had anywhere else. Steak tartar and lobster bisque weren't too shabby either. And also we asked for some of their mocktails (but with alcohol) and they were just as fabulous. 0-RmnGANmq7LuQ_vxk5KTQ.text: Great place for brunch! French inspired brunch is what we had. The waffle, steak and eggs, froi Gras parfait was sooo good. The complimentary French bread was perfect. Service was excellent as well. Great job! Definitely come here if you want a tasty brunch! Would love to try dinner sometime!

jT_qerwhiPetMyPwYLhxdw.text: My wife and I recently enjoyed a trip to Las Vegas after not being on a vacation in 3 1/2 years.  We had a fantastic time experiencing much of what Vegas had to offer but without a doubt the greatest culinary experience of the entire trip was BARDOT Brasserie!!!  We arrived early for our 5:30pm reservation and were shown to the bar to enjoy a drink before being seated,  the Bartender was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable and sold us on an amazing sparkling wine the bar itself is clean well stocked and has an incredible ambiance.  We were then seated where we were promptly greeted by our server Matthew,  This guy was nothing short of amazing,  friendly and funny and quick with an answer or suggestion for any question,  He made the dining experience truly enjoyable.  I had the Duck and I am not exaggerating when I say it was the most fantastic Duck I have ever had.  Cooked to perfection and prepared and served quickly really hit all the notes.  Taste, portion size, presentation,  all get five stars.  My wife had the scallops and she had similar things to say about her dish.  If you are a cheese lover do yourself a favor and try the cheese tray!  You will understand what fine cheese is after I promise.  This was definitely one of the major highlights of our trip!  Thank you to everyone at BARDOT Brasserie!  We will most certainly be returning the next time we are in Vegas!

LdITuHzzF3q2jwQdizICfg.text: Oh yeah, now we're talking.  A casual modern brasserie that can challenge the best in Paris. Refinements to the menu and subtle changes to classic dishes have greatly improved the restaurant quality.  Continued innovation from the bar further heighten the experience.  Brunch, offered Saturday and Sunday, is a great way to sample the menu. The classics tartare, excellent. Hand cut prime beef mixed with coarse grain mustard and a farm fresh egg yolk.. Slathered on warm toasted baguette. Ahhhh.  Not to be outdone the escargot, tender wine braised snails surrounded by puff pastry and topped with hazelnuts and a chartreuse garlic butter. Good eats. The king crab crepe, rich goodness as the sweetness of the crab is heightened by a cider beurre blanc.  A sunny side up egg adds a velvety mouth feel and sauteed trumpet mushrooms, the classic earthiness.  The piece de resistance, and ungodly French onion soup. Beefy intensely packed full of deeply caramelized sweet onions, braised short rib, a poached egg, and black truffles, then topped by layer of melted gruyere cheese and more truffle. Mix it up and enjoy the richness of the egg as the flavors blend harmoniously together,  The portion sensibly reduced for brunch. Get this.  A good selection of cheeses, mostly imported, and a very well cooked, chilled seafood tower (king crab, lobster, oysters on the half shell, shrimp) also work with endless pours of rose ($20).  Dinner adds an excellent veal sweet bread starter. Braised turnips and trumpet mushrooms add to the enjoyment of the pillowy texture and creamy taste of the sweetbreads. Standout mains include an excellent bouillabaisse, filled with perfectly cooked sweet scallops, shrimp, mussels, clams, cod, calamari, all swimming in a saffron infuse tomato broth. Outstanding. Carnivores, do not pass on the well trimmed, simply seasoned, and perfectly cooked rack of lamb.  Meaty with just a hint of gamey funk.    Service is very efficient and friendly.  Excellent list of craft cocktails. Many designed to pair with the food. Excellent wine list focusing mainly on France. Vegas resort pricing.  My poker bud from France sums it up perfectly.  "Meh" when learning the chef isn't French.  Translated "excellent".

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Steak Tartare (now with toasted baguette instead of potato chips)
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petit Onion Soup Gratinee Deluxe (add truffle, braised short rib, and poached egg)

-sTCc-8IOzaxwcWHL07Zuw.text: ~ Happy Hour Review ~  If you're looking for an elegant and decadent meal for a reduced price, I highly recommend checking out Bardot Brasserie's Happy Hour menu served daily from 5-7 pm. For under $60, my boyfriend and I ordered four things off the menu (and a cocktail!) Everything we ordered tasting amazing and the atmosphere felt super classy. We stopped by at the start of HH still in our day clothes and felt very underdressed compared to some of the patrons at the bar. We still received great service, regardless of how we were dressed, but if you're the type to dress up, definitely bring your A game when you come here! All the guys and gals I saw at the bar were decked out in suits and evening gowns.   We ordered salmon tartare, steak tartare, a tartine, and a burger. The salmon tartare tasted fresh and light. I especially loved the taste of the chive mascarpone with capers on the top. I'm not normally a fan of the salty, almost fishy-like taste of capers, but the creamy richness of the mascarpone helped to balance everything out. The steak tartare (ground to order!) not only looked super aesthetically appealing, but the richness of the yolk with the perfectly seasoned ground prime steak was simply divine. My boyfriend, however, mentioned that he didn't like the sauce verte drizzled on the top, as it tasted a bit too rich and pungent for his preference. We also ordered a tartine (open-faced sandwich) with grilled shrimp and saffron roullie. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the garlic-y roullie really gave the shrimp the "oomf" I was looking for. The bread here is also great. I believe it's baked in house. Also, as a side note - you get free bread and butter as an appetizer. And OMG - the butter here is out of this world. Butter is always awesome, but this butter is something really special. It's so spreadable, creamy, salty, and rich! Best butter I've ever had. Seriously.   But the True highlight of this already amazing meal? The le steakburger, made with a prime rib patty. Yup, you read that right. Prime rib. So flavorful and so, so juicy. The nuttiness of the comte cheese along with a generous spread of garlic aioli on the top just made this burger seriously next level shiz. If I recall, this was the most expensive thing that we ordered (I believe about $19), but it was so worth it. This was arguably the best burger of my life - and I've had a lot of great burgers.  Thanks to Bardot Brasserie for a dining experience that this foodie will remember forever!

vfGv5GIWksK23zJHobKntA.text: Let's start with the good, the food, drinks and ambiance are great. Tucked away with the other restaurants in on the second floor of Aria, they've done a great job turning a closed area into a lively restaurant.  The bad... I'm not sure if the kitchen was backed up or lost our ticket multiple times but service, specifically attention to detail was very lacking until we addressed it with the manager.  Arrived at 9 and menus were not distributed until 10 minutes after we were seated. Drinks were ordered immediately but did not arrive until 9:25. Food was delayed until even later, 10:05 and it was only then that our server asked how we were doing.  It would be one thing if the place was packed, I'm in Vegas enough between trade shows, fight nights, and weekend getaways to understand when things get impacted but on a non-major event weekend the delay and lack of communication during the slow roll out was beyond frustrating.  The gf and I appreciated the team's effort to make it right after we addressed it but you dine at Michael Mina establishments to *not* have to think about the quality of service from the moment you walk in.  At the end of the day, mistakes happen, order tickets get misplaced, and bartenders get busy. Judging from the other diners who've been here our experience might have been the exception not the rule, but it doesn't change the fact that as a patron I went from 'This is a place I'd love to bring clients' to 'can I speak with the manager' in 65 minutes.  2.5 stars.

RGBuSHHn5N0tvKmg0sB-rw.text: We were looking for some breakfast options, and decided to go with Bardot since it had such good reviews and was just downstairs in our hotel (Aria). We went in sometime around 1045 and were able to get a table without waiting. This is a French Cafe and serves a blend of American and French options.   Our server was pretty quick getting to us initially, but became pretty slow for the remainder of our meal. I had the American In Paris and my girlfriend ordered an Omelette. Our food was also slow getting to us, taking a bit longer than I would have expected for what we ordered. Once it did arrive, everything was very good. The Hash/Potato Cake served to us both was easily the best item we tried. Everything else was more or less what I could have cooked at home. We both had Orange Juice, which must have been fresh-squeezed, because it was probably the best I have ever had (it was like $9 a glass though, FYI). The French Toast they were serving to nearby tables looked really good!  All in all, you can get a pretty good meal here. The restaurant was really clean and has a cool theme and decor. The portions are large and everything is good, just don't bother if you are in a rush and be prepared to spend more than you would expect for Breakfast/Brunch.

qwF19P6mAViLyVdeqQTXnA.text: I stopped by for happy hour before going to dinner elsewhere. I love that the happy hour went until 7, I feel like that's later than most. Wine & service was great. vwFlAUKGKZEY2geVntedTw.text: I haven't been back to BARDOT since their grand opening last February. One of my girlfriends and I wanted to dine out somewhere nice a few weeks ago and decided on BARDOT.   The architecture of the restaurant is just as gorgeous as I remembered it to be. Both upscale and elegant... Hard not to admire.  We were greeted at the host stand immediately after walking towards the restaurant. We confirmed our reservation and were escorted to a spacious booth near the back end of the restaurant, close by the open kitchen area.  We had Kim as our server who was delightful! She was very knowledgable about the menu and so personable too. She offered some great recommendations, the sea bass being one, which my friend and I decided to split as our main entree.  I would have loved to try their seared foie gras or escargot but my friend isn't the most adventurous eater and wasn't budging. We agreed to start off with the charcuterie board and share a salad. For our entree I (luckily) talked my friend into the sea bass with the help of Kim's recommendation and reassurance.  Everything. Was. So. Delicious. Even the fresh bread they first brought out with us with butter was baked to perfection!   - Charcuterie board  My goodness, what a variety. Came with toasted bread and a number of unique cheese and meats. Pickles, diced candied peaches, pear slices, and toasted nuts were also flavorful sides that came with the charcuterie. I'm a huge fan of meats and cheeses and was impressed with BARDOT's choices  - Endive salad  We had this salad salad before at BARDOT's opening but remembered loving it. Endives, field greens, spinach, green apple slices, walnuts, and bleu cheese tossed in a delicious light vinaigrette. The perfect salad to share as an app  - Sea Bass The server knew my friend and I were sharing the sea bass so they pre-portioned them separately for us. The sea bass was paired with a small assortment of grilled veggies. Cooked JUST right, the fish was flaky and very tender! My friend isn't the biggest fan of fish but she cleared her entire plate!   For drinks we had a bottle of sparkling wine and also tried these lemon/ginger cocktails. You can never go wrong with sparkling wine and the cocktails were strong yet tasty.   Our overall dining experience was excellent. The phenomenal service and cuisine we first experienced a year ago has not changed one bit. There's such quality in Michael Mina's restaurants and BARDOT is one of the finest. I look forward to coming back - hopefully soon to try their famous brunch!

iPF25yl735R0er1pIjOduQ.text: Good was 5 star, I feel bad taking a star away but my drink was badhad Bloody Mary and tasted bad so stay away!!!! Must try the French toast was amazing!!! Definitely will go back.

4qQLoZCRdHOPm8gR2kwRPg.text: There were no signs on how to get there since the place is newly opened. Some of the casino employees didn't even know what we were talking about. You have to go up the escalators to the 2nd floor of the Aria and head in the direction of the buffet. The restaurant is before the buffet on the right, next to Jean Georges Steakhouse. They have a few tables outside of the restaurant but since it's inside the Aria, that's the closest to outdoor seating that you're going to get. The dress is business casual. Love the liquor rack over the bar. Simply gorgeous! BTW, HH is daily from 5-7PM in the bar area only. Spacious with very simple but classic decor and very dim lighting. The fancy bathrooms are in the back corner, close to the kitchen on the side of the entrance. BF was very skeptical about coming here because he is not a Michael Mina fan (he's been to a few of his other restaurants and wasn't impressed). One of my foodie besties went for Valentine's Day and loved it so I was able to convince him to go here with the group. Initially I had wanted to just come here for HH but we all had evening shows to attend so we had a late dinner reservation. Our Order on 2/28/2015 Foie Gras Parfait: ($15) Ruby Port Gelee, Grilled Country Bread Duck a l'orange: ($13) Wood-grilled Wings, Blood Orange, Sauce Maltaise Onion Soup Grainee: ($14) Add Perigord Truffle, Braised Oxtail & Soft Poached Egg ($25) 8oz Filet Mignon: ($54) Topped with Bearnaise / Au Poivre / Foie Gras Butter and server w/ Beef Fat Fries Le Steakburger: ($19) Prime Rib Patty,, Comte Cheese, Garlic Aioli, Watercress, Bordelaise Onions & Hand-cut Fries Parisian Gnocchi: ($23) Wild Mushrooms, Goat Cheese, Roasted Garlic Croque Madame: ($18) Pain de Mie, Paris Ham, Gruyere Fondue, Oranic Egg Sauteed Skate Wing: ($29) Wood-Roasted Cauliflower Puree, Caper-brown Butter, Lemon Carlsbad Mussels Marinieres: ($26) Garlic Butter Dolin Vermouth, Warm Baguette Oak-Fired Duroc Pork Chop: ($36) bacon Lardons, Baby Carrots, Potato Puree, Grain Mustard Potato Puree Red - Glass: ($16) Bouchard Bourgogne Rouge, Burgundy, France 2013. fleshy strawberry and black cherry notes overturned black soil and baking spices Pinot Noir - Bottle: ($133) Domaine Faively 2009. Nuits-St. Georges Full Menu: butterfly1465.wordpress.... For appetizers I had the Foie Gras Parfait. While it was good, I would've liked more of the Gelee to go with it to balance it out more. There wasn't enough bread to eat with the foie gras so I used the complimentary bread which was fine. We ordered an order of the Duck a l'orange for the table that everyone devoured because they all really enjoyed it. Our friends who ordered the Onion Soup thought that it was amazing (it looked and smelled really good too!). I had the Sauteed Skate which I would say it was more fried. I had wanted something fairly light since I had all the foie gras earlier in the meal and was a bit disappointed in the skate. It still tasted pretty good (just a bit on the dry side). Loved the pureed cauliflower. Tried some of the BFs Filet Mignon w/ Foie Gras Butter. He wasn't going to have any sauce but I wanted to try the butter so he asked for it on the side. It was ok but the filet mignon tasted better on its own (which is how it should be). Tried a bite of my friend's gnocchi and thought it was very tender and pretty good. Not the best I've had like in an authentic Italian restaurant though. Absolutely amazing service! Even though we had a late dinner reservation that was close to their closing time, we never once felt rushed. Our chairs were pulled out for us and when someone left the table, our napkins were still folded when we came back. Plates and drinks constantly refilled. The wine list is long so the waiter had the sommelier come by to assist in picking a bottle. The sommelier tried to sell the table a $2k bottle, even though we wanted a mid-range bottle so that wasn't to helpful initially. Ended up with a really good bottle though (I'm not a wine drinker and thought it was easy to drink). Apparently this dinner (and one later in the weekend) got me nominated in picking all the Vegas meals in the future. Would definitely come back. Hopefully for HH next time. Want to try the marrow & escargot!

eaDEeStAY_jKbCcANa1Q4Q.text: First time at Bardot this past week. Intimate setting, dark and deep, but with light and friendly staff to balance it all.  Hubby had the lamb and I had the king crab crepe. We shared the mac gratin and truffle fries. Everything was rich and full of flavor. Although the restaurant was quite busy, we did not wait long for our food. They provide you with your own baguette with salted butter, which they continue to replenish throughout the dinner (which I loved!) Great place and will definitely come back!

g7_TjgKWZYiYtPGBovGXRA.text: We've had dinner here a few times and each time it's excellent.  Mussels and steak frites are amazing, as is their seared foie gras.  Desserts are also wonderful--I love the macaroon, it's fun and delicious.  Portions are pretty generous, so come hungry.  Ambiance is casual elegant and service is always friendly, helpful and gracious.  It can get crowded during weekends, so reservations are always a good idea.  Definitely will come back!

o2oMrBu-LfHgl1eqY7Tuzg.text: My bf and I were excited to try Bardot for dinner based on pictures I had seen in IG and review on here.  We were even more thrilled to find out it was by Michael Mina.    We started with the escargots and foie gras terrine.  The escargots were prepared different from what I am used to and were beautifully presented.  IMO I think the escargot were a tad dry and chewy based on the cooking method.  The foie gras terrine was rich, creamy and just perfect.  It went very well with the crusty bread.    For our entree, we split the bone-in rib-eye with the horseradish creme, side of mac and cheese and mushrooms.  The rib eye was cooked perfectly and had a nice crust.  I love the look of the mac and cheese which tasted like an adult updated version of the blue box from our childhood.  The mac and cheese was extremely salty for my taste which was too bad.    Our meal was delicious and our server was very nice and sweet.  But as the meal progressed, she was non-existent.  She came back to check on us once and we never saw her again.  When my bf went to the restroom, waitstaff stopped by our table a couple of times but never picked up the empty dishes nor did they fold his napkin.  This is what I would expect.    Overall, I might come back to Bardot.  With all the competition Las Vegas has to offer, I feel they really need to step it up in the service dept.

rP3jkP0rcpldz0lLjUeyyA.text: This was one of the best dining experiences EVER! The food was fantastic, portions grande, service excellent but not stuffy...made for an intimate, romantic evening. As devout epicureans, we didn't know what to expect from fine French dining in Vegas, but the menu was too inviting to skip. Sooooo glad we chose to spend our anniversary here! The bartender was a master at his craft snd made spot-on food recommendations. Jesus from Chile not only took good care of us, but helped make our evening one we will not forget.

pmOfoiuMz1ML2fIWfXA-zw.text: Satisfying, fancy French dinner before seeing Zarkana.  I LOOOOOVE it when they serve cocktails on the dry side, and this place does it. I got the Notre Dame (gin, grapefruit, etc.) and it was delicious. No heaps of sugar and juice to cheapen the booze in this baby. Next time on to the more adventurous drinks with egg whites! :O  The duck l'orange was a good appetizer but also felt like eating high-class wings, which I guess is what we were doing. The French onion soup did not disappoint in taste or wads of cheese. And the mushroom gnocchi was fancy in presentation and taste.  Our waiter had an accent - whether real or not, I guess in Vegas it doesn't matter??

PYqoDIHgfjdmPEI7wQJbng.text: What a wonderful discovery!  We went to Bardot's for our anniversary and had an amazing experience.  Bardot is located in Aria, but you can easily avoid having to deal with any Strip traffic by coming into City Center from Harmon and parking at the North Valet (we are locals and weekend traffic on the Strip is about as much fun as having your tonsils removed with a grapefruit spoon).  Bardot's is on the 2nd level promenade, so no casino noise or flashing lights, just a nice relaxed restaurant area fronted by a very cool lounge.  From the series of small tables sitting outside, to the interior decor, it feels very authentic...reminded me very much of Brasserie du Louvre and this time I didn't have to sound like Quasimodo trying to speak French.  We were greeted warmly and once seated we were presented with an anniversary greeting card, with a handwritten message welcoming us for our special night, signed by all the wait staff...it was such a nice touch and really kicked the night off perfectly.  The wine list is quite extensive, including the by the glass section and in addition to the expected selection of French wines, it was nice to see some old favorites from California.  We started off with half a dozen oysters...it was our anniversary after all  ;-)   My wife ordered the King Crab crepe as her main (she's little and fills up fast) and since my favorite French meal is still Moule Frites, I sort of created my own dish by ordering Mussels Marinieres and added the pommes salardaises...three words....Stu-Pen-Dous!!!  The oysters were excellent, very fresh, briny and good...I preferred the West coast to the East coast.  My wife's crepe was rich, savory and incredibly flavorful...each element was there, the rich flavor of crab, the nuttiness of the mushroom the amazing creamy sauce all set off in a buckwheat crepe.  My mussels were perfect...yeah, I work out...okay, so my muscles are a bit old and tired compared to what they are serving up at Bardots, but you get the idea.  The mussels were all perfectly cooked, plump and bursting with flavor and the sauce was a little slice of buttery garlic heaven!  There was plenty to soak up my fries before plucking out a mussel to combine for the perfect bite!  The mussels come with one of Bardot's French Baguettes, which honestly could be its own food group, and the sauce that was left over after my french fry dipping was quickly devoured with the amazing bread.  If plate licking were acceptable, it would have been on! When it came time for dessert, we opted for the "Frozen Paris Brest"...mainly because I wanted to be able to order a Brest out loud and not get smacked for it!  It came out displayed on a plate which read Happy Anniversary in chocolate writing...a very nice touch!  The dessert, like everything else we had was amazing, flavorful and absolutely irresistible...hazelnut, chocolate and this amazing salted caramel!   My only suggestion for Bardots would be to give the Sommelier a few assistants, she was very knowledgeable about her craft, but she shouldn't also have to be in charge of pouring every glass of wine...Yes, I'm a lush and it pains me to see an empty wine glass. All in all a wonderful evening at an amazing restaurant...we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen Paris Brest

-mZypYYUn8bMMXaAl0883A.text: Claims to be an european/french restaurant. I ordered a Latte Machiatto and they didnt have a clue of what that was. Got a Latte instead. Food was mediocre as well. Bread and pastries are delicious.

CV3nrM_nKNLi5WPQNeLnng.text: Excellent service + exceptional French food + endless Champagne what's not to like! Be sure to get the bone marrow, it was the best we've ever had anywhere! Mussels we fantastic, great butter sauce. Cheese plate and pork chops were excellent as well.

rlVooQJcjom0kdO47rYACg.text: Happy hour here was incredible. All tartines were amazing, French Onion Soup was delectable. Highly recommended.

-740PEk4CX-9PjObuJGtYQ.text: I had such high expectations.  But I should have known once they sat us at a crummy table and I observed they had two large functions going on on both sides of restaurant (one of which was right near our table) it was going to be a rough one.  Our waiter was so preoccupied prepping the large room across from our table by mere  8 ft that we were a distraction and/or a nuisance. Here are your menus.  Here's your wine list. I'll be back in 15 minutes.  We finally ordered our drinks and they didn't show up for 16 minutes after that.  They were made but the waiter was too busy with preparing for big group to give a damn.  By this time I was starving so I had to wave him down just to order their bread with special French butter ($5).  After that I just observed him setting places in the big room.  10 minutes later I got the attention of another waiter to get us the included bread and house butter (which was better than the $5 dollar one).  We finally ordered.  The food was excellent.  I had the sole and my husband had the scallops.  Perfectly prepared.  We flagged our waiter down as soon as we could for check because the conference group had arrived in the big room with their badges around their necks and drinks in hand.  We could not hear ourselves think.  Why did they sit us their when I reserved through Open Table and marked it was our first visit their?  They knew what group was coming in!  As we waited and waited to get our waiter's attention because he was so busy opening up wine bottles and pouring glasses for people in the big room, I observed the same hostess trying to give another three top the crappy table location next to us.  They were smart enough to observe and see the cluster f that was occurring and asked for one of the booths that were completely empty.  They were denied!  I guess there was a group who reserved those booths already?  So they got slotted almost back into the bar area at a table.  Are you kidding me?  Why on earth they even opened to the public that evening is beyond me.  I see restaurants in Vegas all the time posting "closed for a private function".  Ok you want to be open to the public while hosting two big groups?  Then prepare for them with staff accordingly!  Restaurant management 101.  Oh, btw, completely overpriced.  Even the best steak places in Vegas do NOT charge $69 for an 8oz filet!  If you have prices like that please match with stellar service.  Wasn't even asked if we wanted another round of drinks.  Such a bummer.  Great chefs, poorly trained management.

jxBlKv5gHcujCTP2ODVrLA.text: Came here at 5 for happy hour. Turns out no more HH deal on food. Beer is still $5 and the specialty drink is $7. Also they don't serve regular food til 6pm. Sucks for us because we had to leave at 6 to catch a flight. Didn't get to try the food but service was good. Minus one star for not having any deal on food for hh.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stillwater lager $5 5-7pm hh

L_UhZkBIXBq0GQ0oPo9Pkg.text: This is as FRENCH as it gets! The service, the food, simply amazing. The duck and froie gra appetizers were elegant. The pork chop was cooked to perfection. If anyone tells you that pink is not right in pork. Then you are WRONG! Slight pink is perfect on a pork ! it was tender and juicy. The fish was amazing. I would recommend this little spot on a date night. No date..That's fine too! Small groups will enjoy it as much!

m6CghAZLbQCYVWycObB-bA.text: I have extremely low expectations for restaurants on the strip.  I feel as though they can get away with more and have less to prove being "on the strip."   However this was not the case with Bardot.  I was invited last minute to go to brunch with a few old friends, and although I was hesitant, I was SO happy I went!   Bardot is located in the Aria, which is already a beautiful (non-smoking, so yay) and pleasant place.  Self-parking *which was not painful* and valet is available for guests and it's a short walk through the casino and up to the second floor for Bardot.   The ambiance was lovely, although the music didn't go with the vibe of the restaurant.  The menu was pretty, laid out nicely and offered many different selections. We started with the boulange basket, with assorted sweet breads -- made me miss Paris.   For brunch, my friend and I decided to split both the salmon croissant benedicts and the french toast.  Both were AMAZING -- the french toast was a large puffed (looked like honey toast) piece of toast and sweet, but not too rich.  The almond syrup it came with was over the top.....I thought the toast was perfect on it's own, thank goodness it was on the side.   The salmon croissant benedict was absolutely mouth-watering. The salmon was cooked perfectly and each bite melted in your mouth.  I was sad when I came down to my last bite.    Staff was extremely friendly and attentive, my glass of water was never empty, so that deserves a  huge thumbs up.   Only downfall was no outside seating, but that's understandable. I will definitely go again.

1wvOCD4OtVqAdxGdOSY_RQ.text: We had reservations well in advance - it was my birthday- and were given the absolute worst table in the entire restaurant, despite numerous communications I'd had with the hotel staff. Service was okay. Food was very good. But to be seated at the bar entrance/exit when numerous tables in the actual dining room were empty...we were ignored quite a bit-note that restaurant was never even close to full while we were there. I was not disappointed in the food; the treatment is another story.

jZCXiKsLXreBHgPgi9-YaA.text: This was a front of house and a back of house fail. Service: 8 min wait for water plus an additional 6 min to see a menu. So if you're keeping track that's a 14 min wait to just see the menu. Add another 8 min if you want a drink from the bar.   The seats were hard and uncomfortable.  I see the lack of a gluten-free menu as a front of house problem because it puts an additional burden on the back of house.  Very limited menu.  The foie terrine was not to my taste. The pork chop was very undercooked. Unacceptable. You cannot serve undercooked pork to your guests. Instant one star.

UZwRLJJYGhNs-fJbkwV3Wg.text: Place is good but don't think it all dat, 3 1/2 for me. I like the escargot here, they are pretty tasty! Rather go next door for a steak!

uHX9qIkfthPFtF-AEpl8cg.text: Excellent food and service. Went for Mother's Day brunch on the Saturday before. Our server was wonderful. We started with some of the items off the starter menu. The pastry basket was amazing. It was like you are getting pastry on Paris ! The other were great as well. The size and flavor of the bacon slices on the American in Paris breakfast was beyond expectations Highly recommend .

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit plate starter

X1B5eXvBfG5l4QxYmtqIBw.text: AMAZING EVERYTHING is all i have to say. Bottomless rose? Um PLEASE!!!! Service is amazing, food is out of this world. I will be back to Bardot every time i am in Vegas, no doubt about it!

qlH-0zZWHjHHw_-nOepQkQ.text: Loved loved loved this place! Was looking for a nice French restaurant without having to get to formally dressed (sorry it's 105 degrees so getting DH to not wear shorts was hard enough!). Server was friendly, informative and attentive without being in our face. Started with the oysters. Hubby is not a fan usually but he enjoyed them! Very fresh and clean tasting. I also had the Lime in Da Abricot cocktail which was nice and light and refreshing. Hubby had a French beer which he also enjoyed. For dinner I went with the duck breast which was HUGE but cooked perfectly. When I mean huge, it was obscenely huge! It could have easily served 2-3 adults. I'd hate to have met that duck in a dark alley alone! Hubby went with the Parisian Gnocchi which was fantastic! We did order a side of Brussel sprouts which were just ok. I don't think they were cooked quite long enough as they were a bit too tough for us to enjoy. It was creamy, rich, decadent and we just wanted it to go on and on! For dessert I had the apple tarte tatin and hubby had the Mille Feuille which was amazing!! Loved the decor and just about every little thing about this place. We will definitely be back next time we're in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V6LD3wEPoVO8lD78YaD_MQ.text: Review is for brunch.  The restaurant was pretty full at 11am Saturday, but they had open seating around a large bar.  Bartenders were great and I swear one of them looked like tennis legend John McEnroe!    We ordered four dishes to share:  Escargot in Puff Pastry: These were incredibly good - just four bite-sized pieces unfortunately.  You would never know you're eating snails, so definitely newbie friendly.  Smoked Salmon: This dish was an assemble-yourself project. Lots of slices of smoked salmon, a small loaf of bread, pre-sliced, avocado, and cream cheese. You basically make your own sandwich.  Pretty good - salmon was fresh, not "fishy."    Hunters Waffle: This savory dish has two perfectly poached eggs and some really good shredded duck confit - almost a play on a conventional Benedict.    Seasonal Fruit Platter: A surprisingly good appetizer that could double as a healthy  dessert.  Buckwheat sugar-coated beignets, a cake-like side of yogurt parfait with nuts and a sweet crust, and an assortment of fresh fruit including grapes, pineapples, figs, strawberry, and passionfruit!  I liked the yogurt parfait the best - better than cheesecake!  Would definitely recommend this place for an early brunch or lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry display inside of restaurant
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hunter Waffle - poached eggs with shredded duck confit

nBiRd2WLhqdfLGNsKmK0SQ.text: Came here for a friend's birthday. They take reservations and was able to accommodate a party of ten.   Atmosphere:  5 stars!  Loved the decor and look of the place. The bar was really pretty. Lots of accents of gold and marble.   Service:  4 stars. The waiters were nice and gave us his recommendations but he forgot an order and it came out later than everyone else's. However he did give us a complimentary salmon tartine dish so that was nice.   Food:  2 stars. Sadly... On our side of the table, none of us really liked our food. I mean it was good but it didn't blow us away. And for this price point I was really disappointed. I mean 15 dollars for soup... Had to be good right?  Nope... Didn't really enjoy it.  Between all of us we ordered basically 75% of the menu. We got all the appetizers, salads. Fish, pork chop, steak, mussels and gnocchi. Nothing was spectacular... Just ok.b I would say maybe the sea bass and the crab crepe were the best ones out of the bunch. Did not like the pate, bone marrow, froie grois, or pork chop.   I would come here for drinks next time because it really is a cute place. Then I would go somewhere else for food.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Froie groie
Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

SU1-DjExh4ayQ9wjtagynA.text: As Virginia Woolf said, "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." At Bardot, you will dine well. We found it to be a very solid and mostly authentic French bistro. We had the steak tartare, the escargot, and foie gras and the fish. All were very good. The escargot critters were not in the shell but stuffed into puffed pastry. First time we had them this way but still good. We loved the Mille Feuille with delicious cream. Well done, Michael Mina.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DUkVJfpxXcWvh0sY5-e9xg.text: Boy, restaurants in Las Vegas have sure come a long way  :). The BARDOT is located in the Aria hotel. This is very much a high end restaurant. The service is impeccable and the ambience is tasteful.   I went here for dinner with a colleague and we both enjoyed this restaurant very much. For drinks, I started with the Moscow Mule. It wasn't on the cocktail menu but the server assured me that they made it very well, and he was right. It was excellent. We then had a cab. for dinner, which was very good as well.   For appetizers, I was planning on getting the foie gras parfait based on the reviews, but the server explained that this was more of a mousse, and if I was looking for a real piece of foie gras, to get the seared foie gras lyonnaise. OMG, it was amazing. The lentils and the caramelized shallots were a perfect complement. We also got the tuna tartare, it was okay.   For dinner, I ordered the rack of lamb, medium rare. These were served over creamy polenta. It was amazing. The lamb chops were thick and juicy and cooked perfectly. Some of the best lamb chops I've had. Unfortunately, there really was no room for dessert.   This place is pricy, but the product that the provide is well worth it. An outstanding experience. I highly recommend it.

ZQGNVUNf5L4JQb8Iq8lpmA.text: Cool atmosphere but that's about it. Food is pretty over priced for the quality and the service was just okay. Took absolutely forever for our drinks to come out. Luckily we were all pretty buzzed and didn't even notice that it took our food a long time to come out. We just kept filling up on the bread. Nice to try but won't be returning due to so many other places on the strip with better quality.

3BaSXQhmDCWBG7Gy3G3spg.text: Food:  Drinks:  Service:   Though the overall experience wasn't bad, I will not go back. There wasn't any dish that was great. Everything was just average. Recommend the bone marrow and the pork chop. Say no to the escargot and the halibut.

qeeplnHji-RhJ0UiL_D-WQ.text: Best brunch in town. Great service and great food. Even the managers check on you once in a while making sure everything is good. The French toast is sooo amazing!!

ZpV1VE0fn3mwXwCYVfkX4g.text: This is my favorite restaurant to overload on carbs. They really do have an amazing French toast. We always get their pastry basket and it's amazing. You can pretty much order something random for the menu and not go wrong with it. They also have really good hash browns and they have amazing butter. Yes, butter. Even their freaking butter is better than anywhere else

3TNhmU7E81dTMU--5-vSzw.text: Food was amazing! The host and busser were polite and provided excellent service. We were a party of 5 and ordered the filet mignon, heritage chicken, and the pork chops. The only reason I rated 4 stars is because unfortunately the server was less than average. Our drinks came and she asked one of us to pass them instead of setting them down next to us. She never introduced herself and her service was lagging the entire evening.

0z-s-ZuH71AeUrtPuz7mcA.text: My fiance surprised me with dinner at BARDOT Brasserie and I was so happy he did! Michael Mina's French brasserie in the Aria is a beautiful addition to a beautiful hotel. The restaurant is decorated with beautiful Parisian decor that makes you feel like you're away from the crazy city that is Las Vegas. Everything from the bar to the kitchen is absolutely beautiful.  We started off with a glass of wine and the steak tartare. Yum! We honestly loved it so much, we almost had a second order.  When it came down to the entrees, I went for the Lobster and my fiance ordered the Lamb Rack. Beautiful presentation and best of all, it was delicious! I had a bite of the lamb rack and was instantly jealous of my fiance's order. My lobster was yummy too, however, the next time I am ordering the brandy cream on the side.   Finally, the server (who was excellent btw), insisted on dessert and coffee. We went straight for the giant chocolate macaroon (one word = HEAVEN) and had some cappuccinos. Absolutely delicious! The macaroon was perfection. I honestly could have had two more orders, if I wasn't so stuffed from everything else.  Overall, if you're looking for great service and a delicious meal, hit up BARDOT Brasserie.

Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster

IIiyanLzWcJBNqZs8l0IxQ.text: Omg!!!! There Nutella sticky bun was to die for. I hate driving to the strip for Sunday brunch. Went there last week and it was absolutely delicious. Three of us went and shared a few entrees. Was only of good.  I would definitely try the French toast as well. Well worth the drive to the strip!

pcFn6jgoHmS0BrvLvLYFnw.text: What a great find this place was.  We got there late and decided to eat at the bar.  Our two bartender's were awesome.  I asked them to recommend two appetizers - so they suggested the King Crab Crepe and the Foie Gras Parfait.  Excellent choices.  My favorite was the Crepe- it was so different.  The egg makes this dish shine.  They also suggested the Le Classique Steakburger.  This is only available at the bar.  Beef patty was all prime rib deliciousness.  It was so good, I could of ate another one.  The fries are fried in beef fat.  These fries were so awesome.  Every single French fry was crispy.  Next time I am back in Vegas I will come back.

XwI-UXsFVqxNBBwNzggkVQ.text: Amazing experience 5*. French onion soup with all the add-ons wasn't cheap at $23 but more than worth it! Bone marrow and Giant shrimp were on point! Would def come again on the next trip to Vegas!

JjZ72WEBmGR85jfSMjzTRg.text: We had a reservation for 9:30 a.m. and arrived at 9:25. The restaurant was nearly empty but we were told there would be a wait because others had checked in before us. We then waited until 9:45 to be seated, so we did not start off on the right foot. Why make us wait? Then our server, Clementine, tried to upsell us on everything we ordered. Would you like to add fruit to that? Would you care for any extras with that? We know how to read a menu, Clementine, we don't need to be prompted to add items. This does not happen in other restaurants! I ordered coffee with heavy cream, and the cream was not delivered with the coffee. I had to flag down a busser to get the cream, and when it arrived, unbeknownst to me, it was steamed, and I burned my hand on the pitcher because I didn't know it was hot. My friend ordered a latte extra hot, and said that not only was it just mildly warm, but it was one of the worst lattes she'd ever had. She said it was undrinkable. The saving grace of the meal was the pastry basket. Two of the pastries, the canelli and the queen aman, were absolute perfection. But our main courses were just mediocre. My french herb omelette was lukewarm when it arrived, had nearly no cheese or herbs, and was basically just an egg. My salad had dressing on the top leaf only, I thought that was very odd. Were the other leaves supposed to be eaten sans dressing? We all agreed that the hype over this place was a lot bigger than the experience. Wouldn't really recommend, unless you go just for the pastry. But bring your own coffee!

5gEQb_bf6a8ALHmNQVYO1A.text: Food was decent - overall service and experience left much to be desired.   These were issues that my party encountered:   (1) We were seated without menus or water. Waited almost 20-30 minutes until our waitress came to get our drink orders / pour us water. Had to request from a bus boy a menu. Unacceptable.  (2) Waitress did not ask us if we wanted bottle or tap water, immediately starting pouring Fiji water for our table of 6. Can get a little pricey for a thirsty party at $10/bottle! (3) We has a couple of diners with food allergies - waitress was not knowledgeable about the menu / substitutions and said she would inquire with the chef but never followed back up with us.  (4) Waitress did not check in with us during our dining experience - had to hunt her down to order anything or ask questions.   Disappointing experience overall. Would not recommend.

7fVTfJz2AgQ5EfbfEgSSfw.text: I'm an MLife Platinum member who lives 200m from Aria but will UNLIKELY to return, especially with all the other great options nearby. Grilled octopus was too salty; service was mediocre (4 bartenders/servers were busy watching TV); Burgundy was disappointing for the price. No wonder the place feels dead ... one visit, done!

jhre_Pf0EXT8Z7g3Vr9xKQ.text: Our most favorite Las Vegas dining experience yet. From the drinks to the main course, excellent! Each plate was beautiful and delicious. Don't miss the endive salad. Service was perfect. Beautiful ambiance for a special occasion or romantic dinner. We will be back!

1M9QRVnPiymKr4I97f3C6Q.text: Excellent green (side) salad & Loup de Mer fish, very fresh! But the standout was my Pavlova dessert!  Absolutely perfect ratio of dry, slightly chewy meringue & berries & simple fresh whipped cream all topped with the heavenly slightly tart cassis sauce which the waiter poured on after setting it down in front of me.

yD6QcEwr7L-KgCxcVjbpyg.text: Overrated, simple as that. I expected more and during this visit they didn't deliver.  Atmosphere - A negative. The decor is very nice but the sound volume makes this an enjoyable place for a couple. There are large groups, bad acoustics and they pump music in the background that builds it up. The noise level is very loud. Also surprised to see a lady walk in with a bulldog on leash following her across the tile and she sits down at the table next to us so they should advertise being pet friendly. Considering the place sent me a text reminding me of their dress code I was surprised to have a dog sitting two feet from us while we tried to enjoy the dining. Maybe it was a French bulldog so it was allowed.  Service - While I went in with the mindset to not rush through dinner they took it to a new level. We had to order our first drinks from a manager who checked on us and went down from there.  Food - While the dishes were very good they didn't meet up to the hype and pricing (yes, I know it is Vegas). The pricing doesn't bother me it was that the dishes didn't rise to that level.  Overall, I take their stars down for atmosphere, definitely for service, food and the dog.

LjBoceFhlfQojnHXnHgHCw.text: I really like this place. We went on a Sunday evening so we were seated right away without reservations. The decor is really nice. Service is great. Everyone from the hostess to the server to the runners were great. We tried the onion soup, gnocchi, and tater tots. All three were delicious. Their fresh baguette is to die for. Prices are consistent with nice Vegas eateries. Plan on $100-150 for two people without alcohol.

qu_aNpfm3kvnKnKsMfEeaQ.text: Perfection.  From the service to the food to the spot on recommendations for the wine and food everything was fantastic. It was one of the most relaxing and enjoyable experiences we've had in Las Vegas.

2D3O1uhaB38nzrBbAyCgnQ.text: Very good experience. Pleasant place to start your day.

9vZfiZKuIwbus9qDM7zo5A.text: My wife and I came in for the happy hour as we are staying at the Aria and this place did not disappoint. First of all, Michael Mina should write a book or teach a class on how to set up a happy hour menu. People tend to go to HH for value, but this place is great in putting together a selection that would make you come back for a proper meal. Great service, awesome location and outstanding food!

uG8bp3HfqhI8RFXnunzsVg.text: I'm going to start by saying a big portion of my rating is due to the atmosphere here... No, I probably shouldn't rate a place so highly based on that. But, this restaurant is truly beautiful and I felt classy as hell eating here! From the beautiful bar to the awesome waitress, it all was one pleasant picture.  For the food itself, it was good, but it didn't blow my mind. I ordered their sea bass based on a recommendation and again, good, but not sure I'd ever return specifically for that dish. I thought the lemon was a bit too overpowering. I did enjoy the cheese platter that we ordered though and their bread/butter is truly scrumptious! Their cocktails are also great. I think overall, I would definitely be back since the experience itself was lovely. I would just be sure to branch out and try something else the next time around.

j_2OoJW_58VFcpte7dbfWA.text: The wife and I strolled in on Sun around 1:45pm. There was no one at the front desk, but there were 2 bartenders and many servers walking around with a good handful of seated customers. We stood there for a few minutes before waking over to the bar to ask if someone could seat us and he responded we closed at 1:30pm! Well that would be helpful to know rather than just letting 2 patrons stand there like idiots and just ignoring us.. Good job..! Had high hopes of checking them out, but no longer interested.

kpkEmXhINpX2AXyMTo_URg.text: I visited Bardot on a Saturday night for dinner before Cher's farewell show. There was hardly anyone there for dinner. The menu is very french and the ambiance is very french. The food was very good. The portions are large enough to make you feel stuffed when you are done.

F3WML1JvgzE8QoG3jI2M_A.text: After a few trips abroad I learned that if I want to be nearly 100% sure that I will like my breakfast, the french cuisine is a way to go. And it works every time, this visit being no different.   Bardot Brasserie is a spacious, elegant restaurant located inside the Aria Hotel. They attracted me with their great brunch menu consisting of appetizing light starters, nice cheese selection and vast choice of breakfast dishes. And wines :). After carefull consideration, my fiance and I decided to share a desk of cheese as a kind of starter. They serve it with fresh bread and house mustard, seasonal jam and candied nuts on the side. The whole selection was very good and the mix of flavours suited us very well. Next, we ordered famous Hunter's waffles and french toast with mascarpone and almonds. The former was good, but not as exceptional as we thought it would, but the later, mmm... tasted heavenly. Not too sweet, crunchy but soft, just enough almond. And it was really big, definitely too much for one small person. The service was very professional and friendly, our waiter gave us some great advice.   It's a shame we visited that place on our last day, as if I had known it earlier I would gladly eat there more than once.

9LLZ2jaCTejN8tkFcay_Og.text: Nice ambiance. Little away from the crowd. Awesome bartenders and even better drinks during happy hour. We had fun!

nnR2ZHcFLdFsQXmTbMmupw.text: This place is so nice I had the greatest meal ever. The duck wings are to die for. The service is impeccable and the care that they give us guest is top notch can't wait to return. Please take their recommendations on the food and drinks. They made me feel special.

photos.caption: Photo of BARDOT Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great

qXrdDC1BHcz43gnMc4UazQ.text: Amazing French food for a reasonable price. Highlights include: King crab crepe - super fresh crab with a buckwheat crepe and hollandaise sauce = superb Lobster egg Benedict - tasty lobster, very gracious with the amount of lobster, over a flaky croissant.. What's not to like? Seafood tower - a must have if you're with a large party. Oysters are delicious, king crab legs are super meaty and the shrimp is amazing! Quiche - probably the highlight of the meal, I don't normally like quiche but this was a very flavorful and flaky quiche that just melts in your mouth  Service was fantastic and attentive, I'd recommend going here hands down!

H_456-A_uyZdvnSPUk64vw.text: Because all the compliments from Yelpers', we went there for Sunday brunch and ordered their special dishes, such as ESCARGOTS BARDOT, hunter's waffle, and lobster croissant. ESCARGOTS BARDOT is good but hunter's waffle and lobster croissant.  Let's start with lobster croissant, this dish doesn't keep up with the price I paid,$32. You expect the croissant to be crispy and buttery and when you put lobster on the top, a good chef should consider it might get soggy and try to do something about it. However, it didn't and you even can see watery croissant because of  water from lobster. Don't even mention about hunter's waffle, it tastes exactly like lobster croissant just changed the lobster to duck confit because the sauce they used is the same. It is like playing Lego you put stuffs you need and do nothing to balance the ingredient. I am very disappointed about their dishes and for price I paid, Bouchon at The Venetian is doing better than Bardot.

z8q3KmSIQuscuFN_--_vbw.text: Uniformly terrible- super slow service, awful food. Don't waste your time and money. It took over an hour and a half to get some of our brunch food. We had to settle the bill because we ran out of time. The food was not good and cold. Just awful

HftX95yJCaS-4j7HtSnp_Q.text: Oh my MERP! So delicious! Had the Maine Lobster which was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. Also, the ribeye steak frites are superb! French onion soup was delicious and the dessert was also great. No bad things to say about this place! Service was friendly and attentive. Meal was well worth the money spent.

8FdCURrY9AlK78hAMPCiGw.text: This has become my "go to" spot in Vegas. I usually stay at Aria or Vdara, which makes this restaurant really convenient, and really delicious. I've tried a lot of their menu items, and whats below is only what I can remember. They're also really easy to get a table last minute, which is great when you suck at planning, but still want a good meal.   The Excellent:  The wait staff is really friendly and accomodating. I always ask for ice in my water, which they don't do by default, but none the less they make sure to keep my glass full of ice. One of their staff members even turned me onto a place names San Sebastian in spain, and I visited there based purely on his recommendation, and I've been back twice since! Can't think him enough for that. Unfortunately I only saw him once, and when I asked for him on a return visit, they said he didn't work there any more.  No Dress code - I hate dress codes.  Beef Tartar - Oh man this is good stuff. Flavored well, and really delicious. They serve it with potato chips which is perfect.  Bone Marrow - oh man. I've had very few things in life that were this delicious.  Onion Soup - Get this. Seriously. You don't have a choice. I often get this as my entree, with the added beef, truffles, and egg on top.  Foie Gras Parfait - delicious stuff. Really rich though, so a little is enough.  Lamb Shanks - Oh man these unbelievably good. Perfectly cooked.  Crab Legs - They're good, and normally they'd be in the "good" column, but they peel the legs back for you, so they're super easy to eat, which puts them in the excellent column in my book.  Oysters - Delicious and fresh every time.  Scallops - Unbelievably tender, and flavorful. Amazing.  Beet Salad - Nice and refreshing salad, since everything else here is pretty heavy and bold.  The orange friend chicken - Delicious, and the butter sauce they serve with it is amazing.   The good:  The Mac and cheese - I usually order it, and I'm usually a little bit disapointed because EVERYTHING else is so good.. but this mac and cheese, while still good, is not as excellent as it could be. It's a little dry, and needs more cheese sauce. Surprisingly, it might be better reheated the next day.  Gnocchi - It was good, but not great. Kind of "rubbery", and needed more sauce.  Truffle Fries - They're really good, but I don't really get much "truffle" flavor from them.  Creme Brulet - Good, but not anything I haven't had anywhere else.  Snails - I found a picture of these on my phone, but I don't remember them, so they must not have been too spectacular, but I don't remember them being bad either.   The Bad:  The only bad thing I'd have to say about them is that I tried to get a last minute reservation for 20, and they were only able to accomodate us with a limited menu. hard to blame them, but I hate limited menus... Maybe it's not fair to put this in the "bad" column, but I have to have something :)

cEXindPhUSJ7QRt-lis7CQ.text: To be honest...my bf and I were thoroughly disturbed after what happened last night at the restaurant. Food was great and service was great however the incident completely ruined our dinner.  We were approached by a photographer who asked if we wanted our photo taken. We didn't think much of it and said sure. Then the photographer started having us do poses...still didn't think much of it although we thought it was a bit odd. Later at the end of dinner the photographer came back with a collage of our photos in an album. She set it down and said nothing to us and kept standing there...we were thoroughly confused as to why she kept standing there...so I took out a bill thinking she wanted a tip and as I handed it to her and at that point she finally spoke and she said its "$145" for the photos...We were both dumbfounded...if she had said something to us or explained the costs we would have considered possibly purchasing a photo but the whole situation made us feel uneasy.  Just shady...  We left immediately after dinner as we felt creeped out as now she had a full collage of our photos...everything was great for dinner but the situation totally ruined our night...

N9x6BYDl5N4BBAwDplxvDA.text: Ok, so I have had brunch here twice. Food was good. Service good but not friendly. I do have to complain about the bartenders. Both times went to get a drink first and the bar staff was so stuffy. This last Saturday night was the worst. The older gentleman who was at the bar around 6pm was just flat out rude. We ask to see the happy hour menu and he was reluctant to give it to us. We asked how is night was so far to try and warm him up but nothing. I know happy hour patrons may not be your favorite but they are still patrons. With everyone's stuffy attitudes we won't be back.m
